original: tha dad ces byar yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: tha dad ces byar yang mi rung ste /
translated: It is not suitable to say they are different,

original: tha dad pa'i bdag nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa'i bdag nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they do not have different natures.

original: dper na mar la mar gyi snying khu yang mar dang gcig pa'i mtshan nyid dam tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid ces gdags par sla ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dper na mar la mar gyi snying khu yang mar dang gcig pa'i mtshan nyid dam tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid ces gdags par sla ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: For example, it is not easy to designate whether the essence of butter and butter-oil have the characteristics of being the same as butter or having different characteristics.

original: brgyad pa mar dang snying khu gcig pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa'i dpe ste /
analyzed: brgyad pa mar dang snying khu gcig pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa'i dpe ste /
translated: This is the eighth example of butter and butter-oil not being the same or different.

original: 'dir snying khu nyi tshe smos pa ni reg bya 'jam pa nyid bzung bar dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir snying khu nyi tshe smos pa ni reg bya 'jam pa nyid bzung bar dgongs pa'o //
translated: Here, the mention of ‚Äúbutter-oil‚Äù is intended to include the quality of smoothness.

original: mar dang snying khu nyid gcig ces byar mi rung ste /
analyzed: mar dang snying khu nyid gcig ces byar mi rung ste /
translated: It is not suitable to say that butter and butter-oil are the same,

original: spyi dang bye brag tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyi dang bye brag tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the general and the specific are different.

original: tha dad ces byar yang @175b mi rung ste /
analyzed: tha dad ces byar yang @175b mi rung ste /
translated: It is not suitable to say they are different,

original: tha dad pa'i bdag nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa'i bdag nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they do not have different natures.

original: slob dpon yang dag bden pa'i brjed byang las /
analyzed: slob dpon yang dag bden pa'i brjed byang las /
translated: In the master ParamƒÅrtha‚Äôs notes,

original: mar dang snying khu zhes gsungs pa ni reg bya smos pa yin te /
analyzed: mar dang snying khu zhes gsungs pa ni reg bya smos pa yin te /
translated: it says ‚Äúbutter and butter-oil,‚Äù which refers to the quality of smoothness,

original: ro brjod pa ni ma yin no zhe'o //
analyzed: ro brjod pa ni ma yin no zhe'o //
translated: but not to taste.

original: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo dang / tshig nges par 'grel pa'i mdo las kyang mdo 'di dang mthun par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo dang / tshig nges par 'grel pa'i mdo las kyang mdo 'di dang mthun par 'byung ngo //
translated: The Sutra Unravelling the Intended Meaning and the Sutra Definitely Elucidating the Noble Intention also state that the ultimate is not the object of knowledge.

original: gzhan yang dper na 'du byed thams cad la mi rtag pa nyid dang / zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos thams cad la sdug bsngal ba nyid dang / chos thams cad la gang zag gi bdag med pa nyid kyang 'du byed la sogs pa de dag dang gcig pa'i mtshan nyid dam tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid ces gdags par sla ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni //
analyzed: gzhan yang dper na 'du byed thams cad la mi rtag pa nyid dang / zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos thams cad la sdug bsngal ba nyid dang / chos thams cad la gang zag gi bdag med pa nyid kyang 'du byed la sogs pa de dag dang gcig pa'i mtshan nyid dam tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid ces gdags par sla ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni //
translated: Moreover, it is not easy to designate impermanence in all compounded phenomena, suffering in all contaminated phenomena, and the selflessness of persons in all phenomena as having the same or different characteristics as those compounded phenomena and so forth.

original: dgu pa don dang dngos po gcig pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa'i dpe ste /
analyzed: dgu pa don dang dngos po gcig pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa'i dpe ste /
translated: This is the ninth example, that of the ultimate being neither the same as nor different from things.

original: de la 'du byed thams cad la mi rtag pa nyid ces bya ba la 'du byed ni zag pa dang bcas pa thams cad de mtshan nyid bzhi po de dag gis rnam par 'gyur bar byed pa'i phyir mi rtag pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de la 'du byed thams cad la mi rtag pa nyid ces bya ba la 'du byed ni zag pa dang bcas pa thams cad de mtshan nyid bzhi po de dag gis rnam par 'gyur bar byed pa'i phyir mi rtag pa zhes bya ste /
translated: All formations are impermanent because they are transformed by those four characteristics.

original: de'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo las 'du byed rnams ni mi rtag ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo las 'du byed rnams ni mi rtag ste /
translated: Therefore, the MahƒÅparinirvƒÅ·πáa S≈´tra says, ‚ÄúFormations are impermanent.

original: de ni skye zhing 'gag pa nyid //üîΩces gsungs so //üîΩzag pa dang bcas pa'i chos thams cad la sdug bsngal ba nyid ces bya ba ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams gnas ngan len dang 'brel bas sdug bsngal ba zhes bshad de /
analyzed: de ni skye zhing 'gag pa nyid // ces gsungs so // zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos thams cad la sdug bsngal ba nyid ces bya ba ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams gnas ngan len dang 'brel bas sdug bsngal ba zhes bshad de /
translated: They are born and cease.üîΩAll dharmas with outflows are suffering.

original: bstan bcos mngon pa las ji skad bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: bstan bcos mngon pa las ji skad bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: Dharmas with outflows are suffering because they are connected to negative dispositions, as explained in the Abhidharma treatise.üîΩAll dharmas are the selflessness of persons.

original: chos thams cad la gang zag gi bdag med pa nyid ces bya ba la chos thams cad ces bya ba ni 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams sdud pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad la gang zag gi bdag med pa nyid ces bya ba la chos thams cad ces bya ba ni 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams sdud pa'o //
translated: All dharmas refers to conditioned and unconditioned dharmas.

original: gang zag ces bya bas ni yang sbyor zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gang zag ces bya bas ni yang sbyor zhes bya ste /
translated: The term person is added to indicate that it is the person who is bound.

original: 'di ltar sems can rnams las dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i dbang gis yang nas yang du 'gro ba len pas yang sbyor zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar sems can rnams las dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i dbang gis yang nas yang du 'gro ba len pas yang sbyor zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, it is called bound because sentient beings repeatedly take up rebirth due to the power of virtuous and nonvirtuous karma.

original: bdag med pa'i don yang rnam pa gnyis yod de sems can stong pa nyid dang / chos stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: bdag med pa'i don yang rnam pa gnyis yod de sems can stong pa nyid dang / chos stong pa nyid do //
translated: The meaning of selflessness also has two aspects: the emptiness of sentient beings and the emptiness of phenomena.

original: 'dir ni snga ma bstan pa yin gyi phyi ma ma yin pas de'i phyir gang zag gi bdag med pa zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir ni snga ma bstan pa yin gyi phyi ma ma yin pas de'i phyir gang zag gi bdag med pa zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Here, the former is taught, not the latter, and therefore it is said, the selflessness of persons.

original: don gyis rnam pa bzhi yod pa yin te /
analyzed: don gyis rnam pa bzhi yod pa yin te /
translated: In fact, there are four aspects of meaning,

original: stong pa nyid ci'i phyir ma gsungs /
analyzed: stong pa nyid ci'i phyir ma gsungs /
translated: Why is emptiness not taught?

original: smras pa @176a * //
analyzed: smras pa @176a * //
translated: It is said:

original: 'dir chos kyi phyag rgya rnam pa gsum gyi dbang gis te /
analyzed: 'dir chos kyi phyag rgya rnam pa gsum gyi dbang gis te /
translated: Here, it is due to the power of the three axioms of Dharma.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: zag pa dang bcas pa dag ni thams cad kyang sdug bsngal ba dang / 'dus byas rnams ni mi rtag pa yin pa dang / chos rnams thams cad ni bdag med pas khyab pa yin la /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa dag ni thams cad kyang sdug bsngal ba dang / 'dus byas rnams ni mi rtag pa yin pa dang / chos rnams thams cad ni bdag med pas khyab pa yin la /
translated: All that is contaminated is suffering, all conditioned things are impermanent, and all phenomena are empty and devoid of self.

original: stong pa nyid ni de ltar btab pa med pa'i phyir 'dir ma gsungs so //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni de ltar btab pa med pa'i phyir 'dir ma gsungs so //
translated: But emptiness is not so described, because it is not fabricated.

original: de la mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid 'du byed la sogs pa'i chos dang gcig ces byar mi rung ste /
analyzed: de la mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid 'du byed la sogs pa'i chos dang gcig ces byar mi rung ste /
translated: It is not tenable to say that the reality of impermanence, etc. is identical with the phenomena of compositional activity, etc.

original: dngos po dang don tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po dang don tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the thing and the meaning are not different.

original: tha dad ces byar yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: tha dad ces byar yang mi rung ste /
translated: It is also not tenable to say that they are different,

original: tha dad pa'i bdag nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa'i bdag nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they do not have a different identity.

original: de'i phyir slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa sum cu pa las /üîΩgzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid //
analyzed: de'i phyir slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa sum cu pa las / gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid //
translated: Therefore, the master Vasubandhu‚Äôs Thirty Verses says:üîΩThe dependent nature

original: rnam rtog yin te rkyen las byung //
analyzed: rnam rtog yin te rkyen las byung //
translated: is conceptual thought, arising from conditions.

original: grub pa de la snga ma'o //
analyzed: grub pa de la snga ma'o //
translated: Its establishment is the former,

original: rtag tu med par gyur te yin //
analyzed: rtag tu med par gyur te yin //
translated: which is always non-existent.

original: de'i phyir de nyid gzhan dbang las //
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid gzhan dbang las //
translated: Therefore, it is not different from the dependent,

original: gzhan min gzhan ma yin pa min //
analyzed: gzhan min gzhan ma yin pa min //
translated: and it is not not different.

original: mi rtag la sogs bzhin du brjod //
analyzed: mi rtag la sogs bzhin du brjod //
translated: It is said to be like impermanence, etc.

original: de ma mthong bar de mi mthong //üîΩzhes bshad do //
analyzed: de ma mthong bar de mi mthong //üîΩzhes bshad do //
translated: Without seeing the one, the other is not seen.

original: 'di nyid kyi 'grel pa las yongs su grub pa ni gzhan gyi dbang dang tha dad pa yang ma yin tha mi dad pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi 'grel pa las yongs su grub pa ni gzhan gyi dbang dang tha dad pa yang ma yin tha mi dad pa yang ma yin no //
translated: The commentary on this passage says, ‚ÄúThe perfected is neither different from the dependent nor non-different from it.

original: gal te tha dad pa zhig yin na /
analyzed: gal te tha dad pa zhig yin na /
translated: If it were different,

original: de bzhin nyid de'i yang dag pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid de'i yang dag pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: suchness would not be the reality of that.

original: tha dad pa ma yin na ni ngo bo nyid 'di mi rtag par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa ma yin na ni ngo bo nyid 'di mi rtag par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not different, this reality would be impermanent.

original: de gnyis ka yang yongs su dag pa'am yongs su dag pa ma yin pa'i dmigs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de gnyis ka yang yongs su dag pa'am yongs su dag pa ma yin pa'i dmigs par 'gyur te /
translated: Both would be the object of the completely purified and the not completely purified.

original: 'o na ni rtsa ba dang rjes las thob pa'i ye shes kyi nus pa yang bye brag med par 'gyur ro //üîΩji ltar ngo bo nyid gnyis tha dad pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: 'o na ni rtsa ba dang rjes las thob pa'i ye shes kyi nus pa yang bye brag med par 'gyur ro // ji ltar ngo bo nyid gnyis tha dad pa yang ma yin /
translated: Then the power of the wisdom of the root and the subsequent attainment would be undifferentiated.

original: gcig pa yang ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: gcig pa yang ma yin zhe na /
translated: How are the two realities neither different nor the same?

original: mi rtag pa dang bdag med pa nyid la sogs pa ji lta ba bzhin te /
analyzed: mi rtag pa dang bdag med pa nyid la sogs pa ji lta ba bzhin te /
translated: Like impermanence and selflessness, etc.

original: mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa 'du byed la sogs pa'i chos dang tha dad par gyur ba zhig yin na ni chos de dag mi rtag pa la sogs pa ma yin par 'gyur ba'i rigs so //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa 'du byed la sogs pa'i chos dang tha dad par gyur ba zhig yin na ni chos de dag mi rtag pa la sogs pa ma yin par 'gyur ba'i rigs so //
translated: If impermanence, etc. were different from conditioned things, etc., it would be reasonable that those things would not be impermanent, etc.

original: tha dad pa ma yin na ni de dag spyi'i mtshan nyid ma yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: tha dad pa ma yin na ni de dag spyi'i mtshan nyid ma yin par 'gyur te /
translated: If they were not different, they would not be the general characteristics.

original: des na dpe 'dis yongs su grub pa gzhan gyi dbang de dang gcig pa yang ma yin tha dad pa yang ma yin pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: des na dpe 'dis yongs su grub pa gzhan gyi dbang de dang gcig pa yang ma yin tha dad pa yang ma yin pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, this example shows that the perfected is neither the same as nor different from the dependent.

original: chos dang chos nyid ni @176b gdon mi za bar tshul de ltar yin te /
analyzed: chos dang chos nyid ni @176b gdon mi za bar tshul de ltar yin te /
translated: The Dharma and its reality are certainly such.

original: don dam pa dang kun rdzob ni phun tshun ltos pa las yod pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: don dam pa dang kun rdzob ni phun tshun ltos pa las yod pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Since the ultimate and the conventional exist through mutual dependence.

original: gzhan yang dper na 'dod chags kyi ma zhi ba'i mtshan nyid dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid kyang 'dod chags de dang gcig pa'i mtshan nyid dam /
analyzed: gzhan yang dper na 'dod chags kyi ma zhi ba'i mtshan nyid dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid kyang 'dod chags de dang gcig pa'i mtshan nyid dam /
translated: Moreover, for example, the characteristic of non-peace of attachment and the characteristic of defilement are not the characteristic of that attachment.

original: tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid ces gdags par sla ba ma yin no //
analyzed: tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid ces gdags par sla ba ma yin no //
translated: It is not easy to designate them as having different characteristics.

original: 'dod chags kyi ji lta ba bzhin du zhe sdang dang gti mug gi yang de yang rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni bcu pa nyon mongs pa nyid dang mtshan nyid gcig pa dang / tha dad pa ma yin pa'i dpe bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi ji lta ba bzhin du zhe sdang dang gti mug gi yang de yang rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni bcu pa nyon mongs pa nyid dang mtshan nyid gcig pa dang / tha dad pa ma yin pa'i dpe bstan pa'o //
translated: Just as with attachment, so also with hatred and delusion. This is the explanation of the tenth verse, which shows the example of the identity and non-difference of the defilements.

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dag ni mtshan nyid gnyis dang ldan te /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dag ni mtshan nyid gnyis dang ldan te /
translated: Attachment, hatred, and delusion have two characteristics.

original: dang po rang gi mtshan nyid ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dang po rang gi mtshan nyid ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The first is their individual characteristic,

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang la sogs pa so so tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang la sogs pa so so tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because attachment, hatred, etc. are individually different.

original: gnyis pa spyi'i mtshan nyid ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa spyi'i mtshan nyid ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The second is their general characteristic,

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa la sogs pa de dag thun mong du yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa la sogs pa de dag thun mong du yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are generally defiled, etc.

original: spyi'i mtshan nyid kyang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: spyi'i mtshan nyid kyang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The general characteristic is also twofold.

original: ma zhi ba'i mtshan nyid ni 'di ltar g-yo ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma zhi ba'i mtshan nyid ni 'di ltar g-yo ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The characteristic of non-peace is because of agitation.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid ni mtshungs par ldan pa dang / dmigs par bya ba'i 'ching ba gnyis 'dres pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid ni mtshungs par ldan pa dang / dmigs par bya ba'i 'ching ba gnyis 'dres pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The characteristic of defilement is the combination of the bonds of association and objective domains.

original: 'di ltar 'dod chags la sogs pa de dag gi ngo bo nyid dang mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i phyir gcig ces byar yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dod chags la sogs pa de dag gi ngo bo nyid dang mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i phyir gcig ces byar yang mi rung ngo //
translated: Thus, since the nature and characteristics of desire, etc., are different, it is not proper to say that they are one.

original: 'dres pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa tha dad pa'i phyir tha dad ces brjod du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: 'dres pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa tha dad pa'i phyir tha dad ces brjod du mi rung ngo //
translated: And it is not proper to say that they are different, because the combination of desire, etc., is different.

original: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa re re la yang ma zhi ba'i mtshan nyid kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid yod de /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa re re la yang ma zhi ba'i mtshan nyid kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid yod de /
translated: And in each of desire, hatred, etc., there is the characteristic of defilement, the characteristic of non-peace.

original: sde pa rnams kyi gzhung lugs kun las kyang chos kyi skye mched kyis bsdus par 'dod la /
analyzed: sde pa rnams kyi gzhung lugs kun las kyang chos kyi skye mched kyis bsdus par 'dod la /
translated: And in all the scriptural systems of the schools, it is accepted that they are included in the element of mental objects.

original: 'dir 'du byed la sogs pa thams cad ni mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i spyi'i mtshan nyid byed do zhes bshad pa'i rigs pa dang sbyar na skye mched bcu gnyis kun rtogs par 'dra na /
analyzed: 'dir 'du byed la sogs pa thams cad ni mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i spyi'i mtshan nyid byed do zhes bshad pa'i rigs pa dang sbyar na skye mched bcu gnyis kun rtogs par 'dra na /
translated: Here, all formations and so on are the general characteristics of impermanence and so on.

original: ci'i phyir mod 'di las chos kyi skye mched nyid ces bsdus par gsungs she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mod 'di las chos kyi skye mched nyid ces bsdus par gsungs she na /
translated: If the twelve bases are similar in being conceptualized, why does this s≈´tra state that they are subsumed in the phenomena base alone?

original: smras pa / thams cad yod par smra ba dag ni /
analyzed: smras pa / thams cad yod par smra ba dag ni /
translated: Vaibhasikas say:

original: 'du byed thams cad dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa thams cad kyang /
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa thams cad kyang /
translated: All formations and all impermanence and so on

original: skye mched bcu gnyis kyis bsdus par bshad ce na @177a * //
analyzed: skye mched bcu gnyis kyis bsdus par bshad ce na @177a * //
translated: are subsumed by the twelve bases.

original: chos kyi skye mched de yang bye brag kho na'i yin gyi spyi'i ni ma yin no //
analyzed: chos kyi skye mched de yang bye brag kho na'i yin gyi spyi'i ni ma yin no //
translated: But that phenomena base is a specific base and not a general one.

original: 'di ltar tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / 'dus ma byas rnam pa gsum dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs dang bdun po 'di dag ni gzhan skye mched bcu gnyis po dag tu ma 'dus so zhes zer ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / 'dus ma byas rnam pa gsum dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs dang bdun po 'di dag ni gzhan skye mched bcu gnyis po dag tu ma 'dus so zhes zer ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, feeling, perception, formation, the three types of unconditioned phenomena, and nonindicative form are not included in the twelve sense bases.

original: mdo sde pa'i gzhung gis chos kyi skye mched ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: mdo sde pa'i gzhung gis chos kyi skye mched ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The Sautrantikas explain that the phenomena base has two types:

original: bye brag dang / spyi'i zhes bshad de /
analyzed: bye brag dang / spyi'i zhes bshad de /
translated: specific and general.

original: bye brag gi chos kyi skye mched ni phal cher thams cad yod par smra ba dag 'dod pa dang mthun no //
analyzed: bye brag gi chos kyi skye mched ni phal cher thams cad yod par smra ba dag 'dod pa dang mthun no //
translated: The specific phenomena base is for the most part in accordance with the assertions of the Vaibhasikas.

original: de la bye brag ni de dag gzhung gis byas pa ma yin pa ni gzugs kyang ma yin sems kyang ma yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de la bye brag ni de dag gzhung gis byas pa ma yin pa ni gzugs kyang ma yin sems kyang ma yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: They say that specific phenomena are neither form nor mind, and they are not created by the scriptures.

original: spyi'i chos kyi skye mched ni /
analyzed: spyi'i chos kyi skye mched ni /
translated: The general phenomena base is

original: de dag gi gzhung gis bcu gnyis po thams cad ni chos kyi skye mched ces bya ste /
analyzed: de dag gi gzhung gis bcu gnyis po thams cad ni chos kyi skye mched ces bya ste /
translated: explained in the scriptures as all twelve being called the phenomena base.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pas dmigs par bya ba'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhe'o //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pas dmigs par bya ba'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhe'o //
translated: because they are not objects that are observed by mental consciousness.

original: 'dir theg pa chen po'i bstan pa dang sbyar na phal cher mdo sde pa 'dod pa dang mthun par spyi dang bye brag gnyis ka yang chos kyi skye mched ces bya'o zhes bshad de /
analyzed: 'dir theg pa chen po'i bstan pa dang sbyar na phal cher mdo sde pa 'dod pa dang mthun par spyi dang bye brag gnyis ka yang chos kyi skye mched ces bya'o zhes bshad de /
translated: Here, when applied to the teaching of the Mahayana, it is explained that both the general and the specific are called the phenomena base, for the most part in accordance with the assertions of the SautraÃÑntikas.

original: de'i phyir rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa'i bstan bcos las /
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa'i bstan bcos las /
translated: Therefore, the treatise Establishing the Existence of External ObjectsüîΩsays:

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa lnga po de dag ni /üîΩgzugs la sogs pa kho na rnam par rig pas /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa lnga po de dag ni / gzugs la sogs pa kho na rnam par rig pas /
translated: The five consciousnesses of form and so onüîΩare called the consciousnesses of form and so on

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: because they are conscious of form and so on.

original: chos kyi rnam par shes pa ni spyi dang bye brag tu chos thams cad rnam par rig pa'i phyir chos kyi rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos kyi rnam par shes pa ni spyi dang bye brag tu chos thams cad rnam par rig pa'i phyir chos kyi rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The consciousness of phenomena is called the consciousness of phenomena because it is conscious of all phenomena in general and in particular.

original: yang chos kyi reg bya rnam par rig pa'i phyir chos kyi rnam par shes pa'i ming 'thob pa yin no zhes bshad de /
analyzed: yang chos kyi reg bya rnam par rig pa'i phyir chos kyi rnam par shes pa'i ming 'thob pa yin no zhes bshad de /
translated: Also, because it is conscious of the phenomena of contact, it is called the consciousness of phenomena.

original: 'di dang sbyar na theg pa chen po'i bstan bcos las /
analyzed: 'di dang sbyar na theg pa chen po'i bstan bcos las /
translated: In this context, the treatises of the Great Vehicle state:

original: chos kyi skye mched rnam pa gnyis dang ldan par mngon no //
analyzed: chos kyi skye mched rnam pa gnyis dang ldan par mngon no //
translated: The phenomena element is twofold.

original: 'dir yang dag pa'i don du na 'du byed thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa dag ni skye mched bcu gnyis su gtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dir yang dag pa'i don du na 'du byed thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa dag ni skye mched bcu gnyis su gtogs pa yin te /
translated: Here, the statement ‚Äúin reality, all formations‚Äù and so on indicates that they are included in the twelve sense bases.

original: mdo sde 'di las re zhig yid kyi rnam par shes pas dmigs par bya ba dang chos kyi skye mched du gtogs pa'i don rnam pa gnyis kyi dbang du mdzad pa'i phyir 'du byed la sogs pa de dag thams cad la chos kyi skye mched ces gsungs pa
analyzed: mdo sde 'di las re zhig yid kyi rnam par shes pas dmigs par bya ba dang chos kyi skye mched du gtogs pa'i don rnam pa gnyis kyi dbang du mdzad pa'i phyir 'du byed la sogs pa de dag thams cad la chos kyi skye mched ces gsungs pa
translated: In this sutra, the phenomena element is mentioned because it is the domain of the mental consciousness and because it is the domain of the two types of objects included in the phenomena element.

original: yin no // de bzhin du blo gros shin tu @177b rnam dag don dam pa'i bden pa'i mtshan nyid dang / 'du byed rnams kyi mtshan nyid gcig pa'i mtshan nyid dam tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid ces gdags par mi nus so zhes bya ba ni bzhi pa dpe dang don du sbyar ba ste /
analyzed: yin no // de bzhin du blo gros shin tu @177b rnam dag don dam pa'i bden pa'i mtshan nyid dang / 'du byed rnams kyi mtshan nyid gcig pa'i mtshan nyid dam tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid ces gdags par mi nus so zhes bya ba ni bzhi pa dpe dang don du sbyar ba ste /
translated: This is the fourth application of the example and meaning.

original: mdo nyid kyis brda phrad par zad do //
analyzed: mdo nyid kyis brda phrad par zad do //
translated: The s≈´tra itself explains the correspondence.

original: blo gros shin tu rnam dag ngas ni ji ltar phra ba mchog tu phra ba /
analyzed: blo gros shin tu rnam dag ngas ni ji ltar phra ba mchog tu phra ba /
translated: Suvi≈õuddhamati, I fully awakened to the characteristic of ultimate truth, which is extremely subtle, supremely subtle,

original: zab pa mchog tu zab pa /
analyzed: zab pa mchog tu zab pa /
translated: profound, supremely profound,

original: rtogs par dka' ba mchog tu rtogs par dka' ba gcig pa dang tha dad pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid las yang dag par 'das pa'i don dam pa'i bden pa'i mtshan nyid mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te /
analyzed: rtogs par dka' ba mchog tu rtogs par dka' ba gcig pa dang tha dad pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid las yang dag par 'das pa'i don dam pa'i bden pa'i mtshan nyid mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te /
translated: difficult to realize, supremely difficult to realize, and utterly transcends the characteristic of sameness and difference.

original: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas kyang gzhan dag la bsnyad cing rab tu bstan /üîΩrnam par bshad /
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas kyang gzhan dag la bsnyad cing rab tu bstan / rnam par bshad /
translated: Having fully awakened, I explained it to others,üîΩtaught it,üîΩdesignated it,

original: rnam par gdags par byas /
analyzed: rnam par gdags par byas /
translated: and analyzed it.

original: gsal bar byas so zhes bya ba ni lnga pa mjug bsdu ba ste /
analyzed: gsal bar byas so zhes bya ba ni lnga pa mjug bsdu ba ste /
translated: The fifth, the conclusion, is it is made clear.

original: pha rol gyi the tshom gcod pa yin pa de bzhin gshegs pas bstan dgos so //
analyzed: pha rol gyi the tshom gcod pa yin pa de bzhin gshegs pas bstan dgos so //
translated: Since it is the elimination of the doubts of others, the Tathagata must teach it.

original: shin tu zab pa'i don dam pa de ji ltar khong du chud par bya snyam pa la /
analyzed: shin tu zab pa'i don dam pa de ji ltar khong du chud par bya snyam pa la /
translated: How is that very profound ultimate truth to be understood?

original: de'i phyir yang de ltar gcig pa dang / tha dad pa nyid las yang dag par 'das pa'i mtshan nyid mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas gzhan dag la bsnyad do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang de ltar gcig pa dang / tha dad pa nyid las yang dag par 'das pa'i mtshan nyid mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas gzhan dag la bsnyad do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is said, Having fully awakened to the characteristic that is utterly beyond sameness and difference, it is then explained to others.

original: don dam pa de yang dad pa bcu'i mdun rol gyi phyi rol pa'i so so'i skye bo rnams kyi spyod yul las 'das pas de dag gis bsnyad par bya ba ma yin pa dang / de dag gis rig par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir phra ba mchog tu phra ba zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: don dam pa de yang dad pa bcu'i mdun rol gyi phyi rol pa'i so so'i skye bo rnams kyi spyod yul las 'das pas de dag gis bsnyad par bya ba ma yin pa dang / de dag gis rig par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir phra ba mchog tu phra ba zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Since that ultimate truth is beyond the domain of ordinary beings who are outsiders in the presence of the ten faiths, it is said to be subtle and supremely subtle because it is not to be explained by them and is not to be known by them.

original: sa'i mdun rol gyi 'di pa'i so so'i skye bo'i sa las 'das pas /
analyzed: sa'i mdun rol gyi 'di pa'i so so'i skye bo'i sa las 'das pas /
translated: Since it is beyond the stage of ordinary beings of this Buddhist tradition, which is prior to the stages, it is said to be beyond the stage of ordinary beings.üîΩ Since it is beyond the stage of the ten faiths, it is said to be beyond the stage of the ten faiths.

original: tshig gis brjod par bya ba ma yin pa dang / bsam pas reg par 'gyur ba ma yin pa'i phyir zab pa mchog tu zab pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: tshig gis brjod par bya ba ma yin pa dang / bsam pas reg par 'gyur ba ma yin pa'i phyir zab pa mchog tu zab pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: Because it is not to be expressed by words and is not to be touched by thought, it is said to be profound, supremely profound.

original: mnyam pa nyid du byang chub pa man chad kyi byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sa las 'das pas tshig gis brjod pa ma yin pa dang / bsam pas reg par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir rtogs par dka' ba mchog tu rtogs par dka' ba zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid du byang chub pa man chad kyi byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sa las 'das pas tshig gis brjod pa ma yin pa dang / bsam pas reg par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir rtogs par dka' ba mchog tu rtogs par dka' ba zhes gsungs te /
translated: Because it transcends the stages of the bodhisattvas up to the enlightenment of equality, it is not to be expressed by words and is not to be touched by thought, it is said to be difficult to realize, supremely difficult to realize.

original: bskal pa grangs med pa gsum gyi brjod pa dang / bsam pa yang bsdu ba'i phyir tshig drug gsungs pa yin pas ci rigs @178a * //üîΩsu shes par bya'o //
analyzed: bskal pa grangs med pa gsum gyi brjod pa dang / bsam pa yang bsdu ba'i phyir tshig drug gsungs pa yin pas ci rigs @178a * // su shes par bya'o //
translated: Because the three incalculable aeons are included in the expression and thought, six verses are spoken. Therefore, one should understand them as appropriate.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis don de nyid yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gsungs so zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa tshigs su bcad pas mdor bstan pa zhes bya ba ston to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis don de nyid yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gsungs so zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa tshigs su bcad pas mdor bstan pa zhes bya ba ston to //
translated: Then, the BhagavƒÅn, in order to teach just that meaning, spoke these verses. From here on is the second, the brief teaching through verses.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: This also has two parts:

original: tshigs su bcad pa gleng bslang ba dang / tshigs su bcad pa smos nas mdor bstan pa ste /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa gleng bslang ba dang / tshigs su bcad pa smos nas mdor bstan pa ste /
translated: the introduction by way of a verse and the brief teaching by way of a verse.

original: 'di ni dang po'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po'o //
translated: This is the first.

original: 'du byed khams dang don dam mtshan nyid ni //
analyzed: 'du byed khams dang don dam mtshan nyid ni //
translated: The compositional factors element and the characteristic of the ultimate

original: gcig dang tha dad bral ba'i mtshan nyid de //
analyzed: gcig dang tha dad bral ba'i mtshan nyid de //
translated: are characterized as neither the same nor different.

original: gcig dang tha dad nyid du gang rtogs pa //
analyzed: gcig dang tha dad nyid du gang rtogs pa //
translated: Those who think of them as the same or different

original: de dag tshul bzhin du ni bzhugs ma yin //
analyzed: de dag tshul bzhin du ni bzhugs ma yin //
translated: are not properly abiding.

original: sems can mtshan mas bcings pa gang dag dang // gnas ngan len gyis bcings pa gang yin pa //üîΩzhi gnas lhag mthong dag ni goms byas na //
analyzed: sems can mtshan mas bcings pa gang dag dang // gnas ngan len gyis bcings pa gang yin pa // zhi gnas lhag mthong dag ni goms byas na //
translated: Those sentient beings who are bound by characteristics and those who are bound by negative tendenciesüîΩwill attain liberation

original: de nas rnam par grol ba 'thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: de nas rnam par grol ba 'thob par 'gyur //
translated: after they have cultivated serenity and insight.

original: zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa tshigs su bcad pa smos nas mdor bstan pa nyid do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa tshigs su bcad pa smos nas mdor bstan pa nyid do //
translated: This is the second, the brief teaching by way of a verse.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gsum du dbye ste /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gsum du dbye ste /
translated: This also has three parts:

original: dang po tshig gnyis kyis ni don zab ba nyid du bsngags pa nyid do //
analyzed: dang po tshig gnyis kyis ni don zab ba nyid du bsngags pa nyid do //
translated: The first two lines praise the profundity of the meaning.

original: tshig bar ma bzhis ni mngon par zhen pa dag skyon dang bcas par bstan to //
analyzed: tshig bar ma bzhis ni mngon par zhen pa dag skyon dang bcas par bstan to //
translated: The four middle phrases show that those who are attached have faults.

original: tha ma'i tshig gnyis kyis ni gang rnal 'byor bsgom pa de dag 'bras bu thob pa nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: tha ma'i tshig gnyis kyis ni gang rnal 'byor bsgom pa de dag 'bras bu thob pa nyid du bstan to //
translated: The last two phrases show that those who cultivate yoga attain the result.

original: de la 'du byed khams zhes bya ba la 'du byed ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la 'du byed khams zhes bya ba la 'du byed ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Therein, the so-called formation realm. Formation is as follows:

original: rnam par gyur pa 'dus byas kyi 'du byed rnams so //
analyzed: rnam par gyur pa 'dus byas kyi 'du byed rnams so //
translated: The formations of the conditioned that have undergone transformation.

original: khams ni ngo bo nyid kyi don to //
analyzed: khams ni ngo bo nyid kyi don to //
translated: Realm means the meaning of essence.

original: 'di yang bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
analyzed: 'di yang bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
translated: This is also explained in two ways.

original: kha cig na re 'dus byas kyi rang gi ngo bo nyid ni khams zhes bya'o zhe'o //
analyzed: kha cig na re 'dus byas kyi rang gi ngo bo nyid ni khams zhes bya'o zhe'o //
translated: Some say that the essence of the conditioned is called the realm.

original: kha cig na re 'du byed rnams ni de bzhin nyid kyis ngo bo nyid byed pas /
analyzed: kha cig na re 'du byed rnams ni de bzhin nyid kyis ngo bo nyid byed pas /
translated: Some say that the formations are formed by suchness itself.

original: de'i phyir 'du byed kyi khams zhes bya'o zhes bshad de /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'du byed kyi khams zhes bya'o zhes bshad de /
translated: Therefore, it is called the formation realm.

original: des ni 'du byed kyi khams don dam pa yin par bstan to //
analyzed: des ni 'du byed kyi khams don dam pa yin par bstan to //
translated: This shows that the formation realm is ultimate.

original: tshig bar ma bzhis mngon par zhen pa dag la skyon yod par bstan pa yang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: tshig bar ma bzhis mngon par zhen pa dag la skyon yod par bstan pa yang 'di lta ste /
translated: The next four lines show the faults in the attachments of the extremists:

original: gcig pa dang tha dad pa nyid du 'dzin pa de dag ni thams cad tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gcig pa dang tha dad pa nyid du 'dzin pa de dag ni thams cad tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because of their attachment to identity and difference,

original: 'ching ba gnyis po dag gis bcings par gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: 'ching ba gnyis po dag gis bcings par gyur pa yin te /
translated: they are bound by the two bonds.

original: 'ching ba gnyis kyi don ni gong du bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'ching ba gnyis kyi don ni gong du bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: The meaning of the two bonds is as explained above.

original: tha ma'i tshig gnyis kyis rnal 'byor pa bsgom pa dag 'bras bu thob par bstan pa yang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: tha ma'i tshig gnyis kyis rnal 'byor pa bsgom pa dag 'bras bu thob par bstan pa yang 'di lta ste /
translated: The last two lines show that the yogis who cultivate meditation attain the result:

original: rmongs pa ma yin pa @178b gang yin pa de dag zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgoms na gdod rnam par grol ba thob par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rmongs pa ma yin pa @178b gang yin pa de dag zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgoms na gdod rnam par grol ba thob par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Those who are not confused, when they cultivate serenity and insight, will attain liberation.

original: zhi gnas ni ting nge 'dzin gyi bdag nyid de /
analyzed: zhi gnas ni ting nge 'dzin gyi bdag nyid de /
translated: Serenity is the nature of samadhi.

original: rnam par g-yeng ba zhi bar byed pas zhi gnas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par g-yeng ba zhi bar byed pas zhi gnas zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called serenity because it pacifies distraction.

original: lhag mthong ni shes rab kyi bdag nyid de chos rnams so sor rtogs par byed pas lhag mthong zhes bya ste /
analyzed: lhag mthong ni shes rab kyi bdag nyid de chos rnams so sor rtogs par byed pas lhag mthong zhes bya ste /
translated: Insight is the nature of wisdom. It is called insight because it penetrates the individual characteristics of phenomena.

original: 'og nas rnal 'byor rnam par 'byed pa'i skabs nas rgya cher rnam par 'byed do //
analyzed: 'og nas rnal 'byor rnam par 'byed pa'i skabs nas rgya cher rnam par 'byed do //
translated: This will be analyzed extensively in the chapter on the analysis of yoga.

original: rnam par grol ba zhes bya ba ni 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi rnam par grol ba rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba zhes bya ba ni 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi rnam par grol ba rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Liberation is twofold: conditioned and unconditioned.

original: 'dus byas kyi rnam par grol ba ni sems dang shes rab rnam par grol ba rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi rnam par grol ba ni sems dang shes rab rnam par grol ba rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: The conditioned liberation is the twofold liberation of mind and wisdom.

original: 'dus ma byas kyi rnam par grol ba ni 'dus ma byas kyi mya ngan las 'das pa rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyi rnam par grol ba ni 'dus ma byas kyi mya ngan las 'das pa rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: The unconditioned liberation is the four types of unconditioned nirvana.

original: de ni 'di skad du gal te 'ching ba rnam pa gnyis yongs su spang bar 'dod na bskal pa grangs med pa gsum du zhi gnas dang lhag mthong shin tu goms par byas na gdod 'ching ba rnam pa gnyis las grol bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan par 'gyur
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du gal te 'ching ba rnam pa gnyis yongs su spang bar 'dod na bskal pa grangs med pa gsum du zhi gnas dang lhag mthong shin tu goms par byas na gdod 'ching ba rnam pa gnyis las grol bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan par 'gyur
translated: This is taught as follows: If one wishes to abandon the two types of bondage, one should cultivate serenity and insight for three measureless kalpas. Only then will one be liberated from the two types of bondage.

original: ro // rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las kyang mdo sde 'di dang don mthun par ston te /
analyzed: ro // rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las kyang mdo sde 'di dang don mthun par ston te /
translated: The YogƒÅcƒÅryƒÅbh≈´mi also teaches that this s≈´tra is consistent with its meaning.

original: de'i phyir de nyid las gzhan yang nyon mongs pa rnams ni ji ltar spong bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid las gzhan yang nyon mongs pa rnams ni ji ltar spong bar 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, that text says, ‚ÄúMoreover, how are afflictions abandoned?

original: ji tsam gyis ni nyon mongs pa thams cad spong bar brjod par bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji tsam gyis ni nyon mongs pa thams cad spong bar brjod par bya zhe na /
translated: By how much are all afflictions said to be abandoned?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this.

original: zhi gnas la goms pa'i phyir dang / lhag mthong la goms par bya ba'i phyir nyon mongs pa spong bar byed de /
analyzed: zhi gnas la goms pa'i phyir dang / lhag mthong la goms par bya ba'i phyir nyon mongs pa spong bar byed de /
translated: Afflictions are abandoned through cultivating ≈õamatha and cultivating vipa≈õyanƒÅ.

original: mtshan ma'i 'ching ba las nges par grol na /
analyzed: mtshan ma'i 'ching ba las nges par grol na /
translated: When one is definitely liberated from the bondage of signs,

original: gnas ngan len gyi 'ching ba las kyang rnam par grol bar 'gyur ba ni nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs par brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: gnas ngan len gyi 'ching ba las kyang rnam par grol bar 'gyur ba ni nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs par brjod par bya ste /
translated: one is also liberated from the bondage of negative propensities. This is said to be the abandonment of all afflictions.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ji skad du /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ji skad du /
translated: As the BhagavƒÅn said:

original: mtshan ma'i 'ching bas skye bo bcings pa dang // gnas ngan len dag gis kyang gang bcings pa //
analyzed: mtshan ma'i 'ching bas skye bo bcings pa dang // gnas ngan len dag gis kyang gang bcings pa //
translated: Those who are bound by the bondage of signs and also bound by negative propensitiesüîΩare liberated from both

original: zhi gnas lhag mthong zung du rab bsgoms nas //
analyzed: zhi gnas lhag mthong zung du rab bsgoms nas //
translated: through cultivating the union of ≈õamatha and vipa≈õyanƒÅ.

original: gnyis ka las ni rnam par grol bar 'gyur //
analyzed: gnyis ka las ni rnam par grol bar 'gyur //
translated: One becomes liberated from both.

original: zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: // / bam po bcu drug pa /
analyzed: // / bam po bcu drug pa /
translated: CHAPTER 16

original: de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das kyis rab 'byor la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das kyis rab 'byor la bka' stsal pa /
translated: At that time, the Blessed One said to Subh≈´ti:

original: rab 'byor zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni bzhi pa thams cad rab tu ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ston to //
analyzed: rab 'byor zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni bzhi pa thams cad rab tu ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ston to //
translated: Subh≈´ti and so on teaches the fourth, the characteristic of complete one-taste.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
translated: This is also divided into two:

original: @179a * // tshig rkyang pas rgya cher rnam par bshad pa dang / tshigs su bcad pas mdor bstan pa'o //
analyzed: @179a * // tshig rkyang pas rgya cher rnam par bshad pa dang / tshigs su bcad pas mdor bstan pa'o //
translated: the extensive explanation with prose and the brief teaching with verses.

original: tshig rkyang pas rnam par bshad pa yang rnam pa gsum du dbye ste /
analyzed: tshig rkyang pas rnam par bshad pa yang rnam pa gsum du dbye ste /
translated: The extensive explanation with prose is also divided into three:

original: de bzhin gshegs pas bka' stsal smos pa dang / 'phags pa rab 'byor gyis lan gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis yang dag par bshad pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas bka' stsal smos pa dang / 'phags pa rab 'byor gyis lan gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis yang dag par bshad pa ste /
translated: the statement of the TathƒÅgata's teaching, the reply of the noble Subh≈´ti, and the correct explanation of the Blessed One.

original: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pas bka' stsal smos pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pas bka' stsal smos pa'o //
translated: This is the statement of the TathƒÅgata's teaching.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: This is also twofold:

original: dus dang sbyar nas bka' stsal smra ba po smos pa dang / bka' smra ba nyid yang dag par bstan pa ste /
analyzed: dus dang sbyar nas bka' stsal smra ba po smos pa dang / bka' smra ba nyid yang dag par bstan pa ste /
translated: The first is the statement of the speaker in relation to the time, and the teaching of the speaker's authority.

original: 'di ni dang po'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po'o //
translated: This is the first.

original: de'i tshe na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i tshe na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: At that time means

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de bzhin nyid ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid gsungs pa'i che 'am /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de bzhin nyid ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid gsungs pa'i che 'am /
translated: at the time when the Lord taught the characteristic of the one taste of thusness,

original: yang na 'phags pa rab 'byor gyis zhu ba gsol ba'i tshe na'o //
analyzed: yang na 'phags pa rab 'byor gyis zhu ba gsol ba'i tshe na'o //
translated: or at the time when the noble Subh≈´ti made his request.

original: slob dpon yang dag bden pa'i brjed byang las de'i tshe na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: slob dpon yang dag bden pa'i brjed byang las de'i tshe na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In the commentary by Master Satyadvaya, it says:

original: rnam pa bcu gcig yod de sangs rgyas 'jig rten na bzhugs pa'i dus dang / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i dus dang / yongs su smin par bya ba rgyun mi 'chad cing 'khor 'dus pa'i dus dang / thos pa dang bsam pa dang bsgom pa'i dus dang /
analyzed: rnam pa bcu gcig yod de sangs rgyas 'jig rten na bzhugs pa'i dus dang / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i dus dang / yongs su smin par bya ba rgyun mi 'chad cing 'khor 'dus pa'i dus dang / thos pa dang bsam pa dang bsgom pa'i dus dang /
translated: At that time means there are eleven aspects: the time when the Buddha is in the world, the time when the wheel of Dharma is turned, the time when the assembly gathers without interruption for the sake of ripening, the time of listening, reflection, and meditation,

original: sa bon btab nas rnam par grol ba yongs su smin pa'i dus dang / rang gi don yang dag par rnam par gzhag pa'i dus dang / log par 'dzin pa rnam par gzhig pa'i don rnam par gzhag pa'i dus dang / 'khor ba'i btson ra dam po rnam par gzhom pa'i dus dang /
analyzed: sa bon btab nas rnam par grol ba yongs su smin pa'i dus dang / rang gi don yang dag par rnam par gzhag pa'i dus dang / log par 'dzin pa rnam par gzhig pa'i don rnam par gzhag pa'i dus dang / 'khor ba'i btson ra dam po rnam par gzhom pa'i dus dang /
translated: the time of the complete ripening of liberation after planting the seed, the time of the perfect establishment of one‚Äôs purpose, the time of the establishment of the purpose of destroying wrong grasping, the time of destroying the tight prison of sa·πÉsƒÅra,

original: yang dag pa'i don bshad pa'i dbang gis dga' bar 'gyur ba'i don phyin ci log gis sems can sgrib pa rnam par 'jig pa'i dus dang / yang dag pa'i rnal 'byor pa dag rin po che'i bgo bsha' nod pa na /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i don bshad pa'i dbang gis dga' bar 'gyur ba'i don phyin ci log gis sems can sgrib pa rnam par 'jig pa'i dus dang / yang dag pa'i rnal 'byor pa dag rin po che'i bgo bsha' nod pa na /
translated: the time of destroying the obscurations of sentient beings through the meaning of delight through the power of explaining the true meaning, and the time of the distribution of the jewels to the true yogis.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi chos yang dag par 'khor rnams la bgo bsha' byed pa zhes gsungs pas chos rin po che 'khor rnams la bgo bsha' mdzad pa'i dus dang / yang dag par rnal 'byor bsgom pa na yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / shes pa skye zhing don dman pa dag zil gyis gnon pa'i phyir de'i tshe na zhes gsungs so zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi chos yang dag par 'khor rnams la bgo bsha' byed pa zhes gsungs pas chos rin po che 'khor rnams la bgo bsha' mdzad pa'i dus dang / yang dag par rnal 'byor bsgom pa na yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / shes pa skye zhing don dman pa dag zil gyis gnon pa'i phyir de'i tshe na zhes gsungs so zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: And when one meditates on correct yoga, correct meditative stabilization and knowledge arise, and because they surpass inferior objects, that time is mentioned.

original: de la rab 'byor ces bya ba ni brgyud de bshad pa dag las /
analyzed: de la rab 'byor ces bya ba ni brgyud de bshad pa dag las /
translated: In that regard, Subh≈´ti is explained in the following way in the explanations of the lineage:

original: 'di la dang po btsas @179b pa'i tshe khyim ston par gyur pa dang / pha mas ya mtshan du bzung nas mtshan mkhan dag la smras so //
analyzed: 'di la dang po btsas @179b pa'i tshe khyim ston par gyur pa dang / pha mas ya mtshan du bzung nas mtshan mkhan dag la smras so //
translated: When he was first born, he was a teacher in the home, and his parents, thinking it strange, told the astrologers.

original: mtshan mkhan dag gis stong par ston pa 'di ni dge ba kho na yin te bskyed pa med do zhes smras pa'i phyir rab 'byor ces bya'o //
analyzed: mtshan mkhan dag gis stong par ston pa 'di ni dge ba kho na yin te bskyed pa med do zhes smras pa'i phyir rab 'byor ces bya'o //
translated: The astrologers said, ‚ÄúThis teacher of emptiness is only virtuous, he is not a product,‚Äù and therefore he was called Subh≈´ti.

original: slob dpon yang dag bden pas 'phags pa rdo rje gcod pa'i brjed byang las 'di ni shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sangs rgyas rlung sngon po zhes bya ba yin te /üîΩ'dir sprul pa'i gzugs brnyan bstan pa yin no zhes bshad de rgya cher ni brjed byang de nyid las 'byung ba bzhin no //üîΩgzhan yang brgyud de bshad pa dag las 'di skye ba gcig gis thogs pa'i sa la gnas par ston pa yin pa'i gsung rab yod do zhes bshad de /
analyzed: slob dpon yang dag bden pas 'phags pa rdo rje gcod pa'i brjed byang las 'di ni shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sangs rgyas rlung sngon po zhes bya ba yin te / 'dir sprul pa'i gzugs brnyan bstan pa yin no zhes bshad de rgya cher ni brjed byang de nyid las 'byung ba bzhin no // gzhan yang brgyud de bshad pa dag las 'di skye ba gcig gis thogs pa'i sa la gnas par ston pa yin pa'i gsung rab yod do zhes bshad de /

original: rgyal byed kyi tshal du bcom ldan 'das skyel du song ba las dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu thob par gyur to zhe'o //
analyzed: rgyal byed kyi tshal du bcom ldan 'das skyel du song ba las dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu thob par gyur to zhe'o //
translated: He went to the Jetavana to accompany the Blessed One and there he obtained the fruit of arhatship.

original: kha cig na re 'di ni rgyal po yongs su dag pa'i dbyangs zhes bya ba'i sras yin no zhe'o //
analyzed: kha cig na re 'di ni rgyal po yongs su dag pa'i dbyangs zhes bya ba'i sras yin no zhe'o //
translated: Some say that he was the son of King Vi≈õuddhadeva.

original: ci'i phyir 'khor 'di 'phags pa rab 'byor 'ba' zhig la bka' stsal la /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'khor 'di 'phags pa rab 'byor 'ba' zhig la bka' stsal la /
translated: Why did the Blessed One speak to the noble Subh≈´ti alone,

original: 'khor gzhan gsum po dag dang byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor rnams la bka' ma stsal zhe na /
analyzed: 'khor gzhan gsum po dag dang byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor rnams la bka' ma stsal zhe na /
translated: and not to the other three assemblies or to the assembly of bodhisattvas?üîΩIn the commentary on the noble S≈´tra on the Jewel at the Crown of the Head, it says:

original: slob dpon yang dag bden pa'i brjed byang las 'khor gzhan dag la bka' ma stsal ba ni don rnam pa gsum yod de /
analyzed: slob dpon yang dag bden pa'i brjed byang las 'khor gzhan dag la bka' ma stsal ba ni don rnam pa gsum yod de /
translated: The reason the Blessed One did not speak to the other assemblies is that there are three reasons:

original: dang po chos kyi 'khor lo thog mar bskor ba'i tshe dge slong dag sngar lam du zhugs nas sangs rgyas kyi zham 'bring byas pa yin la 'khor gzhan dag ni phyis zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dang po chos kyi 'khor lo thog mar bskor ba'i tshe dge slong dag sngar lam du zhugs nas sangs rgyas kyi zham 'bring byas pa yin la 'khor gzhan dag ni phyis zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: First, when the wheel of the Dharma was first turned, the monks entered the path first and served the Buddha, while the others entered later.

original: gnyis pa ni bsnyen par rdzogs nas lo brgya lon pa'i dge slong mas deng bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i dge slong la phyag bya ba yin te /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni bsnyen par rdzogs nas lo brgya lon pa'i dge slong mas deng bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i dge slong la phyag bya ba yin te /
translated: The second is that a nun who has received full ordination one hundred years earlier must bow down to a monk who has received full ordination that day.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: dge slong 'di tshul khrims yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge slong 'di tshul khrims yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because this monk is perfect in morality.

original: gzhan yang nam 'tsho'i bar du dge slong la gnas bca' dgos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang nam 'tsho'i bar du dge slong la gnas bca' dgos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, for as long as she lives, a nun must request the full ordination from a monk.

original: gsum pa ni dbang po'i rang bzhin mchog tu gyur pa ste /
analyzed: gsum pa ni dbang po'i rang bzhin mchog tu gyur pa ste /
translated: The third is that the nature of the faculties is superior.

original: @180a * // 'di ltar skyes pa ni dbang po rno zhing rtul phod pa yin la /
analyzed: @180a * // 'di ltar skyes pa ni dbang po rno zhing rtul phod pa yin la /
translated: Thus, a male is sharp and courageous,üîΩbut a female is unclear and weak. Therefore, the Vinaya declares:

original: bud med ni mi gsal zhing zhan pas de'i phyir 'dul ba las bud med la tshig lnga'am drug las lhag bar chos bstan na ltung ba'o zhes gsungs pa'o //üîΩde la tshig lnga ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bud med ni mi gsal zhing zhan pas de'i phyir 'dul ba las bud med la tshig lnga'am drug las lhag bar chos bstan na ltung ba'o zhes gsungs pa'o // de la tshig lnga ni 'di lta ste /
translated: If a nun teaches the doctrine to a woman for more than five or six words, she commits an offense.

original: phung po lnga'o //üîΩtshig drug ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: phung po lnga'o // tshig drug ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Five words are, for example, the five aggregates.

original: skye mched drug go //
analyzed: skye mched drug go //
translated: Six words are, for example, the six sense bases.

original: bud med la chos 'chad pa na phung po dang skye mched las lhag pa'i don 'chad du mi rung ste /
analyzed: bud med la chos 'chad pa na phung po dang skye mched las lhag pa'i don 'chad du mi rung ste /
translated: When explaining the Dharma to women, it is unsuitable to explain anything other than the aggregates and bases,

original: dbang po mi gsal zhing zhan pas mang du 'dzin mi nus pa'i phyir ro zhe'o //
analyzed: dbang po mi gsal zhing zhan pas mang du 'dzin mi nus pa'i phyir ro zhe'o //
translated: because their faculties are unclear and weak and they are unable to grasp much.

original: 'khor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' la bka' ma stsal ba yang rgya cher rnam par dbye na /
analyzed: 'khor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' la bka' ma stsal ba yang rgya cher rnam par dbye na /
translated: If the other retinue is classified in detail,

original: don rnam pa lnga yod de mangs kyis dogs nas 'dir ma brjod do //
analyzed: don rnam pa lnga yod de mangs kyis dogs nas 'dir ma brjod do //
translated: there are five topics, but fearing too much, they are not mentioned here.üîΩMoreover, the five-part Vinaya states:

original: gzhan yang 'dul ba dum bu lnga pa las tshig lnga zhes bya ba ni gzugs mi rtag ces bya ba nas tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed dang rnam par shes pa mi rtag pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang 'dul ba dum bu lnga pa las tshig lnga zhes bya ba ni gzugs mi rtag ces bya ba nas tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed dang rnam par shes pa mi rtag pa'i bar du'o //
translated: The five terms are form is impermanent, up to feeling, discrimination, compositional factors, and consciousness are impermanent.

original: tshig drug ces bya ba ni mig bdag med ces bya ba nas /
analyzed: tshig drug ces bya ba ni mig bdag med ces bya ba nas /
translated: The six terms are the eyes are selfless, up to

original: rna ba dang sna dang / lce dang lus dang yid bdag med pa'i bar du 'o zhes gsungs 'dul ba dum bu bzhi pa la sogs pa las ni rnam par bshad pa med do //
analyzed: rna ba dang sna dang / lce dang lus dang yid bdag med pa'i bar du 'o zhes gsungs 'dul ba dum bu bzhi pa la sogs pa las ni rnam par bshad pa med do //
translated: The four-part Vinaya and so on do not explain this.

original: 'dir 'phags pa rab 'byor la bka' stsal pa'i rnam par bshad pa yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las /
analyzed: 'dir 'phags pa rab 'byor la bka' stsal pa'i rnam par bshad pa yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las /
translated: Here, the explanation that was spoken to the noble Subh≈´ti is also found in the Commentary on the Perfection of Wisdom.

original: 'phags pa rab 'byor yang rgyu dang rkyen gnyis na bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal nas chos 'chad par mdzad la slob ma gzhan dag la ni bka' ma stsal pa yin te /
analyzed: 'phags pa rab 'byor yang rgyu dang rkyen gnyis na bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal nas chos 'chad par mdzad la slob ma gzhan dag la ni bka' ma stsal pa yin te /
translated: The noble Subh≈´ti, when the two causes and conditions were spoken by the Blessed One, explained the Dharma, but he did not speak to other disciples.

original: nyon mongs pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la rab tu zhugs pa'i phyir dang / chos stong pa nyid la shin tu zhugs pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la rab tu zhugs pa'i phyir dang / chos stong pa nyid la shin tu zhugs pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: This is because he was engaged in the concentration of the absence of afflictions and because he was engaged in the emptiness of phenomena.

original: gal te de ltar na ci'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams la bka' ma stsal /
analyzed: gal te de ltar na ci'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams la bka' ma stsal /
translated: If that is so, why was it not spoken to the bodhisattvas?

original: smras pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las /
analyzed: smras pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las /
translated: It says in the Commentary on the Perfection of Wisdom:

original: 'phags pa rab 'byor ni rtag par stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin la spyod cing zag pa rnams spangs pas sems can rnams yid ches pa rnams bskyed pa'i phyir chos 'chad par bka' stsal pa yin no zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'phags pa rab 'byor ni rtag par stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin la spyod cing zag pa rnams spangs pas sems can rnams yid ches pa rnams bskyed pa'i phyir chos 'chad par bka' stsal pa yin no zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: The noble Subh≈´ti is always engaged in the concentration of emptiness and has abandoned the contaminants. Therefore, he is authorized to teach the doctrine in order to generate confidence in sentient beings.

original: gzhan yang punda r'i ka'i 'grel pa'i mtshan nyid kyi le'u las /
analyzed: gzhan yang punda r'i ka'i 'grel pa'i mtshan nyid kyi le'u las /
translated: Moreover, the chapter on the characteristics in the commentary on the Pundarika states:

original: don rnam pa lnga'i phyir @180b bcom ldan 'das kyis nyan thos rnams la bka' stsal pa mdzad kyi byang chub sems dpa' rnams la bka' mi stsal to zhes bshad do //
analyzed: don rnam pa lnga'i phyir @180b bcom ldan 'das kyis nyan thos rnams la bka' stsal pa mdzad kyi byang chub sems dpa' rnams la bka' mi stsal to zhes bshad do //
translated: ‚ÄúThe BhagavƒÅn teaches the doctrine to ≈õrƒÅvakas for five reasons, but not to bodhisattvas.‚Äù

original: gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las byang chub sems dpa' dang / slob ma gzhan dag la bka' ma stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis 'chad par mi mdzad pa'i gtan tshigs rgya cher 'byung bas de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las byang chub sems dpa' dang / slob ma gzhan dag la bka' ma stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis 'chad par mi mdzad pa'i gtan tshigs rgya cher 'byung bas de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, the commentary on the Perfection of Wisdom extensively explains the reasons why he did not teach the doctrine to bodhisattvas and other disciples and why the BhagavƒÅn himself did not explain it. It should be understood in that way.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel ba de dang sbyar nas /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel ba de dang sbyar nas /
translated: In connection with that commentary on the perfection of wisdom,

original: 'phags pa rab 'byor 'ba' zhig la bka' stsal par ston pas mdo sde 'dir yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //üîΩkhyod kyis sems can gyi khams na sems can ji snyed cig mngon pa'i nga rgyal can mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyis mngon du zin pa'i phyir shes ba brda 'phrod bar byed pa yod par shes /
analyzed: 'phags pa rab 'byor 'ba' zhig la bka' stsal par ston pas mdo sde 'dir yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o // khyod kyis sems can gyi khams na sems can ji snyed cig mngon pa'i nga rgyal can mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyis mngon du zin pa'i phyir shes ba brda 'phrod bar byed pa yod par shes /
translated: it is shown that the Lord spoke only to the noble Subh≈´ti. Thus, it should be understood in this s≈´tra as well.üîΩYou know that in the realm of sentient beings, as many sentient beings as there are who are conceited, who are known to be conceited due to their conceit,üîΩyou know that in the realm of sentient beings, as many sentient beings as there are who are free from conceit, who are known to be free from conceit,

original: khyod kyis sems can gyi khams na sems can ji snyed cig mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang bral bas shes pa brda sprod par byed pa yod par shes zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa bkas smras pa nyid yang dag par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: khyod kyis sems can gyi khams na sems can ji snyed cig mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang bral bas shes pa brda sprod par byed pa yod par shes zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa bkas smras pa nyid yang dag par bstan pa'o //
translated: This shows the second, the correct teaching of the statement.

original: de la mngon pa'i nga rgyal can zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa punda r'i ka'i mdo las ji skad du ma thob par thob bo snyam pa dang / ma rtogs par rtogs so snyam pa dang mngon pa'i nga rgyal zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de la mngon pa'i nga rgyal can zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa punda r'i ka'i mdo las ji skad du ma thob par thob bo snyam pa dang / ma rtogs par rtogs so snyam pa dang mngon pa'i nga rgyal zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: The phrase those who are conceited is as it says in the noble Pundarika Sutra: It is called 'conceit' when one thinks 'I have attained' without having attained, or 'I have realized' without having realized.

original: tshig nges par 'grel pa'i mdo las kyang 'di dang mthun par bshad do //
analyzed: tshig nges par 'grel pa'i mdo las kyang 'di dang mthun par bshad do //
translated: The Sutra Definitely Elucidating the Noble Intention also explains in accordance with that.

original: 'dir ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal yod ba dang med pa las brtsams nas rnam pa gnyis kas smras pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dir ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal yod ba dang med pa las brtsams nas rnam pa gnyis kas smras pa yin te /
translated: Here, both are spoken of in terms of whether or not one has conceit.

original: de'i phyir slob dpon yang dag bden pa'i brjed byang las /
analyzed: de'i phyir slob dpon yang dag bden pa'i brjed byang las /
translated: Therefore, the master Yasomitra's commentary on the Treasury of Knowledge says:

original: snga ma ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang bcas pa las brtsams nas smras pa'o //
analyzed: snga ma ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang bcas pa las brtsams nas smras pa'o //
translated: The former is spoken of in terms of those who have conceit.

original: phyi ma ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal med pa las brtsams nas smras pa'o //
analyzed: phyi ma ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal med pa las brtsams nas smras pa'o //
translated: The latter is spoken of in terms of those who do not have conceit.

original: gzhan yang snga ma ni so so'i skye bo las brtsams nas smras pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang snga ma ni so so'i skye bo las brtsams nas smras pa'o //
translated: Moreover, the former is spoken of in terms of ordinary beings.

original: phyi ma ni 'phags pa las brtsams nas smras pa'o //
analyzed: phyi ma ni 'phags pa las brtsams nas smras pa'o //
translated: The latter is spoken of in terms of ƒÅryas.

original: gzhan yang snga ma ni gsor mi rung ba las brtsams nas smras pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang snga ma ni gsor mi rung ba las brtsams nas smras pa'o //
translated: Moreover, the former was spoken beginning with the incurable.

original: phyi ma ni gang zag gsor rung ba las brtsams nas smras pa'o //
analyzed: phyi ma ni gang zag gsor rung ba las brtsams nas smras pa'o //
translated: The latter was spoken beginning with the curable person.

original: gzhan yang snga ma ni 'bras bu med pa'i gang zag gi spyod pa smras pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang snga ma ni 'bras bu med pa'i gang zag gi spyod pa smras pa'o //
translated: Moreover, the former was spoken about the conduct of a person without result.

original: phyi ma ni 'bras bu dang bcas pa'i gang zag gi spyod pa smras pa'o //
analyzed: phyi ma ni 'bras bu dang bcas pa'i gang zag gi spyod pa smras pa'o //
translated: The latter was spoken about the conduct of a person with result.

original: @181a * // gzhan yang snga ma ni gang zag phyin ci log tu gyur pa smras pa'o //
analyzed: @181a * // gzhan yang snga ma ni gang zag phyin ci log tu gyur pa smras pa'o //
translated: Moreover, the former was spoken about a person who has gone wrong.

original: phyi ma ni gang zag phyin ci log tu ma gyur pa smras pa'o //
analyzed: phyi ma ni gang zag phyin ci log tu ma gyur pa smras pa'o //
translated: The latter was spoken about a person who has not gone wrong.

original: gzhan yang snga ma ni log pa'i phung po nyid du nges pa'i gang zag smras pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang snga ma ni log pa'i phung po nyid du nges pa'i gang zag smras pa'o //
translated: Moreover, the former was spoken about a person who is definitely a false aggregate.

original: phyi ma ni yang dag pa'i phung po nyid du nges pa'i gang zag smras pa'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: phyi ma ni yang dag pa'i phung po nyid du nges pa'i gang zag smras pa'o zhes bshad do //
translated: The latter was spoken about a person who is definitely a true aggregate.

original: mdo'i tshig 'di'i bshad pa yang slob dpon yang dag bden pa'i brjed byang las /
analyzed: mdo'i tshig 'di'i bshad pa yang slob dpon yang dag bden pa'i brjed byang las /
translated: Also, the master ParamƒÅrtha‚Äôs notes on the s≈´tra say:

original: nga rgyal dang bcas pa dang nga rgyal med pa re re la yang don rnam pa bzhi bzhi yod pa bshad de /
analyzed: nga rgyal dang bcas pa dang nga rgyal med pa re re la yang don rnam pa bzhi bzhi yod pa bshad de /
translated: Each of the four types of pride and the four types of absence of pride have four meanings.üîΩ

original: de la nga rgyal dang bcas pa'i rnam pa bzhi yang mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi gnas ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la nga rgyal dang bcas pa'i rnam pa bzhi yang mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi gnas ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Each of the four kinds of pride and the four kinds of absence of pride are explained as having four kinds of meaning.

original: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga dang bcas pa'o //üîΩnga rgyal gyi rgyu ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga dang bcas pa'o // nga rgyal gyi rgyu ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The basis of the pride that is manifest is the five appropriative aggregates.

original: nga rgyal gyi bag la nyal lo //üîΩnga rgyal gyi bdag nyid ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: nga rgyal gyi bag la nyal lo // nga rgyal gyi bdag nyid ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The cause of pride is the latent impressions of pride.

original: mtho ba'i sems so //üîΩnga rgyal gyi dngos po'i nus pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: mtho ba'i sems so // nga rgyal gyi dngos po'i nus pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The nature of pride is a lofty attitude.

original: sems mtho ba'i nga rgyal gyi rgyu las dang rnam par smin pa la sogs pa bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: sems mtho ba'i nga rgyal gyi rgyu las dang rnam par smin pa la sogs pa bskyed pa'o //
translated: The power of the thing that is pride is the generation of the cause of the pride of a lofty attitude, of the ripening of karma, and so on.

original: sems can ji snyed cig ces bya ba ni nga rgyal gyi gnas bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sems can ji snyed cig ces bya ba ni nga rgyal gyi gnas bstan pa'o //
translated: As many sentient beings as there are is the teaching of the basis of pride.

original: mngon pa'i nga rgyal can zhes bya ba ni nga rgyal gyi rgyu bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mngon pa'i nga rgyal can zhes bya ba ni nga rgyal gyi rgyu bstan pa'o //
translated: Those who are proud is the teaching of the cause of pride.

original: mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyis mngon du zin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni nga rgyal gyi bdag nyid bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyis mngon du zin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni nga rgyal gyi bdag nyid bstan pa'o //
translated: The phrase because of the manifest pride indicates the nature of pride.

original: shes pa brda sprod par byed pa yod par shes zhes bya ba ni nga rgyal gyi dngos po'i nus pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: shes pa brda sprod par byed pa yod par shes zhes bya ba ni nga rgyal gyi dngos po'i nus pa bstan pa'o //
translated: The phrase one should know that the pride exists in the form of a designation of cognition indicates the power of the entity of pride.

original: nga rgyal med pa'i rnam pa bzhi yang nga rgyal med pa'i gnas ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: nga rgyal med pa'i rnam pa bzhi yang nga rgyal med pa'i gnas ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The four types of absence of pride are as follows:

original: zag pa med pa'i phung po lnga rgyun mi 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i phung po lnga rgyun mi 'chad pa'o //
translated: The basis of the absence of pride is the uninterrupted continuity of the five undefiled aggregates.

original: nga rgyal med pa'i rgyu ni mi shes pa kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po'o //üîΩnga rgyal med pa'i bdag nyid ni kun shes pa'i dbang po'o //
analyzed: nga rgyal med pa'i rgyu ni mi shes pa kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po'o // nga rgyal med pa'i bdag nyid ni kun shes pa'i dbang po'o //
translated: The cause of the absence of pride is the faculty of understanding what has not been understood.üîΩThe nature of the absence of pride is the faculty of understanding.

original: nga rgyal med pa'i dngos po'i nus pa ni kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po'o //
analyzed: nga rgyal med pa'i dngos po'i nus pa ni kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po'o //
translated: The power of the entity of the absence of pride is the faculty of possession of understanding.

original: sems can ji snyed cig ces bya ba ni nga rgyal med pa'i gnas bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sems can ji snyed cig ces bya ba ni nga rgyal med pa'i gnas bstan pa'o //
translated: The phrase all sentient beings indicates the basis of the absence of pride.

original: mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni nga rgyal med pa'i rgyu dang bdag nyid bstan to //
analyzed: mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni nga rgyal med pa'i rgyu dang bdag nyid bstan to //
translated: The phrase free from manifest conceit indicates the cause of non-conceit and its nature.

original: tshig nges par 'grel pa'i mdo las ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal med pa dang mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi dbang du ma gyur pa zhes 'byung la //
analyzed: tshig nges par 'grel pa'i mdo las ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal med pa dang mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi dbang du ma gyur pa zhes 'byung la //
translated: The S≈´tra Unravelling the Intended Meaning says, They are free from manifest conceit and are not under the influence of manifest conceit.

original: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las ni bdag dang bral ba nga rgyal dang bral ba zhes 'byung bas mdo de nyid las ni tshig gnyis tshang @181b bar smos la /
analyzed: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las ni bdag dang bral ba nga rgyal dang bral ba zhes 'byung bas mdo de nyid las ni tshig gnyis tshang @181b bar smos la /
translated: The S≈´tra Unravelling the Profound Thought says, They are free from self and free from conceit. Thus, both phrases are complete in that s≈´tra.

original: mdo 'di las tshig gcig las mi smos pa ni don gnyis te bsdus pas de'i phyir mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang bral ba zhes bya ba 'ba' zhig gsungs so //
analyzed: mdo 'di las tshig gcig las mi smos pa ni don gnyis te bsdus pas de'i phyir mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang bral ba zhes bya ba 'ba' zhig gsungs so //
translated: But this s≈´tra mentions only one phrase, free from manifest conceit, because it includes the other two meanings.

original: shes pa brda sprod par byed pa yod pa zhes bya ba ni nga rgyal med pa'i dngos po'i nus pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: shes pa brda sprod par byed pa yod pa zhes bya ba ni nga rgyal med pa'i dngos po'i nus pa bstan pa'o //
translated: The phrase they have the knowledge that conveys symbols indicates the power of non-conceit.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the Venerable Subhuti said to the Lord:üîΩLord, I see only a few beings in the world who are free from pride, who are fit to be taught this Dharma.

original: bcom ldan 'das bdag gis ni sems can gyi khams na sems can nyung shas cig mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang bral bas shes pa brda sprod par 'tshal lags kyi zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa 'phags pa rab 'byor gyis lan gsol pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bdag gis ni sems can gyi khams na sems can nyung shas cig mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang bral bas shes pa brda sprod par 'tshal lags kyi zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa 'phags pa rab 'byor gyis lan gsol pa'o //
translated: This is the second part, the reply of the noble Subhuti.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: This also has two parts:

original: bkas smras pa phyi ma'i lan gsol ba dang / bkas smras pa snga ma'i lan gsol ba'o //
analyzed: bkas smras pa phyi ma'i lan gsol ba dang / bkas smras pa snga ma'i lan gsol ba'o //
translated: the reply to the later request and the reply to the earlier request.

original: 'di ni dang po ste 'di ltar sa dang po yan chad kyi byang chub sems dpa' dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du thams cad du ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid chos stong pa nyid kyi don dam pa khong du chud pa des mngon pa'i nga rgyal
analyzed: 'di ni dang po ste 'di ltar sa dang po yan chad kyi byang chub sems dpa' dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du thams cad du ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid chos stong pa nyid kyi don dam pa khong du chud pa des mngon pa'i nga rgyal
translated: This is the first part. Thus, the bodhisattvas from the first level onward, by their understanding of the ultimate meaning of the emptiness of phenomena, the characteristic of their being of one taste in all respects just as they are, are free from pride

original: rnams mi bskyed kyi theg pa gnyis dang so so'i skye bo la sogs pa ni ma yin pa'i phyir sems can nyung shas cig mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang bral bas shes pa brda sprod par 'tshal lags kyi zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: rnams mi bskyed kyi theg pa gnyis dang so so'i skye bo la sogs pa ni ma yin pa'i phyir sems can nyung shas cig mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang bral bas shes pa brda sprod par 'tshal lags kyi zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: but not for the two vehicles, ordinary beings, and so on.

original: 'o na ji ltar theg pa gnyis kyi de'i mtshan nyid 'chad shes shing byang chub sems dpa' rnams la 'chad par byed ce na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar theg pa gnyis kyi de'i mtshan nyid 'chad shes shing byang chub sems dpa' rnams la 'chad par byed ce na /
translated: If you ask, ‚ÄúHow do the bodhisattvas know and explain the characteristics of the two vehicles?‚Äù

original: smras pa sangs rgyas kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i phyir spyi'i mtshan nyid mdo tsam du shes pa yin gyi re re nas mthar phyin par khong du chud pa ni ma yin te /
