analyzed: smras pa sangs rgyas kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i phyir spyi'i mtshan nyid mdo tsam du shes pa yin gyi re re nas mthar phyin par khong du chud pa ni ma yin te /
translated: we reply: They know them in a general way and in brief through the Buddha‚Äôs blessing, but they do not comprehend them in detail.

original: de'i phyir des shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i le'u chen po'i nang nas ljags kyi mtshan nyid kyi le'u las rab 'byor gyis byang chub sems dpa' rnams la chos 'chad pa sangs rgyas kyi mthu yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir des shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i le'u chen po'i nang nas ljags kyi mtshan nyid kyi le'u las rab 'byor gyis byang chub sems dpa' rnams la chos 'chad pa sangs rgyas kyi mthu yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, in the chapter on the characteristics of the tongue in the great chapter on the perfection of wisdom, Subh≈´ti says that the bodhisattvas‚Äô teaching of the Dharma is the Buddha‚Äôs power.

original: 'phags pa rab 'byor 'di byin gyis brlabs pa'i dbang gis chos 'chad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'phags pa rab 'byor 'di byin gyis brlabs pa'i dbang gis chos 'chad pa yin no //
translated: Noble Subh≈´ti explains the Dharma by the power of his consecration.

original: 'o na ni chos su 'dzin pa yang spangs pa'i rigs so //
analyzed: 'o na ni chos su 'dzin pa yang spangs pa'i rigs so //
translated: 'If so, then it is reasonable to abandon even the apprehension of dharmas.

original: gal te ma spangs pa na ji ltar 'chad par nus byin gyi rlabs kyis brlabs pa'i phyir mngon par yid ches shing khong du yang chud la stong pa nyid 'chad par yang nus kyi /üîΩgal te de lta @182a * //
analyzed: gal te ma spangs pa na ji ltar 'chad par nus byin gyi rlabs kyis brlabs pa'i phyir mngon par yid ches shing khong du yang chud la stong pa nyid 'chad par yang nus kyi / gal te de lta @182a * //
translated: If not abandoned, how can he explain? Because of consecration, he can explain emptiness with full confidence and understanding.

original: ma yin na /
analyzed: ma yin na /
translated: If not,

original: chos su 'dzin pa spangs pa'i skyon dang ldan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: chos su 'dzin pa spangs pa'i skyon dang ldan par 'gyur te /
translated: he would have the fault of abandoning the apprehension of dharmas.

original: de'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel ba las /
analyzed: de'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel ba las /
translated: Therefore, in the commentary on the Perfection of Wisdom it is said:

original: theg pa gnyis chos stong ba nyid kyi tshul du da dung ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: theg pa gnyis chos stong ba nyid kyi tshul du da dung ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: Because the two vehicles have not yet realized emptiness in the manner of the teaching of dharmas.

original: 'phags pa rab 'byor 'di theg pa 'og ma pa yin na /
analyzed: 'phags pa rab 'byor 'di theg pa 'og ma pa yin na /
translated: If this noble Subh≈´ti is of the lower vehicle,

original: ji ltar len gsol cing zhing yongs su dag pa na gnas par gyur ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar len gsol cing zhing yongs su dag pa na gnas par gyur ce na /
translated: how did he make requests and dwell in a pure field?

original: sangs rgyas kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i phyir zhing yongs su dag par phyin par gyur ba'am /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i phyir zhing yongs su dag par phyin par gyur ba'am /
translated: or they go to a pure land through the Buddha‚Äôs blessing;

original: yangs sangs rgyas kyi sprul ba yin gyi yang dag pa'i lus kyis ni ma yin pa'am /
analyzed: yangs sangs rgyas kyi sprul ba yin gyi yang dag pa'i lus kyis ni ma yin pa'am /
translated: or they are emanations of the Buddha, not real bodies;

original: yang na zhing yongs su ma dag pa dag na bkas smras pa dang lan du gsol ba 'di lta bu dag srid pa yin no //
analyzed: yang na zhing yongs su ma dag pa dag na bkas smras pa dang lan du gsol ba 'di lta bu dag srid pa yin no //
translated: or it is possible that such questions and answers occur in impure lands.üîΩ‚ÄúLord, I know that in the realm of beings there are beings who, because of their pride, are proud of their pride,

original: bcom ldan 'das bdag gis sems can gyi khams na tshad ma mchis grangs ma mchis brjod du ma mchis pa snyed kyi sems can dag mngon pa'i nga rgyal can mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyis mngon du zin pa'i slad du shes pa brda sprod par bgyid pa dag mchis
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bdag gis sems can gyi khams na tshad ma mchis grangs ma mchis brjod du ma mchis pa snyed kyi sems can dag mngon pa'i nga rgyal can mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyis mngon du zin pa'i slad du shes pa brda sprod par bgyid pa dag mchis
translated: and who are teachers of knowledge.

original: par 'tshal lags kyi zhes bya ba man chad ni gnyis pa bkas smras pa snga ma'i lan gsol ba zhes bya ba ston to //
analyzed: par 'tshal lags kyi zhes bya ba man chad ni gnyis pa bkas smras pa snga ma'i lan gsol ba zhes bya ba ston to //
translated: The rest of the passage shows the second answer to the first question.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gsum du dbye ste lan mdor gsol pa dang / bdag nyid kyi mthong ba smos pa dang / bdag nyid kyi bsam pa gang yin pa gsol ba'o //
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gsum du dbye ste lan mdor gsol pa dang / bdag nyid kyi mthong ba smos pa dang / bdag nyid kyi bsam pa gang yin pa gsol ba'o //
translated: This is also divided into three parts: the brief answer, the mention of his own vision, and the statement of his own thought.

original: 'di ni dang po ste /
analyzed: 'di ni dang po ste /
translated: This is the first.

original: bdag gis sems can gyi khams na tshad ma mchis pa snyed kyi sems can dag mngon pa'i nga rgyal la brten nas shes pa brda sprod par bgyid pa mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bdag gis sems can gyi khams na tshad ma mchis pa snyed kyi sems can dag mngon pa'i nga rgyal la brten nas shes pa brda sprod par bgyid pa mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: I see in the realm of sentient beings sentient beings who, on the basis of overweening pride, teach knowledge.

original: shes pa brda sprod par byed pa'i mtshan nyid ni phyis 'og nas ston to //
analyzed: shes pa brda sprod par byed pa'i mtshan nyid ni phyis 'og nas ston to //
translated: The characteristic of teaching knowledge will be explained later.

original: 'dir gsungs pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal can zhes bya ba yang so so nas bshad pa mi mthun te /
analyzed: 'dir gsungs pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal can zhes bya ba yang so so nas bshad pa mi mthun te /
translated: Here, the so-called overweening pride is explained differently by each [commentator].

original: thams cad yod par smra ba'i gzhung dang sbyar na gang zag rnam pa bzhis mngon pa'i nga rgyal skyed par byed de /
analyzed: thams cad yod par smra ba'i gzhung dang sbyar na gang zag rnam pa bzhis mngon pa'i nga rgyal skyed par byed de /
translated: If applied to the scriptures of the SarvƒÅstivƒÅda, overweening pride is generated by four types of persons.

original: 'di lta ste so so'i skye bo dang 'bras bu 'og ma gsum po dag go zhes bshad de bstan bcos bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las ji skad du mngon pa'i nga rgyal bskyed pa yang bshad pa mi mthun pa gsum yod de /
analyzed: 'di lta ste so so'i skye bo dang 'bras bu 'og ma gsum po dag go zhes bshad de bstan bcos bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las ji skad du mngon pa'i nga rgyal bskyed pa yang bshad pa mi mthun pa gsum yod de /
translated: There are three different explanations of generating manifest pride.

original: kha cig na re so so'i skye bos ni lnga skyed par byed de 'di lta ste /
analyzed: kha cig na re so so'i skye bos ni lnga skyed par byed de 'di lta ste /
translated: Some say: Ordinary beings generate five,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba bzhi dang 'bras bu bzhi po dag la'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba bzhi dang 'bras bu bzhi po dag la'o //
translated: because they generate the four roots of virtue and four results.

original: rgyun du @182b zhugs pa ni bzhi skyed par byed de dang po ma gtogs pa'o //üîΩlan cig phyir 'ong bas ni gsum skyed par byed de dang po gnyis ma gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyun du @182b zhugs pa ni bzhi skyed par byed de dang po ma gtogs pa'o // lan cig phyir 'ong bas ni gsum skyed par byed de dang po gnyis ma gtogs pa'o //
translated: Those entering the stream generate four, excluding the first.üîΩThose returning once generate three, excluding the first two.

original: phyir mi 'ong bas ni gnyis skyed par byed de dang po gsum ma gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong bas ni gnyis skyed par byed de dang po gsum ma gtogs pa'o //
translated: Nonreturners generate two, excluding the first three.

original: dgra bcom pa la ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal med do zhe'o //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa la ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal med do zhe'o //
translated: Arhats do not generate manifest pride.

original: kha cig na re so so'i skye bos ni dgu skyed par byed de 'di lta ste /
analyzed: kha cig na re so so'i skye bos ni dgu skyed par byed de 'di lta ste /
translated: Some say: Ordinary beings generate nine,üîΩbecause they generate the four roots of virtue and five results.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dang zhugs pa bzhi dang 'bras bu la gnas pa bzhi po dag la'o //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dang zhugs pa bzhi dang 'bras bu la gnas pa bzhi po dag la'o //
translated: They are the four who have entered the fruit and the four who abide in the fruit.

original: rgyun du zhugs pas bdun skyed par byed de dang po gnyis ma gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pas bdun skyed par byed de dang po gnyis ma gtogs pa'o //
translated: The stream enterer generates seven, excluding the first two.

original: lan cig phyir 'ong bar zhugs pas drug skyed par byed de snga ma'i gsum po dag ma gtogs pa'o //üîΩlan cig phyir 'ong bas lnga skyed par byed de /
analyzed: lan cig phyir 'ong bar zhugs pas drug skyed par byed de snga ma'i gsum po dag ma gtogs pa'o // lan cig phyir 'ong bas lnga skyed par byed de /
translated: The once returner who has entered generates six, excluding the first three.

original: snga ma bzhi po dag ma gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: snga ma bzhi po dag ma gtogs pa'o //
translated: The once returner generates five, excluding the first four.

original: phyir mi 'ong bas zhugs pas bzhi skyed par byed de snga ma'i lnga po dag ma gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong bas zhugs pas bzhi skyed par byed de snga ma'i lnga po dag ma gtogs pa'o //
translated: The nonreturner who has entered generates four, excluding the first five.

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la gnas pas gsum skyed par byed de snga ma'i drug ma gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la gnas pas gsum skyed par byed de snga ma'i drug ma gtogs pa'o //
translated: The nonreturner who abides in the fruit generates three, excluding the first six.

original: dgra bcom pa la zhugs pas gnyis skyed par byed de snga ma'i bdun po dag ma gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa la zhugs pas gnyis skyed par byed de snga ma'i bdun po dag ma gtogs pa'o //
translated: The arhat who has entered generates two, excluding the first seven.

original: dgra bcom pa nyid las mngon pa'i nga rgyal med do //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid las mngon pa'i nga rgyal med do //
translated: There is no pride in the state of an arhat.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa la phyogs pa la ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal bskyed pa'i don med do zhe'o //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa la phyogs pa la ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal bskyed pa'i don med do zhe'o //
translated: It is meaningless to generate manifest pride in one who is entering the stream.

original: spyad pa dag gis bshad pa'i 'phags pa rnams kyang dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa khyad par can dag la mngon pa'i nga rgyal bskyed pas de'i phyir 'phags pa drug po dag la snga ma bzhin du skyed par byed pa yin no zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: spyad pa dag gis bshad pa'i 'phags pa rnams kyang dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa khyad par can dag la mngon pa'i nga rgyal bskyed pas de'i phyir 'phags pa drug po dag la snga ma bzhin du skyed par byed pa yin no zhes 'byung ste /
translated: Also, the six aryas explained in the chapter on conduct generate manifest pride in special contaminated virtue.

original: rgya cher de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rgya cher de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: This is extensively stated in the Abhidharmakosa.

original: mdo sde pa dag kyang thams cad yod par smra ba 'dod pa dang mthun pas 'gal ba med de sde pa de las brtags pa mang po yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdo sde pa dag kyang thams cad yod par smra ba 'dod pa dang mthun pas 'gal ba med de sde pa de las brtags pa mang po yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Vaibhasikas assert that since they agree with the assertion that everything exists, there is no contradiction, because many imputed entities exist in that school.

original: 'dir theg pa chen po'i bstan pa dang sbyar na phal cher sde pa gnyis kyi gzhung dang mthun te mngon pa'i nga rgyal ni so so skye bo dang slob pa dang bcas pa'i 'phags pa dag la yod par bshad de de'i phyir rnam par rig pa tsam du
analyzed: 'dir theg pa chen po'i bstan pa dang sbyar na phal cher sde pa gnyis kyi gzhung dang mthun te mngon pa'i nga rgyal ni so so skye bo dang slob pa dang bcas pa'i 'phags pa dag la yod par bshad de de'i phyir rnam par rig pa tsam du
translated: Therefore, the treatise Establishing Mere Consciousness

original: grub pa'i bstan bcos las nga rgyal gang zhe na /
analyzed: grub pa'i bstan bcos las nga rgyal gang zhe na /
translated: says, ‚ÄúWhat is pride?

original: bdag nyid khengs shing gzhan dag la rlom sems dang bcas pa'i mtshan nyid de nga rgyal med pa la sgrib cing sdug bsngal skyed par byed pa'i rten byed pa'i las can no //üîΩnga @183a * //
analyzed: bdag nyid khengs shing gzhan dag la rlom sems dang bcas pa'i mtshan nyid de nga rgyal med pa la sgrib cing sdug bsngal skyed par byed pa'i rten byed pa'i las can no // nga @183a * //
translated: It has the character of self-inflation and arrogance toward others. It obscures the absence of pride and functions as the basis for producing suffering.

original: rgyal 'di'i bye brag dang rnam pa dgu yod de /
analyzed: rgyal 'di'i bye brag dang rnam pa dgu yod de /
translated: This pride has nine specific types and aspects.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows.

original: phyogs rnam pa gsum dang bdag dang yon tan las skyes pa'o //
analyzed: phyogs rnam pa gsum dang bdag dang yon tan las skyes pa'o //
translated: It arises from the three aspects of partiality, self, and qualities.

original: thams cad kyang mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya bar rtogs pa dag go zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: thams cad kyang mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya bar rtogs pa dag go zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: All are understood to be abandoned by seeing and meditation.‚Äù

original: 'phags pa'i gnas skabs su yang nga rgyal mngon du 'byung bas nga rgyal gyi rnam pa yang des 'byung ba la 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i gnas skabs su yang nga rgyal mngon du 'byung bas nga rgyal gyi rnam pa yang des 'byung ba la 'gal ba med do //
translated: Since pride also occurs in the context of ƒÅryas, it is not contradictory that the aspect of pride also occurs in that context.

original: nga rgyal rnam pa bdun ni /
analyzed: nga rgyal rnam pa bdun ni /
translated: There are seven types of pride:

original: bstan bcos phung po lnga'i rab tu 'byed pa las nga rgyal gang zhe na 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bstan bcos phung po lnga'i rab tu 'byed pa las nga rgyal gang zhe na 'di lta ste /
translated: The treatise Analysis of the Five Aggregates says, ‚ÄúWhat is pride?

original: nga rgyal dang che ba'i nga rgyal dang / nga rgyal las kyang nga rgyal dang nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang cung zad snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang / log pa'i nga rgyal lo //
analyzed: nga rgyal dang che ba'i nga rgyal dang / nga rgyal las kyang nga rgyal dang nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang cung zad snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang / log pa'i nga rgyal lo //
translated: It is arrogance, excessive arrogance, the pride of thinking ‚ÄòI am,‚Äô the pride of thinking ‚ÄòI am superior,‚Äô the pride of thinking ‚ÄòI am a little lower,‚Äô the pride of thinking ‚ÄòI am equal,‚Äô the pride of thinking ‚ÄòI am superior,‚Äô and the pride of thinking ‚ÄòI am inferior.‚Äô

original: nga rgyal ni 'di lta ste /üîΩchung ngu bas bdag tshe'o snyam pa'am /
analyzed: nga rgyal ni 'di lta ste / chung ngu bas bdag tshe'o snyam pa'am /
translated: Arrogance is thinking ‚ÄòI am superior‚Äô

original: mtshungs pa dang mtshungs so snyam du sems khengs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: mtshungs pa dang mtshungs so snyam du sems khengs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: or thinking ‚ÄòI am equal‚Äô to those who are inferior or equal.

original: che ba'i nga rgyal ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: che ba'i nga rgyal ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Excessive arrogance is thinking ‚ÄòI am superior‚Äô

original: mtshungs pa bas bdag che ba'am /
analyzed: mtshungs pa bas bdag che ba'am /
translated: or thinking ‚ÄòI am equal‚Äô to those who are superior.

original: bdag che ba dang mtshungs so snyam du bdag sems khengs pa gang yin pa'o //üîΩnga rgyal las kyang nga rgyal ni 'di lta ste /üîΩche ba bas bdag che'o snyam du sems khengs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: bdag che ba dang mtshungs so snyam du bdag sems khengs pa gang yin pa'o // nga rgyal las kyang nga rgyal ni 'di lta ste / che ba bas bdag che'o snyam du sems khengs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the inflation of the mind which thinks, I am equal to the equal of the great ones.üîΩ Pride of pride is the inflation of the mind which thinks,

original: nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal ni 'di lta ste /
translated: I am greater than the great ones.üîΩ Pride of thinking I is the inflation of the mind which thinks,

original: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po rnams la bdag gam bdag gir yang dag par lta ba'i sems khengs pa gang yin pa'o //üîΩmngon pa'i nga rgyal ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po rnams la bdag gam bdag gir yang dag par lta ba'i sems khengs pa gang yin pa'o // mngon pa'i nga rgyal ni 'di lta ste /
translated: I am the five appropriative aggregates.

original: gong ma'i khyad par thob par bya ba ma thob par bdag gis thob po snyam du sems khengs pa gang yin pa'o //üîΩcung zad snyam pa'i nga rgyal ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gong ma'i khyad par thob par bya ba ma thob par bdag gis thob po snyam du sems khengs pa gang yin pa'o // cung zad snyam pa'i nga rgyal ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Pride of conceit is the inflation of the mind which thinks, I have attained what has not been attained.üîΩ Pride of thinking I am a little is the inflation of the mind which thinks,

original: khyad ches 'phags pas bdag cung zad cig gis chung ngo snyam pa'i sems khengs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: khyad ches 'phags pas bdag cung zad cig gis chung ngo snyam pa'i sems khengs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: I am a little less than the very great ones.

original: log pa'i nga rgyal ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: log pa'i nga rgyal ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Pride of wrong view is the inflation of the mind which thinks,üîΩI am the doer, the cause, the creator, the modifier, the disposer, the lord, the master, the maker of beings, the maker of heaven and earth, the maker of gods and men, the maker of all that exists and does not exist.

original: yon tan ma yin pa dang ldan pa las bdag yon tan dang ldan no snyam du sems khengs pa gang yin pa'o zhes 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: yon tan ma yin pa dang ldan pa las bdag yon tan dang ldan no snyam du sems khengs pa gang yin pa'o zhes 'byung ba'o //
translated: It is the inflation of the mind in which one who is not virtuous thinks, I am virtuous.

original: bstan bcos mngon pa kun las btus pa dang / chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa dang / rnam 'byor spyod pa'i sa las kyang 'di dang mthun par bshad do //
analyzed: bstan bcos mngon pa kun las btus pa dang / chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa dang / rnam 'byor spyod pa'i sa las kyang 'di dang mthun par bshad do //
translated: The Abhidharma treatise, the Compendium of Higher Knowledge, the Compendium of Different Kinds of Dharma, and the Levels of Spiritual Practice explain this in a way that is consistent with this.

original: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las /
analyzed: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las /
translated: The commentary to the Perfection of Wisdom says:

original: gang zag mngon pa'i nga rgyal can ni sangs rgyas kyi slob ma bsam @183b gtan dang ting nge 'dzin dang ldan pa thob pa la 'phags pa'i 'bras bu ma thob par bdag gis thob po snyam du sems khengs pa'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: gang zag mngon pa'i nga rgyal can ni sangs rgyas kyi slob ma bsam @183b gtan dang ting nge 'dzin dang ldan pa thob pa la 'phags pa'i 'bras bu ma thob par bdag gis thob po snyam du sems khengs pa'o zhes bshad do //
translated: The person who is inflated with pride is a disciple of the Buddha who has attained meditative stabilization and meditative absorption, but who has not attained the fruit of a noble being. He thinks, I have attained it, and his mind is inflated.üîΩThe nine types of pride are explained in the treatise Generating the Knowledge of the Scriptures:

original: nga rgyal rnam pa dgu zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos shes pa bskyed pa las nga rgyal ni rnam pa dgu yod de /
analyzed: nga rgyal rnam pa dgu zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos shes pa bskyed pa las nga rgyal ni rnam pa dgu yod de /
translated: Pride has nine types.

original: 'di lta ste bdag mchog tu gyur pa dang / bdag dang mtshungs pa dang bdag pas chung ba dang / bdag pas mchog tu gyur pa yod pa dang / bdag dang mtshungs pa yod pa dang / bdag pas dma' ba yod pa dang / bdag pas mchog tu gyur pa med pa dang /
analyzed: 'di lta ste bdag mchog tu gyur pa dang / bdag dang mtshungs pa dang bdag pas chung ba dang / bdag pas mchog tu gyur pa yod pa dang / bdag dang mtshungs pa yod pa dang / bdag pas dma' ba yod pa dang / bdag pas mchog tu gyur pa med pa dang /
translated: They are as follows: ‚ÄúI am superior,‚Äù ‚ÄúI am equal,‚Äù ‚ÄúI am inferior,‚Äù ‚ÄúThere is one who is superior to me,‚Äù ‚ÄúThere is one who is equal to me,‚Äù ‚ÄúThere is one who is inferior to me,‚Äù ‚ÄúThere is no one who is superior to me,‚Äù ‚ÄúThere is no one who is equal to me,‚Äù ‚ÄúThere is no one who is inferior to me.‚ÄùüîΩ

original: bdag dang mtshungs pa med pa dang bdag pas dma' ba med do snyam pa'o zhes 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: bdag dang mtshungs pa med pa dang bdag pas dma' ba med do snyam pa'o zhes 'byung ba'o //
translated: It is the thought that I am superior, I am equal, I am inferior, I am superior, I am equal, I am inferior, I am not inferior, I am not superior, I am not equal.

original: bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las kyang nga rgyal rnam pa gsum gyi rnam pa'i ming kho na smos pa yin te /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las kyang nga rgyal rnam pa gsum gyi rnam pa'i ming kho na smos pa yin te /
translated: The treatise Attainment of Knowledge mentions the names of the three types of pride alone:

original: de'i phyir de nyid las mdo sde las ji skad du nga rgyal gyi rnam pa gsum zhes gsungs pa ni bdag mchog tu gyur to snyam pa'i nga rgyal gyi rnam pa dang / bdag pas dman no snyam pa'i nga rgyal gyi rnam pa dag yin no zhes bshad de don gyi rnam pa dgu bstan pa yin pas don du 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid las mdo sde las ji skad du nga rgyal gyi rnam pa gsum zhes gsungs pa ni bdag mchog tu gyur to snyam pa'i nga rgyal gyi rnam pa dang / bdag pas dman no snyam pa'i nga rgyal gyi rnam pa dag yin no zhes bshad de don gyi rnam pa dgu bstan pa yin pas don du 'gal ba med do //
translated: Since it teaches nine types of pride, there is no contradiction in meaning.

original: nga rgyal rnam pa bdun dang dgu zhes bya ba 'di yang rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa'i bstan bcos dang sbyar na gnas rnam pa lnga las skye bar bshad de /
analyzed: nga rgyal rnam pa bdun dang dgu zhes bya ba 'di yang rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa'i bstan bcos dang sbyar na gnas rnam pa lnga las skye bar bshad de /
translated: The seven and nine types of pride are explained in the treatise that establishes vij√±aptimƒÅtra as arising from five bases.üîΩTherefore the same text explains:

original: de'i phyir de nyid las 'di'i phye brag kyang rnam pa bdun nam rnam pa dgu yod de phyogs rnam pa gsum dang bdag dang yon tan gyi gnas las skyes pa'o zhes bshad de /
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid las 'di'i phye brag kyang rnam pa bdun nam rnam pa dgu yod de phyogs rnam pa gsum dang bdag dang yon tan gyi gnas las skyes pa'o zhes bshad de /
translated: Its divisions are seven or nine, since there are three types of pride from the three positions of self, qualities, and the basis.

original: de la re zhig nga rgyal rnam pa bdun las nga rgyal dang che ba'i nga rgyal dang nga rgyal las kyang nga rgyal dang cung zad snyam pa'i nga rgyal ni phyogs rnam pa gsum la brten nas 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de la re zhig nga rgyal rnam pa bdun las nga rgyal dang che ba'i nga rgyal dang nga rgyal las kyang nga rgyal dang cung zad snyam pa'i nga rgyal ni phyogs rnam pa gsum la brten nas 'byung ngo //
translated: Among the seven types of pride, pride, exaggerated pride, and supreme pride occur on the basis of the three types of objects.

original: nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal ni bdag gnas su gyur pa la brten nas skye'o //
analyzed: nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal ni bdag gnas su gyur pa la brten nas skye'o //
translated: The pride of thinking ‚ÄúI am‚Äù occurs on the basis of the self as the basis.

original: log pa'i nga rgyal dang mngon pa'i nga rgyal ni yon tan gnas su gyur pa la brten nas skye ste /
analyzed: log pa'i nga rgyal dang mngon pa'i nga rgyal ni yon tan gnas su gyur pa la brten nas skye ste /
translated: The false pride and the manifest pride occur on the basis of the basis of qualities.

original: 'bring dang chen po'i rnam pa la brten nas ni che ba'i nga rgyal skye'o //
analyzed: 'bring dang chen po'i rnam pa la brten nas ni che ba'i nga rgyal skye'o //
translated: Exaggerated pride occurs on the basis of the middling and the great aspects.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa las chung du dang 'bring gi rnam pa gnyis las ni nga rgyal skye'o //üîΩ'bring dang chen po'i rnam pa la brten nas ni che ba'i nga rgyal skye'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa las chung du dang 'bring gi rnam pa gnyis las ni nga rgyal skye'o // 'bring dang chen po'i rnam pa la brten nas ni che ba'i nga rgyal skye'o //
translated: Therefore, the treatise Abhidharmasamuccaya states: Pride occurs on the basis of the two aspects of the small and the middling.üîΩExaggerated pride occurs on the basis of the middling and the great aspects.

original: chen po'i rnam pa la brten nas @184a * //
analyzed: chen po'i rnam pa la brten nas @184a * //
translated: Manifest pride occurs on the basis of the great aspect.

original: ni nga rgyal las kyang nga rgyal skye'o //
analyzed: ni nga rgyal las kyang nga rgyal skye'o //
translated: Pride is born from pride.

original: chung ngu'i rnam pa la brten nas ni cung zad snyam pa'i nga rgyal skye'o //
analyzed: chung ngu'i rnam pa la brten nas ni cung zad snyam pa'i nga rgyal skye'o //
translated: From the idea of being inferior, the pride of thinking oneself a little better is born.üîΩFrom the idea of the five aggregates of attachment as self and as mine, the pride of thinking ‚ÄúI am‚Äù is born.üîΩFrom the idea of having attained special qualities when one has not, the pride of thinking ‚ÄúI am special‚Äù is born.üîΩFrom the idea of having qualities when one does not, the pride of thinking ‚ÄúI am‚Äù is born.

original: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag lo bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa de las ni nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal 'byung ngo //
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag lo bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa de las ni nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal 'byung ngo //
translated: The pride of thinking ‚ÄúI am‚Äù is born from the idea of the five aggregates of attachment as self and as mine.üîΩThe pride of thinking ‚ÄúI am special‚Äù is born from the idea of having attained special qualities when one has not.

original: yon tan khyad par can ma thob par bdag gis yon tan khyad par can thob snyam pa las ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal 'byung ngo //
analyzed: yon tan khyad par can ma thob par bdag gis yon tan khyad par can thob snyam pa las ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal 'byung ngo //
translated: The pride of thinking ‚ÄúI am‚Äù is born from the idea of having qualities when one does not.üîΩThe pride of thinking ‚ÄúI am‚Äù is born from the idea of the five aggregates of attachment as self and as mine.üîΩThe pride of thinking ‚ÄúI am special‚Äù is born from the idea of having attained special qualities when one has not.üîΩThe pride of thinking ‚ÄúI am‚Äù is born from the idea of having qualities when one does not.üîΩThe pride of thinking ‚ÄúI am‚Äù is born from the idea of the five aggregates of attachment as self and as mine.üîΩThe pride of thinking ‚ÄúI am special‚Äù is born from the idea of having attained special qualities when one has not.

original: yang dag par yon tan med bzhin du yang bdag ni yon tan dang ldan no snyam pa las ni log pa'i nga rgyal 'byung ngo zhes bshad do //üîΩnga rgyal rnam pa dgu rnam par 'byed pa yang bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
analyzed: yang dag par yon tan med bzhin du yang bdag ni yon tan dang ldan no snyam pa las ni log pa'i nga rgyal 'byung ngo zhes bshad do //üîΩnga rgyal rnam pa dgu rnam par 'byed pa yang bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
translated: The pride of thinking ‚ÄúI am‚Äù is born from the idea of having qualities when one does not.üîΩThe pride of thinking ‚ÄúI am‚Äù is born from the idea of the five aggregates of attachment as self and as mine.üîΩThe pride of thinking ‚ÄúI am special‚Äù is born from the idea of having attained special qualities when one has not.üîΩThe pride of thinking ‚ÄúI am‚Äù is born from the idea of having qualities when one does not.üîΩThe pride of thinking ‚ÄúI am‚Äù is born from the idea of the five aggregates of attachment as self and as mine.üîΩThe pride of thinking ‚ÄúI am special‚Äù is born from the idea of having attained special qualities when one has not.üîΩThe pride of thinking ‚ÄúI am‚Äù is born from the idea of having qualities when one does not.üîΩThe pride of thinking ‚ÄúI am‚Äù is born from the idea of the five aggregates of attachment as self and as mine.üîΩThe pride of thinking ‚ÄúI am special‚Äù is born from the idea of having attained special qualities

original: bstan bcos shes pa skyed pa dang sbyar na mdzod kyi bstan bcos las ji skad du 'di ltar rnam pa dgu po 'di dag ni snga ma'i nga rgyal bdun gyi rnam pa las 'byung ba yin te 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bstan bcos shes pa skyed pa dang sbyar na mdzod kyi bstan bcos las ji skad du 'di ltar rnam pa dgu po 'di dag ni snga ma'i nga rgyal bdun gyi rnam pa las 'byung ba yin te 'di lta ste /
translated: These nine types arise from the seven types of pride mentioned previously, which are

original: sngar bstan pa'i nga rgyal dang che ba'i nga rgyal dang cung zad snyam pa'i nga rgyal las so //
analyzed: sngar bstan pa'i nga rgyal dang che ba'i nga rgyal dang cung zad snyam pa'i nga rgyal las so //
translated: pride, great pride, and slight pride, as previously explained.

original: 'di ltar rnam pa gsum po de dag gal te lta ba la brten nas 'du byed skyed par byed na /
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam pa gsum po de dag gal te lta ba la brten nas 'du byed skyed par byed na /
translated: If these three types of pride generate formations in dependence on view,

original: de la khyad par can gyi rnam pa gsum gsum mngon par 'grub par 'gyur te /üîΩdang po'i gsum ni go rims bzhin du che ba'i nga rgyal dang / nga rgyal dang cung zad snyam pa'i nga rgyal dag go //
analyzed: de la khyad par can gyi rnam pa gsum gsum mngon par 'grub par 'gyur te / dang po'i gsum ni go rims bzhin du che ba'i nga rgyal dang / nga rgyal dang cung zad snyam pa'i nga rgyal dag go //
translated: then three special types are established.üîΩThe first three are great pride, pride, and slight pride, respectively.

original: bar ma gsum ni go rims bzhin du cung zad snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang nga'i nga rgyal dang che ba'i nga rgyal dag go //
analyzed: bar ma gsum ni go rims bzhin du cung zad snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang nga'i nga rgyal dang che ba'i nga rgyal dag go //
translated: The middle three are slight pride, pride, and great pride, respectively.

original: tha ma gsum ni go rims bzhin du nga rgyal dang / che ba'i nga rgyal dang cung zad snyam pa'i nga rgyal de dag go zhes bshad do rgya cher ni bstan bcos bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las 'byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: tha ma gsum ni go rims bzhin du nga rgyal dang / che ba'i nga rgyal dang cung zad snyam pa'i nga rgyal de dag go zhes bshad do rgya cher ni bstan bcos bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las 'byung ba bzhin no //
translated: The extensive explanation is like that found in the Great Treatise on Differentiation.

original: bstan bcos phyogs kyi rnam pa'i gnas bstan pa las nga rgyal gyi rnam pa bshad pa dang sbyar na de las re zhig bdag mchog go snyam pa'i nga rgyal gyi rnam pa ni nga rgyal rnam pa gsum las 'byung ste /
analyzed: bstan bcos phyogs kyi rnam pa'i gnas bstan pa las nga rgyal gyi rnam pa bshad pa dang sbyar na de las re zhig bdag mchog go snyam pa'i nga rgyal gyi rnam pa ni nga rgyal rnam pa gsum las 'byung ste /
translated: When applied to the explanation of the aspects of pride in the treatise Exposition of the Classes of Phenomena, the aspect of pride thinking I am superior arises from three types of pride.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows.

original: nga rgyal dang che ba'i nga rgyal dang / nga rgyal las kyang nga rgyal las so //
analyzed: nga rgyal dang che ba'i nga rgyal dang / nga rgyal las kyang nga rgyal las so //
translated: Pride, great pride and pride over pride.

original: gsum po 'di dag ni dman pa dang mtshungs pa dang / khyad par du gyur pa'i yul la rtog pa'i bye brag gi phyir te /
analyzed: gsum po 'di dag ni dman pa dang mtshungs pa dang / khyad par du gyur pa'i yul la rtog pa'i bye brag gi phyir te /
translated: These three are distinguished by the object of investigation, which is inferior, equal or superior.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las bstan bcos phyogs kyi rnam pa'i gnas bstan pa las bshad pa dang sbyar na bdag mchog @184b go snyam pa'i nga rgyal gyis ni nga rgyal rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las bstan bcos phyogs kyi rnam pa'i gnas bstan pa las bshad pa dang sbyar na bdag mchog @184b go snyam pa'i nga rgyal gyis ni nga rgyal rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Therefore, if we apply the explanation in the Great Treatise on Differentiations to the explanation of the topics of the treatise in the Abhidharmako≈õa, there are three types of pride:

original: dman pa dag las bdag ni lhag go snyam pa gang yin pa de ni nga rgyal zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dman pa dag las bdag ni lhag go snyam pa gang yin pa de ni nga rgyal zhes bya'o //
translated: Pride is the thought i am superior to those who are inferior.

original: mtshungs pa dag las ni bdag mchog go snyam pa gang yin pa de ni che'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mtshungs pa dag las ni bdag mchog go snyam pa gang yin pa de ni che'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal zhes bya'o //
translated: The thought i am equal to those who are equal is the pride thinking i am great.

original: mchog tu gyur pa dag las bdag ni mchog tu gyur pa yin no snyam pa gang yin pa de ni nga rgyal las kyang nga rgyal zhes bya'o //üîΩnga rgyal gyi rnam pa gzhan brgyad ni ci rigs par bshad par bya'o zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: mchog tu gyur pa dag las bdag ni mchog tu gyur pa yin no snyam pa gang yin pa de ni nga rgyal las kyang nga rgyal zhes bya'o // nga rgyal gyi rnam pa gzhan brgyad ni ci rigs par bshad par bya'o zhes 'byung ste /
translated: The thought i am superior to those who are superior is the pride thinking i am superior to those who are superior.üîΩThe other eight types of pride should be explained as appropriate.

original: de la nga rgyal gyi rnam pa brgyad ni ci rigs par bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de la nga rgyal gyi rnam pa brgyad ni ci rigs par bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The other eight types of pride should be explained as appropriate.

original: bdag dang mtshungs so snyam pa'i nga rgyal gyi rnam pa ni 'bring dang chen po'i rnam pa la brten nas nga rgyal rnam pa gnyis sdud par byed de /
analyzed: bdag dang mtshungs so snyam pa'i nga rgyal gyi rnam pa ni 'bring dang chen po'i rnam pa la brten nas nga rgyal rnam pa gnyis sdud par byed de /
translated: The form of pride that thinks ‚ÄúI am equal‚Äù combines the two forms of pride, based on the form of pride that thinks ‚ÄúI am superior‚Äù and the form of pride that thinks ‚ÄúI am slightly inferior.‚Äù

original: mtshungs pa la mtshungs so snyam du 'dzin pa gang yin pa de ni nga rgyal zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mtshungs pa la mtshungs so snyam du 'dzin pa gang yin pa de ni nga rgyal zhes bya'o //
translated: The form of pride that thinks ‚ÄúI am equal‚Äù to those who are equal to me is called pride.

original: khyad par du gyur ba la mtshungs so snyam du 'dzin pa gang yin pa de ni che ba'i nga rgyal zhes bya'o //
analyzed: khyad par du gyur ba la mtshungs so snyam du 'dzin pa gang yin pa de ni che ba'i nga rgyal zhes bya'o //
translated: The form of pride that thinks ‚ÄúI am equal‚Äù to those who are superior is called excessive pride.

original: bdag chung ngo snyam pa'i nga rgyal ni chen po'i rnam pa la brten nas nga rgyal rnam pa gcig sdud par byed de /
analyzed: bdag chung ngo snyam pa'i nga rgyal ni chen po'i rnam pa la brten nas nga rgyal rnam pa gcig sdud par byed de /
translated: The form of pride that thinks ‚ÄúI am slightly inferior‚Äù combines the one form of pride that thinks ‚ÄúI am superior,‚Äù based on the form of pride that thinks ‚ÄúI am superior.‚Äù

original: ches khyad par du 'phags pa las bdag cung zad cig gis dman no snyam pa gang yin pa de ni cung zad snyam pa'i nga rgyal zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ches khyad par du 'phags pa las bdag cung zad cig gis dman no snyam pa gang yin pa de ni cung zad snyam pa'i nga rgyal zhes bya'o //
translated: The form of pride that thinks ‚ÄúI am slightly inferior‚Äù to those who are greatly superior is called the pride of thinking ‚ÄúI am slightly inferior.‚Äù

original: mchog tu gyur pa yod pa dang dman pa med pa yang bdag chung ngo snyam pa dang 'dra bar bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: mchog tu gyur pa yod pa dang dman pa med pa yang bdag chung ngo snyam pa dang 'dra bar bshad par bya'o //
translated: The pride that thinks ‚ÄúI am slightly inferior‚Äù should be explained as being like the pride that thinks ‚ÄúI am equal‚Äù to those who are superior and the pride that thinks ‚ÄúI am superior‚Äù to those who are equal.

original: mtshungs pa yod pa dang / mchog tu gyur pa med pa ni bdag dang mtshungs so snyam pa dang 'dra bar bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: mtshungs pa yod pa dang / mchog tu gyur pa med pa ni bdag dang mtshungs so snyam pa dang 'dra bar bshad par bya'o //
translated: The same should be said for the existence of the equal and the non-existence of the superior, as if one were to think, ‚ÄúI am equal to myself.‚Äù

original: dman pa yod pa dang mtshungs pa med pa ni bdag mchog tu gyur pa dang 'dra bar bshad do //
analyzed: dman pa yod pa dang mtshungs pa med pa ni bdag mchog tu gyur pa dang 'dra bar bshad do //
translated: The existence of the inferior and the non-existence of the equal should be explained as if one were to think, ‚ÄúI am superior.‚Äù

original: rnam pa dgu po de dag las gsum ni rnam pa gsum la brten to //
analyzed: rnam pa dgu po de dag las gsum ni rnam pa gsum la brten to //
translated: Among these nine types, three are based on the three types of pride.

original: gsum ni 'bring dang chen po'i rnam pa la brten to //
analyzed: gsum ni 'bring dang chen po'i rnam pa la brten to //
translated: Three are based on the middling and great types.

original: gsum ni chen po'i rnam pa la brten te snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gsum ni chen po'i rnam pa la brten te snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: Three are based on the great type, as should be understood as before.

original: 'dir nga rgyal dang bcas zhes bstan pa ni nga rgyal rnam pa bdun dang dgu las mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'dir nga rgyal dang bcas zhes bstan pa ni nga rgyal rnam pa bdun dang dgu las mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang sbyar ro //
translated: Here, the statement ‚Äúalong with pride‚Äù indicates that the seven types of pride and the nine types of pride are associated with manifest pride.

original: 'di la yang bshad pa mi mthun pa gsum yod de /
analyzed: 'di la yang bshad pa mi mthun pa gsum yod de /
translated: Here, there are three different explanations.

original: slob dpon yang dag bden pa ni so so skye bo la mngon pa'i nga rgyal yod par bshad de 'di ltar dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i rnal 'byor pa la yang dag pa'i rnal 'byor ro snyam du @185a * //
analyzed: slob dpon yang dag bden pa ni so so skye bo la mngon pa'i nga rgyal yod par bshad de 'di ltar dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i rnal 'byor pa la yang dag pa'i rnal 'byor ro snyam du @185a * //
translated: The Acarya, the true man, explains that ordinary people have manifest pride, because the yogi who has an object thinks, I am a true yogi.

original: mngon pa'i nga rgyal skye ba'i phyir ro zhe'o //
analyzed: mngon pa'i nga rgyal skye ba'i phyir ro zhe'o //
translated: Because of that, manifest pride arises.

original: kha cig ni so so skye bo dang theg pa gnyis kyi slob pa dag la mngon pa'i nga rgyal yod par bshad de /
analyzed: kha cig ni so so skye bo dang theg pa gnyis kyi slob pa dag la mngon pa'i nga rgyal yod par bshad de /
translated: Some say that ordinary people and those in training in the two vehicles have manifest pride,

original: 'di ltar dgra bcom pa dag ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar dgra bcom pa dag ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because arhats have abandoned the obscurations of the mental afflictions.

original: de'i phyir dam pa'i chos punda r'i ka'i mdo las yang dag par dgra bcom pa thob pas gang de skad bshad la yid mi ches na de ni gnas med do zhes gsungs so zhe'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir dam pa'i chos punda r'i ka'i mdo las yang dag par dgra bcom pa thob pas gang de skad bshad la yid mi ches na de ni gnas med do zhes gsungs so zhe'o //
translated: Therefore, in the Parinirvana Sutra, it says, ‚ÄúIf one does not believe what is explained in that way, that is impossible.‚Äù

original: kha cig ni dgra bcom pa yang gtogs so zhes zer te de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: kha cig ni dgra bcom pa yang gtogs so zhes zer te de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Some say that arhats are included, because of what?

original: nyon mongs pa'i nga rgyal med kyang shes bya'i nga rgyal dang bcas pa'i phyir ro zhe'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i nga rgyal med kyang shes bya'i nga rgyal dang bcas pa'i phyir ro zhe'o //
translated: Because, although they are without the pride of the defilements, they are endowed with the pride of the knowable.

original: gal te de lta na dam pa'i chos punda ra'i ka las gsungs pa de ji ltar shes par bya zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na dam pa'i chos punda ra'i ka las gsungs pa de ji ltar shes par bya zhe na /
translated: If that is so, how should one understand what is said in the Subahupariprccha about the Dharma?

original: smras pa de ni nyon mongs pa'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs kyi 'di ni shes bya la brten nas bstan pa yin pas yod ces bshad pa dang med ces bshad pa de dag phan tshun 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: smras pa de ni nyon mongs pa'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs kyi 'di ni shes bya la brten nas bstan pa yin pas yod ces bshad pa dang med ces bshad pa de dag phan tshun 'gal ba med do //
translated: It is said that that was taught with reference to the defilements, but this is taught with reference to the knowable. Therefore, there is no contradiction between the statement that it exists and the statement that it does not exist.

original: sa bdun man chad kyi byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa la mngon pa'i nga rgyal 'byung ngam zhe na /
analyzed: sa bdun man chad kyi byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa la mngon pa'i nga rgyal 'byung ngam zhe na /
translated: Does the pride of the knowable arise for Bodhisattvas on the seven stages and below?

original: smras pa 'di la bshad pa gsum yod de kha cig na res dang po yan chad mngon pa'i nga rgyal mi skyed de /
analyzed: smras pa 'di la bshad pa gsum yod de kha cig na res dang po yan chad mngon pa'i nga rgyal mi skyed de /
translated: It is said that there are three explanations. Some say that from the first stage on, the pride of the knowable does not arise,

original: don dam pa'i ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid thob pa'i phyir ro zhe'o /
analyzed: don dam pa'i ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid thob pa'i phyir ro zhe'o /
translated: because they have attained the characteristic of the one taste of the ultimate.

original: kha cig na re sa bdun pa man chad la byung na nyes pa med do //
analyzed: kha cig na re sa bdun pa man chad la byung na nyes pa med do //
translated: Some say that if it arises on the seven stages and below, there is no fault.

original: mdo sde dag las ji skad du ched du bskyed pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o zhe'o //
analyzed: mdo sde dag las ji skad du ched du bskyed pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o zhe'o //
translated: Because they are generated by effort.

original: kha cig na re snga ma'i sa bdun po dag la nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'i nga rgyal nyi tshe 'byung bar ma zad kyi shes bya'i sgrib pa'i nga rgyal kyang mngon du 'byung ste /
analyzed: kha cig na re snga ma'i sa bdun po dag la nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'i nga rgyal nyi tshe 'byung bar ma zad kyi shes bya'i sgrib pa'i nga rgyal kyang mngon du 'byung ste /
translated: Some say: On the first seven stages, not only is the pride of the affliction obscuration generated, but also the pride of the obscuration to omniscience is generated.

original: sa re re la phan tshun ltos nas mchog dang dman pa yod pa'i phyir ro zhe'o //
analyzed: sa re re la phan tshun ltos nas mchog dang dman pa yod pa'i phyir ro zhe'o //
translated: Because each stage is superior and inferior in relation to each other.

original: sangs rgyas kyis sems can thams cad kyi mtha' thugs su chud dam zhe na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis sems can thams cad kyi mtha' thugs su chud dam zhe na /
translated: Do buddhas comprehend the end of all sentient beings?üîΩThe Great Exegesis declares:

original: smras pa bstan bcos bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las ji skad du 'dul ba las bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub kyi shing drung du sems can rnams phung po gsum du rnam par gzhag pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: smras pa bstan bcos bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las ji skad du 'dul ba las bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub kyi shing drung du sems can rnams phung po gsum du rnam par gzhag pa 'di lta ste /
translated: In the Vinaya, the Bhagavan said that at the foot of the Bodhi tree he classified sentient beings into three groups:

original: 'di snyed cig ni log pa'i phung po nyid du nges pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di snyed cig ni log pa'i phung po nyid du nges pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called those definitely possessing the wrong aggregates.

original: 'di snyed cig ni yang dag pa'i phung po nyid du nges pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di snyed cig ni yang dag pa'i phung po nyid du nges pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is the definite number of aggregates.

original: 'di snyad cig ni ma nges pa'i phung po nyid du nges pa zhes gsungs so zhes 'byung ba lta @185b bu'o //
analyzed: 'di snyad cig ni ma nges pa'i phung po nyid du nges pa zhes gsungs so zhes 'byung ba lta @185b bu'o //
translated: This is the indefinite number of aggregates.

original: sems can gyi tshad kyi dbang du mdzad nas rnam par gzhag pa yin nam chos kyi dbang du mdzad pa zhig yin /
analyzed: sems can gyi tshad kyi dbang du mdzad nas rnam par gzhag pa yin nam chos kyi dbang du mdzad pa zhig yin /
translated: Are the aggregates established in terms of the measure of sentient beings or in terms of the measure of phenomena?

original: gal te sems can gyi dbang du mdzad pa zhig yin na ni ci'i phyir sems can gyi rgya mtsho'i mtha' ni dpag par bya ba ma yin no zhes gsungs /
analyzed: gal te sems can gyi dbang du mdzad pa zhig yin na ni ci'i phyir sems can gyi rgya mtsho'i mtha' ni dpag par bya ba ma yin no zhes gsungs /
translated: If they are established in terms of the measure of sentient beings, why did the BhagavƒÅn say, ‚ÄúThe extent of the ocean of sentient beings is not to be measured‚Äù?

original: gal te chos kyi dbang du mdzad pa zhig yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te chos kyi dbang du mdzad pa zhig yin na ni /
translated: If they are established in terms of the measure of phenomena,

original: nyan thos rnams kyang rnam par gzhag nus par 'gyur bas sangs rgyas dang nyan thos thun mong du ma gyur pa ci yod ce na /
analyzed: nyan thos rnams kyang rnam par gzhag nus par 'gyur bas sangs rgyas dang nyan thos thun mong du ma gyur pa ci yod ce na /
translated: then ≈õrƒÅvakas would be able to establish them. What is the point of having buddhas and ≈õrƒÅvakas?

original: kha cig na re sems can gyi dbang du mdzad nas rnam par gzhag pa yin no zhes bshad de /
analyzed: kha cig na re sems can gyi dbang du mdzad nas rnam par gzhag pa yin no zhes bshad de /
translated: Some say: They are established in terms of the measure of sentient beings.

original: gal te de lta na ci'i phyir sems can gyi rgya mtsho'i mtha' ni dpag par bya ba ma yin no zhes gsungs /
analyzed: gal te de lta na ci'i phyir sems can gyi rgya mtsho'i mtha' ni dpag par bya ba ma yin no zhes gsungs /
translated: If that is so, why did he say, ‚ÄúThe end of the ocean of sentient beings is not to be discovered‚Äù?

original: smras pa / sangs rgyas sems can gyi rgya mtsho'i mtha' brnyes par gyur na yang nyes pa med de de yang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyis brnyes pa yin gyi bye brag gi mtshan nyid kyis brnyes pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: smras pa / sangs rgyas sems can gyi rgya mtsho'i mtha' brnyes par gyur na yang nyes pa med de de yang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyis brnyes pa yin gyi bye brag gi mtshan nyid kyis brnyes pa ni ma yin te /
translated: We reply: There is no fault in saying that the Buddha discovered the end of the ocean of sentient beings, because he discovered it in terms of their general characteristics, but not in terms of their specific characteristics.

original: 'di ltar sems can thams cad ni skye ba rnam pa bzhi las gud na med pas de ltar brnyes par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar sems can thams cad ni skye ba rnam pa bzhi las gud na med pas de ltar brnyes par gyur pa'o //
translated: Thus, he discovered it because all sentient beings are not beyond the four modes of birth.

original: kha cig na re chos kyi dbang du mdzad nas rnam par gzhag pa yin no zhe'o //
analyzed: kha cig na re chos kyi dbang du mdzad nas rnam par gzhag pa yin no zhe'o //
translated: Some say: He did so from the perspective of the Dharma.

original: gal te de lta na nyan thos rnams kyang rnam par gzhag pa yod pas sangs rgyas dang nyan thos thun mong du ma gyur pa ci zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na nyan thos rnams kyang rnam par gzhag pa yod pas sangs rgyas dang nyan thos thun mong du ma gyur pa ci zhig yod ce na /
translated: If that is so, then since ≈õrƒÅvakas also exist from the perspective of the Dharma, what is the difference between the Buddha and ≈õrƒÅvakas?

original: smras pa nyan thos ni sangs rgyas kyi rgyus thos pa yin la /
analyzed: smras pa nyan thos ni sangs rgyas kyi rgyus thos pa yin la /
translated: We reply: ≈örƒÅvakas are those who hear the Buddha‚Äôs words.

original: sangs rgyas ni slob dpon mi mnga' bar nyid kyis rnam par gzhag pa mdzad pas 'di ni thun mong du ma gyur pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas ni slob dpon mi mnga' bar nyid kyis rnam par gzhag pa mdzad pas 'di ni thun mong du ma gyur pa'o //
translated: The Buddha, however, is not dependent on a master, and he has established this by himself. This is not common to all.

original: kha cig na re stong gsum gyi 'jig rten gyi khams dang lo stong tshun chad kyi gang yin pa de ni sems can la brten nas rnam par gzhag pa yin no //üîΩ'jig rten gyi khams gzhan gyi 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan dang dus gzhan dag gi gang yin pa de dag ni chos la brten nas rnam par gzhag pa yin te 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa dang sbyar na yang de las dris
analyzed: kha cig na re stong gsum gyi 'jig rten gyi khams dang lo stong tshun chad kyi gang yin pa de ni sems can la brten nas rnam par gzhag pa yin no // 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan gyi 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan dang dus gzhan dag gi gang yin pa de dag ni chos la brten nas rnam par gzhag pa yin te 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa dang sbyar na yang de las dris
translated: Some say: That which is included in the trichiliocosm and one thousand years is established in dependence on sentient beings.üîΩThat which is included in other world systems and other times is established in dependence on the Dharma.

original: lan dag yod de /
analyzed: lan dag yod de /
translated: If it is applied to the commentary on the perfection of wisdom, there are questions and answers there.

original: de'i phyir de nyid las sems can thams cad kyi sems ma lus par mkhyen par rung ngam /
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid las sems can thams cad kyi sems ma lus par mkhyen par rung ngam /
translated: Therefore, is it suitable that he knows the minds of all sentient beings without exception?

original: gal te mkhyen na ni sems can la mtha' yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te mkhyen na ni sems can la mtha' yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: If he knows, then sentient beings would have a limit.

original: gal te mi mkhyen na ji ltar sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi mos pa rnams mi mkhyen par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te mi mkhyen na ji ltar sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi mos pa rnams mi mkhyen par 'gyur ro //
translated: If he does not know them, how can he know the mental dispositions of all sentient beings?

original: ci'i phyir sangs rgyas la thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya zhe na /üîΩsmras pa / sems can @186a * //
analyzed: ci'i phyir sangs rgyas la thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya zhe na / smras pa / sems can @186a * //

analyzed: gyi sems dang sems las 'byung ba'i chos ni ma lus par mkhyen par rung ste /
translated: He is omniscient because he knows the minds and mental factors of sentient beings without exception.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

original: mdo dag las ji skad du bden par smra ba rnams kyi nang na sangs rgyas ni mchog go zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: mdo dag las ji skad du bden par smra ba rnams kyi nang na sangs rgyas ni mchog go zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: Because it is said in the s≈´tras, ‚ÄúAmong those who speak the truth, the Buddha is supreme.‚Äù

original: gal te sems can thams cad kyi sems mkhyen cing mtha' brnyes pa ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te sems can thams cad kyi sems mkhyen cing mtha' brnyes pa ma yin na /
translated: If he does not know the minds of all sentient beings and does not attain omniscience,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ci'i phyir ma lus par mkhyen zhes gsungs /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ci'i phyir ma lus par mkhyen zhes gsungs /
translated: why did the BhagavƒÅn say, ‚ÄúI know without exception‚Äù?

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i gang zag ces kyang mi bya ste /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i gang zag ces kyang mi bya ste /
translated: He should not be called a person who is omniscient.

original: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung ni yang dag pa'i bden pa yin la gdon mi za bar thams cad mkhyen pa'i gang zag kyang yod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung ni yang dag pa'i bden pa yin la gdon mi za bar thams cad mkhyen pa'i gang zag kyang yod pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the speech of the Lord is the truth of the real, and there is no doubt that there are persons who are omniscient.

original: gzhan yang sems can mtha' med pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyang mtha' med de /
analyzed: gzhan yang sems can mtha' med pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyang mtha' med de /
translated: Moreover, since sentient beings are infinite, the knowledge of the one who knows all aspects is also infinite.

analyzed: dper na sgo che ba'i phyi kha gab kyang che ba yin no //
translated: For example, the outer door panel of a large door is also large.

original: gal te mkhyen pa la ni mtha' yod la sems can la ni mtha' med na ni klan ka 'di yod par 'gyur gyi 'dir mkhyen pa dang sems can gnyi ga yang mtha' med pa'i phyir khyod kyi 'di klan kar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gal te mkhyen pa la ni mtha' yod la sems can la ni mtha' med na ni klan ka 'di yod par 'gyur gyi 'dir mkhyen pa dang sems can gnyi ga yang mtha' med pa'i phyir khyod kyi 'di klan kar mi rung ngo //
translated: If knowledge were finite and sentient beings were infinite, this objection would exist. But since both knowledge and sentient beings are infinite, your objection is not appropriate.

original: gzhan yang mtha' yod ces bya ba dang / mtha' med ces bya ba gnyi ga yang sangs rgyas kyi chos las ni gzhan pa'i lung bstan pa dag yin par gsungs pa yin te /

original: dngos po bcu bzhi po de dag ni mi bden zhing phan pa med pa'i phyir klan kar mi rung ngo zhes 'byung ste zhib tu de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no //

analyzed: gzhan yang de nyid las gal te byang chub sems dpa' rnams sems can thams cad kyi re ba yongs su rdzogs par byed par gyur na /
translated: Moreover, that same text says, ‚ÄúIf bodhisattvas fulfilled the hopes of all sentient beings,

original: bkres pa dang grang ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal myong ba rnams kyang med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bkres pa dang grang ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal myong ba rnams kyang med par 'gyur ro //

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sems can thams cad re ba yongs su rdzogs shing sdug bsngal dang bral nas bde ba thob pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: sems can thams cad re ba yongs su rdzogs shing sdug bsngal dang bral nas bde ba thob pa'i phyir ro zhe na /

analyzed: smras pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs zhes bya ba yang ming gis thams cad yin gyi yang dag pa'i thams cad ni ma yin te /
translated: We say that ‚Äúall‚Äù is just a name, not an actual ‚Äúall.‚Äù

original: 'phags pa chos kyi tshig gi mdo'i tshigs su bcad pa las ji skad du /
analyzed: 'phags pa chos kyi tshig gi mdo'i tshigs su bcad pa las ji skad du /
translated: As it says in the noble S≈´tra on the Words of the Dharma:

original: thams cad kyang ni 'chi bas skrag gyur pas //
analyzed: thams cad kyang ni 'chi bas skrag gyur pas //

original: lcag dbyig na tshas mi 'jigs gang yang med //

original: bdag gi nyams ni gang yin dper @186b zhog la //
analyzed: bdag gi nyams ni gang yin dper @186b zhog la //

analyzed: gsad par mi bya lcag gis gzhu mi bya // zhes gsungs pa lta bu ste /
translated: I should not be killed, I should not be whipped.‚Äù

analyzed: thams cad lcag dbyig gi na tshas 'jigs so zhes gsungs mod kyi gzugs med pa'i khams kyi sems can gyi lus med pa'i phyir lcag dbyig gi na tsha med do //

analyzed: gzugs kyi khams kyi sems can lus yod kyang lcag dbyig gi na tsha med do //

original: lta bu'o // bcom ldan 'das bdag dus gcig na dgon pa nags khrod chen po zhig na mchis pa'i tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyis pa bdag nyid kyi mthong ba smos pa zhes bya ba ston to //

translated: The statement ‚ÄúBhagavƒÅn, at one time I was in a great forest wilderness‚Äù and so on teaches the second, the statement of one‚Äôs own vision.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /

analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi gnas bstan pa dang bdag gis dge slong de dag ces bya ba man chad kyis gzhan gyi shes pa brda sprod par byed pa bstan pa'o //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúI was in a great forest wilderness‚Äù and so on teaches the statement of one‚Äôs own vision, and the statement ‚ÄúI saw those bhik·π£us‚Äù and so on teaches the statement of the vision of others.

analyzed: gnyis pa bcad gtubs kyi gnas las dpen pa ni 'di lta ste /

analyzed: rgyang grags phyed dang gnyis phan chad ni dgon pa'i gnas zhes bya'o // byang phyogs kyi rgyang grags gcig mngon par 'grub par 'gyur te zhes bshad do //
translated: A monastery is beyond one and a half kro≈õas.

analyzed: gzhu lnga brgya la ni dgon pa'i gnas zhes bya'o //

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

original: yul mnyam ka ni sa gzhi mnyam par grong khyer dang thag nye yang sgra thos par mi 'gyur la byang phyogs ni mtho dman che zhing sgra thos pa'i phyir byang phyogs kyi rgyang grags che ba yin no //
analyzed: yul mnyam ka ni sa gzhi mnyam par grong khyer dang thag nye yang sgra thos par mi 'gyur la byang phyogs ni mtho dman che zhing sgra thos pa'i phyir byang phyogs kyi rgyang grags che ba yin no //
translated: In the plains, the ground is flat and even, so a town is not far away, and sound cannot be heard. But in the north, the ground is uneven and sound can be heard. Therefore, a kro≈õa in the north is greater.

analyzed: mdzod kyi bstan bcos las 'di'i tshad rgya cher rnam par 'byed de //
translated: The extent of a kro≈õa is extensively distinguished in the Abhidharmako≈õa.

translated: Therefore, it says in the KƒÅrikƒÅ:üîΩThe smallest particle, the smallest atom, the atom of gold, the atom of water,üîΩthe atom of rabbit, sheep, ox, and sunbeam,

original: sro ma shig dang nas dang sor mo'i tshigs //

analyzed: nyi zer gyi rdul bdun la ni sro ma gcig go // sro ma bdun la ni shig gcig go // shig bdun la ni @187b nas 'bru gcig go //

translated: Twenty-four fingers is one cubit.üîΩFour cubits is one

analyzed: khru bzhi chur bsgreng ba la gzhu gang ngo //

analyzed: grong khyer yongs su spangs te /
translated: ‚ÄúHaving abandoned towns,

original: rgyang grags gcig las 'das pa de ni dgon pa zhes bya'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: rgyang grags gcig las 'das pa de ni dgon pa zhes bya'o zhes bshad do //
translated: a place more than a kro≈õa away is called a ‚Äòremote place.‚ÄôüîΩ‚Äù

original: gnas pa bcu'i bstan bcos las /
analyzed: gnas pa bcu'i bstan bcos las /
translated: The Treatise on the Ten Grounds says:

original: 'du 'dzi'i gtam las ring du 'gyur ba ni dgon pa zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'du 'dzi'i gtam las ring du 'gyur ba ni dgon pa zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúA place far from the talk of crowds is called a ‚Äòremote place.‚ÄôüîΩ‚ÄùüîΩThe Levels of Yogic Deeds says, ‚ÄúA place that is isolated from towns and cities, such as a forest, a grove, or the outskirts of a town, is called a ‚Äòremote place.‚Äô

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las grong dang grong rdal las dben pa'i gnas mal dgon pa dang / nags 'dab dang / bas mtha' gang dag yin pa dag tu gnas par byed pa ni dgon pa pa zhes bya'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las grong dang grong rdal las dben pa'i gnas mal dgon pa dang / nags 'dab dang / bas mtha' gang dag yin pa dag tu gnas par byed pa ni dgon pa pa zhes bya'o zhes bshad do //
translated: The Bodhisattva Levels says, ‚ÄúThe one who lives in a place that is isolated from towns and cities, in a solitary place, a forest, or a remote area is called a ‚Äòsolitary one.‚Äô ‚ÄùüîΩüîΩ

original: sbyangs pa'i yon tan gyi mdo las kyang /üîΩdgon pa'i chos ni 'du 'dzi las dben zhing rab tu dben pa na gnas pa'o //
analyzed: sbyangs pa'i yon tan gyi mdo las kyang / dgon pa'i chos ni 'du 'dzi las dben zhing rab tu dben pa na gnas pa'o //
translated: The S≈´tra on the Benefits of Observing Ethical Discipline also says:üîΩ‚ÄúThe quality of a remote place is that it is isolated and secluded.

original: de la rab tu dben pa ni mang pos gnod par 'gyur ba dang / bag med pa'i gnas las dben pa'o //
analyzed: de la rab tu dben pa ni mang pos gnod par 'gyur ba dang / bag med pa'i gnas las dben pa'o //
translated: Secluded means that it is free from the harm of crowds and from the conditions for carelessness.üîΩ‚Äù

original: de ltar nye na yang rgyang grags gcig tsam las mi nye bar yun ring por lus la shin tu phan 'dogs pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar nye na yang rgyang grags gcig tsam las mi nye bar yun ring por lus la shin tu phan 'dogs pa'o //
translated: Even though it is so close, it is not less than a league away, and it has long been of great benefit to the body.

original: de ltar dben par gyur nas sems kyang 'dod pa lnga'i sgrib pa lnga po dag las shin tu thag ring bar gyur pa ni dong pa zhes bya'o zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de ltar dben par gyur nas sems kyang 'dod pa lnga'i sgrib pa lnga po dag las shin tu thag ring bar gyur pa ni dong pa zhes bya'o zhes gsungs te /
translated: Thus, when one has become secluded, the mind also becomes very far away from the five hindrances of the five desires, and that is called gone far away.

original: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las kyang de skad du bshad do //
analyzed: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las kyang de skad du bshad do //
translated: This is also explained in the commentary on the noble Perfection of Wisdom.

original: de na dge slong rab tu mang po dag cig kyang nags khrod de la brten cing bdag gi nyen kor na gnas lags te zhes bya ba 'dis ni gnyis pa gzhan mang po gnas pa'i gnas bstan to //
analyzed: de na dge slong rab tu mang po dag cig kyang nags khrod de la brten cing bdag gi nyen kor na gnas lags te zhes bya ba 'dis ni gnyis pa gzhan mang po gnas pa'i gnas bstan to //
translated: There, many monks also rely on that forest and live in my vicinity. This shows the second place where many others live.

original: dge slong zhes bya ba ni slob dpon drang srong rdo rjes slong ba dang / sdig pa 'joms pa dang / bdud skrag par byed pa'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: dge slong zhes bya ba ni slob dpon drang srong rdo rjes slong ba dang / sdig pa 'joms pa dang / bdud skrag par byed pa'o zhes bshad do //
translated: Monk is explained as one who begs, one who conquers evil, and one who frightens Mara, by the teacher Rishivajra.

original: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las @188a * //
analyzed: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las @188a * //
translated: In the commentary to the Perfection of Wisdom,

original: ni don rnam pa lnga dang ldan par bshad de dang po ni slong ba ste /
analyzed: ni don rnam pa lnga dang ldan par bshad de dang po ni slong ba ste /
translated: it is explained as having five topics. The first is ‚Äúbegging,‚Äù

original: yongs su dag pas 'tsho bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su dag pas 'tsho bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one lives by means of complete purity.üîΩTherefore, it says in the same text:

original: de'i phyir de nyid las khas 'tsho ba rnam pa bzhi dang bral ba'i phyir yongs su dag pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid las khas 'tsho ba rnam pa bzhi dang bral ba'i phyir yongs su dag pa zhes bya ste /
translated: ‚ÄúIt is called ‚Äòcomplete purity‚Äô because it is free of the four kinds of impure living.üîΩThe four kinds of impure living are:

original: khas 'tsho ba rnam pa bzhi ni rab tu byung ba gang gis sman sbyor ba dang / 'bru rnams rmed pa dang / skyed shing la sogs pa bskyed nas yongs su ma dag pas 'tshob gang yin pa de ni kha thur du lta bas 'tsho ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: khas 'tsho ba rnam pa bzhi ni rab tu byung ba gang gis sman sbyor ba dang / 'bru rnams rmed pa dang / skyed shing la sogs pa bskyed nas yongs su ma dag pas 'tshob gang yin pa de ni kha thur du lta bas 'tsho ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The first is called ‚Äòliving with one‚Äôs face to the ground,‚Äô which is the impure living of a renunciate who makes a living by compounding medicines, by farming, or by planting and tending fruit trees.

original: rab tu byung ba gang gis gza' skar dang nyi zla dang rlung dang char pa dang glog 'gyur ba dang / lce 'bab pa las rab tu rtog cing yongs su dag pas 'tsho ba gang yin pa de ni kha gyen du lta bas 'tsho ba zhes bya'o //üîΩrab tu byung ba gang gis smin gnyer gyis mthu ston pa dang / phyogs bzhir pho nyar 'gro ba dang kha gsag dang / mang du tshol zhing yongs su ma dag pas 'tsho ba gang yin pa de ni kha phyogs su lta bas 'tsho ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rab tu byung ba gang gis gza' skar dang nyi zla dang rlung dang char pa dang glog 'gyur ba dang / lce 'bab pa las rab tu rtog cing yongs su dag pas 'tsho ba gang yin pa de ni kha gyen du lta bas 'tsho ba zhes bya'o // rab tu byung ba gang gis smin gnyer gyis mthu ston pa dang / phyogs bzhir pho nyar 'gro ba dang kha gsag dang / mang du tshol zhing yongs su ma dag pas 'tsho ba gang yin pa de ni kha phyogs su lta bas 'tsho ba zhes bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúMonks who live by looking up are those who live by pure means, who predict eclipses of the sun and moon, winds, rains, and lightning, and who predict earthquakes.üîΩ‚ÄúMonks who live by looking around are those who live by impure means, who use their eyebrows to display their power, who go as messengers in the four directions, who flatter, and who seek out many patrons.

original: rab tu byung ba gang gis sngags dang mkhyud dpyad rnam pa sna tshogs bslabs nas legs nyes rnams ston cing 'di lta bu la sogs pa yongs su ma dag pas 'tsho ba gang yin pa de ni khas 'tsho ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rab tu byung ba gang gis sngags dang mkhyud dpyad rnam pa sna tshogs bslabs nas legs nyes rnams ston cing 'di lta bu la sogs pa yongs su ma dag pas 'tsho ba gang yin pa de ni khas 'tsho ba zhes bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúMonks who live by looking down are those who live by impure means, who teach good and bad omens after training in various incantations and divinations, and who live by such impure means.

original: gnyis pa ni nyon mongs pa bcom pa'i phyir dge slong zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni nyon mongs pa bcom pa'i phyir dge slong zhes bya'o //
translated: The second is called bhik·π£u because he has destroyed the afflictions.

original: gsum pa ni rab tu byung ba'i gang zag gi ming ngo //
analyzed: gsum pa ni rab tu byung ba'i gang zag gi ming ngo //
translated: The third is the name of a person who has gone forth.

original: bzhi pa ni tshul khrims yongs su dag pa bsrung ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni tshul khrims yongs su dag pa bsrung ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The fourth is called one who guards pure morality.

original: lnga pa ni bdud skrag par byed pa'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: lnga pa ni bdud skrag par byed pa'o zhes bshad do //
translated: The fifth is one who terrifies MƒÅra.

original: rnal 'byor pa'i spyod pa'i sa las /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa'i spyod pa'i sa las /
translated: The Bodhisattvabh≈´mi says,

original: dge slong ni rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: dge slong ni rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: ‚ÄúA bhik·π£u is of five kinds:

original: slong pa'i dge slong dang / bdag nyid khas 'che ba'i dge slong dang / ming gi dge slong dang / nyon mongs pa bcom pa'i dge slong dang / gsol ba dang bzhi'i las kyis bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i dge slong ngo zhes bshad do //
analyzed: slong pa'i dge slong dang / bdag nyid khas 'che ba'i dge slong dang / ming gi dge slong dang / nyon mongs pa bcom pa'i dge slong dang / gsol ba dang bzhi'i las kyis bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i dge slong ngo zhes bshad do //
translated: the bhik·π£u who begs, the bhik·π£u who claims to be, the bhik·π£u in name only, the bhik·π£u who has destroyed the afflictions, and the bhik·π£u who has been fully ordained by the rite of four requests and a monk‚Äôs proclamation.‚Äù

original: slob dpon yang dag bden pa'i brjed byang las rgyu la gnas pa'i tshe ni bdud skrag par byed pa dang slong ba dang / sdig pa 'joms pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: slob dpon yang dag bden pa'i brjed byang las rgyu la gnas pa'i tshe ni bdud skrag par byed pa dang slong ba dang / sdig pa 'joms pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The master Paramartha‚Äôs commentary on the MahƒÅyƒÅnƒÅvatƒÅra says, ‚ÄúWhen abiding in the cause, he is called one who terrifies MƒÅra, one who begs, and one who destroys evil.‚Äù

original: 'bras bu'i gnas su phyin pa'i tshe bdud skrag par byed pa ni dgra bcom par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i gnas su phyin pa'i tshe bdud skrag par byed pa ni dgra bcom par 'gyur ro //
translated: When one has arrived at the stage of fruition, one terrifies Mara, one becomes an Arhat.

original: slong ba ni mchod 'os su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: slong ba ni mchod 'os su 'gyur ro //
translated: One is worthy of offerings, one becomes an object of worship.

original: sdig pa 'joms pa ni mi skye ba zhes brjod do zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sdig pa 'joms pa ni mi skye ba zhes brjod do zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: One conquers evil, one is said to be non-arisen.

original: @188b bdag gi dge slong de dag snga dro'i dus kyi tshe phan tshun nas 'dus te /üîΩdmigs pa dang bcas pa'i mngon par rtogs pa la gnas nas so so nas mtshan ma rnam pa sna tshogs can gyi chos ston pas shes pa brda sprod par bgyid pa dag mthong ste zhes bya ba man chad ni gnyis gzhan dag gi shes pa brda sprod par
analyzed: @188b bdag gi dge slong de dag snga dro'i dus kyi tshe phan tshun nas 'dus te / dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i mngon par rtogs pa la gnas nas so so nas mtshan ma rnam pa sna tshogs can gyi chos ston pas shes pa brda sprod par bgyid pa dag mthong ste zhes bya ba man chad ni gnyis gzhan dag gi shes pa brda sprod par
translated: In the morning, my monks gather from all directions.üîΩThey abide in the realization with an object, and each one teaches the Dharma with various signs, conveying knowledge.

original: byed pa ston to //
analyzed: byed pa ston to //
translated: This shows the conveying of knowledge by others.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: This also has two parts:

original: brtags pa rnams spyir smos pa dang brtags pa rnam par phye ste bstan pa'o //
analyzed: brtags pa rnams spyir smos pa dang brtags pa rnam par phye ste bstan pa'o //
translated: The general statement of the classifications, and the teaching by classifying the classifications.

original: 'di ni dang po'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po'o //
translated: This is the first.

original: 'di ni dang po brtags pa spyir smos pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni dang po brtags pa spyir smos pa ste /
translated: This is the first general statement of the classifications.

original: 'og nas bstan pa bzhin no //üîΩphung po lnga la sogs pa la brten te /
analyzed: 'og nas bstan pa bzhin no // phung po lnga la sogs pa la brten te /
translated: As will be explained below.üîΩThe five aggregates, etc., are the basis for the various consciousnesses.

original: shes pa sna tshogs su gyur nas de dag la dmigs pa'i don du 'dod kyi /
analyzed: shes pa sna tshogs su gyur nas de dag la dmigs pa'i don du 'dod kyi /
translated: They are asserted to be the objects of those consciousnesses.

original: thams cad du ro gcig pa'i chos stong pa nyid kyi rig pas don dam pa'i bden pa ston par yang mi byed la /
analyzed: thams cad du ro gcig pa'i chos stong pa nyid kyi rig pas don dam pa'i bden pa ston par yang mi byed la /
translated: But the knowledge of emptiness, which is of the same taste everywhere, does not teach ultimate truth.

original: de bzhin du 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i bar gyi rang gi ngo bo nyid kyi bye brag dang / gnyen po la sogs pa la don dam par brtags nas mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed pa'i phyir 'dir smos pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i bar gyi rang gi ngo bo nyid kyi bye brag dang / gnyen po la sogs pa la don dam par brtags nas mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed pa'i phyir 'dir smos pa yin no //
translated: Similarly, the noble eightfold path is mentioned here because it is a special antidote, etc., and because it is a source of pride to think that one can examine the ultimate nature of the noble eightfold path.

original: de la mngon par rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las sbyar na de la nges pa'i don gang yin pa de ni mngon par rtogs pa'i don to zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de la mngon par rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las sbyar na de la nges pa'i don gang yin pa de ni mngon par rtogs pa'i don to zhes bshad do //
translated: In this regard, the YogƒÅcƒÅrabh≈´mi ≈öƒÅstra explains that the term ‚Äúrealization‚Äù means that which is ascertained in the treatise.

original: mdzod kyi bstan bcos las ni bden pa rnams kyi yul mngon sum du gsal bar mthong ba gang yin pa de ni mngon par rtogs pa zhes bya'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: mdzod kyi bstan bcos las ni bden pa rnams kyi yul mngon sum du gsal bar mthong ba gang yin pa de ni mngon par rtogs pa zhes bya'o zhes bshad do //
translated: The treatise Abhidharmako≈õa states, ‚ÄúThat which directly sees the object of the truths is called clear realization.‚Äù

original: mngon par rtogs pa 'di yang bstan pa rnams las so so nas bshad pa mi mthun te /
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa 'di yang bstan pa rnams las so so nas bshad pa mi mthun te /
translated: This clear realization is explained differently in the various scriptures.

original: mdzod kyi bstan bcos las mngon par rtogs pa ni rnam pa gsum yod de 'di lta ste lta ba dang / rkyen dang dngos po'i bye brag gi phyir ro zhes bshad do //
analyzed: mdzod kyi bstan bcos las mngon par rtogs pa ni rnam pa gsum yod de 'di lta ste lta ba dang / rkyen dang dngos po'i bye brag gi phyir ro zhes bshad do //
translated: The treatise Abhidharmako≈õa states, ‚ÄúClear realization is threefold: that is, it is due to the distinctions of view, condition, and entity.‚Äù

original: kha cig las ni rnam pa drug go zhes bshad de rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: kha cig las ni rnam pa drug go zhes bshad de rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: Some scriptures explain it as being sixfold, as in the explanation in the Levels of Yogic Deeds.

original: kha cig las ni sa rnam pa bcu'o zhes bshad de /
analyzed: kha cig las ni sa rnam pa bcu'o zhes bshad de /
translated: Some scriptures explain it as being ten levels.

original: bstan bcos chos mngon pa kun las btus pa dang / chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa las bstan pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: bstan bcos chos mngon pa kun las btus pa dang / chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa las bstan pa lta bu'o //
translated: This is as explained in the Compendium of Abhidharma and the Compendium of the Abhidharma of Various Classes.

original: 'dir dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i mngon par rtogs pa zhes gsungs pa ni 'di lta ste /üîΩdge slong de dag chos kyi 'khor lo dang po la brten nas chos kyi sgo rnam @189a * //
analyzed: 'dir dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i mngon par rtogs pa zhes gsungs pa ni 'di lta ste / dge slong de dag chos kyi 'khor lo dang po la brten nas chos kyi sgo rnam @189a * //
translated: Here, the term ‚Äúclear realization with reference points‚Äù refers to the following.

original: pa bcu gsum bshad de /
analyzed: pa bcu gsum bshad de /
translated: Those monks, based on the first wheel of dharma, explained the thirteen aspects of the dharma gateway.

original: sgra ji bzhin du don bzung nas dmigs su med pa ro gcig pa'i chos stong pa nyid kyi don dam pa khong du ma chud pas mngon pa'i nga rgyal bskyed nas mthar phyin pa'i don dam pa rtogs so snyam du sems par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: sgra ji bzhin du don bzung nas dmigs su med pa ro gcig pa'i chos stong pa nyid kyi don dam pa khong du ma chud pas mngon pa'i nga rgyal bskyed nas mthar phyin pa'i don dam pa rtogs so snyam du sems par gyur pa'o //
