translated: They did not understand the meaning of emptiness, the ultimate that is without reference points and of one taste, having taken the meaning literally. They generated manifest pride, thinking, ‚ÄúWe have realized the ultimate that is the culmination of the path.‚Äù

original: dge slong de dag mngon par rtogs pa gang la brten nas shes pa brda sprod par byed ce na /
analyzed: dge slong de dag mngon par rtogs pa gang la brten nas shes pa brda sprod par byed ce na /
translated: Based on which clear realization do those monks explain the knowledge of grammar?

original: smras pa mthong ba dang bsgom pa la gnas pa dang / mi slob pa dang snga ma'i sbyor ba rnams kyang spyir bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: smras pa mthong ba dang bsgom pa la gnas pa dang / mi slob pa dang snga ma'i sbyor ba rnams kyang spyir bstan pa yin te /
translated: It is taught in general that those monks are abiding in seeing, meditation, and no learning, as well as in the earlier preparations.

original: de'i phyir 'og nas mdo las dran pa nye bar gzhag pa thob pa zhes bya ba nas de bzhin du 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa thob pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no /üîΩ// / bam po bcu bdun pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'og nas mdo las dran pa nye bar gzhag pa thob pa zhes bya ba nas de bzhin du 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa thob pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no / // / bam po bcu bdun pa /
translated: Therefore, the sutra states below, ‚ÄúOne obtains the foundations of mindfulness,‚Äù and so on, up to ‚ÄúOne obtains the eightfold noble path.‚ÄùüîΩHere, some say that one obtains the aggregates, obtains the signs of the aggregates, obtains the arising of the aggregates, obtains the cessation of the aggregates, obtains the cessation of the aggregates, and obtains the manifestation of the cessation of the aggregates.

original: de na kha cig ni phung po thob pa dang / phung po'i mtshan ma thob pa dang / phung po'i skye ba thob pa dang / phung po'i zad pa thob pa dang / phung po'i 'gog pa thob pa dang / phung po'i 'gog pa mngon du bgyi ba thob pa'i slad du shes pa brda sprod par bgyid ces bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa brtags pa rnam par phye ste bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de na kha cig ni phung po thob pa dang / phung po'i mtshan ma thob pa dang / phung po'i skye ba thob pa dang / phung po'i zad pa thob pa dang / phung po'i 'gog pa thob pa dang / phung po'i 'gog pa mngon du bgyi ba thob pa'i slad du shes pa brda sprod par bgyid ces bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa brtags pa rnam par phye ste bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the second part, which is the explanation that analyzes the two.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
translated: This is also divided into two parts.

original: mkhas pas brtag par bya ba'i spyod yul rnam pa drug la brten nas shes pa brda sprod par byed pa bstan pa dang / kha cig ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa thob pa zhes bya ba man chad kyis byang chub kyi phyogs kyi rnal 'byor gyi sgo rnam pa bdun la brten nas shes pa brda sprod par byed pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mkhas pas brtag par bya ba'i spyod yul rnam pa drug la brten nas shes pa brda sprod par byed pa bstan pa dang / kha cig ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa thob pa zhes bya ba man chad kyis byang chub kyi phyogs kyi rnal 'byor gyi sgo rnam pa bdun la brten nas shes pa brda sprod par byed pa bstan pa'o //
translated: The explanation of the teaching of consciousness by means of the six kinds of objects of discernment by the wise, and the explanation of the teaching of consciousness by means of the seven kinds of yoga of the factors of enlightenment, beginning with the attainment of the applications of mindfulness.

original: 'dir ni dang por mkhas pas brtag par bya ba'i spyod yul rnam pa drug la brten nas shes pa brda sprod par byed pa ston te /
analyzed: 'dir ni dang por mkhas pas brtag par bya ba'i spyod yul rnam pa drug la brten nas shes pa brda sprod par byed pa ston te /
translated: Here, first of all, the teaching of the teaching of consciousness by means of the six kinds of objects of discernment by the wise is shown.

original: mkhas par bya ba rnam pa drug ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: mkhas par bya ba rnam pa drug ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The six kinds of discernment are as follows:

original: phung po dang skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang zas rnam pa bzhi dang / bden pa bzhi dang / khams bco brgyad do //
analyzed: phung po dang skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang zas rnam pa bzhi dang / bden pa bzhi dang / khams bco brgyad do //
translated: the aggregates, the sense bases, dependent origination, the four kinds of nutriment, the four truths, and the eighteen elements.

original: yang dag pa'i don du na skye mched dang / khams kyi chos rnams ma lus par bsdus mod kyi sems can rnams kyi mos pa tha dad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i don du na skye mched dang / khams kyi chos rnams ma lus par bsdus mod kyi sems can rnams kyi mos pa tha dad pa'i phyir /
translated: In reality, all phenomena of the sense spheres and constituents are included in the five aggregates, but sentient beings have different interests.

original: phung po la sogs pa la brten nas sgo rnam pa drug tu phye ba yin no /üîΩde kho na nyid kyi mngon par rtogs pa gang yin pa de ro gcig pa'i don dam pa'i tshul rtogs pa na gdod @189b mngon par rtogs pa zhes bya ba yin na dge slong de dag mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang bcas pa phung po la sogs pa'i mtshan
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa la brten nas sgo rnam pa drug tu phye ba yin no / de kho na nyid kyi mngon par rtogs pa gang yin pa de ro gcig pa'i don dam pa'i tshul rtogs pa na gdod @189b mngon par rtogs pa zhes bya ba yin na dge slong de dag mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang bcas pa phung po la sogs pa'i mtshan
translated: In reality, all phenomena of the sense spheres and elements are included in the aggregates, but the six topics are distinguished in dependence on the aggregates and so on in order to classify them in six ways in accordance with the different interests of sentient beings.üîΩIf the realization of thatness is the realization of the mode of the ultimate, which is of one taste, then the realization of thatness is the realization of the ultimate, which is of one taste.

original: ma dmigs pa la de kho na nyid kyi mngon bar rtogs pa yin no snyam du sems pa'i phyir 'dir brtags pa rnam pa drug smos pa yin no //
analyzed: ma dmigs pa la de kho na nyid kyi mngon bar rtogs pa yin no snyam du sems pa'i phyir 'dir brtags pa rnam pa drug smos pa yin no //
translated: Since those monks with pride think that the realization of thatness is the observation of the signs of the aggregates and so on, here the six topics are mentioned as the six topics of investigation.

original: sgo rnam pa drug yod kyang rnam pa lngar bsdu bar bya ste /
analyzed: sgo rnam pa drug yod kyang rnam pa lngar bsdu bar bya ste /
translated: Although there are six topics, they are subsumed in five topics.

original: phung po lnga bstan pa dang / zlas skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang / zas rnam pa bzhi dang / bden pa bzhi dang / khams bco brgyad bstan pa'o //
analyzed: phung po lnga bstan pa dang / zlas skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang / zas rnam pa bzhi dang / bden pa bzhi dang / khams bco brgyad bstan pa'o //
translated: The five aggregates, the twelve sense bases, dependent origination, the four kinds of nutriment, the four noble truths, and the eighteen elements.

original: 'di ni dang po phung po lnga'i tshig drug rnam par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po phung po lnga'i tshig drug rnam par bshad pa'o //
translated: This is the first explanation of the six categories in terms of the five aggregates.

original: tshig drug po 'di dag brtags pa rnam pa gcig gi mtshan nyid dam /
analyzed: tshig drug po 'di dag brtags pa rnam pa gcig gi mtshan nyid dam /
translated: Are these six categories defined in terms of a single conceptual construction,

original: 'on te brtags pa rnam pa drug tu 'gyur ba zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te brtags pa rnam pa drug tu 'gyur ba zhig yin zhe na /
translated: or are there six conceptual constructions?

original: smras pa / tshig nges par 'grel ba'i mdo dang mtshams rnam par 'grel pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: smras pa / tshig nges par 'grel ba'i mdo dang mtshams rnam par 'grel pa'i mdo las /
translated: It is said that in the S≈´tra Unravelling the Intended Meaning and in the S≈´tra on theüîΩJewel at the Crown of the Head,

original: dge slong kha cig ni phung po'i mtshan ma dmigs pa la chos rtogs pa zhes ston to //
analyzed: dge slong kha cig ni phung po'i mtshan ma dmigs pa la chos rtogs pa zhes ston to //
translated: some monks are taught that the realization of phenomena is the observation of theüîΩcharacteristics of the aggregates.üîΩSome monks are taught that the realization of phenomena is the observation ofüîΩthe arising of the aggregates. Therefore it is clear that these six categories are

original: dge slong kha cig ni phung po'i skye ba dmigs pa la chos rtogs pa zhes ston to zhes 'byung bas de'i phyir tshig drug po 'di dag ni brtags pa tha dad yin par mngon no //
analyzed: dge slong kha cig ni phung po'i skye ba dmigs pa la chos rtogs pa zhes ston to zhes 'byung bas de'i phyir tshig drug po 'di dag ni brtags pa tha dad yin par mngon no //
translated: different conceptual constructions.

original: 'dir mdo 'di nyid las sgo re re la yang kha cig ni zhes gsungs pas de dag dang mthun pa'i phyir brtags pa rnam pa drug tu dbye bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir mdo 'di nyid las sgo re re la yang kha cig ni zhes gsungs pas de dag dang mthun pa'i phyir brtags pa rnam pa drug tu dbye bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Here, since the sutra itself says ‚Äúsome‚Äù for each door, it should be understood that the six types of investigation are in accordance with that.

original: yang na sgo gcig la brtags pa rnam pa gcig tu byas na yang 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: yang na sgo gcig la brtags pa rnam pa gcig tu byas na yang 'gal ba med do //
translated: Or, if one makes the six types of investigation into one type based on one door, there is no contradiction.

original: tshig drug po 'di dag rnam par bshad pa yang rnam pa gnyis kyis bstan te /
analyzed: tshig drug po 'di dag rnam par bshad pa yang rnam pa gnyis kyis bstan te /
translated: The explanation of these six terms is presented in two parts:

original: tshig gi rnam grangs mang nyung bstan pa dang bye brag gi mtshan nyid rnam par 'byed pa'o //
analyzed: tshig gi rnam grangs mang nyung bstan pa dang bye brag gi mtshan nyid rnam par 'byed pa'o //
translated: the presentation of the many and few synonyms and the differentiation of the characteristics of the specific.

original: de la grangs mang nyung bstan pa ni dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo dang sbyar na de las tshig lnga las mi 'byung bas tshig dang po ma tshang ste /
analyzed: de la grangs mang nyung bstan pa ni dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo dang sbyar na de las tshig lnga las mi 'byung bas tshig dang po ma tshang ste /
translated: With regard to the presentation of the many and few, if it is applied to the Sutra Unraveling the Profound Thought, since it does not occur in five terms, the first term is incomplete.

original: lnga ni phung po'i mtshan nyid dang / phung po skye ba'i mtshan nyid dang / phung po 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid dang phung po 'gog pa'i chos dang / phung po 'gog pa mngon du bgyi ba'i chos zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: lnga ni phung po'i mtshan nyid dang / phung po skye ba'i mtshan nyid dang / phung po 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid dang phung po 'gog pa'i chos dang / phung po 'gog pa mngon du bgyi ba'i chos zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: The five are the characteristics of the aggregates, the characteristics of the arising of the aggregates, the characteristics of the destruction of the aggregates, the cessation of the aggregates, and the path to the realization of the cessation of the aggregates.

original: tshig nges par 'grel ba'i mdo las ni tshig drug tshang bar 'byung ste don 'di dang mthun no //üîΩde la tshig drug ni phung po dang / phung po'i mtshan nyid dang / phung po'i skye ba dang / phung po'i rnam @190a * //
analyzed: tshig nges par 'grel ba'i mdo las ni tshig drug tshang bar 'byung ste don 'di dang mthun no // de la tshig drug ni phung po dang / phung po'i mtshan nyid dang / phung po'i skye ba dang / phung po'i rnam @190a * //
translated: The S≈´tra Unravelling the Intended Meaning presents all six terms, and their meaning is consistent with this explanation.

original: par 'gyur ba dang / phung po 'gog pa mngon du bgyi ba'i lam zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: par 'gyur ba dang / phung po 'gog pa mngon du bgyi ba'i lam zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: The six terms are the aggregates, the characteristics of the aggregates, the arising of the aggregates, the destruction of the aggregates, the cessation of the aggregates, and the path to the realization of the cessation of the aggregates.

original: de la bye brag gi mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la bye brag gi mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni /
translated: The specific characteristics are as follows.

original: slob dpon yang dag bden pas bshad pa las /
analyzed: slob dpon yang dag bden pas bshad pa las /
translated: The master Par≈õvadeva explains:

original: phung po lnga la sogs pa chos kyi sgo mo brgyad khri dag la ro gcig pa'i don du rtogs par bya ba yin na /
analyzed: phung po lnga la sogs pa chos kyi sgo mo brgyad khri dag la ro gcig pa'i don du rtogs par bya ba yin na /
translated: If you understand the eighty-four thousand gates of the teachings, such as the five aggregates, to have a single taste,

original: de'i mtshan nyid ni ji ltar bu /
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid ni ji ltar bu /
translated: What is its definition?

original: gnas brtan pa'i sde pa dang sbyar na ni chos kyi sgo mo brgyad khri bzhi stong ngo zhes zer /
analyzed: gnas brtan pa'i sde pa dang sbyar na ni chos kyi sgo mo brgyad khri bzhi stong ngo zhes zer /
translated: If it is associated with the Sthavira school, it is said that there are 84,000 doors of Dharma.

original: 'di yang dag pa'i tshad ma'i sde pa dang sbyar na ni brgyad khri kho nar zad do zhe na /
analyzed: 'di yang dag pa'i tshad ma'i sde pa dang sbyar na ni brgyad khri kho nar zad do zhe na /
translated: If it is associated with the school of true valid cognition, it is said that there are only 84,000.

original: smras pa chos kyi mtshan nyid rnam pa drug la brten nas ro gcig pa'i don bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: smras pa chos kyi mtshan nyid rnam pa drug la brten nas ro gcig pa'i don bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is said that the meaning of one taste is taught based on the six characteristics of phenomena.

original: de la dge slong kha cig ni phung po dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyi thob pa gang yin pa brda sprod par byed pa ste /üîΩ'di ni dang po phung po lnga yod pa nyid du 'dzin cing ston pa chen pos gsungs pa khong du chud par mi nus pas sgra ji bzhin du mngon par zhen nas phung po las chos gzhan med do zhes de ltar ro gcig pa'i don khong du ma
analyzed: de la dge slong kha cig ni phung po dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyi thob pa gang yin pa brda sprod par byed pa ste / 'di ni dang po phung po lnga yod pa nyid du 'dzin cing ston pa chen pos gsungs pa khong du chud par mi nus pas sgra ji bzhin du mngon par zhen nas phung po las chos gzhan med do zhes de ltar ro gcig pa'i don khong du ma
translated: In that regard, some monks say that the object of observation of the aggregates is the attainment of one's own continuum, which is the meaning of the term.üîΩThis is because they apprehend the five aggregates as existent and do not understand the teachings of the Great Teacher.üîΩThey cling to the words literally and say that apart from the aggregates there are no other phenomena.

original: chud pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chud pa'i phyir /
translated: They do not understand the meaning of one taste.

original: yang dag par phung po lnga ni yod snyam du mngon par zhen pa med do snyam du mngon par zhen pa bskyed do //üîΩmngon par zhen pa 'di'i dbang gis ni /
analyzed: yang dag par phung po lnga ni yod snyam du mngon par zhen pa med do snyam du mngon par zhen pa bskyed do // mngon par zhen pa 'di'i dbang gis ni /
translated: The five aggregates are not real.üîΩThe five aggregates are real.üîΩThe five aggregates are not real.

original: phyin ci log skye la phyin ci log gi dbang gis ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal skyes pa'o //
analyzed: phyin ci log skye la phyin ci log gi dbang gis ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal skyes pa'o //
translated: The five aggregates are real.üîΩThe five aggregates are not real.

original: dge slong kha cig ni phung po'i mtshan nyid rtogs shing dmigs pas zhes bya ba 'di ni gnyis pa phung po lnga'i mtshan nyid bstan pa ste /üîΩbrtag pa'i mtshan nyid dam /
analyzed: dge slong kha cig ni phung po'i mtshan nyid rtogs shing dmigs pas zhes bya ba 'di ni gnyis pa phung po lnga'i mtshan nyid bstan pa ste / brtag pa'i mtshan nyid dam /
translated: The five aggregates are real.üîΩThe five aggregates are not real.üîΩThe five aggregates are real.üîΩThe five aggregates are not real.

original: yang dag pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid dam /üîΩyon tan gyi mtshan nyid dam /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid dam / yon tan gyi mtshan nyid dam /
translated: The five aggregates are real.üîΩThe five aggregates are not real.üîΩThe five aggregates are real.üîΩThe five aggregates are not real.üîΩThe five aggregates are real.üîΩThe five aggregates are not real.

original: nyes dmigs kyi mtshan nyid dam /üîΩrgyu dang rkyen gyi mtshan nyid dam /
analyzed: nyes dmigs kyi mtshan nyid dam / rgyu dang rkyen gyi mtshan nyid dam /
translated: The five aggregates are real.üîΩThe five aggregates are not real.üîΩThe five aggregates are real.üîΩThe five aggregates are not real.üîΩThe five aggregates are real.üîΩThe five aggregates are not real.üîΩThe five aggregates are real.üîΩThe five aggregates are not real.üîΩThe five aggregates are real.üîΩThe five aggregates are not real.üîΩThe five aggregates are real.üîΩThe five aggregates are not real.üîΩThe five aggregates are real.üîΩThe five aggregates are not real.üîΩThe five aggregates are real.üîΩThe five aggregates are not real.üîΩThe five aggregates are real.üîΩThe five aggregates are not real.üîΩThe five aggregates are real.üîΩThe five aggregates are not real.

original: dus gsum gyi mtshan nyid dam /üîΩskye ba dang gnas pa dang / 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid dam /
analyzed: dus gsum gyi mtshan nyid dam / skye ba dang gnas pa dang / 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid dam /
translated: The five aggregates are real.üîΩThe five aggregates are not real.üîΩThe five aggregates are real.üîΩThe five aggregates are not real.üîΩThe five aggregates are real.

original: sdug bsngal la sogs pa bden pa bzhi'i mtshan nyid dam /
analyzed: sdug bsngal la sogs pa bden pa bzhi'i mtshan nyid dam /
translated: The five aggregates are not real.

original: khams gsum pa'i mtshan nyid dam /
analyzed: khams gsum pa'i mtshan nyid dam /
translated: the characteristics of the three realms,

original: zag pa med pa'i dbyings kyi mtshan nyid dam /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i dbyings kyi mtshan nyid dam /
translated: the characteristics of the uncontaminated realm,

original: mgo gcig tu lung bstan pa'i mtshan nyid dam /üîΩrnam par phye ste lung bstan pa'i mtshan nyid dam /üîΩdris nas lung bstan pa'i mtshan nyid dam /
analyzed: mgo gcig tu lung bstan pa'i mtshan nyid dam / rnam par phye ste lung bstan pa'i mtshan nyid dam / dris nas lung bstan pa'i mtshan nyid dam /
translated: the characteristics of a definitive answer,üîΩthe characteristics of a differentiated answer,üîΩthe characteristics of an answer through a question,

original: rnam par gzhag pa'i lung bstan pa'i @190b mtshan nyid dam /
analyzed: rnam par gzhag pa'i lung bstan pa'i @190b mtshan nyid dam /
translated: the characteristics of an answer through a proposition,

original: gzugs rnam pa bzhi'i mtshan nyid dam /
analyzed: gzugs rnam pa bzhi'i mtshan nyid dam /
translated: the characteristics of the four types of form,üîΩthe characteristics of that which has a continuum and that which does not, the characteristics of form and mind, the characteristics of that which is neither form nor mind, and so on.

original: rgyun dang bcas pa dang rgyun med pa dang / gzugs dang sems dang / gzugs dang sems ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid la sogs pa phung po la 'di lta bu'i rig pa rnam pa sna tshogs dang ldan pa gang yin pa 'di ni phung po'i mtshan nyid ces bya ste /
analyzed: rgyun dang bcas pa dang rgyun med pa dang / gzugs dang sems dang / gzugs dang sems ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid la sogs pa phung po la 'di lta bu'i rig pa rnam pa sna tshogs dang ldan pa gang yin pa 'di ni phung po'i mtshan nyid ces bya ste /
translated: This is called the characteristics of the aggregates.

original: 'di ltar ro gcig pa'i rig pa khong du ma chud pa'i phyir 'di ni yang dag pa'i rig pa yin no snyam pa'i 'dzin pa skyed par byed /
analyzed: 'di ltar ro gcig pa'i rig pa khong du ma chud pa'i phyir 'di ni yang dag pa'i rig pa yin no snyam pa'i 'dzin pa skyed par byed /
translated: Since one does not understand the single taste of vidyƒÅ, one generates the grasping that thinks, ‚ÄúThis is the correct vidyƒÅ.‚Äù

original: 'dzin pa 'di'i rgyu'i phyir ni phyin ci log 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'dzin pa 'di'i rgyu'i phyir ni phyin ci log 'byung ngo //
translated: Because of this grasping, there is error.

original: phyin ci log tu gyur pa'i phyir ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal skyes pa'o //
analyzed: phyin ci log tu gyur pa'i phyir ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal skyes pa'o //
translated: Because of error, there is the arising of the conceit of self.

original: dge slong kha cig ni phung po'i skye ba rtogs shing dmigs pas zhes bya ba 'di ni gsum pa skye ba'i mtshan nyid bstan pa ste /
analyzed: dge slong kha cig ni phung po'i skye ba rtogs shing dmigs pas zhes bya ba 'di ni gsum pa skye ba'i mtshan nyid bstan pa ste /
translated: Some monks, because of the realization and perception of the arising of the aggregates,

original: 'di ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu ro gcig pa nyid du ma shes pa'i phyir phung po lnga la yang dag pa nyid du skye ba yod pa nyid pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu ro gcig pa nyid du ma shes pa'i phyir phung po lnga la yang dag pa nyid du skye ba yod pa nyid pa'o //
translated: because of the non-realization of the identity of cause and effect, there is the arising of the aggregates.

original: 'dzin pa 'di'i dbang gis phyin ci log 'byung la /
analyzed: 'dzin pa 'di'i dbang gis phyin ci log 'byung la /
translated: Because of this grasping, there is error.

original: phyin ci log tu gyur pa'i phyir ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal skyes pa'o //
analyzed: phyin ci log tu gyur pa'i phyir ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal skyes pa'o //
translated: Because of error, there is the arising of the conceit of self.

original: dge slong kha cig ni phung po'i rnam par 'gyur ba dmigs pas zhes bya ba 'di ni bzhi pa phung po'i rnam par 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid bstan pa ste /
analyzed: dge slong kha cig ni phung po'i rnam par 'gyur ba dmigs pas zhes bya ba 'di ni bzhi pa phung po'i rnam par 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid bstan pa ste /
translated: Some monks, because of the realization and perception of the transformation of the aggregates,

original: 'di ltar 'gag pa med pa ro gcig pa nyid du ma shes pa'i phyir yang dag par 'gyur ba yod do snyam pa'i 'dzin pa 'di 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'gag pa med pa ro gcig pa nyid du ma shes pa'i phyir yang dag par 'gyur ba yod do snyam pa'i 'dzin pa 'di 'byung ngo //
translated: Thus, because of not knowing the non-cessation of the aggregates as being of one taste, this grasping arises: ‚ÄúThere is a real transformation.‚Äù

original: 'dzin pa'i dbang gis ni phyin ci log 'byung la /
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i dbang gis ni phyin ci log 'byung la /
translated: Through the power of grasping, there is error.

original: phyin ci log tu gyur pa'i phyir ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal skyes pa'o //
analyzed: phyin ci log tu gyur pa'i phyir ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal skyes pa'o //
translated: And because of error, there is the arising of overweening pride.

original: dge slong kha cig ni phung po'i 'gog pa rtogs shing dmigs pas zhes bya ba ni lnga pa phung po'i mtshan nyid bstan pa ste /
analyzed: dge slong kha cig ni phung po'i 'gog pa rtogs shing dmigs pas zhes bya ba ni lnga pa phung po'i mtshan nyid bstan pa ste /
translated: Some monks realize the cessation of the aggregates through objectification.

original: 'di ltar rnam par dag pa ro gcig pa nyid du ma shes pa'i phyir rnam par dag pa yang dag par yod do snyam pa'i 'dzin pa 'di 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par dag pa ro gcig pa nyid du ma shes pa'i phyir rnam par dag pa yang dag par yod do snyam pa'i 'dzin pa 'di 'byung ngo //
translated: Thus, because of not knowing the purity of the aggregates as being of one taste, this grasping arises: ‚ÄúThere is a real purity.‚Äù

original: 'dzin pa 'di'i dbang gis na phyin ci log 'byung la /
analyzed: 'dzin pa 'di'i dbang gis na phyin ci log 'byung la /
translated: Through the power of grasping, there is error.

original: phyin ci log tu gyur pa'i phyir ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal skyes par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: phyin ci log tu gyur pa'i phyir ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal skyes par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: And because of error, there is the arising of overweening pride.

original: dge slong kha cig ni phung po 'gog pa'i lam rtogs pas zhes bya ba 'di ni drug pa phung po 'gog pa'i lam bstan pa ste /üîΩ'di ltar yul dang shes pa ro gcig pa @191a * //
analyzed: dge slong kha cig ni phung po 'gog pa'i lam rtogs pas zhes bya ba 'di ni drug pa phung po 'gog pa'i lam bstan pa ste / 'di ltar yul dang shes pa ro gcig pa @191a * //
translated: this is the sixth, the teaching on the path of cessation of the aggregates.

original: nyid du ma shes pa'i phyir yang dag par 'gog pa thob pa'i lam yod do snyam pa'i 'dzin pa 'di 'byung ngo //
analyzed: nyid du ma shes pa'i phyir yang dag par 'gog pa thob pa'i lam yod do snyam pa'i 'dzin pa 'di 'byung ngo //
translated: Thus, because one does not understand the single taste of object and consciousness, this grasping arises, thinking that there is a path to attain complete cessation.

original: 'dzin pa'i dbang gi sa ni phyin ci log 'byung la phyin ci log tu gyur pa'i phyir ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal skyes pa'o //
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i dbang gi sa ni phyin ci log 'byung la phyin ci log tu gyur pa'i phyir ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal skyes pa'o //
translated: Due to the power of grasping, error arises, and due to error, manifest pride arises.

original: phung po lnga'i chos kyi sgo mo la don rnam pa drug dang ldan pas ro gcig pa nyid rnam pa drug tu bstan pa bzhin du skye mched bcu gnyis la sogs pa chos kyi sgo mo thams cad la yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: phung po lnga'i chos kyi sgo mo la don rnam pa drug dang ldan pas ro gcig pa nyid rnam pa drug tu bstan pa bzhin du skye mched bcu gnyis la sogs pa chos kyi sgo mo thams cad la yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Just as the single taste is taught in six aspects through the six aspects of meaning in the Dharma door of the five aggregates, so it should be applied in the same way to all Dharma doors such as the twelve sense bases and so on.

original: bshad pa'i rnam grangs gzhan du na de las tshig dang pos ni tha snyad kyi phyogs kyi rnam pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: bshad pa'i rnam grangs gzhan du na de las tshig dang pos ni tha snyad kyi phyogs kyi rnam pa bstan pa ste /
translated: Another explanation: the first phrase teaches the aspect of the conventional side.

original: 'di ltar phung po lnga po dag ni tha snyad tsam du zad kyi gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar phung po lnga po dag ni tha snyad tsam du zad kyi gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, the five aggregates are exhausted as mere conventions, because there is nothing else.

original: tshig gnyis pas ni don dang tshul gyi phyogs kyi rnam pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: tshig gnyis pas ni don dang tshul gyi phyogs kyi rnam pa bstan pa ste /
translated: The second phrase teaches the aspect of the side of the ultimate mode.

original: btags pa dang / yang dag pa'i chos dang / dus gsum la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid rnam pa sna tshogs mi mthun pa sngar bstan pa lta bu yod kyang yang dag pa'i tshul du na bdag med par gcig pa'o //
analyzed: btags pa dang / yang dag pa'i chos dang / dus gsum la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid rnam pa sna tshogs mi mthun pa sngar bstan pa lta bu yod kyang yang dag pa'i tshul du na bdag med par gcig pa'o //
translated: Although there are various incompatible aspects of the characteristics of the imputed, the correct, the three times, and so on, as previously explained, in the correct mode they are the same in being selfless.

original: tshig gsum pas ni dgag par bya ba phyogs kyi rnam pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: tshig gsum pas ni dgag par bya ba phyogs kyi rnam pa bstan pa ste /
translated: The third phrase teaches the aspect of the side of the object of negation.

original: de ni kun 'byung ba'i bden pa nyon mongs pa dang las yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni kun 'byung ba'i bden pa nyon mongs pa dang las yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is because the truth of origin is affliction and karma.

original: tshig bzhi pas ni shes par bya ba'i phyogs kyi rnam pa bstan te /
analyzed: tshig bzhi pas ni shes par bya ba'i phyogs kyi rnam pa bstan te /
translated: The fourth phrase teaches the aspect of the side of the object of knowledge.

original: 'di ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'o //
translated: This is the truth of suffering.

original: tshig lnga pas ni thob par bya ba'i phyogs kyi rnam pa bstan te /
analyzed: tshig lnga pas ni thob par bya ba'i phyogs kyi rnam pa bstan te /
translated: The fifth phrase indicates the aspect of the object to be attained.

original: 'di ni 'gog pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'gog pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: This is the truth of cessation.

original: tshig drug pas ni bsgrub par bya ba'i phyogs kyi rnam pa bstan te /
analyzed: tshig drug pas ni bsgrub par bya ba'i phyogs kyi rnam pa bstan te /
translated: The sixth phrase indicates the aspect of the object to be accomplished.

original: 'di ni lam gyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni lam gyi bden pa'o //
translated: This is the truth of the path.

original: skye mched la sogs pa la yang de bzhin du drug po 'di dag yod par sbyar ro zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: skye mched la sogs pa la yang de bzhin du drug po 'di dag yod par sbyar ro zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: The six should be applied in the same way to the sense bases and so on.

original: 'dir rnam par bshad pa ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir rnam par bshad pa ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: Here the explanation is not like that.

original: de la phung po thob pa zhes bya ba ni phung po lnga'i chos kyi sgo mo rtogs pa spyir bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de la phung po thob pa zhes bya ba ni phung po lnga'i chos kyi sgo mo rtogs pa spyir bstan pa ste /
translated: Obtaining the aggregates is a general presentation of the door of Dharma of the five aggregates.

original: 'di ni mdor bstan pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: 'di ni mdor bstan pa'i tshig go //
translated: This is the phrase of brief indication.

original: phung po'i mtshan ma thob pa zhes bya ba ni phung po'i rang gi ngo bo'i mtshan nyid dang / bye brag gi mtshan nyid thob pa ste /
analyzed: phung po'i mtshan ma thob pa zhes bya ba ni phung po'i rang gi ngo bo'i mtshan nyid dang / bye brag gi mtshan nyid thob pa ste /
translated: Obtaining the signs of the aggregates is obtaining the general and specific characteristics of the nature of the aggregates.

original: tshig 'di gnyis ni spyi yin pas tshig 'og ma kun dang sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: tshig 'di gnyis ni spyi yin pas tshig 'og ma kun dang sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: Since these two phrases are general, they should be applied to all the following phrases.

original: de'i phyir 'og nas mdo las ming brda tsam du gzugs kyi phung @191b po zhes rang gi ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid dam bye brag gi mtshan nyid du rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba nas gzugs kyi phung po gtan du spangs pa dang /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'og nas mdo las ming brda tsam du gzugs kyi phung @191b po zhes rang gi ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid dam bye brag gi mtshan nyid du rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba nas gzugs kyi phung po gtan du spangs pa dang /
translated: Therefore, the sutra states below: ‚ÄúThe form aggregate is posited as a mere nominal convention, as a characteristic of its own entity or as a specific characteristic, up to the complete abandonment and complete knowledge of the form aggregate,

original: yongs su shes pa zhes rang gi ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid dam bye brag gi mtshan nyid ces bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: yongs su shes pa zhes rang gi ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid dam bye brag gi mtshan nyid ces bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa yin no //
translated: as a characteristic of its own entity or as a specific characteristic.‚Äù

original: de la rang gi ngo bo nyid ces bya ba ni chos gang bdag nyid dang bcas pa ni rang gi ngo bo nyid ces bya ste /
analyzed: de la rang gi ngo bo nyid ces bya ba ni chos gang bdag nyid dang bcas pa ni rang gi ngo bo nyid ces bya ste /
translated: Therein, that which possesses its own nature is called its own entity.

original: ji ltar gzugs dang tshor ba'i phung po zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji ltar gzugs dang tshor ba'i phung po zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the aggregates of form and feeling, and so on.

original: rang gi ngo bo nyid la bye brag gi don rnam par 'byed pa ni bye brag gi mtshan nyid ces bya ste /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo nyid la bye brag gi don rnam par 'byed pa ni bye brag gi mtshan nyid ces bya ste /
translated: The specific meaning that distinguishes its own entity is called a specific characteristic.

original: ji ltar rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'i phung po'i skye ba thob pa dang / phung po'i zad pa zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di gnyis kyis ni skye zhing 'jig pa'i mi rtag pa'i rnal 'byor bstan te /üîΩde'i phyir 'og nas mod las phung po rnams kyi skye ba'i mtshan nyid dang / 'gog pa'i mtshan nyid ces gsungs pa dang / gzhan yang mdo dag las 'du byed rnams ni mi rtag ste /
analyzed: ji ltar rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'i phung po'i skye ba thob pa dang / phung po'i zad pa zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di gnyis kyis ni skye zhing 'jig pa'i mi rtag pa'i rnal 'byor bstan te / de'i phyir 'og nas mod las phung po rnams kyi skye ba'i mtshan nyid dang / 'gog pa'i mtshan nyid ces gsungs pa dang / gzhan yang mdo dag las 'du byed rnams ni mi rtag ste /
translated: The two phrases ‚Äúarising of the aggregates‚Äù and ‚Äúcessation of the aggregates‚Äù teach the yoga of impermanence, which is the arising and cessation of the aggregates, like the phrases ‚Äúpermanent‚Äù and ‚Äúimpermanent,‚Äù ‚Äúcontaminated‚Äù and ‚Äúuncontaminated,‚Äù and so on.

original: byung nas zad pa'i chos can gyi phyir ro zhes gsungs so //üîΩgzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las 'du byed rnams ni mi rtag pa ste /
analyzed: byung nas zad pa'i chos can gyi phyir ro zhes gsungs so // gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las 'du byed rnams ni mi rtag pa ste /
translated: Therefore, later the sutra says, ‚ÄúThe characteristic of arising of the aggregates and the characteristic of cessation of the aggregates,‚Äù and it also says, ‚ÄúConditioned states are impermanent because they are subject to destruction after arising.‚Äù

original: gdon mi za bar byung na zad pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gdon mi za bar byung na zad pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Moreover, the Bodhisattvabhumi says, ‚ÄúConditioned states are impermanent because they are concomitant with destruction after arising.‚Äù

original: phung po 'gog pa thob pa dang / phung po 'gog pa mngon du bgyi ba thob pa'i slad du zhes bya ba'i tha tshig 'di gnyis kyis ni 'gog pa dang / lam gyi bden pa gnyis bstan te /
analyzed: phung po 'gog pa thob pa dang / phung po 'gog pa mngon du bgyi ba thob pa'i slad du zhes bya ba'i tha tshig 'di gnyis kyis ni 'gog pa dang / lam gyi bden pa gnyis bstan te /
translated: The two phrases, ‚Äúattainment of the cessation of the aggregates‚Äù and ‚Äúattainment of the realization of the cessation of the aggregates,‚Äù indicate the two truths of cessation and path.

original: sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba'i bden pa spangs na 'gag pa'i bden pa thob pa'i phyir dang / lam gyi dbang gi sa phung po spangs nas 'gog pa mngon du byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba'i bden pa spangs na 'gag pa'i bden pa thob pa'i phyir dang / lam gyi dbang gi sa phung po spangs nas 'gog pa mngon du byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because when the truths of suffering and origination are abandoned, the truth of cessation is attained, and because through the power of the path, the aggregates are abandoned and cessation is realized.

original: skye mched bcu gnyis la sogs pa yang 'di dang 'dra bar bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: skye mched bcu gnyis la sogs pa yang 'di dang 'dra bar bshad par bya'o //
translated: The twelve sense bases, etc., should be explained in the same way.

original: phung po lnga'i don rgya cher rnam par 'byed pa ni mtshan nyid bstan pa dag las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //üîΩji ltar kha cig phung po thob pa'i slad du /
analyzed: phung po lnga'i don rgya cher rnam par 'byed pa ni mtshan nyid bstan pa dag las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o // ji ltar kha cig phung po thob pa'i slad du /
translated: The extensive analysis of the meaning of the five aggregates should be understood according to the Abhidharma.üîΩJust as some attain the aggregates,üîΩin the same way some attain the sense bases, some attain dependent origination,

original: ji lta ba de bzhin du kha cig skye mched thob pa dang // kha cig rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba thob @192a * //
analyzed: ji lta ba de bzhin du kha cig skye mched thob pa dang // kha cig rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba thob @192a * //
translated: and some attain the truths.

original: pa yang de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa zlas skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba bstan pa yin te re re la yang tshig drug yod pa ni phung po bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: pa yang de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa zlas skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba bstan pa yin te re re la yang tshig drug yod pa ni phung po bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The same is true of the sense bases and dependent origination.

original: skye mched dang rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i don ni mtshan nyid bstan pa las 'byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: skye mched dang rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i don ni mtshan nyid bstan pa las 'byung ba bzhin no //
translated: The meaning of the sense bases and dependent origination is as stated in the teaching on characteristics.

original: yang kha cig ni zas thob pa dang / zas kyi mtshan ma thob pa dang / zas kyi skye ba thob pa dang / zas kyi zad pa thob pa dang / zas 'gog pa thob pa dang / zas 'gog pa mngon du bgyi ba thob pa'i slad du shes pa brda sprod par bgyid ces bya ba ni gsum pa zas rnam pa bzhi'i sgo la brten nas shes pa brda sprod par byed pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: yang kha cig ni zas thob pa dang / zas kyi mtshan ma thob pa dang / zas kyi skye ba thob pa dang / zas kyi zad pa thob pa dang / zas 'gog pa thob pa dang / zas 'gog pa mngon du bgyi ba thob pa'i slad du shes pa brda sprod par bgyid ces bya ba ni gsum pa zas rnam pa bzhi'i sgo la brten nas shes pa brda sprod par byed pa bstan pa ste /
translated: Again, some teach cognition in terms of obtaining food, obtaining the sign of food, obtaining the arising of food, obtaining the cessation of food, obtaining the realization of the cessation of food, and obtaining the realization of the cessation of food. This is the teaching on the third, the teaching of cognition based on the four kinds of food.

original: tshig drug sbyar zhing rnam par bshad pa ni gong ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: tshig drug sbyar zhing rnam par bshad pa ni gong ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The application of the six phrases and their explanation should be understood as above.

original: zas rnam pa bzhi'i don rnam par dbye ba ni mtshan nyid bstan pa dag las 'byung ba bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: zas rnam pa bzhi'i don rnam par dbye ba ni mtshan nyid bstan pa dag las 'byung ba bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: The meaning of the four kinds of food should be understood according to the teaching of their characteristics.

original: yang kha cig ni bden pa thob pa dang / bden pa'i mtshan ma thob pa dang / bden pa yongs su shes pa thob pa dang / bden pa gtan du spangs pa thob pa dang / bden pa mngon du bgyi ba thob pa dang / bden pa bsgom pa thob pa'i slad du shes pa brda sprod par bgyid ces bya ba ni bzhi pa bden pa bzhi'i sgo la brten nas shes pa brda sprod par byed pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: yang kha cig ni bden pa thob pa dang / bden pa'i mtshan ma thob pa dang / bden pa yongs su shes pa thob pa dang / bden pa gtan du spangs pa thob pa dang / bden pa mngon du bgyi ba thob pa dang / bden pa bsgom pa thob pa'i slad du shes pa brda sprod par bgyid ces bya ba ni bzhi pa bden pa bzhi'i sgo la brten nas shes pa brda sprod par byed pa bstan pa ste /
translated: Again, some teach the knowledge of the attainment of the truth, the attainment of the sign of the truth, the attainment of the full knowledge of the truth, the attainment of the complete abandonment of the truth, the attainment of the realization of the truth, and the attainment of the cultivation of the truth. This shows the teaching of the knowledge of the four noble truths.

original: tshig rnam pa drug las dang po gnyis ni spyi yin te snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: tshig rnam pa drug las dang po gnyis ni spyi yin te snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: From the six kinds of words, the first two are general, to be understood as before.

original: phyi ma bzhi ni go rims bzhin du sdug bsngal yongs su shes par bya ba dang / kun 'byung gtan du spang bar bya ba dang / 'gog pa mngon du bya ba dang / lam bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: phyi ma bzhi ni go rims bzhin du sdug bsngal yongs su shes par bya ba dang / kun 'byung gtan du spang bar bya ba dang / 'gog pa mngon du bya ba dang / lam bsgom par bya'o //
translated: The latter four are, respectively, the suffering that is to be fully known, the origin that is to be abandoned, the cessation that is to be realized, and the path that is to be cultivated.

original: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa dang sbyar na /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa dang sbyar na /
translated: If one correlates this with the Levels of Yogic Deeds,

original: de las ci'i phyir sdug bsngal gyi bden pa yongs su shes par bya ba dang / kun 'byung gi bden pa gtan du spang bar bya ba dang / 'gog pa'i bden pa rig cing mngon du bya ba dang / lam gyi bden pa bsgom par bya bar bshad ce na /
analyzed: de las ci'i phyir sdug bsngal gyi bden pa yongs su shes par bya ba dang / kun 'byung gi bden pa gtan du spang bar bya ba dang / 'gog pa'i bden pa rig cing mngon du bya ba dang / lam gyi bden pa bsgom par bya bar bshad ce na /
translated: why is the truth of suffering to be fully known, the truth of origin to be abandoned, the truth of cessation to be realized, and the truth of the path to be cultivated?

original: smras pa / sdug bsngal gyi bden pa de ni phyin ci log bzhi'i gnas yin pas phyin ci log bsal bas phyir yongs su shes par bya ba'o //
analyzed: smras pa / sdug bsngal gyi bden pa de ni phyin ci log bzhi'i gnas yin pas phyin ci log bsal bas phyir yongs su shes par bya ba'o //
translated: The truth of suffering is the basis of the four misconceptions, so it is fully known by eliminating the misconceptions.

original: kun 'byung gi bden pa ni sdug bsngal gyi bden par gsungs @192b pa'i phyir sdug bsngal gyi bden pa yongs su shes su zin kyang da dung kun 'byung ba'i bden pa dang / rjes su 'brel ba'i phyir kun 'byung gi bden pa ni spang bar bya ba yin par bshad dgos so //
analyzed: kun 'byung gi bden pa ni sdug bsngal gyi bden par gsungs @192b pa'i phyir sdug bsngal gyi bden pa yongs su shes su zin kyang da dung kun 'byung ba'i bden pa dang / rjes su 'brel ba'i phyir kun 'byung gi bden pa ni spang bar bya ba yin par bshad dgos so //
translated: Because the truth of origination is said to be the origin of the truth of suffering, even though the truth of suffering is already known, the truth of origination must be explained as that which is to be abandoned, because it is related to the truth of suffering.

original: mngon sum du bya ba ni mngon sum du byas pa'i don yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum du bya ba ni mngon sum du byas pa'i don yin te /
translated: The term ‚Äúto be actualized‚Äù means to be actualized.

original: 'gog pa'i bden pa mngon sum du mthong ba'i phyir mi skrag cing dga' ba yongs su 'dzin pas de'i phyir de'i 'og tu ni 'gog pa'i bden pa ni mngon sum du byas pa yin par bshad do //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i bden pa mngon sum du mthong ba'i phyir mi skrag cing dga' ba yongs su 'dzin pas de'i phyir de'i 'og tu ni 'gog pa'i bden pa ni mngon sum du byas pa yin par bshad do //
translated: Because the truth of cessation is directly seen, one is not frightened, but takes up joy. Therefore, immediately after that, the truth of cessation is explained as that which is to be actualized.

original: lam goms par byas nas gdod ji skad smos pa'i don gsum po dag mngon par 'grub pas de'i phyir tha mar lam gyi bden pa ni bsgom par bya ba yin par bshad pa yin no zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: lam goms par byas nas gdod ji skad smos pa'i don gsum po dag mngon par 'grub pas de'i phyir tha mar lam gyi bden pa ni bsgom par bya ba yin par bshad pa yin no zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Having cultivated the path, one subsequently accomplishes the three things mentioned above. Therefore, in the end, the truth of the path is explained as that which is to be cultivated.

original: bden pa gsum po dag kyang yongs su shes par bya ba yin na /
analyzed: bden pa gsum po dag kyang yongs su shes par bya ba yin na /
translated: If the three truths are to be fully known,

original: ci'i phyir sdug bsngal ba 'ba' zhig yongs su shes par bshad ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sdug bsngal ba 'ba' zhig yongs su shes par bshad ce na /
translated: why is it said that only suffering is fully known?

original: smras pa / 'di ni bstan bcos bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las ji skad du mdo sde dag las ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa kho na yongs su shes par bya bar gsungs na ci'i phyir chos mngon pa las chos thams cad yongs su shes par bstan zhe na
analyzed: smras pa / 'di ni bstan bcos bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las ji skad du mdo sde dag las ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa kho na yongs su shes par bya bar gsungs na ci'i phyir chos mngon pa las chos thams cad yongs su shes par bstan zhe na
translated: It is said that in the sutras only the truth of suffering is said to be fully known, but why is it taught in the Abhidharma that all phenomena are fully known?

original: / btsun pa rtsibs na re /
analyzed: / btsun pa rtsibs na re /
translated: Bhadanta SƒÅ·πÉghabhadra says:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis sdug bsngal kho na yongs su shes par bya bar gsungs pa 'am /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis sdug bsngal kho na yongs su shes par bya bar gsungs pa 'am /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn said that only suffering is to be fully known,

original: yang na sdug bsngal 'ba' zhig yongs su shes par bya ba yin pas /
analyzed: yang na sdug bsngal 'ba' zhig yongs su shes par bya ba yin pas /
translated: or only suffering is to be fully known,

original: de'i phyir chos mngon pa las chos thams cad ni yongs su shes par bya ba yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de'i phyir chos mngon pa las chos thams cad ni yongs su shes par bya ba yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: therefore it is taught in the Abhidharma that all phenomena are to be fully known.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kun 'byung kho na yongs su sdang bar gsungs pa'am /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kun 'byung kho na yongs su sdang bar gsungs pa'am /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn said that only origin is to be abandoned,

original: yang na kun 'byung ba 'ba' zhig yongs su spang bar bya ba yin pas de'i phyir chos mngon pa las zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams ni yongs su spang bar bya ba yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: yang na kun 'byung ba 'ba' zhig yongs su spang bar bya ba yin pas de'i phyir chos mngon pa las zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams ni yongs su spang bar bya ba yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: ‚ÄúAll contaminated phenomena are to be abandoned.‚Äù

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'gog pa kho na mngon sum du bya bar gsungs pa'am /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'gog pa kho na mngon sum du bya bar gsungs pa'am /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn stated that only cessation is to be realized.

original: yang na 'gog pa 'ba' zhig mngon du bya ba yin pas /
analyzed: yang na 'gog pa 'ba' zhig mngon du bya ba yin pas /
translated: Or else, since only cessation is to be realized,

original: de'i phyir chos mngon pa las mngon du bya ba thob pa la brten nas dge ba'i chos rnams ni mngon sum du bya ba yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de'i phyir chos mngon pa las mngon du bya ba thob pa la brten nas dge ba'i chos rnams ni mngon sum du bya ba yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: the Abhidharma states: ‚ÄúAll virtuous phenomena are to be realized on the basis of obtaining realization.‚Äù

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis lam kho na bsgom par gsungs pa'am /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis lam kho na bsgom par gsungs pa'am /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn stated that only the path is to be cultivated.

original: yang na @193a * //
analyzed: yang na @193a * //
translated: Or else,

original: lam 'ba' zhig bsgom par bya ba yin pas de'i phyir chos mngon pa las 'dus byas kyi chos dge ba thams cad ni bsgom par bya ba yin no zhes bstan te /
analyzed: lam 'ba' zhig bsgom par bya ba yin pas de'i phyir chos mngon pa las 'dus byas kyi chos dge ba thams cad ni bsgom par bya ba yin no zhes bstan te /
translated: since only the path is to be cultivated, the Abhidharma states: ‚ÄúAll conditioned virtuous phenomena are to be cultivated.‚Äù

original: 'dis ni mdo las gsungs pa ni nges pa'i don ma yin la /
analyzed: 'dis ni mdo las gsungs pa ni nges pa'i don ma yin la /
translated: This shows that what is stated in the sutras is not of definitive meaning,

original: chos mngon pa las bshad pa ni nges pa'i don yin par bstan pa yin zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: chos mngon pa las bshad pa ni nges pa'i don yin par bstan pa yin zhes 'byung ste /
translated: and what is explained in the Abhidharma is of definitive meaning.

original: rgya cher ni bstan bcos de nyid las rnam grangs mang pos bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rgya cher ni bstan bcos de nyid las rnam grangs mang pos bstan pa yin no //
translated: The extensive explanation is in that treatise itself, with many enumerations.

original: bden pa bzhi'i don rgya cher rnam par 'byed pa ni mtshan nyid bstan pa 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bden pa bzhi'i don rgya cher rnam par 'byed pa ni mtshan nyid bstan pa 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The extensive analysis of the meaning of the four noble truths should be understood as it occurs in the teaching on their characteristics.

original: yang kha cig ni khams thob pa dang / khams kyi mtshan ma thob pa dang / khams sna tshogs pa nyid thob pa nyid dang / khams gcig pa nyid ma yin pa thob pa dang / khams 'gog pa thob pa dang / khams 'gog ba mngon du bgyi ba thob pa'i slad du shes pa brda sprod par bgyid ces bya ba ni lnga pa khams bco brgyad la brten nas shes pa brda sprod par byed pa bstan to //
analyzed: yang kha cig ni khams thob pa dang / khams kyi mtshan ma thob pa dang / khams sna tshogs pa nyid thob pa nyid dang / khams gcig pa nyid ma yin pa thob pa dang / khams 'gog pa thob pa dang / khams 'gog ba mngon du bgyi ba thob pa'i slad du shes pa brda sprod par bgyid ces bya ba ni lnga pa khams bco brgyad la brten nas shes pa brda sprod par byed pa bstan to //
translated: Again, some say that the knowledge is taught in order to obtain the elements, to obtain the signs of the elements, to obtain the diversity of the elements, to obtain the non-singularity of the elements, to obtain the cessation of the elements, and to obtain the manifestation of the cessation of the elements. This is the fifth teaching on the knowledge that is taught in dependence on the eighteen elements.

original: tshig drug po de dag las dang po gnyis dang / tha ma gnyis ni snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: tshig drug po de dag las dang po gnyis dang / tha ma gnyis ni snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The first two and the last two of these six terms should be understood as above.

original: tshig bya ba gnyis ni bye brag rnam par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: tshig bya ba gnyis ni bye brag rnam par bshad pa'o //
translated: The two terms ‚Äúaction‚Äù and ‚Äúagent‚Äù are explained in the VibhƒÅ·π£ƒÅ.

original: rnam pa shin tu mang bas sna tshogs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa shin tu mang bas sna tshogs zhes bya'o //
translated: Since there are many kinds, it is called ‚Äúvarious.‚Äù

original: grangs gcig las 'das pa'i phyir gcig pa nyid ma yin pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: grangs gcig las 'das pa'i phyir gcig pa nyid ma yin pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Since it is more than one, it is called ‚Äúnot one.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir lung sna tshogs las bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir lung sna tshogs las bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Therefore, the BhagavƒÅn said to the monks in the various scriptures:

original: khams sna tshogs ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: khams sna tshogs ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúWhat is the various constituents?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: khams bco brgyad po mig gi khams dang / gzugs kyi khams dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams nas yid kyi khams dang / chos kyi khams dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi bar du gang yin pa de ni khams sna tshogs yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: khams bco brgyad po mig gi khams dang / gzugs kyi khams dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams nas yid kyi khams dang / chos kyi khams dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi bar du gang yin pa de ni khams sna tshogs yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: The eighteen constituents, from the eye constituent and form constituent and eye-consciousness constituent up to the mind constituent and dharma constituent and mind-consciousness constituent, are the various constituents.‚Äù

original: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa dang sbyar na /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa dang sbyar na /
translated: If this is applied to the YogƒÅcƒÅrabh≈´mi ≈öƒÅstra,

original: phung po lnga la brten nas sna tshogs dang gcig pa nyid ma yin pa'i don gyi bye brag ston to //
analyzed: phung po lnga la brten nas sna tshogs dang gcig pa nyid ma yin pa'i don gyi bye brag ston to //
translated: The meaning of the various and non-identical is taught in terms of the five aggregates.

original: de'i phyir de nyid las de las phung po rnams kyi bdag nyid tha dad pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid las de las phung po rnams kyi bdag nyid tha dad pa gang zhe na /
translated: Therefore, the same text says, ‚ÄúWhat is the difference in self-nature of the aggregates?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: gzugs kyi phung po yang gzhan la de bzhin du rnam @193b par shes pa'i phung po'i bar yang gzhan pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po yang gzhan la de bzhin du rnam @193b par shes pa'i phung po'i bar yang gzhan pa'o //
translated: The form aggregate is one thing, and similarly, up to the consciousness aggregate is another thing.

original: de la phung po rnams kyi bdag nyid mang po gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la phung po rnams kyi bdag nyid mang po gang zhe na /
translated: What is the multiplicity of the self-natures of the aggregates?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: gzugs kyi phung po yang gcig pa ma yin zhing rnam pa sna tshogs mang po 'byung ba dang / 'byung ba las gyur pa'i bye brag gi phyir 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa bye brag gi phyir ro zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po yang gcig pa ma yin zhing rnam pa sna tshogs mang po 'byung ba dang / 'byung ba las gyur pa'i bye brag gi phyir 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa bye brag gi phyir ro zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: The form aggregate is not one thing, but many different things arise, due to the distinctions of the elements and the derivatives of the elements, and due to the distinctions of the past, future, and present, and so on.‚Äù

original: gzhan yang de nyid las khams sna tshogs nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan yang de nyid las khams sna tshogs nyid gang zhe na /
translated: Moreover, the same text says, ‚ÄúWhat is the variety of the elements?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: khams bco brgyad po dag phan tshun mtshan nyid tha dad pa nyid gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: khams bco brgyad po dag phan tshun mtshan nyid tha dad pa nyid gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the fact that the characteristics of the eighteen elements are distinct from one another.

original: khams gcig pa nyid ma yin pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: khams gcig pa nyid ma yin pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the fact that they are not one?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is

original: khams de dag nyid sems sna tshogs dpag tu med pa'i rab tu dbye bas gnas pa nyid do //
analyzed: khams de dag nyid sems sna tshogs dpag tu med pa'i rab tu dbye bas gnas pa nyid do //
translated: the fact that the elements are differentiated by the infinite variety of the mind.

original: khams tshad med pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: khams tshad med pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the immensity of the elements?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It isüîΩthe fact that the elements are infinite.

original: de gnyi ga gcig tu bsdus pa la khams tshad med pa zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de gnyi ga gcig tu bsdus pa la khams tshad med pa zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: The fact that the elements are infinite is called the immensity of the elements.üîΩMoreover, in the same text, it is said:

original: gzhan yang de nyid las khams bco brgyad khong du chud pa gang yin pa de ni khams du mar shes pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang de nyid las khams bco brgyad khong du chud pa gang yin pa de ni khams du mar shes pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe understanding of the eighteen elements is the knowledge of the multiplicity of the elements.

original: de dag gi rnam pa sna tshogs shes pa ni khams sna tshogs shes pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gi rnam pa sna tshogs shes pa ni khams sna tshogs shes pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of their various aspects is the knowledge of the variety of the elements.

original: de dag gi rab tu dbye ba shes pa ni khams dang / 'gro ba dang / sa dang / gang zag dang / rnam pa'i dbye ba shes pa'o zhes 'byung khams bco brgyad kyi don ni mtshan nyid bstan pa dag las bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de dag gi rab tu dbye ba shes pa ni khams dang / 'gro ba dang / sa dang / gang zag dang / rnam pa'i dbye ba shes pa'o zhes 'byung khams bco brgyad kyi don ni mtshan nyid bstan pa dag las bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: The meaning of the eighteen elements is as explained in the teaching on their characteristics.

original: yang kha cig ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa thob pa dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i mtshan ma thob pa dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i gnyen po dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs bstan pa dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa thob pa dang /
analyzed: yang kha cig ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa thob pa dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i mtshan ma thob pa dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i gnyen po dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs bstan pa dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa thob pa dang /
translated: Some obtain the foundations of mindfulness, some obtain the signs of the foundations of mindfulness, some are taught the antidotes and counteragents of the foundations of mindfulness, some obtain the cultivation of the foundations of mindfulness,

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ma skyes pa skye ba thob pa dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa skyes pa gnas pa dang / mi bskyud pa dang / slar zhing 'byung ba dang / 'phel zhing rgyas pa thob pa'i slad du shes pa brda sprod par bgyid ces bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa byang chub kyi phyogs sum cu rtsa bdun la brten nas shes pa brda sprod par byed pa ston to //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ma skyes pa skye ba thob pa dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa skyes pa gnas pa dang / mi bskyud pa dang / slar zhing 'byung ba dang / 'phel zhing rgyas pa thob pa'i slad du shes pa brda sprod par bgyid ces bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa byang chub kyi phyogs sum cu rtsa bdun la brten nas shes pa brda sprod par byed pa ston to //
translated: The phrase in order to attain the arising of the not yet arisen applications of mindfulness, and for the abiding, non-forgetting, repeated arising, increase, and growth of the arisen applications of mindfulness indicates the second kind of instruction, which is based on the thirty-seven aids to enlightenment.

original: 'di la yang bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
analyzed: 'di la yang bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
translated: Here also there are two explanations.

original: kha cig na re snga ma'i phung po la sogs pa'i chos ni rtogs pa'i yul la brten nas shes pa brda sprod pa yin la /üîΩphyi ma la dran pa nye bar @194a * //
analyzed: kha cig na re snga ma'i phung po la sogs pa'i chos ni rtogs pa'i yul la brten nas shes pa brda sprod pa yin la / phyi ma la dran pa nye bar @194a * //
translated: Some say that the former, based on the objects of understanding, is the instruction in knowledge of the aggregates, etc.

original: gzhag pa la sogs pa ni rtogs pa'i spyod pa la brten nas shes pa brda sprod par byed pa yin no zhe'o //
analyzed: gzhag pa la sogs pa ni rtogs pa'i spyod pa la brten nas shes pa brda sprod par byed pa yin no zhe'o //
translated: The latter, based on the practice of understanding, is the instruction in knowledge of the applications of mindfulness, etc.

original: kha cig na re dge slong de dag phung po la sogs pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid rnam pa drug khon la don dam pa'i mngon par rtogs pa'i yul lo zhes dmigs pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: kha cig na re dge slong de dag phung po la sogs pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid rnam pa drug khon la don dam pa'i mngon par rtogs pa'i yul lo zhes dmigs pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Some say: Those monks do not objectify the six aspects of the characteristics of phenomena such as the aggregates as the object of ultimate realization.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / yang dag pa'i spong ba la sogs pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid rnam pa drug po dag la yang de khon nyid kyi mngon par rtogs par byed pa'i spyod yul bar brtags pa yin te /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / yang dag pa'i spong ba la sogs pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid rnam pa drug po dag la yang de khon nyid kyi mngon par rtogs par byed pa'i spyod yul bar brtags pa yin te /
translated: They investigate the six aspects of the characteristics of phenomena such as the four establishments of mindfulness and the four correct abandonments as the domain of the realization of thatness.

original: de'i phyir tshig nges par 'grel pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: de'i phyir tshig nges par 'grel pa'i mdo las /
translated: Therefore the sutra unravelling the intended meaning says:

original: dge slong kha cig ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i mtshan nyid la sogs pa rtogs shing dmigs pas rang gi thob pa brda sprod par bgyid ces gsungs pa dang / gzhan yang dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las 'di ltar dge slong de dag dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i mtshan ma bzung nas chos rtogs pa'o zhes ston to zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: dge slong kha cig ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i mtshan nyid la sogs pa rtogs shing dmigs pas rang gi thob pa brda sprod par bgyid ces gsungs pa dang / gzhan yang dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las 'di ltar dge slong de dag dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i mtshan ma bzung nas chos rtogs pa'o zhes ston to zhes gsungs te /
translated: ‚ÄúMonks, those who apprehend the signs of the applications of mindfulness teach that phenomena are understood.‚Äù

original: zhib tu de nyid las gsungs pa bzhin no zhe'o //
analyzed: zhib tu de nyid las gsungs pa bzhin no zhe'o //
translated: This is taught in detail in Asanga‚Äôs Compendium of Knowledge.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gsum du phye nas bstan te /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gsum du phye nas bstan te /
translated: This is also taught by dividing it into three:

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pas shes pa brda sprod pa dang / kha cig ni zhes bya ba man chad kyis zlas yang dag pa'i spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag gis shes pa brda sprod pa dang /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pas shes pa brda sprod pa dang / kha cig ni zhes bya ba man chad kyis zlas yang dag pa'i spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag gis shes pa brda sprod pa dang /
translated: The teaching from ‚ÄúSome monks‚Äù up to ‚Äúthey teach their own attainments‚Äù is the explanation of the knowledge that is communicated by the applications of mindfulness.

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad kyis shes pa brda sprod pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad kyis shes pa brda sprod pa'o //
translated: The eightfold noble path is the teaching of knowledge.

original: 'di dang po dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi la brten nas shes pa brda sprod pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'di dang po dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi la brten nas shes pa brda sprod pa nyid do //
translated: The teaching of knowledge is based on the first, the four foundations of mindfulness.

original: de la dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The four foundations of mindfulness are as follows:

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhin po lus dang / tshor ba dang / sems dang / chos so //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhin po lus dang / tshor ba dang / sems dang / chos so //
translated: The four foundations of mindfulness are the body, feeling, mind, and phenomena.

original: bstan bcos yang dag pa'i rigs pa las ci'i phyir shes rab la dmigs pa la dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhe na /
analyzed: bstan bcos yang dag pa'i rigs pa las ci'i phyir shes rab la dmigs pa la dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhe na /
translated: Why is the object of wisdom called the foundation of mindfulness?

original: shes rab ni dran pa'i stobs kyis yongs su bzung nas gnas par byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
analyzed: shes rab ni dran pa'i stobs kyis yongs su bzung nas gnas par byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
translated: It is explained that wisdom is established by the power of mindfulness.

original: mdzod kyi bstan bcos las ni bye brag tu smra ba dag 'di skad du /
analyzed: mdzod kyi bstan bcos las ni bye brag tu smra ba dag 'di skad du /
translated: In the treatise Abhidharmako≈õa, the VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas say:

original: shes rab ni dran ba'i stobs kyis yongs su gzung ba'i phyir dbang @194b gis gnas par byed pa'i phyir ro zhes zer te /
analyzed: shes rab ni dran ba'i stobs kyis yongs su gzung ba'i phyir dbang @194b gis gnas par byed pa'i phyir ro zhes zer te /
translated: Wisdom is established by the power of mindfulness.

original: yang dag pa'i don du na shes rab kyi dbang gis dran pa yul gnas par byed de /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i don du na shes rab kyi dbang gis dran pa yul gnas par byed de /
translated: In reality, mindfulness is made to abide in the object by the power of wisdom.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba dag gsal bar dran pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba dag gsal bar dran pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
translated: Because of the clarity of mindfulness of those who see reality just as it is.üîΩThe great treatise on differentiation explains:

original: bstan bcos bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las 'di ltar dran pa'i mthu stobs kyis rang gi bdag nyid yongs su sel ba'i phyir dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bstan bcos bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las 'di ltar dran pa'i mthu stobs kyis rang gi bdag nyid yongs su sel ba'i phyir dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because the power of mindfulness completely eliminates its own nature, it is called the foundation of mindfulness.

original: de la rang gi bdag nyid ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i phung po lnga po dag yin te /
analyzed: de la rang gi bdag nyid ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i phung po lnga po dag yin te /
translated: Its own nature is the five contaminated aggregates.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i dbang gis de rab tu sel ba'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i dbang gis de rab tu sel ba'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Because the power of the foundation of mindfulness completely eliminates them.üîΩThe commentary on the perfection of wisdom explains:

original: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las shes rab kyi rjes su 'brang zhing dmigs pa la yang dag par gnas pa ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las shes rab kyi rjes su 'brang zhing dmigs pa la yang dag par gnas pa ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya'o zhes bshad do //
translated: Following wisdom and correctly abiding in the object is called the foundation of mindfulness.

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las de la dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya ba'i don gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las de la dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya ba'i don gang zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of the term foundations of mindfulness?

original: smras pa / gang la dran pa nye bar gzhag par byed pa dang / gang gis dran pa nye bar 'jog par byed pa de ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: smras pa / gang la dran pa nye bar gzhag par byed pa dang / gang gis dran pa nye bar 'jog par byed pa de ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is said: That upon which mindfulness is placed and that by which mindfulness is placed is called the foundation of mindfulness.

original: de la gang la dran pa nye bar 'jog par byed ce na /
analyzed: de la gang la dran pa nye bar 'jog par byed ce na /
translated: What is it upon which mindfulness is placed?

original: de ni dmigs pa la dran pa nye bar gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni dmigs pa la dran pa nye bar gzhag pa yin no //
translated: It is the object upon which mindfulness is placed.

original: gang gis dran pa nye bar 'jog par byed ce na /
analyzed: gang gis dran pa nye bar 'jog par byed ce na /
translated: By what is mindfulness placed?üîΩThat by which mindfulness is placed is the foundation of mindfulness.

original: de la shes rab dang dran pas ting nge 'dzin sdud par byed pa gang yin pa de ni ngo bo nyid kyis dran pa nye bar gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: de la shes rab dang dran pas ting nge 'dzin sdud par byed pa gang yin pa de ni ngo bo nyid kyis dran pa nye bar gzhag pa yin no //
translated: That by which mindfulness is placed is the wisdom and mindfulness that gather samadhi.

original: de las gzhan pa de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams ni 'dres pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa yin no zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams ni 'dres pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa yin no zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Other than that, the mind and mental factors that are concomitant with them are the mixed foundations of mindfulness.

original: de la ngo bo nyid rnam par 'byed pa ni thams cad yod par smra ba dag 'dod pa dang sbyar na /
analyzed: de la ngo bo nyid rnam par 'byed pa ni thams cad yod par smra ba dag 'dod pa dang sbyar na /
translated: The discernment of their nature is explained as follows:

original: shes rab kyi ngo bo nyid do zhes bshad do //
analyzed: shes rab kyi ngo bo nyid do zhes bshad do //
translated: If they are applied to the belief of the SarvƒÅstivƒÅdins, they are the nature of wisdom.

original: theg pa chen po'i bstan pa dang sbyar na ni dran pa dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid do zhes bshad de /
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i bstan pa dang sbyar na ni dran pa dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid do zhes bshad de /
translated: If they are applied to the teaching of the MahƒÅyƒÅna, they are explained as having the nature of mindfulness and wisdom.

original: de'i phyir chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa las dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i ngo bo nyid ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa las dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i ngo bo nyid ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Therefore, the Compendium of Abhidharma says, ‚ÄúThe nature of the foundations of mindfulness is as follows:

original: shes rab dang dran pa'o //üîΩbcom ldan 'das kyi mdo dag las dman pa la sogs pa'i rjes su rtog pa zhes bya ba yod pa'i phyir dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa @195a * //
analyzed: shes rab dang dran pa'o // bcom ldan 'das kyi mdo dag las dman pa la sogs pa'i rjes su rtog pa zhes bya ba yod pa'i phyir dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa @195a * //
translated: Wisdom and mindfulness.‚Äù

original: dang bcas pa zhes gsungs pa'i phyir dang / go rims bzhin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: dang bcas pa zhes gsungs pa'i phyir dang / go rims bzhin no zhes bshad do //
translated: It is said that they are in that order because the foundations of mindfulness are mentioned in the s≈´tras of the BhagavƒÅn as the investigation of inferior and so on, because they are said to be associated with mindfulness, and because they are the nature of wisdom and mindfulness.

original: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las ni shes rab dang / dran pas ting nge 'dzin yang dag par sdud pa ni ngo bo nyid kyi dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'o zhes 'byung ngo //

translated: The YogƒÅcƒÅrabh≈´mi ≈öƒÅstra says, ‚ÄúThe essence of the applications of mindfulness is the wisdom and memory that gather and hold samƒÅdhi.üîΩ‚Äù

analyzed: gzhan yang de nyid las 'di yang rnam pa gsum te /

analyzed: tshig drug pa las rnam pa gnyis su phye bas 'di lta ste /
translated: The GƒÅthƒÅko≈õa says:üîΩThe GƒÅthƒÅko

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa skyes pa gnas pa dang bsgom pa'i mtshan nyid mi bskyud pa zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa skyes pa gnas pa dang bsgom pa'i mtshan nyid mi bskyud pa zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: The arising of the application of mindfulness is the non-loss of the characteristics of abiding and cultivation.

original: tshig nges par 'grel ba'i mdo las ni slob dpon yang dag bden pas tshig rnam pa bcur phye nas ston te /
analyzed: tshig nges par 'grel ba'i mdo las ni slob dpon yang dag bden pas tshig rnam pa bcur phye nas ston te /
translated: The S≈´tra Unravelling the Intended Meaning explains that the master Samgharak·π£hita analyzes the words into ten categories.

original: de'i phyir slob dpon yang dag bden pa'i brjed byang las /
analyzed: de'i phyir slob dpon yang dag bden pa'i brjed byang las /
translated: Therefore, the master Samgharak·π£hita‚Äôs Summary of the Meaning of the S≈´tra on the Application of Mindfulness to Phenomena states:

original: mdo las dge slong kha cig ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig bcus ci zhig ston par mdzad ce na /
analyzed: mdo las dge slong kha cig ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig bcus ci zhig ston par mdzad ce na /
translated: What does the s≈´tra teach with the ten phrases beginning, ‚ÄúMonks, some are the objects of the application of mindfulness‚Äù?

original: smras pa / don rnam pa bcu bstan pa'i phyir tshig bcu po 'di dag gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: smras pa / don rnam pa bcu bstan pa'i phyir tshig bcu po 'di dag gsungs pa yin te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúThese ten phrases are stated in order to teach ten topics.

original: tshig dang po dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rtogs shing dmigs pas zhes bya ba de ni yul gyi dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: tshig dang po dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rtogs shing dmigs pas zhes bya ba de ni yul gyi dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'o //
translated: The first phrase, ‚ÄòThe application of mindfulness that is the realization and object,‚Äô is the application of mindfulness to the object.

original: gnyis pa dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba de ni ngo bo nyid kyi dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba de ni ngo bo nyid kyi dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'o //
translated: The second phrase, ‚ÄòThe characteristic of the application of mindfulness,‚Äô is the application of mindfulness to the nature.

original: gsum pa dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i mi mthun pa'i zhes bya bas ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i lam mi mthun pa'i phyogs phyin ci log bzhi bstan to //
analyzed: gsum pa dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i mi mthun pa'i zhes bya bas ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i lam mi mthun pa'i phyogs phyin ci log bzhi bstan to //
translated: The third verse shows the four errors as the counteragents to the applications of mindfulness.

original: bzhi pa dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i gnyen po lam zhes bya ba ni gnyen por gyur pa'i lam bstan te /
analyzed: bzhi pa dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i gnyen po lam zhes bya ba ni gnyen por gyur pa'i lam bstan te /
translated: The fourth verse shows the path as the counteragent to the applications of mindfulness.

original: de ni 'dres pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa phyin ci log bzhi'i gnyen por gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni 'dres pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa phyin ci log bzhi'i gnyen por gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the path of application of the mixed applications of mindfulness, because it is the counteragent to the four errors.

original: lnga pa dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i bsgom pa zhes bya ba de ni dran pa nye @195b bar gzhag pa'i sbyor ba'i lam mo //
analyzed: lnga pa dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i bsgom pa zhes bya ba de ni dran pa nye @195b bar gzhag pa'i sbyor ba'i lam mo //
translated: The fifth verse shows the cultivation of the applications of mindfulness.

original: drug pa dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ma skyes pa skye ba rtogs shing dmigs pa zhes bya ba de ni bar chad med pa'i lam yin te /
analyzed: drug pa dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ma skyes pa skye ba rtogs shing dmigs pa zhes bya ba de ni bar chad med pa'i lam yin te /
translated: The sixth verse shows the realization and the object of the arising of the applications of mindfulness that have not arisen. It is the uninterrupted path.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: bzod pa brgyad po dag go //
analyzed: bzod pa brgyad po dag go //
translated: the eight acceptances.

original: bdun pa dran pa nye bar gzhag pa skyes pa gnas pa rtogs shing dmigs pa zhes bya ba de ni rnam par 'grel pa'i lam yin te /
analyzed: bdun pa dran pa nye bar gzhag pa skyes pa gnas pa rtogs shing dmigs pa zhes bya ba de ni rnam par 'grel pa'i lam yin te /
