translated: The seventh is called the path of realization of the establishment and the object of the established mindfulness.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: shes pa brgyad po de dag go //
analyzed: shes pa brgyad po de dag go //
translated: The eight knowledges.

original: brgyad pa mi bskyud pa zhes bya ba ni bsgom pa'i lam yin te /
analyzed: brgyad pa mi bskyud pa zhes bya ba ni bsgom pa'i lam yin te /
translated: The eighth is called the path of non-forgetting.

original: rdo rje lta bu'i sems kyi bar dag go //
analyzed: rdo rje lta bu'i sems kyi bar dag go //
translated: It is the diamond-like thought and so on.

original: dgu pa 'phel ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dgu pa 'phel ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The ninth is called the path of increase.

original: mi slob pa'i lam yin te /
analyzed: mi slob pa'i lam yin te /
translated: It is the path of no-more-learning.

original: rdo rje lta bu'i 'og gi sems so //
analyzed: rdo rje lta bu'i 'og gi sems so //
translated: It is the thought after the diamond-like thought.üîΩThe tenth is called the path of completion.

original: bcu pa yongs su rdzogs pa zhes bya ba ni rdzu 'phrul gyi lam yin te /
analyzed: bcu pa yongs su rdzogs pa zhes bya ba ni rdzu 'phrul gyi lam yin te /
translated: It is the path of magic.

original: 'khor lo rnam pa gsum gyis sems can la phan 'dogs pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'khor lo rnam pa gsum gyis sems can la phan 'dogs pa 'di lta ste /
translated: It is the benefitting of sentient beings by means of the three wheels, namely,

original: rdzu 'phrul dang sems lung bstan pa dang yang dag par bstan pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul dang sems lung bstan pa dang yang dag par bstan pa rnams kyis so //
translated: by means of magic, by means of the prediction of thoughts, and by means of the correct teaching.

original: ji ltar dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi la tshig bcu yod pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi la tshig bcu yod pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as there are ten words for the four foundations of mindfulness,

original: yang dag pa'i spong ba bzhi nas 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i bar du sbyar bar bya'o zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i spong ba bzhi nas 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i bar du sbyar bar bya'o zhes 'byung ste /
translated: The four right efforts should be applied up to the eightfold noble path.

original: zhib tu de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: zhib tu de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: This is taught in detail in the same text.

original: 'dir rnam par bshad pa ni de lta ma yin te chos kyi sgo re re yang tshig drug yod par sbyar te /
analyzed: 'dir rnam par bshad pa ni de lta ma yin te chos kyi sgo re re yang tshig drug yod par sbyar te /
translated: Here the explanation is different: each Dharma gateway has six words.

original: dang po'i tshig gnyis ni phung po bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dang po'i tshig gnyis ni phung po bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The first two words should be understood like the aggregates.

original: tshig 'og ma bzhi ni phung po la sogs pa dang mi mthun te /
analyzed: tshig 'og ma bzhi ni phung po la sogs pa dang mi mthun te /
translated: The four remaining words are not the same as the aggregates, etc.

original: de la dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i gnyen po dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs thob par zhes bya ba ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi po dag phyin ci log bzhi po dag gi gnyen por gyur par bstan to //
analyzed: de la dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i gnyen po dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs thob par zhes bya ba ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi po dag phyin ci log bzhi po dag gi gnyen por gyur par bstan to //
translated: Therein, the four establishments of mindfulness are taught as the antidotes to the four errors.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pas lus la mi gtsang ba nyid du bsgom pas gtsang ba nyid du phyin ci log pa'i gnyen por gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pas lus la mi gtsang ba nyid du bsgom pas gtsang ba nyid du phyin ci log pa'i gnyen por gyur pa yin no //
translated: The establishment of mindfulness of the body, by cultivating the body as impure, is the antidote to the error of purity.

original: tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pas tshor ba la bde ba med pa nyid du phyin ci log pa'i gnyen por gyur pa yin no //üîΩsems dran pa nye bar gzhag pas /
analyzed: tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pas tshor ba la bde ba med pa nyid du phyin ci log pa'i gnyen por gyur pa yin no // sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pas /
translated: The application of mindfulness to sensation is the antidote to the error of taking what is not pleasant to be pleasant.

original: sems mi rtag pa nyid bsgom pas rtag pa nyid du phyin ci log pa'i gnyen por gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: sems mi rtag pa nyid bsgom pas rtag pa nyid du phyin ci log pa'i gnyen por gyur pa yin no //
translated: The application of mindfulness to mind is the antidote to the error of taking what is impermanent to be permanent.

original: chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pas chos bdag med pa nyid du bsgom pas phyin ci log pa'i gnyen por gyur ba yin te /üîΩrgya cher @196a * //
analyzed: chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pas chos bdag med pa nyid du bsgom pas phyin ci log pa'i gnyen por gyur ba yin te / rgya cher @196a * //
translated: The application of mindfulness to dharmas is the antidote to the error of taking what is insubstantial to be substantial.

original: ni bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ni bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: The extensive explanation is in the YogƒÅcƒÅrabh≈´mi.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa thob pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gsum po de dag ni bsgom pa rnam pa bzhi'i dbang du mdzad nas dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa thob pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gsum po de dag ni bsgom pa rnam pa bzhi'i dbang du mdzad nas dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi bshad pa yin te /
translated: The three phrases beginning with ‚Äúhaving attained the cultivation of the applications of mindfulness‚Äù explain the four applications of mindfulness from the perspective of four types of cultivation.

original: bsgom pa bzhi po de yang thams cad yod par smra ba'i gzhung gis dran pa nye bar gzhag pa mngon sum du gyur pa ni mngon par 'du byed ba'i bsgom pa zhes kyang bya /
analyzed: bsgom pa bzhi po de yang thams cad yod par smra ba'i gzhung gis dran pa nye bar gzhag pa mngon sum du gyur pa ni mngon par 'du byed ba'i bsgom pa zhes kyang bya /
translated: Also, the treatise Attainment of Knowledge declares:

original: thob pa'i bsgom pa zhes kyang bya ste /
analyzed: thob pa'i bsgom pa zhes kyang bya ste /
translated: The cultivation of the four meditations is called the meditation of manifest actual establishment and the meditation of obtainment.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i thob pa dang / 'thob par 'gyur pa'i rnam pa skyed par nus pa gang yin pa de ni thob pa'i bsgom pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i thob pa dang / 'thob par 'gyur pa'i rnam pa skyed par nus pa gang yin pa de ni thob pa'i bsgom pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The meditation of obtainment is the obtainment of future states and the ability to generate the aspect of that which will be obtained.üîΩTherefore the treatise Abhidharmakosa states,

original: de'i phyir mdzod kyi bstan bcos las bsgom pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir mdzod kyi bstan bcos las bsgom pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: There are four types of meditation:üîΩthe meditation of obtainment, the meditation of teaching, the meditation of antidotes and the meditation of distancing.

original: 'thob pa'i bsgom pa dang / bstan pa'i bsgom pa dang / gnyen po'i bsgom pa dang / thag bsring ba'i bsgom pa'o 'di ltar bsgom pa bzhi po de dag kyang chos gang la brten nas rnam par gzhag ce na /
analyzed: 'thob pa'i bsgom pa dang / bstan pa'i bsgom pa dang / gnyen po'i bsgom pa dang / thag bsring ba'i bsgom pa'o 'di ltar bsgom pa bzhi po de dag kyang chos gang la brten nas rnam par gzhag ce na /
translated: What phenomena are posited in dependence on these four meditations?

original: tshig le'ur byas pa las /
analyzed: tshig le'ur byas pa las /
translated: The Verses of S≈´tra Requested by Shariputra states:

original: rnyed dang bsten pa'i bsgom pa gnyis dag ni //
analyzed: rnyed dang bsten pa'i bsgom pa gnyis dag ni //
translated: The two meditations of acquisition and reliance

original: dge ba 'dus byas chos rten rnam par gzhag / zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos la brten nas ni /
analyzed: dge ba 'dus byas chos rten rnam par gzhag / zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos la brten nas ni /
translated: Virtue is posited as the cultivation of conditioned phenomena.

original: gnyen po thag bsring bsgom pa gzhag pa yin zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: gnyen po thag bsring bsgom pa gzhag pa yin zhes 'byung ste /
translated: The cultivation of antidotes and distancing is posited in dependence on contaminated phenomena.

original: 'di nyid kyi 'grel pa las /
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi 'grel pa las /
translated: The Autocommentary states:

original: thob pa dang bsten pa'i bsgom pa gnyis ni dge ba 'dus byas la brten pa yin te /
analyzed: thob pa dang bsten pa'i bsgom pa gnyis ni dge ba 'dus byas la brten pa yin te /
translated: The two cultivations of obtainment and reliance are dependent on conditioned virtue.

original: ma 'ongs pa rnams kyis thob pa kho na'o //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa rnams kyis thob pa kho na'o //
translated: Those of the future are only obtained.

original: da ltar byung ba rnams kyis ni gnyi ga'o //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba rnams kyis ni gnyi ga'o //
translated: Those of the present are both.

original: gnyen po dang thag bsring ba'i bsgom pa gnyis ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos la brten pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gnyen po dang thag bsring ba'i bsgom pa gnyis ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos la brten pa'i phyir /
translated: The two cultivations of antidote and distancing are dependent on contaminated phenomena.

original: zag pa dang dge ba ni dge ba bzhi char dang ldan no //
analyzed: zag pa dang dge ba ni dge ba bzhi char dang ldan no //
translated: Contaminated virtue possesses all four types of virtue.

original: zag pa med pa'i 'dus byas dang / zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos gzhan dag ni go rims bzhin du so so nas snga ma dang / phyi ma gnyis kyi bsgom pa dag dang ldan no zhes bshad de /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i 'dus byas dang / zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos gzhan dag ni go rims bzhin du so so nas snga ma dang / phyi ma gnyis kyi bsgom pa dag dang ldan no zhes bshad de /
translated: Uncontaminated conditioned phenomena and other contaminated phenomena possess the two cultivations of the former and latter, respectively.

original: rgya cher rnam par 'byed pa ni bstan bcos yang dag pa'i rigs pa dang / rjes su mthun pa dang / bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rgya cher rnam par 'byed pa ni bstan bcos yang dag pa'i rigs pa dang / rjes su mthun pa dang / bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: The extensive differentiation is in accordance with the treatises, the correct reasonings and the Great Exegesis.

original: 'dir theg pa chen po bstan pa dag dang sbyar nas @196b so so nas mi mthun te /
analyzed: 'dir theg pa chen po bstan pa dag dang sbyar nas @196b so so nas mi mthun te /
translated: Here, they are not in agreement with the teachings of the Great Vehicle.

original: bstan bcos mngon pa kun las btus pa dang / chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa las bsgom pa rnam pa bzhi la brten nas dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa bsgom par bstan pa dang / yang dag pa'i spong ba bzhi las brtsams nas bsgom pa rnam pa bzhi ston te /
analyzed: bstan bcos mngon pa kun las btus pa dang / chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa las bsgom pa rnam pa bzhi la brten nas dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa bsgom par bstan pa dang / yang dag pa'i spong ba bzhi las brtsams nas bsgom pa rnam pa bzhi ston te /
translated: The Abhidharmasamuccaya and the AbhidharmasamuccayabhƒÅsya teach the cultivation of the applications of mindfulness and so on in dependence on four cultivations and they teach four cultivations in terms of the four correct renunciations.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos de nyid las yang lam bsgom ba rnams kyi khyad par ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos de nyid las yang lam bsgom ba rnams kyi khyad par ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: Therefore, the treatise itself says, ‚ÄúThe differences in the cultivations of the path are, in brief, four.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: 'thob pa'i bsgom pa dang / bsten pa'i bsgom pa dang / gsal ba'i bsgom pa dang / gnyen po'i bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: 'thob pa'i bsgom pa dang / bsten pa'i bsgom pa dang / gsal ba'i bsgom pa dang / gnyen po'i bsgom pa'o //
translated: cultivation of attainment, cultivation of reliance, cultivation of clarity, and cultivation of antidotes.

original: 'thob pa'i bsgom pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'thob pa'i bsgom pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The cultivation of attainment is as follows:

original: dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams bskyed pa'i phyir bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams bskyed pa'i phyir bsgom pa'o //
translated: Cultivation for the sake of generating wholesome dharmas that have not yet arisen.

original: bsten pa'i bsgom pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bsten pa'i bsgom pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The cultivation of reliance is as follows:

original: dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams gnas pa dang / mi nyams pa dang / phyir 'byung ba dang / 'phel ba dang / spang bar bya ba'i phyir gang bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams gnas pa dang / mi nyams pa dang / phyir 'byung ba dang / 'phel ba dang / spang bar bya ba'i phyir gang bsgom pa'o //
translated: Cultivation for the sake of maintaining, not degenerating, increasing, and abandoning wholesome dharmas that have already arisen.

original: gsal ba'i bsgom pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gsal ba'i bsgom pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The cultivation of clarity is as follows:

original: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos skyes ba rnams spang ba'i phyir gang bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos skyes ba rnams spang ba'i phyir gang bsgom pa'o //
translated: Cultivation for the sake of abandoning arisen unwholesome dharmas.

original: gnyen po bsgom pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gnyen po bsgom pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The cultivation of antidotes is as follows:

original: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams mi skyed pa'i phyir gang bsgom pa'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams mi skyed pa'i phyir gang bsgom pa'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Cultivation for the sake of not generating unwholesome dharmas that have not yet arisen.

original: 'di ltar khyad par rnam pa bzhi po 'di dag ni ci rigs par yang dag par spong ba bzhi po dag dang sbyar zhing bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar khyad par rnam pa bzhi po 'di dag ni ci rigs par yang dag par spong ba bzhi po dag dang sbyar zhing bshad par bya ste /
translated: Thus, these four kinds of distinctions should be explained as corresponding to the four right efforts.

original: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las kyang 'di dang mthun par ston to //
analyzed: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las kyang 'di dang mthun par ston to //
translated: The YogƒÅcƒÅrabh≈´mi ≈öƒÅstra teaches in agreement with this.

original: mdo sde 'di nyid dang sbyar na ni dang po'i bsgom pa gnyis 'ba' zhig dran pa gzhag pa bsgom par ston to //
analyzed: mdo sde 'di nyid dang sbyar na ni dang po'i bsgom pa gnyis 'ba' zhig dran pa gzhag pa bsgom par ston to //
translated: If we apply this to the present sutra, only the first two cultivations are the cultivation of the establishment of mindfulness.

original: de la dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i sgo thob pa zhes bya ba ni bsgom pa gnyis mdor bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de la dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i sgo thob pa zhes bya ba ni bsgom pa gnyis mdor bstan pa'o //
translated: Among them, the attainment of the door of the applications of mindfulness is the brief teaching of the two cultivations.

original: ma skyes pa skye ba zhes bya ba ni thob pa'i bsgom pa rnam par phye ste bstan pa'o //
analyzed: ma skyes pa skye ba zhes bya ba ni thob pa'i bsgom pa rnam par phye ste bstan pa'o //
translated: The generation of what has not yet arisen is the teaching of the analysis of the cultivation of attainment.

original: skyes pa gnas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bstan pa'i bsgom pa rnam par phye ste bstan pa'o //
analyzed: skyes pa gnas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bstan pa'i bsgom pa rnam par phye ste bstan pa'o //
translated: The abiding of what has already arisen, etc., is the teaching of the analysis of the cultivation of teaching.

original: ci'i phyir bsgom pa phyi ma gnyis ma bstan ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bsgom pa phyi ma gnyis ma bstan ce na /
translated: Why are the last two cultivations not taught?

original: smras pa / 'dir dge ba'i chos rnams bsgom pa kho nar ston par mdzad kyi /
analyzed: smras pa / 'dir dge ba'i chos rnams bsgom pa kho nar ston par mdzad kyi /
translated: He replied: Here, the teacher teaches only the cultivation of virtuous qualities.

original: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos gsal bar mi @197a * //üîΩston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos gsal bar mi @197a * // ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He does not teach the clarification of sinful, nonvirtuous qualities.

original: yang na bzhi chang dang yang ldan te /
analyzed: yang na bzhi chang dang yang ldan te /
translated: Or else, the four are combined with the five,

original: sngar gnyen po bstan pa'i skabs su bsgom pa gnyis kyang bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngar gnyen po bstan pa'i skabs su bsgom pa gnyis kyang bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the two cultivations are included in the section on the antidotes taught above.üîΩThe four establishments of mindfulness are: the generation of the nonarisen, the maintenance of the arisen, the increase of the arisen, and the nonloss of the arisen.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ma skyes pa skye ba thob pa zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa dang sbyar na /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ma skyes pa skye ba thob pa zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa dang sbyar na /
translated: The generation of the nonarisen is the generation of the not yet arisen.üîΩThe arisen is the arisen.üîΩThe increase of the arisen is the increase of the arisen.

original: de las dge ba'i chos ma bskyed pa bskyed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de las dge ba'i chos ma bskyed pa bskyed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The nonloss of the arisen is the nonloss of the arisen.üîΩThe four establishments of mindfulness are: the generation of the nonarisen, the maintenance of the arisen, the increase of the arisen, and the nonloss of the arisen.

original: da dung ma thob pa'o //
analyzed: da dung ma thob pa'o //
translated: The generation of the nonarisen is the generation of the not yet arisen.

original: dge ba'i chos zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The arisen is the arisen.üîΩThe increase of the arisen is the increase of the arisen.üîΩThe nonloss of the arisen is the nonloss of the arisen.üîΩThe four establishments of mindfulness are: the generation of the nonarisen, the maintenance of the arisen, the increase of the arisen, and the nonloss of the arisen.üîΩThe generation of the nonarisen is the generation of the not yet arisen.üîΩThe arisen is the arisen.

original: thos pa dang bsams pa dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab rnam pa gsum po dag skyon med pa'i don gyi phyir dge ba zhes bya'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: thos pa dang bsams pa dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab rnam pa gsum po dag skyon med pa'i don gyi phyir dge ba zhes bya'o zhes bshad do //
translated: The increase of the arisen is the increase of the arisen.üîΩThe nonloss of the arisen is the nonloss of the arisen.

original: bskyed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bskyed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin order to generate‚Äù means

original: de dag thob bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag thob bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: in order to attain them.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa skyes pa gnas pa dang / mi bskyud pa dang / slar zhing 'byung ba dang / 'phel zhing rgyas pa thob pa'i slad du zhes bya ba 'di ni bsten pa'i bsgom pa ston te /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa skyes pa gnas pa dang / mi bskyud pa dang / slar zhing 'byung ba dang / 'phel zhing rgyas pa thob pa'i slad du zhes bya ba 'di ni bsten pa'i bsgom pa ston te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin order to maintain, not forget, re-experience, attain, increase, and expand the generated foundations of mindfulness‚Äù teaches the cultivation of reliance.

original: 'di yang bstan pa rnams las so so nas bshad pa mi mthun pas bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las ni rnam pa bdun du bstan te /
analyzed: 'di yang bstan pa rnams las so so nas bshad pa mi mthun pas bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las ni rnam pa bdun du bstan te /
translated: Moreover, since the teachings disagree about the individual explanations, the treatises explain them in seven ways.

original: dge ba'i chos skyes pa dang / gnas pa dang / mi brjed pa dang / bsgom pa dang / yongs su rdzogs pa dang / phyir zhing 'byung ba dang / 'phel ba dang rgyas par bya ba'i phyir zhes bshad do /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos skyes pa dang / gnas pa dang / mi brjed pa dang / bsgom pa dang / yongs su rdzogs pa dang / phyir zhing 'byung ba dang / 'phel ba dang rgyas par bya ba'i phyir zhes bshad do /
translated: The treatises explain: ‚Äúin order to maintain, not forget, cultivate, perfect, re-experience, increase, and expand the generated virtuous qualities.‚ÄùüîΩTherefore, the same treatise states:

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos de nyid las skyes ba zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos de nyid las skyes ba zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: ‚ÄúGenerated‚Äù means

original: thob zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thob zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they have already been attained.

original: gnas pa zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gnas pa zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Abiding is as follows.üîΩ

original: thob pa'i shes rab kyis so //üîΩmi brjed pa zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: thob pa'i shes rab kyis so // mi brjed pa zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Abiding is the wisdom of attainment.

original: bsams pa'i shes rab kyis so //üîΩbsgom pa yongs su rdzogs pa zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bsams pa'i shes rab kyis so // bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs pa zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Non-forgetting is the wisdom of reflection.

original: bsgoms pa'i shes rab kyis so //
analyzed: bsgoms pa'i shes rab kyis so //
translated: The completion of meditation is the wisdom of meditation.

original: gong ma'i tshig gsum gyis ni shin tu bsrungs pas thob pa'i dge ba rnams bstan to //
analyzed: gong ma'i tshig gsum gyis ni shin tu bsrungs pas thob pa'i dge ba rnams bstan to //
translated: The three higher terms show the virtues obtained by very careful protection.

original: phyir 'byung ba dang / 'phel ba dang rgyas pa zhes bya ba ni go rims bzhin du de dag kho na la chog shes pa mi skye ba'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: phyir 'byung ba dang / 'phel ba dang rgyas pa zhes bya ba ni go rims bzhin du de dag kho na la chog shes pa mi skye ba'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: The terms ‚Äúemergence,‚Äù ‚Äúincrease,‚Äù and ‚Äúexpansion‚Äù mean that one is not satisfied with those virtues as they are obtained, but seeks higher ones.

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las 'di bdun gyi ming smos par zad kyi rnam par bshad pa ni med do //
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las 'di bdun gyi ming smos par zad kyi rnam par bshad pa ni med do //
translated: The Bodhisattvabhumi mentions only the names of these seven, but does not explain them.

original: kha cig ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa thob pa'i slad du ji lta ba de bzhin du yang kha cig ni yang @197b dag pa'i spong ba thob pa dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa thob pa dang / dbang po rnams thob pa dang /
analyzed: kha cig ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa thob pa'i slad du ji lta ba de bzhin du yang kha cig ni yang @197b dag pa'i spong ba thob pa dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa thob pa dang / dbang po rnams thob pa dang /
translated: some obtain the powers, and some obtain the branches of enlightenment.

original: stobs rnams thob pa dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams thob pa yang de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa zlas sgo lnga rnam par bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: stobs rnams thob pa dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams thob pa yang de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa zlas sgo lnga rnam par bshad pa yin te /
translated: This is the second explanation of the five faculties, in terms of pairs.

original: ji ltar dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la tshig drug yod pa de bzhin du yang dag pa'i spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams la yang tshig drug yod par yang gong ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la tshig drug yod pa de bzhin du yang dag pa'i spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams la yang tshig drug yod par yang gong ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: Just as the foundations of mindfulness have six members, the correct exertions, bases of supernatural power, faculties, powers, and branches of enlightenment also have six members, as explained above.

original: de la sgo lnga zhes bya ba yang dang po ni yang dag pa'i spong ba bzhi po 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la sgo lnga zhes bya ba yang dang po ni yang dag pa'i spong ba bzhi po 'di lta ste /
translated: The five faculties are as follows. The first is the four correct exertions.

original: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams yongs su spangs pa'i phyir dang / sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams mi skyed pa'i phyir dang / dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams bskyed pa'i phyir dang / dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnam gnas pa dang /
analyzed: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams yongs su spangs pa'i phyir dang / sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams mi skyed pa'i phyir dang / dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams bskyed pa'i phyir dang / dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnam gnas pa dang /
translated: It is because they completely abandon negative, nonvirtuous qualities that have arisen, because they do not give rise to negative, nonvirtuous qualities that have not yet arisen, because they give rise to virtuous qualities that have not yet arisen, and because they maintain virtuous qualities that have arisen.

original: mi brjed pa la sogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi brjed pa la sogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it abandons nonvirtuous dharmas that have arisen, because it prevents nonvirtuous dharmas that have not arisen from arising, because it generates virtuous dharmas that have not arisen, and because it stabilizes and prevents the loss of virtuous dharmas that have arisen.

original: mdzod kyi bstan bcos las ci'i phyir brtson 'grus la yang dag pa'i spong ba zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: mdzod kyi bstan bcos las ci'i phyir brtson 'grus la yang dag pa'i spong ba zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is effort called right abandonment in the treatise on the Abhidharma?

original: yang dag pa'i bsgom pas spong ba'i gnas skabs su /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i bsgom pas spong ba'i gnas skabs su /
translated: Because it abandons through the state of correct meditation.

original: brtson 'grus 'di'i stobs kyis le lo spong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brtson 'grus 'di'i stobs kyis le lo spong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because through the power of this effort, laziness is abandoned.

original: yang na yang dag pa'i mchog ces bya ste /
analyzed: yang na yang dag pa'i mchog ces bya ste /
translated: Or it is called right supreme effort because

original: yang dag pa'i lus dang / ngag dang yid kyi nan tan gyi nang na 'di mchog tu gyur pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lus dang / ngag dang yid kyi nan tan gyi nang na 'di mchog tu gyur pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ste /
translated: it is supreme among the correct practices of body, speech and mind.

original: bstan bcos yang dag pa'i rigs pa dang bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las kyang 'di dang mthun par bshad do //
analyzed: bstan bcos yang dag pa'i rigs pa dang bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las kyang 'di dang mthun par bshad do //
translated: The treatise, the Correctly Conceived, and the Great Exegesis explain in agreement with this.

original: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las log pa'i chos 'dzin cing yang dag pa'i lam du 'gro ba'i phyir yang dag pa'i spong ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las log pa'i chos 'dzin cing yang dag pa'i lam du 'gro ba'i phyir yang dag pa'i spong ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The commentary to the Perfection of Wisdom says, ‚ÄúIt is called right effort because it holds to the true Dharma and goes on the true path.‚Äù

original: gzhan yang de nyid las brtson 'grus kyi sems rnam pa bzhis nan tan dang / 'bad pa bskyed pa'i phyir yang dag pa'i spong ba zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gzhan yang de nyid las brtson 'grus kyi sems rnam pa bzhis nan tan dang / 'bad pa bskyed pa'i phyir yang dag pa'i spong ba zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Moreover, it says, ‚ÄúIt is called right effort because it generates the practice and effort of the four kinds of mental exertion.‚Äù

original: de la ngo bo nyid rnam par 'byed pa ni theg pa che chung gi bstan pa kun las brtson 'grus kyi bdag nyid do zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de la ngo bo nyid rnam par 'byed pa ni theg pa che chung gi bstan pa kun las brtson 'grus kyi bdag nyid do zhes bshad do //
translated: In this passage, the analysis of the essence explains that right effort is the essence of exertion in all the teachings of the Great and Lesser Vehicles.üîΩThe Bases of Supernatural Powers

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa ni 'di lta ste /üîΩrdzu 'phrul @198a * //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa ni 'di lta ste / rdzu 'phrul @198a * //
translated: The bases of supernatural powers are as follows.

original: gyi rkang pa bzhi po 'dun pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / sems dang / dpyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: gyi rkang pa bzhi po 'dun pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / sems dang / dpyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: The four bases of supernatural powers are concentration with the aspects of aspiration, strength, mind, and investigation.

original: mdzod kyi bstan bcos las /
analyzed: mdzod kyi bstan bcos las /
translated: The treatise Abhidharmakota states:

original: ci'i phyir ting nge 'dzin la rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa zhes rnam par gzhag ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir ting nge 'dzin la rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa zhes rnam par gzhag ce na /
translated: Why are concentrations called bases of supernatural power?

original: yon tan khyad par can rnams kyi gnas su gyur pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
analyzed: yon tan khyad par can rnams kyi gnas su gyur pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
translated: Because they are the basis of special qualities.

original: slob dpon gzhan kha cig na re rdzu 'phrul ni ting nge 'dzin yin la /üîΩrkang pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: slob dpon gzhan kha cig na re rdzu 'phrul ni ting nge 'dzin yin la / rkang pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Some other masters say: Supernatural power is concentration.

original: 'dun pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dun pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The bases are will and so on.

original: byang chub kyi yan lag gi ngo bo ni bcu gsum ste 'dun pa dang sems kyis bskyed pa'i phyir ro zhe'o //üîΩbye brag tu smra ba dag na re /
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag gi ngo bo ni bcu gsum ste 'dun pa dang sems kyis bskyed pa'i phyir ro zhe'o // bye brag tu smra ba dag na re /
translated: Because they generate will and so on, the nature of the branches of enlightenment is thirteen.

original: byang chub kyi yan lag bcu gcig gi steng du 'dun pa dang / sems kyis bsnan pa'i phyir dngos po bcu gsum du 'gyur ro zhe'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag bcu gcig gi steng du 'dun pa dang / sems kyis bsnan pa'i phyir dngos po bcu gsum du 'gyur ro zhe'o //
translated: Vaibhasikas say: Because will and thought are added to the eleven branches of enlightenment, there are thirteen things.üîΩAlso, a sutra states:

original: gzhan yang mdo las ji skad du ngas khyed la rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang mdo las ji skad du ngas khyed la rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: I will explain the bases of supernatural power and so on to you.

original: rdzu 'phrul ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Supernatural power is as follows.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi yul rnam pa sna tshogs myong zhing gcig las mang por byed pa la sogs pa /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi yul rnam pa sna tshogs myong zhing gcig las mang por byed pa la sogs pa /
translated: He experiences the various kinds of objects of his magical power, and he transforms one into many, and so on.

original: rgya cher bshad pa'i bar du'o //üîΩrkang pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rgya cher bshad pa'i bar du'o // rkang pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: This is explained in detail in the Abhidharma.

original: 'dun pa la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin bzhi po dag go zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'dun pa la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin bzhi po dag go zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: The feet are the four concentrations of will, etc.

original: de la 'dir bcom ldan 'das kyis ting nge 'dzin gyi 'bras bu la ni rdzu 'phrul zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de la 'dir bcom ldan 'das kyis ting nge 'dzin gyi 'bras bu la ni rdzu 'phrul zhes gsungs so //
translated: The Blessed One has said that the result of concentration is magical power.

original: 'dun pa la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin la ni rkang pa zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dun pa la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin la ni rkang pa zhes gsungs te /
translated: The concentrations of will, etc. are called feet.

original: bstan bcos yang dag pa'i rigs pa las kyang phal cher 'di dang mthun par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: bstan bcos yang dag pa'i rigs pa las kyang phal cher 'di dang mthun par 'byung ngo //
translated: The treatise, the Correct System, is for the most part in agreement with this.

original: gzhan yang bstan bcos bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las /
analyzed: gzhan yang bstan bcos bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las /
translated: Moreover, the great commentary treatise says,

original: rdzu 'phrul yon tan khyad par can gyi gnas su gyur pa'i phyir rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul yon tan khyad par can gyi gnas su gyur pa'i phyir rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúThey are called feet of magical power because they are the basis of the special qualities of magical power.‚Äù

original: rgya cher ni de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rgya cher ni de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: This is explained in detail in that treatise.

original: gzhan yang 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las /
translated: Moreover, the commentary to the noble perfection of wisdom states:

original: sems rtse gcig tu bsdus nas dmigs pa la bde bar gnas pa'i phyir yid bzhin gyi rkang pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems rtse gcig tu bsdus nas dmigs pa la bde bar gnas pa'i phyir yid bzhin gyi rkang pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because it abides happily in the object of meditation by gathering the mind into one-pointed concentration, it is called the wish-fulfilling foot.üîΩMoreover, the same text states:

original: gzhan yang de nyid las yang dag par spong ba bzhi po dag gis dus su sems la sogs pa rnam par g-yeng bas /
analyzed: gzhan yang de nyid las yang dag par spong ba bzhi po dag gis dus su sems la sogs pa rnam par g-yeng bas /
translated: By means of the four correct abandonments, at the appropriate time, the mind and so on are distracted.

original: 'di ltar ting nge 'dzin gyis sems @198b sdud pa'i phyir yid bzhin gyi rkang pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar ting nge 'dzin gyis sems @198b sdud pa'i phyir yid bzhin gyi rkang pa zhes bya'o //
translated: In this way, because concentration gathers the mind, it is called the wish-fulfilling foot.üîΩMoreover, the same text states:

original: gzhan yang de nyid las shes rab dang ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs la sogs pas smon pa rnams thob pa'i phyir yid bzhin gyi rkang pa zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang de nyid las shes rab dang ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs la sogs pas smon pa rnams thob pa'i phyir yid bzhin gyi rkang pa zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ste /
translated: Because one obtains one's wishes by means of the power of wisdom and concentration and so on, it is called the wish-fulfilling foot.

original: zhib tu de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: zhib tu de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: This is explained in detail in that text.

original: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las /
translated: The treatise the levels of a yogi's practice states:

original: ci'i phyir rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why are they called the feet of miracles?üîΩIt says:

original: smras pa / 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: smras pa / 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: It is like this.

original: gang la rkang pa yod pa des 'gro ba dang / ldog pa dang / pha rol gnon par nus pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: gang la rkang pa yod pa des 'gro ba dang / ldog pa dang / pha rol gnon par nus pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as those who have feet are able to go, return, and cross over,üîΩin the same way,

original: gang la chos de dag kyang yod la /
analyzed: gang la chos de dag kyang yod la /
translated: those who have these qualities and

original: ting nge 'dzin de dag kyang yongs su rdzogs par yod cing /üîΩde de ltar sems yongs su dag pa dang / yongs su byang ba dang / nyon mongs pa med pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang bral ba dang / drang por gyur pa dang / las su rung bar gnas pa dang / mi g-yo ba thob par gyur na /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de dag kyang yongs su rdzogs par yod cing / de de ltar sems yongs su dag pa dang / yongs su byang ba dang / nyon mongs pa med pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang bral ba dang / drang por gyur pa dang / las su rung bar gnas pa dang / mi g-yo ba thob par gyur na /
translated: who have fully perfected these meditative concentrations

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams 'thob par bya ba dang / reg par bya ba'i phyir 'gro ba dang / ldog pa dang / pha rol gnon par nus te /üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams 'thob par bya ba dang / reg par bya ba'i phyir 'gro ba dang / ldog pa dang / pha rol gnon par nus te / 'di lta ste /
translated: are able to go, return, and cross over in order to attain and touch the supramundane qualities.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos de dag rdzu 'phrul dam pa dang / 'byor pa dam pa yin pas na /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos de dag rdzu 'phrul dam pa dang / 'byor pa dam pa yin pas na /
translated: This is because these supramundane qualities are the highest miracles and the highest prosperity.

original: de'i phyir rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ste /
translated: Therefore, they are called bases of supernatural power.

original: rgya cher de nyid las 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rgya cher de nyid las 'byung ngo //
translated: This is extensively explained in the same text.üîΩThe nature of the concentrations

original: de la ngo bo nyid rnam par 'byed pa'i theg pa che chung gi bstan pa kun las /
analyzed: de la ngo bo nyid rnam par 'byed pa'i theg pa che chung gi bstan pa kun las /
translated: The nature of the concentrations is taught in all the teachings of the Great and Lesser Vehicles that analyze reality.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi ngo bo nyid do zhes bstan to //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi ngo bo nyid do zhes bstan to //
translated: The concentrations are taught to be the nature of meditative stabilization.üîΩThe faculties and powers

original: de la dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The faculties and powers are

original: dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga ste /
analyzed: dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga ste /
translated: the five faculties and the five powers.

original: dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dag go //üîΩmdzod kyi bstan bcos dag las /üîΩci'i phyir dad pa la sogs pa la sngar ni dbang po zhes bstan la /
analyzed: dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dag go // mdzod kyi bstan bcos dag las / ci'i phyir dad pa la sogs pa la sngar ni dbang po zhes bstan la /
translated: They are faith, effort, mindfulness, concentration and wisdom.

original: phyis ni stobs zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: phyis ni stobs zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why are faith and so on called faculties indriya when previously they were called the five spiritual guides and later they are called the five powers?üîΩThey are called faculties when they are weak and called powers when they are strong.

original: chos lnga po 'di dag chung ngu dang / chen po'i rnam pa'i phyogs kyi snga phyi la brten pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chos lnga po 'di dag chung ngu dang / chen po'i rnam pa'i phyogs kyi snga phyi la brten pa'i phyir /
translated: They are called faculties when they are weak and called powers when they are strong because they are respectively weak and strong in relation to the former and latter five spiritual guides.

original: gzhan yang zil gyis gnon par nus pa dang / zil gyis gnon par mi nus pa la brten pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //üîΩbstan bcos yang dag pa'i rigs pa las ci'i phyir dad pa la @199a * //
analyzed: gzhan yang zil gyis gnon par nus pa dang / zil gyis gnon par mi nus pa la brten pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad do // bstan bcos yang dag pa'i rigs pa las ci'i phyir dad pa la @199a * //
translated: Moreover, they are called faculties and powers because they are able to overpower and not be overpowered.

original: sogs pa la dbang po dang stobs zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: sogs pa la dbang po dang stobs zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why are faith, etc., called faculties and powers in the treatise, the Ornament of Clear Realization?

original: dbang du gyur pa'i phyir dang / zil gyis gnon par dka' ba'i phyir ro //üîΩci'i phyir lnga pa 'di dag la sngar ni dbang po zhes bstan la de'i 'og tu ni stobs zhes bstan zhe na /
analyzed: dbang du gyur pa'i phyir dang / zil gyis gnon par dka' ba'i phyir ro // ci'i phyir lnga pa 'di dag la sngar ni dbang po zhes bstan la de'i 'og tu ni stobs zhes bstan zhe na /
translated: They are called faculties and powers because they control and are not easily overpowered.üîΩWhy are these five called faculties in the first place and then called powers?

original: chos lnga po 'di dag gi chung ngu dang / chen po'i rnam pa la brten nas /
analyzed: chos lnga po 'di dag gi chung ngu dang / chen po'i rnam pa la brten nas /
translated: They are called faculties and powers because they are respectively weak and strong.

original: snga phyi rnam par dbye ba'i phyir dang / gzhan yang zil gyis gnon pa dang / zil gyis gnon par mi nus pa la gnas pa'i phyir dang / rnam pa'i chung du'i dad pa la sogs pa ni mthu chung ba'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis zil gyis gnon par nus la /
analyzed: snga phyi rnam par dbye ba'i phyir dang / gzhan yang zil gyis gnon pa dang / zil gyis gnon par mi nus pa la gnas pa'i phyir dang / rnam pa'i chung du'i dad pa la sogs pa ni mthu chung ba'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis zil gyis gnon par nus la /
translated: and because small faith and so on are weak and can be overpowered by their opposing factors,

original: chen po'i rnam pa ni 'di las bzlog pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chen po'i rnam pa ni 'di las bzlog pa'i phyir /
translated: but the great aspects are the opposite of that.

original: stobs kyi ming 'thob pa yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: stobs kyi ming 'thob pa yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: Therefore they obtain the name power.

original: gzhan yang bstan bcos bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las /
analyzed: gzhan yang bstan bcos bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las /
translated: Moreover, the great treatise on differentiation states:

original: mthu dang nus pa dbang du gyur pa'i phyir ni dbang po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mthu dang nus pa dbang du gyur pa'i phyir ni dbang po zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called faculties because they control power and ability.

original: choms par dka' ba'i phyir ni stobs zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: choms par dka' ba'i phyir ni stobs zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: They are called powers because they are difficult to overcome.

original: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las /
analyzed: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las /
translated: The commentary to the perfection of wisdom states:

original: shes pa chung du'i sems kyis thob pa'i phyir dbang po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: shes pa chung du'i sems kyis thob pa'i phyir dbang po zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called faculties because they are obtained by a mind of small knowledge.

original: shes pa rnon po'i sems kyis thob pa'i phyir stobs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: shes pa rnon po'i sems kyis thob pa'i phyir stobs zhes bya'o //
translated: Because they are attained by the sharp mind, they are called powers.

original: gzhan yang sems can gyi dbang po shes pa la dbang ba dang / thabs kyis stobs thob pa'i phyir dbang po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang sems can gyi dbang po shes pa la dbang ba dang / thabs kyis stobs thob pa'i phyir dbang po zhes bya'o //
translated: Moreover, they are called faculties because they are the controlling power for knowing the faculties of sentient beings and because they are attained by the power of method.

original: stobs lnga 'phel bar gyur nas nyon mongs pa 'joms pa dang / sems can sgrol zhing mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob par byed pa ni stobs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: stobs lnga 'phel bar gyur nas nyon mongs pa 'joms pa dang / sems can sgrol zhing mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob par byed pa ni stobs zhes bya'o //
translated: When the five powers increase, they are called powers because they conquer the afflictions, liberate sentient beings and cause them to attain the acceptance that phenomena are unborn.

original: gzhan yang lha'i bu'i bdud dang / mu stegs can dag gis 'jig par mi nus pa'i phyir stobs zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang lha'i bu'i bdud dang / mu stegs can dag gis 'jig par mi nus pa'i phyir stobs zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ste /
translated: Moreover, they are called powers because the demon of the sons of the gods and tƒ´rthikas cannot destroy them.

original: zhib tu ni de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: zhib tu ni de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: They are explained in detail in that text.

original: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las ni dbang byed pa'i don gyi phyir dbang po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las ni dbang byed pa'i don gyi phyir dbang po zhes bya'o //
translated: The treatise Levels of Yogic Deeds says, ‚ÄúThey are called faculties because they control.

original: choms par dka' ba'i don gyi phyir ni stobs zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: choms par dka' ba'i don gyi phyir ni stobs zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ste /
translated: They are called powers because they are difficult to overcome.

original: zhib tu de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: zhib tu de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: They are explained in detail in that text.

original: bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa dang / chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa la sogs pa las kyang rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las bstan pa dang don mthun par ston to //
analyzed: bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa dang / chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa la sogs pa las kyang rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las bstan pa dang don mthun par ston to //
translated: The treatises on the explanation of the Abhidharma and the compendiums of the various Abhidharma also teach in accordance with the teachings of the Levels of Yogic Deeds.

original: de la @199b ngo bo nyid rnam par 'byed pa ni /üîΩtheg pa che chung gi bstan bcos kun las dad pa la sogs pa'i chos lnga'i bdag nyid do zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de la @199b ngo bo nyid rnam par 'byed pa ni / theg pa che chung gi bstan bcos kun las dad pa la sogs pa'i chos lnga'i bdag nyid do zhes bshad do //
translated: The analysis of the nature of the five faculties

original: de la byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The treatise called the Analysis of the Nature of the Five Faculties explains that the nature of the five faculties such as faith is the seven aids to enlightenment.üîΩThe aids to enlightenment

original: byang chub kyi yan lag bdun po dran pa dang / chos rnam par 'byed pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dga' ba dang / shin tu sbyangs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / btang snyoms byang chub kyi yan lag rnams so //
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag bdun po dran pa dang / chos rnam par 'byed pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dga' ba dang / shin tu sbyangs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / btang snyoms byang chub kyi yan lag rnams so //
translated: The seven aids to enlightenment are mindfulness, the analysis of phenomena, perseverance, joy, pliancy, samƒÅdhi, and equanimity.

original: bstan bcos bye brag bshad pa chen po las /
analyzed: bstan bcos bye brag bshad pa chen po las /
translated: The Great Exegesis says:

original: de kho na nyid kyi byang chub kyi grogs su gyur pa'i phyir byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya'o //
analyzed: de kho na nyid kyi byang chub kyi grogs su gyur pa'i phyir byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya'o //
translated: They are called ‚Äúlimbs of enlightenment‚Äù because they are the aids to the enlightenment of reality.

original: byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya ba'i don ci yin zhe na /üîΩrtogs par byed pa'i phyir byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya ba'am /
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya ba'i don ci yin zhe na / rtogs par byed pa'i phyir byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya ba'am /
translated: What is the meaning of ‚Äúlimb of enlightenment‚Äù?üîΩThey are called ‚Äúlimbs of enlightenment‚Äù because they cause one to realize enlightenment.

original: byang chub kyi yan lag tu gyur pa'i phyir byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag tu gyur pa'i phyir byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya'o //
translated: Or they are called ‚Äúlimbs of enlightenment‚Äù because they are limbs of enlightenment.

original: kha cig ni 'di skad du rtogs par nus pa'i phyir byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya'o zhe'o //
analyzed: kha cig ni 'di skad du rtogs par nus pa'i phyir byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya'o zhe'o //
translated: Some say: They are called ‚Äúlimbs of enlightenment‚Äù because they are able to realize enlightenment.

original: gal te de lta na gcig ni yin la drug ni ma yin zhe na smras pa /
analyzed: gal te de lta na gcig ni yin la drug ni ma yin zhe na smras pa /
translated: If that is so, then one is a limb of enlightenment, but six are not.

original: drug ni byang chub kyi yan lag yin te /
analyzed: drug ni byang chub kyi yan lag yin te /
translated: Six are limbs of enlightenment.

original: byang chub kyi rjes su gzhol bas gtso bo'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: byang chub kyi rjes su gzhol bas gtso bo'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: Because they are directed toward enlightenment, they are called ‚Äúlimbs of enlightenment‚Äù from the perspective of the primary factor.

original: byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya ba'am /
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya ba'am /
translated: Or they are called ‚Äúlimbs of enlightenment‚Äù because they are limbs of enlightenment.

original: yang kha cig na re /
analyzed: yang kha cig na re /
translated: Some say:

original: byang chub kyi yan lag yin pa'i phyir byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya'o zhe'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag yin pa'i phyir byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya'o zhe'o //
translated: They are called ‚Äúlimbs of enlightenment‚Äù because they are limbs of enlightenment.

original: gal te de lta na drug ni yin la gcig ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na drug ni yin la gcig ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the six are factors of enlightenment and the seventh is not,

original: smras pa chos rnam par 'byed pa ni byang chub kyang yin la byang chub kyi yan lag kyang yin no //
analyzed: smras pa chos rnam par 'byed pa ni byang chub kyang yin la byang chub kyi yan lag kyang yin no //
translated: we reply that the analysis of phenomena is both enlightenment and a factor of enlightenment.

original: gzhan drug po dag ni byang chub kyi yan lag yin gyi byang chub ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan drug po dag ni byang chub kyi yan lag yin gyi byang chub ni ma yin te /
translated: The other six are factors of enlightenment but not enlightenment,

original: ji ltar yang dag pa'i lta ba lam yang yin la lam gyi yan lag kyang yin pa bzhin no zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: ji ltar yang dag pa'i lta ba lam yang yin la lam gyi yan lag kyang yin pa bzhin no zhes 'byung ste /
translated: just as right view is both the path and a factor of the path.

original: zhib tu de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no //üîΩbstan bcos yang dag pa'i rigs pa las kyang /
analyzed: zhib tu de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no // bstan bcos yang dag pa'i rigs pa las kyang /
translated: This is explained in detail in the Abhidharmako≈õa.

original: bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las bstan pa dang don mthun par bshad do //
analyzed: bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las bstan pa dang don mthun par bshad do //
translated: The treatise Correct Pervasion also explains this in accordance with the explanation in the Great Exegesis.

original: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las /
analyzed: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las /
translated: The commentary on the perfection of wisdom states:

original: mi slob pa'i de kho na'i byang chub tu dngos po 'di bdun gyis phyin par nus pa'i phyir yan lag ces bya'o //üîΩgzhan yang de nyid las bsgom @200a * //
analyzed: mi slob pa'i de kho na'i byang chub tu dngos po 'di bdun gyis phyin par nus pa'i phyir yan lag ces bya'o //üîΩgzhan yang de nyid las bsgom @200a * //
translated: These seven are called factors of enlightenment because they are able to reach the enlightenment of the nonlearner that is reality.üîΩMoreover, that text explains that the seven factors of enlightenment are the antidote to the four faults of degeneration,

original: pa'i lam gyi nus pa'i yin pa'i phyir byang chub ces bya'o //
analyzed: pa'i lam gyi nus pa'i yin pa'i phyir byang chub ces bya'o //
translated: and because it is the power of the path, it is called enlightenment.

original: mthong ba'i lam gyi nus pa yin pa'i phyir yan lag ces bya'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam gyi nus pa yin pa'i phyir yan lag ces bya'o zhes bshad do //
translated: and because it is the power of the path of insight, it is called a member.

original: gzhan yang bstan bcos dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa las /
analyzed: gzhan yang bstan bcos dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa las /
translated: Moreover, the Madhyantavibhanga-sastra says:

original: yan lag 'di byang chub kyi grogs su gyur pa'i phyir byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya'o zhes bshad de /
analyzed: yan lag 'di byang chub kyi grogs su gyur pa'i phyir byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya'o zhes bshad de /
translated: These members are called the members of enlightenment because they are the aids to enlightenment.

original: des ni byang chub kyi yan lag ni mthong ba'i lam gyi gnas skabs la gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: des ni byang chub kyi yan lag ni mthong ba'i lam gyi gnas skabs la gnas pa yin no //
translated: This shows that the members of enlightenment are in the state of the path of insight.

original: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las kyang /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las kyang /
translated: The Yogacarabhumi-sastra says:

original: yang dag pa nyid du skyon med par zhugs pa'i gang zag gis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa'i shes rab kyi yan lag 'byed pa'i phyir byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: yang dag pa nyid du skyon med par zhugs pa'i gang zag gis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa'i shes rab kyi yan lag 'byed pa'i phyir byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: The person who has entered the faultless state of reality is called a member of enlightenment because he opens up the member of the wisdom which understands reality just as it is.

original: de la ngo bo nyid rnam par 'byed pa ni theg pa che chung gi bstan pa rnams las /
analyzed: de la ngo bo nyid rnam par 'byed pa ni theg pa che chung gi bstan pa rnams las /
translated: Here, the discernment of reality is in the teachings of the Great and Small Vehicles.

original: shes rab dang / brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / dga' ba dang / shin tu sbyangs pa dang / btang snyoms kyi bdag nyid do zhes bshad do //üîΩyang kha cig ni 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa thob pa dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i mtshan ma thob pa dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i gnyen po dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs thob pa dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i bsgom pa thob pa dang /
analyzed: shes rab dang / brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / dga' ba dang / shin tu sbyangs pa dang / btang snyoms kyi bdag nyid do zhes bshad do // yang kha cig ni 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa thob pa dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i mtshan ma thob pa dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i gnyen po dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs thob pa dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i bsgom pa thob pa dang /
translated: It is the nature of right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, right concentration, right wisdom, and right liberation.üîΩMoreover, it is for the sake of attaining the eightfold noble path, attaining the signs of the eightfold noble path, attaining the antidotes and counteragents of the eightfold noble path, attaining the cultivation of the eightfold noble path,

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i ma skyes pa skye ba thob pa dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i skyes pa gnas pa dang / mi bskyud pa dang / slar zhing 'byung ba dang / 'phel zhing rgyas pa thob pa'i slad du /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i ma skyes pa skye ba thob pa dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i skyes pa gnas pa dang / mi bskyud pa dang / slar zhing 'byung ba dang / 'phel zhing rgyas pa thob pa'i slad du /
translated: attaining the arising of the unarisen eightfold noble path, attaining the abiding, non-forgetting, renewed arising, increase, and expansion of the arisen eightfold noble path,

original: shes pa brda spros par bgyid do zhes bya ba 'di ni gsum pa 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la brten nas shes pa brda sprod par byed do //
analyzed: shes pa brda spros par bgyid do zhes bya ba 'di ni gsum pa 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la brten nas shes pa brda sprod par byed do //
translated: The third is consciousness is the one who conveys the conventional.

original: de la gnyen po ni yang dag pa'i lam brgyad do //
analyzed: de la gnyen po ni yang dag pa'i lam brgyad do //
translated: Here, the antidote is the eightfold noble path.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni log pa brgyad de /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni log pa brgyad de /
translated: The opposing factors are the eight errors.

original: gzhan ni snga ma bzhin du bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni snga ma bzhin du bshad par bya'o //
translated: The rest should be explained as before.

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad ces bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad ces bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The so-called eightfold noble path is as follows:

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang @200b dag pa'i ngag dang / yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtsol ba dang / yang dag pa'i dran pa dang /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang @200b dag pa'i ngag dang / yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtsol ba dang / yang dag pa'i dran pa dang /
translated: right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness,

original: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: and right concentration.

original: bstan bcos bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las lam gyi yan lag ces bya ba'i don ci zhe na /
analyzed: bstan bcos bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las lam gyi yan lag ces bya ba'i don ci zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of the term 'limb of the path' in the great treatise called the Abhidharmako≈õa?

original: yongs su tshol zhing gzhol ba'i phyir lam gyi yan lag ces bya'o //üîΩlam gyi yan lag byed pa'i phyir lam gyi yan lag ces bya'o //
analyzed: yongs su tshol zhing gzhol ba'i phyir lam gyi yan lag ces bya'o // lam gyi yan lag byed pa'i phyir lam gyi yan lag ces bya'o //
translated: They are called members of the path because they are applied to the search for the path.üîΩThey are called members of the path because they cause the path to function.

original: kha cig 'di skad du 'dis yongs su tshol zhing gzhol ba'i phyir lam gyi yan lag ces bya'o zhes zer te //
analyzed: kha cig 'di skad du 'dis yongs su tshol zhing gzhol ba'i phyir lam gyi yan lag ces bya'o zhes zer te //
translated: Some say: They are called members of the path because they are applied to the search for the path.

original: gal te de lta na gcig ni yin la bdun ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na gcig ni yin la bdun ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then one is a member of the path, but seven are not.

original: smras pa bdun ni lam gyi yan lag yin te /üîΩlam gyi rjes su 'brang bas gtso bo'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: smras pa bdun ni lam gyi yan lag yin te / lam gyi rjes su 'brang bas gtso bo'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: We say: Seven are members of the path.

original: lam gyi yan lag gces bstan to //
analyzed: lam gyi yan lag gces bstan to //
translated: Because they follow the path, they are taught as members of the path from the perspective of the primary.

original: yang kha cig na re lam gyi yan lag yin pa'i phyir lam gyi yan lag ces bshad do //
analyzed: yang kha cig na re lam gyi yan lag yin pa'i phyir lam gyi yan lag ces bshad do //
translated: Some say: They are called members of the path because they are members of the path.

original: gal te de lta na bdun ni yin la gcig ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na bdun ni yin la gcig ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then seven are members of the path, but one is not.

original: smras pa / yang dag pa'i lta ba ni lam yang yin la lam gyi yan lag kyang yin no //
analyzed: smras pa / yang dag pa'i lta ba ni lam yang yin la lam gyi yan lag kyang yin no //
translated: We say: Right view is both the path and a member of the path.

original: gzhan ni lam gyi yan lag yin gyi lam ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan ni lam gyi yan lag yin gyi lam ni ma yin te /
translated: The others are members of the path, but not the path.

original: ji ltar chos rnam par 'byed pa ni byang chub kyang yin /
analyzed: ji ltar chos rnam par 'byed pa ni byang chub kyang yin /
translated: How is it that discernment of phenomena is enlightenment?üîΩ

original: byang chub kyi yan lag kyang yin la /üîΩgzhan drug ni byang chub kyi yan lag yin gyi /
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag kyang yin la / gzhan drug ni byang chub kyi yan lag yin gyi /
translated: Just as discernment of dharmas is enlightenment and a branch of enlightenment,

original: byang chub ni ma yin pa bzhin no zhe'o //
analyzed: byang chub ni ma yin pa bzhin no zhe'o //
translated: the other six are branches of enlightenment but not enlightenment.

original: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las /
analyzed: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las /
translated: In the commentary to the perfection of wisdom,

original: chos 'di ni bde ba dang / phun sum tshogs pa yin pas /
analyzed: chos 'di ni bde ba dang / phun sum tshogs pa yin pas /
translated: it explains that since this dharma is happiness and excellence,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa 'dus ma byas kyi grong khyer du 'jug par nus pa'i phyir chos 'di gang spyod pa de ni lam zhes bya'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa 'dus ma byas kyi grong khyer du 'jug par nus pa'i phyir chos 'di gang spyod pa de ni lam zhes bya'o zhes bshad do //
translated: one who practices this dharma is called a path because it is able to enter the city of nirvana, the unconditioned.üîΩThe YogƒÅcƒÅra Levels declares:

original: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las ci'i phyir 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las ci'i phyir 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is it called the eightfold noble path?

original: smras pa / 'phags pa slob pa bzhi mthong ba rnams yan lag brgyad kyis yang dag par 'dus pa'i lam gyis nyon mongs pa /
analyzed: smras pa / 'phags pa slob pa bzhi mthong ba rnams yan lag brgyad kyis yang dag par 'dus pa'i lam gyis nyon mongs pa /
translated: It is said: Those who see the four noble truths in training are noble beings.

original: thams cad ma lus par spang bar bya ba dang / rnam par grol ba mthar phyin par mngon du byed pa'i phyir 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa @201a * //
analyzed: thams cad ma lus par spang bar bya ba dang / rnam par grol ba mthar phyin par mngon du byed pa'i phyir 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa @201a * //
translated: The eightfold noble path is called the noble path because it is the path of the noble ones, it is the path that leads to the city of nirvana, and it is the path that is to be traversed without relying on another path.

original: zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: It is called the noble path because it is the path that is to be traversed without relying on another path.

original: de la ngo bo nyid rnam par 'byed pa ni so so nas bshad pa mi mthun te /üîΩmdzod kyi bstan bcos las ni chos drug gis ngo bo nyid byed de /
analyzed: de la ngo bo nyid rnam par 'byed pa ni so so nas bshad pa mi mthun te / mdzod kyi bstan bcos las ni chos drug gis ngo bo nyid byed de /
translated: The analysis of their natures is not uniform.üîΩThe treatise on the Treasury of Abhidharma explains:

original: yang dag pa'i ngag dang / las kyi mtha' dang / 'tsho ba ni tshul khrims su mtshungs pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ngag dang / las kyi mtha' dang / 'tsho ba ni tshul khrims su mtshungs pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
translated: The nature of morality is determined by six factors, because right speech, right action, and right livelihood are similar in being morality.

original: bye brag tu smra ba dag ni chos bdun gyi bdag nyid de /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba dag ni chos bdun gyi bdag nyid de /
translated: Vaibhasikas say that it is the nature of seven factors,

original: lus dang ngag gi las gnyis ni mi 'bral ba'i phyir zhes zer te /
analyzed: lus dang ngag gi las gnyis ni mi 'bral ba'i phyir zhes zer te /
translated: because the two karmas of body and speech are inseparable.

original: bstan bcos yang dag pa'i rigs pa las kyang de skad du ston to //
analyzed: bstan bcos yang dag pa'i rigs pa las kyang de skad du ston to //
translated: This is also taught in the treatise Correct Pervasion.

original: bstan bcos bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las ni bshad pa rnam pa gsum yod de /
analyzed: bstan bcos bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las ni bshad pa rnam pa gsum yod de /
translated: The Great Treatise on Differentiations explains that there are three explanations.

original: kha cig ni drug go zhes zer /
analyzed: kha cig ni drug go zhes zer /
translated: Some say: six.

original: kha cig ni bdun no zhes zer te /
analyzed: kha cig ni bdun no zhes zer te /
translated: Some say: seven.

original: don ni mdzod kyi bstan bcos las 'byung ba dang mthun no //
analyzed: don ni mdzod kyi bstan bcos las 'byung ba dang mthun no //
translated: The meaning is in agreement with the Abhidharmako≈õa.

original: kha cig ni brgyad do zhes zer te /
analyzed: kha cig ni brgyad do zhes zer te /
translated: Some say: eight.

original: yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba ni yang dag pa'i ngag dang / las kyi mtha' ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhe'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba ni yang dag pa'i ngag dang / las kyi mtha' ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhe'o //
translated: Because right livelihood is not right speech and right action.

original: bstan bcos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa las /
analyzed: bstan bcos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa las /
translated: In the treatise Abhidharmasamuccaya,

original: lam gyi yan lag gi ngo bo nyid ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: lam gyi yan lag gi ngo bo nyid ni 'di lta ste /
translated: the nature of the branches of the path is as follows:

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i ngag dang / yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba dang // yang dag pa'i rtsol ba dang / yang dag pa'i dran pa dang /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i ngag dang / yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba dang // yang dag pa'i rtsol ba dang / yang dag pa'i dran pa dang /
translated: Right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness,

original: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin te /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin te /
translated: and right concentration.

original: chos brgyad po 'di dag ni las kyi rang gi ngo bo nyid ces bya'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: chos brgyad po 'di dag ni las kyi rang gi ngo bo nyid ces bya'o zhes bshad do //
translated: These eight dharmas are said to be the nature of the branches of karma.

original: byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / lam gyi yan lag brgyad gnas skabs gang la brten nas bstan zhe na /
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / lam gyi yan lag brgyad gnas skabs gang la brten nas bstan zhe na /
translated: What are the seven factors of enlightenment and the eightfold noble path, and in what circumstances are they taught?

original: smras pa / bstan bcos bye brag tu bshad pa chen po dang sbyar na /
analyzed: smras pa / bstan bcos bye brag tu bshad pa chen po dang sbyar na /
translated: It is said that according to the great treatise VibhƒÅ·π£ƒÅ,

original: bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
analyzed: bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
translated: there are two explanations.

original: kha cig na re mthong ba'i lam gyi gnas skabs la ni yang dag pa'i lam brgyad rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: kha cig na re mthong ba'i lam gyi gnas skabs la ni yang dag pa'i lam brgyad rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Some say: The eightfold noble path is posited in the context of the path of seeing.

original: bsgom pa'i gnas skabs la ni byang chub kyi yan lag rnam par gzhag go zhe'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i gnas skabs la ni byang chub kyi yan lag rnam par gzhag go zhe'o //
translated: The factors of enlightenment are posited in the context of the path of meditation.

original: kha cig na re /
analyzed: kha cig na re /
translated: Some say:

original: mthong ba'i lam ni byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya'o //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam ni byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya'o //
translated: The path of seeing is called the factors of enlightenment.

original: bsgom pa'i lam ni lam gyi yan lag brgyad pa zhes bya'o zhe'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam ni lam gyi yan lag brgyad pa zhes bya'o zhe'o //
translated: The path of meditation is called the eightfold noble path.

original: dpyad pa dag gi yang dag pa'i don ni bshad pa snga ma yang @201b dag pa yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: dpyad pa dag gi yang dag pa'i don ni bshad pa snga ma yang @201b dag pa yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: The correct meaning of the analysis is that the former explanation is correct.

original: mdzod kyi bstan bcos kyang bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
analyzed: mdzod kyi bstan bcos kyang bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
translated: Also, the treatise K·π£udraka Pi·π≠aka explains this in two ways.

original: bshad pa gcig ni bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las bstan pa dang mthun no //
analyzed: bshad pa gcig ni bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las bstan pa dang mthun no //
translated: One explanation is in agreement with the teaching of the great commentary.

original: gcig ni 'di skad du byang chub kyi yan lag bdun ni mthong ba'i lam gyi gnas skabs su yod do //
analyzed: gcig ni 'di skad du byang chub kyi yan lag bdun ni mthong ba'i lam gyi gnas skabs su yod do //
translated: The other explanation is as follows: The seven factors of enlightenment exist in the state of the path of seeing.

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad ni mthong ba dang / bsgom pa'i gnyi ga la yod do zhe'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad ni mthong ba dang / bsgom pa'i gnyi ga la yod do zhe'o //
translated: The eightfold noble path exists in both the paths of seeing and meditation.

original: 'dir theg pa chen po'i bstan bcos dang sbyar na /
analyzed: 'dir theg pa chen po'i bstan bcos dang sbyar na /
translated: Here, in the context of the Mahayana treatises,

original: 'phags pa shes rab kyi rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel ba las bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
analyzed: 'phags pa shes rab kyi rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel ba las bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
translated: there are two explanations in the commentary on the perfection of wisdom.

original: phal cher bstan bcos bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las bstan pa dang mthun no //
analyzed: phal cher bstan bcos bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las bstan pa dang mthun no //
translated: For the most part, they are in agreement with the teaching of the great commentary.

original: bstan bcos chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa dang / dbus mtha' rnam par 'byed pa las /
analyzed: bstan bcos chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa dang / dbus mtha' rnam par 'byed pa las /
translated: In the treatise Compendium of Abhidharma and Distinguishing the Middle from Extremes,üîΩit says:

original: byang chub kyi yan lag bdun ni mthong ba'i lam la'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag bdun ni mthong ba'i lam la'o //
translated: The seven factors of enlightenment are on the path of seeing.

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad ni bsgom pa'i lam la'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad ni bsgom pa'i lam la'o zhes bshad do //
translated: The eightfold noble path is on the path of meditation.

original: bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las /
translated: The treatise Exposition of the Great Vehicle states:

original: byang chub kyi yan lag bdun ni mthong ba'i lam mo //
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag bdun ni mthong ba'i lam mo //
translated: The seven aids to enlightenment are the path of seeing.

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad las /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad las /
translated: From among the eightfold noble path,

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba ni mthong ba dang bsgom pa gnyis kar gtogs so //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba ni mthong ba dang bsgom pa gnyis kar gtogs so //
translated: right view belongs to both the paths of seeing and meditation.

original: gzhan bdun ni bsgom pa kho na'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: gzhan bdun ni bsgom pa kho na'o zhes bshad do //
translated: The other seven belong to the path of meditation alone.

original: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las /
translated: The treatise Levels of Yogic Deeds states:

original: byang chub kyi yan lag bdun ni mthong ba'i lam la'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag bdun ni mthong ba'i lam la'o //
translated: The seven aids to enlightenment are on the path of seeing.

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad las /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad las /
translated: From among the eightfold noble path,

original: yang dag pa'i ngag dang las kyi mtha' dang / 'tsho ba ni bsgom pa'i lam kho nar rnam par gzhag go zhes bshad de /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ngag dang las kyi mtha' dang / 'tsho ba ni bsgom pa'i lam kho nar rnam par gzhag go zhes bshad de /
translated: right speech, right action, and right livelihood are posited as belonging to the path of meditation alone.

original: gzhan gyi bshad pa ni med do //
analyzed: gzhan gyi bshad pa ni med do //
translated: There is no other explanation.

original: 'phags pa'i lam gyi don rgyar cher rnam par 'byed pa ni mtshan nyid bstan pa dag las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam gyi don rgyar cher rnam par 'byed pa ni mtshan nyid bstan pa dag las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The extensive explanation of the meaning of the noble path should be understood according to the explanations in the Compendium of the MahƒÅyƒÅna.

original: bcom ldan 'das bdag gis de dag mthong nas 'di snyam bgyid de /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bdag gis de dag mthong nas 'di snyam bgyid de /
translated: BhagavƒÅn, when I saw this, I thought as follows:

original: tshe dang ldan pa 'di dag ni dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i mngon par rtogs pa la gnas shing so so nas rnam pa sna tshogs kyi mtshan nyid kyis chos ston pas shes pa brda sprod par bgyid pas zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gsum pa bdag nyid
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa 'di dag ni dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i mngon par rtogs pa la gnas shing so so nas rnam pa sna tshogs kyi mtshan nyid kyis chos ston pas shes pa brda sprod par bgyid pas zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gsum pa bdag nyid
translated: These Venerable Ones are established in the realization of the object, and they teach the Dharma with various characteristics, and they make known the knowledge of the Dharma.

original: kyi bsam pa gang yin pa nyid smos @202a * //üîΩpa zhes bya ba ston to //
analyzed: kyi bsam pa gang yin pa nyid smos @202a * // pa zhes bya ba ston to //
translated: From here on is the third, the statement of one's own intention.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gsum du dbye ste /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gsum du dbye ste /
translated: This is also divided into three:

original: bdag nyid kyi bsam pa mdor bstan pa dang / bdag nyid kyi bsam pa bzlas te gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyi yon tan bsngags pa brjod pa ste /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi bsam pa mdor bstan pa dang / bdag nyid kyi bsam pa bzlas te gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyi yon tan bsngags pa brjod pa ste /
translated: the brief statement of one's own intention, the repetition and request of one's own intention, and the expression of praise for the BhagavƒÅn's good qualities.
