original: 'di ni dang po bdag nyid kyi bsam pa mdor bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po bdag nyid kyi bsam pa mdor bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the first, the brief statement of one's own intention.

original: tshe dang ldan pa 'di dag thams cad ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal can /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa 'di dag thams cad ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal can /
translated: All these Venerable Ones are full of pride,

original: mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyis mngon du zin pa'i slad du /
analyzed: mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyis mngon du zin pa'i slad du /
translated: because they are seized by pride.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa thams cad du ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid ma 'tshal ba sha stag lags so snyam bgyid pas zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa bdag nyid kyi bsam pa bzlas te gsol ba'o //
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa thams cad du ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid ma 'tshal ba sha stag lags so snyam bgyid pas zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa bdag nyid kyi bsam pa bzlas te gsol ba'o //
translated: This is the second, the request of his own thought.

original: de'i srad du bcom ldan 'das ni ngo mtshar rmad du gyur pa de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das ni legs par gsungs pa lags te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
analyzed: de'i srad du bcom ldan 'das ni ngo mtshar rmad du gyur pa de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das ni legs par gsungs pa lags te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
translated: After that, the Blessed One, in the same way as the wonder, The Blessed One, it is well spoken, and so on,

original: gsum pa bcom ldan 'das kyi yon tan gyi bsngags pa brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: gsum pa bcom ldan 'das kyi yon tan gyi bsngags pa brjod pa yin te /
translated: is the third, the praise of the qualities of the Blessed One.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: This also has three aspects.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: legs par gsungs pa yin par mdo tsam du bsngags pa dang / bsngags par bya ba'i bstan pa smos pa dang / gzhan dag gi spyod yul ma yin par bstan pa ste /
analyzed: legs par gsungs pa yin par mdo tsam du bsngags pa dang / bsngags par bya ba'i bstan pa smos pa dang / gzhan dag gi spyod yul ma yin par bstan pa ste /
translated: The praise in brief of the well spoken, the mention of the teaching to be praised, and the teaching that it is not the domain of others.

original: 'di ni dang po'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po'o //
translated: This is the first.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ji skad du /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ji skad du /
translated: As the Blessed One said:

original: don dam pa'i mtshan nyid ni phra ba mchog tu phra ba /
analyzed: don dam pa'i mtshan nyid ni phra ba mchog tu phra ba /
translated: The characteristic of the ultimate is subtle, supremely subtle,

original: zab pa mchog tu zab pa rtogs par dka' ba mchog tu rtogs par dka' ba /
analyzed: zab pa mchog tu zab pa rtogs par dka' ba mchog tu rtogs par dka' ba /
translated: profound, supremely profound, difficult to realize, supremely difficult to realize,

original: thams cad ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid do zhes gsungs pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: thams cad ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid do zhes gsungs pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: having the characteristic of the sameness of all things.

original: gnyis pa bsngags par bya ba'i bstan pa smos pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa bsngags par bya ba'i bstan pa smos pa ste /
translated: The second, the mention of the teaching to be praised, is as follows:

original: phra ba la sogs pa'i tshig gi don ni sngar gong du bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: phra ba la sogs pa'i tshig gi don ni sngar gong du bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: The meaning of the words subtle and so on is as explained above.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'phags pa'i bstan pa nyid la zhugs pa'i dge slong gis kyang don dam pa'i bden pa thams cad du ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid shin tu rtogs par dka' ba lags na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'phags pa'i bstan pa nyid la zhugs pa'i dge slong gis kyang don dam pa'i bden pa thams cad du ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid shin tu rtogs par dka' ba lags na /
translated: If even a monk who has entered the teaching of the BhagavƒÅn finds it extremely difficult to realize the ultimate truth having the characteristic of the sameness of all things,

original: 'di las slad rol pa'i mu stegs can rnams kyis lta smos kyang ci 'tshal zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'di las slad rol pa'i mu stegs can rnams kyis lta smos kyang ci 'tshal zhes bya ba ni /
translated: what need is there to mention the tƒ´rthikas outside of this?

original: gsum pa gzhan dag gi spyod yul ma yin par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gsum pa gzhan dag gi spyod yul ma yin par bstan pa'o //
translated: The third, the teaching that it is not the domain of others, is as follows:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: theg pa gnyis dang / mu stegs rnams kyis ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid khong du ma chud pa gang yin pa de @202b dag thams cad ni 'dir mngon pa'i nga rgyal bskyed pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to /
analyzed: theg pa gnyis dang / mu stegs rnams kyis ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid khong du ma chud pa gang yin pa de @202b dag thams cad ni 'dir mngon pa'i nga rgyal bskyed pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to /
translated: The meaning of the above is that all those who do not understand the characteristics of the single taste of the two vehicles and the tƒ´rthikas are said to be those who give rise to manifest pride.

original: // / bam po bco brgyad pa /
analyzed: // / bam po bco brgyad pa /
translated: The meaning of that is: all those who have not understood the characteristic of the single taste of the two vehicles and the tƒ´rthikas, here they are called ‚Äúarrogant.‚Äù

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Lord said to the venerable Subh≈´ti:

original: de de bzhin no de de bzhin te zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni /
analyzed: de de bzhin no de de bzhin te zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni /
translated: ‚ÄúSo it is, Subh≈´ti, so it is!

original: gsum pa bcom ldan 'das kyis yang dag par bshad pa zhes bya ba ston to //
analyzed: gsum pa bcom ldan 'das kyis yang dag par bshad pa zhes bya ba ston to //
translated: From here on is the third, called ‚ÄúThe Blessed One‚Äôs Correct Explanation.‚Äù

original: sngar bshad pa rnams bden pa nyid du bstan pa dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba man chad kyis shin tu phra ba las brtsams nas rgya cher rnam par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: sngar bshad pa rnams bden pa nyid du bstan pa dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba man chad kyis shin tu phra ba las brtsams nas rgya cher rnam par bshad pa'o //
translated: The explanation above is shown to be true, and from ‚ÄúWhy is that?‚Äù on, it is the extensive explanation beginning with the very subtle.

original: dang po yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
analyzed: dang po yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
translated: The first is also divided into two.

original: gang bsams pa'i dngos po de dag bden pa nyid du bstan pa dang / gang bsngags par bya ba de bden pa nyid du gyur bar bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gang bsams pa'i dngos po de dag bden pa nyid du bstan pa dang / gang bsngags par bya ba de bden pa nyid du gyur bar bstan pa'o //
translated: The first is the demonstration that the things that are thought of are true, and the second is the demonstration that what is to be praised is true.

original: 'di ni dang po gang bsams pa'i dngos po de dag bden pa nyid du bstan pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni dang po gang bsams pa'i dngos po de dag bden pa nyid du bstan pa ste /
translated: This is the first, the demonstration that the things that are thought of are true.

original: mngon par rtogs pa gcig kho na ma yin pas de'i phyir tshig zlos bur de de bzhin no //
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa gcig kho na ma yin pas de'i phyir tshig zlos bur de de bzhin no //
translated: Since there is not just one realization, therefore the words are not repeated.

original: de de bzhin te zhes gsungs pa yin no //üîΩrab 'byor ngas ni phra ba mchog tu phra ba zab pa mchog tu zab pa /
analyzed: de de bzhin te zhes gsungs pa yin no // rab 'byor ngas ni phra ba mchog tu phra ba zab pa mchog tu zab pa /
translated: It is just so, just so! is said.üîΩSubhuti, I have fully awakened to the ultimate truth, which is subtle, supremely subtle, profound, supremely profound,

original: rtogs par dka' ba mchog tu rtogs par dka' ba thams cad du ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid kyi don dam pa'i bden pa mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas kyang /üîΩgzhan dag la bsnyad cing rab tu bstan /
analyzed: rtogs par dka' ba mchog tu rtogs par dka' ba thams cad du ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid kyi don dam pa'i bden pa mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas kyang / gzhan dag la bsnyad cing rab tu bstan /
translated: difficult to realize, supremely difficult to realize, and has the characteristic of being of one taste everywhere. Having fully awakened to it,üîΩI have explained it to others,

original: rnam par bshad /
analyzed: rnam par bshad /
translated: I have fully taught it,

original: gdags par byas /
analyzed: gdags par byas /
translated: I have designated it,

original: gsal bar byas so zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa gang bsngags par bya ba de bden pa nyid du gyur par bstan pa ste /
analyzed: gsal bar byas so zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa gang bsngags par bya ba de bden pa nyid du gyur par bstan pa ste /
translated: The phrase it is made clear indicates the second praise, which shows that what is praised is true.

original: khyod kyis ji skad du bsngags pa brjod pa bzhin du /
analyzed: khyod kyis ji skad du bsngags pa brjod pa bzhin du /
translated: Just as you have praised it,

original: shin tu phra ba la sogs pa ro gcig pa'i don dam pa'i bdag nyid kyang thugs su chud par gyur pa yin la /
analyzed: shin tu phra ba la sogs pa ro gcig pa'i don dam pa'i bdag nyid kyang thugs su chud par gyur pa yin la /
translated: you have also understood the meaning of the ultimate reality, which is of one taste with the extremely subtle, etc.,

original: gzhan dag la yang go bar mdzad par gyur to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzhan dag la yang go bar mdzad par gyur to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: and you have also caused others to understand it.

original: bshad pa'i rnam grangs gzhan du na snga ma ni bdag dang gzhan sad par mdzad pa spyir bsngags pa'o //
analyzed: bshad pa'i rnam grangs gzhan du na snga ma ni bdag dang gzhan sad par mdzad pa spyir bsngags pa'o //
translated: Another way to explain the above passage is that the first praise is a general praise of the one who awakens himself and others.

original: phyi ma ni bdag dang gzhan sad par mdzad pa rnam par phye ste bsngags pa ste /
analyzed: phyi ma ni bdag dang gzhan sad par mdzad pa rnam par phye ste bsngags pa ste /
translated: The second praise is a specific praise of the one who awakens himself and others.

original: bdag dang gzhan sad par mdzad pa'i bsngags pa brjod pa'i phyir tshig zlos bur de de bzhin no //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan sad par mdzad pa'i bsngags pa brjod pa'i phyir tshig zlos bur de de bzhin no //
translated: The repetition of the phrase it is just so is for the purpose of praising the one who awakens himself and others.

original: de de bzhin te zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de de bzhin te zhes gsungs so //
translated: The phrase it is just so is repeated.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs @203a * //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs @203a * //
translated: Why is it so? and so forth.

original: pas ni gnyis pa shin tu phra ba las brtsams nas rgya cher rnam par bshad pa ston to //
analyzed: pas ni gnyis pa shin tu phra ba las brtsams nas rgya cher rnam par bshad pa ston to //
translated: The word therefore indicates the second extensive explanation beginning from the very subtle.

original: 'di yang brtag pa dang / rgya cher rnam par bshad pa dang gnyis bstan te /
analyzed: 'di yang brtag pa dang / rgya cher rnam par bshad pa dang gnyis bstan te /
translated: This also teaches two things: the investigation and the extensive explanation.

original: 'di ni dang po brtag pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po brtag pa'o //
translated: This is the first, the investigation.

original: rab 'byor ngas ni phung po thams cad la rnam par dag pa'i dmigs pa gang yin pa'i don dam pa'i bden pa yin par yongs su bstan zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyis pa rgya cher rnam par bshad pa bstan to //
analyzed: rab 'byor ngas ni phung po thams cad la rnam par dag pa'i dmigs pa gang yin pa'i don dam pa'i bden pa yin par yongs su bstan zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyis pa rgya cher rnam par bshad pa bstan to //
translated: Subhuti, I have taught that the ultimate truth is the object of observation of the purity of all the aggregates, and so forth. This is the second, the extensive explanation.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gsum gyis bstan te /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gsum gyis bstan te /
translated: This is also taught in three parts:

original: chos dang / dpe dang / dpe dang don du sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: chos dang / dpe dang / dpe dang don du sbyar ba'o //
translated: the teaching, the example, and the application of the example to the meaning.

original: chos kyang rnam pa gsum du dbye ste /
analyzed: chos kyang rnam pa gsum du dbye ste /
translated: The teaching is also divided into three parts:

original: rnam par dag pa'i dmigs pa las brtsams nas ro gcig gi mtshan nyid bstan pa dang / rab 'byor dge slong rnal 'byor spyod pa zhes bya ba man chad kyis khyab pa'i don rnam pa gsum las brtsams nas ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa dang /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i dmigs pa las brtsams nas ro gcig gi mtshan nyid bstan pa dang / rab 'byor dge slong rnal 'byor spyod pa zhes bya ba man chad kyis khyab pa'i don rnam pa gsum las brtsams nas ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa dang /
translated: The characteristic of one taste is taught beginning from the topic of the pure object of observation,üîΩthe characteristic of one taste is taught beginning from the topic of the three types of pervasion,

original: rab 'byor ji ltar phung po de dag gis zhes bya ba man chad kyis skyon rnam pa gsum dang bral bar ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid rnam par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor ji ltar phung po de dag gis zhes bya ba man chad kyis skyon rnam pa gsum dang bral bar ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid rnam par bshad pa'o //
translated: and the characteristic of one taste free from the three faults is explained beginning from the topic of ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, it is thus: those bodhisattvas who practice the perfection of wisdom.‚Äù

original: de la dang po yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la dang po yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The first has two parts:

original: rnam par bshad pa dang / mjug bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par bshad pa dang / mjug bsdu ba'o //
translated: the explanation and the summary.

original: rnam par bshad pa yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
analyzed: rnam par bshad pa yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
translated: The explanation is divided into two:

original: rnam par dag pa'i dmigs pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i dmigs pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: the explanation from the perspective of the pure object of observation and

original: don dam pa'i bden pa bstan pa dang / rnam par dag pa'i dmigs pa de yang zhes bya ba man chad rnam par dag pa'i dmigs pas ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'o //
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa bstan pa dang / rnam par dag pa'i dmigs pa de yang zhes bya ba man chad rnam par dag pa'i dmigs pas ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'o //
translated: The teaching on ultimate truth and the passage beginning ‚Äúthat pure object‚Äù teaches the characteristic of being of one taste with the pure object.

original: rnam par dag pa'i dmigs pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i dmigs pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: With reference to the pure object,

original: don dam pa'i bden pa bstan pa yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa bstan pa yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
translated: the teaching on ultimate truth is divided into two parts.

original: phung po'i rnam par dag pa'i dmigs pa don dam pa'i bden pa bstan pa dang / zlas skye mched la sogs pa'i rnam par dag pa'i dmigs pas don dam pa'i bden pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: phung po'i rnam par dag pa'i dmigs pa don dam pa'i bden pa bstan pa dang / zlas skye mched la sogs pa'i rnam par dag pa'i dmigs pas don dam pa'i bden pa bstan pa ste /
translated: The teaching on ultimate truth as the pure object of the aggregates and the teaching on ultimate truth as the pure object of the sense bases, etc.

original: 'di ni dang po'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po'o //
translated: This is the first.

original: de la phung po thams cad ces bya ba la /
analyzed: de la phung po thams cad ces bya ba la /
translated: With regard to that, ‚Äúall the aggregates‚Äù

original: phung po ni lnga ste /üîΩgcig po na ma yin pa'i phyir thams cad ces gsungs so //
analyzed: phung po ni lnga ste / gcig po na ma yin pa'i phyir thams cad ces gsungs so //
translated: means the five aggregates.üîΩThey are called ‚Äúall‚Äù because they are not one.

original: yang na zag pa dang zag pa med pa la sogs pa gcig kho na ma yin pa'i phyir thams cad ces gsungs so //
analyzed: yang na zag pa dang zag pa med pa la sogs pa gcig kho na ma yin pa'i phyir thams cad ces gsungs so //
translated: Or else, they are called ‚Äúall‚Äù because they are not just one thing, such as contaminated or uncontaminated.

original: de ni 'di @203b skad du phung po la sogs pa la don dam pa'i bden pa yod de /
analyzed: de ni 'di @203b skad du phung po la sogs pa la don dam pa'i bden pa yod de /
translated: This is because it would be teaching that the aggregates and so on are ultimate truth,

original: de ni rnam par dag pa'i dmigs pa zhes kyang bya ste /
analyzed: de ni rnam par dag pa'i dmigs pa zhes kyang bya ste /
translated: and that they are also called the pure object of observation,

original: yul 'di la dmigs pa'i dbang gis sems rnam par dag pa yang thob pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: yul 'di la dmigs pa'i dbang gis sems rnam par dag pa yang thob pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: because the mind that observes this object attains purity.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa las /
translated: Thus the Verses of S≈´tra Explication says:

original: rnam par dag pa'i dmigs pa ni //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i dmigs pa ni //
translated: The pure object of observation

original: rtag tu rnam par 'gyur ba med //
analyzed: rtag tu rnam par 'gyur ba med //
translated: is always unchanging,

original: dge dang bde ba'i ngo bo nyid //
analyzed: dge dang bde ba'i ngo bo nyid //
translated: the nature of virtue and bliss,

original: thams cad mngon par 'grub par 'gyur //üîΩzhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: thams cad mngon par 'grub par 'gyur // zhes 'byung ste /
translated: and all will be accomplished.

original: 'di nyid kyi 'grel pa las /
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi 'grel pa las /
translated: And its commentary says:

original: don dam pa'i bden pa ni gcig pa dang tha dad pa nyid dang bral ba'i phyir rnam par dag pa'i dmigs pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa ni gcig pa dang tha dad pa nyid dang bral ba'i phyir rnam par dag pa'i dmigs pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Ultimate truth should be known as the pure object of observation because it is free from being the same or different.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: yul la dmigs pa'i dbang gis sems rnam par dag pa 'thob par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: yul la dmigs pa'i dbang gis sems rnam par dag pa 'thob par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin te /
translated: Because the mind attains purity by the power of observing the object.

original: zhib tu de nyid las bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: zhib tu de nyid las bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: This is explained in detail in the same text.

original: mdo las sngar gong du tshig 'di lta bu gsungs pa med na /
analyzed: mdo las sngar gong du tshig 'di lta bu gsungs pa med na /
translated: If the words ‚Äúthus have I heard‚Äù were not stated at the beginning of the sutras,

original: ci'i phyir yongs su bstan zhes gsungs /
analyzed: ci'i phyir yongs su bstan zhes gsungs /
translated: why would they be stated in the summary?

original: mdo sde shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / mdo sde tshad med pa rnams las de bzhin nyid gsungs so //
analyzed: mdo sde shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / mdo sde tshad med pa rnams las de bzhin nyid gsungs so //
translated: The sutras teach suchness in the perfection of wisdom sutras and in countless other sutras.

original: ngas skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / zas dang / bden pa dang / khams dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / yang dag pa'i spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang /
analyzed: ngas skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / zas dang / bden pa dang / khams dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / yang dag pa'i spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang /
translated: I have taught the sense spheres, dependent origination, the foods, the truths, the elements, the establishments of mindfulness, the right efforts, the bases of supernatural power, the faculties,

original: stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / lam gyi yan lag thams cad la /
analyzed: stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / lam gyi yan lag thams cad la /
translated: the powers, the branches of enlightenment, and all the branches of the path.

original: rnam par dag pa'i dmigs pa gang yin pa de ni don dam pa'i bden pa yin par yongs su bstan to zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa zlas skye mched la sogs pa'i rnam par dag pa dmigs pa don dam pa'i bden pa yin par rnam par bshad pa
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i dmigs pa gang yin pa de ni don dam pa'i bden pa yin par yongs su bstan to zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa zlas skye mched la sogs pa'i rnam par dag pa dmigs pa don dam pa'i bden pa yin par rnam par bshad pa
translated: This is the second explanation of the object of purification of the transcendent wisdom of the ƒÅryas as ultimate truth.

original: ste / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ste / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: don dam pa'i bden pa'i don gyis chos rnams la khyab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa'i don gyis chos rnams la khyab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the meaning of ultimate truth pervades all phenomena.

original: rnam par dag pa'i dmigs pa de yang /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i dmigs pa de yang /
translated: That object of purificationüîΩis of the nature of a single taste in all the aggregates and is of the nature of being undifferentiated.

original: phung po thams cad la ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid dang tha dad pa med pa'i mtshan nyid yin te zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa rnam par dag pa'i dmigs pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /üîΩro gcig @204a * //
analyzed: phung po thams cad la ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid dang tha dad pa med pa'i mtshan nyid yin te zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa rnam par dag pa'i dmigs pa'i dbang du mdzad nas / ro gcig @204a * //
translated: From here onward, in terms of the object of purification,

original: pa'i mtshan nyid ston to //
analyzed: pa'i mtshan nyid ston to //
translated: it teaches the nature of a single taste.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
translated: This is also divided into two.

original: phung po rnams las brtsams nas ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa dang / zlas skye mched la sogs pa'i ro gcig ba'i mtshan nyid rnam bar bshad pa'o //
analyzed: phung po rnams las brtsams nas ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa dang / zlas skye mched la sogs pa'i ro gcig ba'i mtshan nyid rnam bar bshad pa'o //
translated: The characteristic of sameness of taste is taught beginning with the aggregates, and the characteristic of sameness of taste of the sense bases, etc. is explained.

original: 'di ni dang po phung po rnams kyi rnam par dag pa'i dmigs pa las brtsams nas /
analyzed: 'di ni dang po phung po rnams kyi rnam par dag pa'i dmigs pa las brtsams nas /
translated: This is the first, beginning with the object of observation of the purification of the aggregates,

original: ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa ste /
analyzed: ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa ste /
translated: the teaching of the characteristic of sameness of taste.

original: phung po rnams kyi rnam par dag ba'i dmigs pa tha dad pa med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / tha dad pa med pa'i don gang yin pa de nyid ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phung po rnams kyi rnam par dag ba'i dmigs pa tha dad pa med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / tha dad pa med pa'i don gang yin pa de nyid ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The characteristic of the object of observation of the purification of the aggregates is the characteristic of non-difference, and the meaning of non-difference is the characteristic of sameness of taste.

original: phung po la ji lta ba de bzhin du skye mched thams cad nas /
analyzed: phung po la ji lta ba de bzhin du skye mched thams cad nas /
translated: Just as with the aggregates, so it is with all the sense bases, etc.

original: lam gyi yan lag gi bar thams cad la yang ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid dang / tha dad pa med pa'i mtshan nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa zlas skye mched la sogs pa'i ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid rnam par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: lam gyi yan lag gi bar thams cad la yang ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid dang / tha dad pa med pa'i mtshan nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa zlas skye mched la sogs pa'i ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid rnam par bshad pa'o //
translated: The characteristic of the single taste of all the branches of the path and the characteristic of the absence of differentiation is the second, the explanation of the single taste of the sense bases, etc.

original: de'i phyir rab 'byor rigs pa des na don dam pa'i bden pa ni thams cad ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid yin par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa don dam pa'i bden pa ro gcig pa yin par bshad pa'i mjug bsdu ba ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir rab 'byor rigs pa des na don dam pa'i bden pa ni thams cad ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid yin par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa don dam pa'i bden pa ro gcig pa yin par bshad pa'i mjug bsdu ba ste /
translated: Therefore, Subh≈´ti, by this principle you should know that the characteristic of the ultimate truth is the single taste of all. This is the second, the conclusion of the explanation that the ultimate truth is of a single taste.

original: 'di ltar sngar gong du phung po la sogs pa'i chos kyi rnam par dag pa'i dmigs pa gang yin pa de dang / don dam pa'i bden pa'i mtshan nyid tha dad pa med pa'i rigs pa des na don dam pa'i bden pa'i mtshan nyid ni thams cad du khyab pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'di ltar sngar gong du phung po la sogs pa'i chos kyi rnam par dag pa'i dmigs pa gang yin pa de dang / don dam pa'i bden pa'i mtshan nyid tha dad pa med pa'i rigs pa des na don dam pa'i bden pa'i mtshan nyid ni thams cad du khyab pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Thus, by the principle of the non-differentiation of the characteristic of the ultimate truth and the object of observation of the purity of phenomena such as the aggregates, etc., which was previously mentioned above, the characteristic of the ultimate truth is all-pervading. This is what it means.

original: rab 'byor dge slong rnal 'byor pa ni phung po gcig gi de bzhin nyid dang / don dam pa dang / chos bdag med pa nyid rab tu rtogs nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor dge slong rnal 'byor pa ni phung po gcig gi de bzhin nyid dang / don dam pa dang / chos bdag med pa nyid rab tu rtogs nas /
translated: Subhuti, a monk yogi, having realized the suchness, the ultimate, and the selflessness of phenomena of one aggregate,

original: yang de nyid las gzhan pa'i phung po dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang / zas dang bden pa dang / khams dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / yang dag pa'i spong pa dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang /
analyzed: yang de nyid las gzhan pa'i phung po dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang / zas dang bden pa dang / khams dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / yang dag pa'i spong pa dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang /
translated: does not seek the suchness, the ultimate, and the selflessness of phenomena of the other aggregates, sense bases, dependent origination, foods, truths, elements, establishments of mindfulness, right efforts, bases of supernatural feats,üîΩfaculties, powers, branches of enlightenment, and path branches.

original: dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / lam gyi yan lag rnams kyis so so la de bzhin nyid dang / don dam pa dang / chos bdag med pa nyid yongs su tshol bar @204b mi byed kyi zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gsum pa kun du khyab pa'i don rnam pa gsum las brtsams nas /
analyzed: dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / lam gyi yan lag rnams kyis so so la de bzhin nyid dang / don dam pa dang / chos bdag med pa nyid yongs su tshol bar @204b mi byed kyi zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gsum pa kun du khyab pa'i don rnam pa gsum las brtsams nas /
translated: From here onward, up to does not seek the suchness, the ultimate, and the selflessness of phenomena of the other aggregates, sense bases, dependent origination, foods, truths, elements, establishments of mindfulness, right efforts, bases of supernatural feats,

original: ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa yin te /
translated: faculties, powers, branches of enlightenment, and path branches, this teaches the characteristic of one taste, beginning with the three types of all-pervasiveness, which is the third.

original: de la kun du khyab pa'i don rnam pa gsum ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la kun du khyab pa'i don rnam pa gsum ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The three meanings of all-pervasiveness are as follows:

original: de bzhin nyid dang / don dam pa dang / chos bdag med pa nyid do //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid dang / don dam pa dang / chos bdag med pa nyid do //
translated: Suchness, the ultimate, and the selflessness of phenomena.

original: gsum po 'di dag phung po la sogs pa'i chos la khyab pa'i phyir gsum po 'di dag la ro gcig pa zhes bstan to //
analyzed: gsum po 'di dag phung po la sogs pa'i chos la khyab pa'i phyir gsum po 'di dag la ro gcig pa zhes bstan to //
translated: These three are called ‚Äúof one taste‚Äù because they pervade phenomena such as the aggregates.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis kyis bstan te /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis kyis bstan te /
translated: This is also taught in two ways:

original: rnam par bshad pa dang / mjug bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par bshad pa dang / mjug bsdu ba'o //
translated: an explanation and a conclusion.

original: rnam par bshad pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rnam par bshad pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The explanation is also twofold:

original: mi mthun pa'i rnam par bshad pa dang / mthun pa'i rnam par bshad pa ste /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i rnam par bshad pa dang / mthun pa'i rnam par bshad pa ste /
translated: an explanation of the discordant and an explanation of the concordant.

original: 'di ni dang po'o /
analyzed: 'di ni dang po'o /
translated: This is the first.

original: 'di ltar don dam pa'i bden pa ni don rnam pa sna tshogs dang ldan pas /
analyzed: 'di ltar don dam pa'i bden pa ni don rnam pa sna tshogs dang ldan pas /
translated: Thus, since the ultimate truth has various meanings,

original: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mdo las ni ming bcu gnyis gsungs te /
analyzed: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mdo las ni ming bcu gnyis gsungs te /
translated: in the noble Perfection of Wisdom S≈´tras, twelve names are stated:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: de bzhin nyid dang / chos kyi dbyings dang / chos nyid dang / yang dag pa nyid dang / rnam par mi 'gyur ba nyid dang / mnyam pa nyid dang / skyon med pa nyid dang / chos nges pa nyid dang / chos gnas pa nyid dang /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid dang / chos kyi dbyings dang / chos nyid dang / yang dag pa nyid dang / rnam par mi 'gyur ba nyid dang / mnyam pa nyid dang / skyon med pa nyid dang / chos nges pa nyid dang / chos gnas pa nyid dang /
translated: Thusness, the realm of phenomena, the nature of phenomena, reality, the unchanging, sameness, faultlessness, the ascertainment of phenomena, the stability of phenomena,

original: yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / nam mkha'i khams dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings so //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / nam mkha'i khams dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings so //
translated: the limit of reality, the space element, and the inconceivable expanse.

original: de bzhin du bstan pa gzhan dag las 'byung ba ni 'dir brjod kyis mi rdzogs so //
analyzed: de bzhin du bstan pa gzhan dag las 'byung ba ni 'dir brjod kyis mi rdzogs so //
translated: In this way, the other teachings that occur here are not described in detail.

original: 'dir re zhig don rnam pa gsum las brtsams nas ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dir re zhig don rnam pa gsum las brtsams nas ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa yin te /
translated: Here, the characteristic of one taste is taught in terms of three topics.

original: de la de bzhin nyid ces bya ba ni rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa'i bstan bcos las ji skad du /
analyzed: de la de bzhin nyid ces bya ba ni rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa'i bstan bcos las ji skad du /
translated: Regarding that, thusness is as stated in the treatise Establishing Mere Consciousness:

original: de bzhin zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa nyid de mi bden pa ma yin par bstan to //
analyzed: de bzhin zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa nyid de mi bden pa ma yin par bstan to //
translated: Thus means reality, indicating it is not unreal.

original: nyid ces bya ba ni rtag pa nyid de /
analyzed: nyid ces bya ba ni rtag pa nyid de /
translated: ness indicates permanence.

original: rnam par 'gyur ba med par rab tu bstan to //
analyzed: rnam par 'gyur ba med par rab tu bstan to //
translated: It is taught to be unchanging.

original: 'di ltar yang dag pa nyid de /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang dag pa nyid de /
translated: Thus, it is reality.

original: gnas skabs thams cad du rtag par de kho na bzhin pa'i phyir de bzhin nyid ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: gnas skabs thams cad du rtag par de kho na bzhin pa'i phyir de bzhin nyid ces bya ba ste /
translated: Because it is just that way at all times, it is called thusness.

original: 'di ni rnam par 'gyur ba med pa yang dag pa'i don to zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rnam par 'gyur ba med pa yang dag pa'i don to zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: This is the reality of the unchanging ultimate.

original: sngar gong du yang dag pa'i don dam pa'i bden pa ni tha snyad dang bral pa'o zhes ma bstan tam zhe na /
analyzed: sngar gong du yang dag pa'i don dam pa'i bden pa ni tha snyad dang bral pa'o zhes ma bstan tam zhe na /
translated: But wasn‚Äôt it taught above that the ultimate reality is free from conventions?

original: ci'i phyir 'dir de bzhin @205a * //üîΩnyid ces brjod ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'dir de bzhin @205a * // nyid ces brjod ce na /
translated: Why is it called thusness here?

original: rgol ba 'di'i lan ni rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa'i bstan bcos las ji skad du /
analyzed: rgol ba 'di'i lan ni rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa'i bstan bcos las ji skad du /
translated: The answer to this objection is given in the treatise Establishing the Unreality of Things:

original: de bzhin nyid kyang btags pa tsam gyi ming yin te /üîΩmed par 'dod pa dgag pa'i phyir ni yod do zhes bshad la /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyang btags pa tsam gyi ming yin te / med par 'dod pa dgag pa'i phyir ni yod do zhes bshad la /
translated: Thusness is also a name that is merely imputed.üîΩIn order to refute the assertion of nonexistence, it is explained as existent.

original: yod pa nyid du 'dzin pa dgag pa'i phyir ni stong pa nyid do zhes bshad do //
analyzed: yod pa nyid du 'dzin pa dgag pa'i phyir ni stong pa nyid do zhes bshad do //
translated: In order to refute the grasping of existence, it is explained as emptiness.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa sgyu ma nyid du 'dzin bar ma gyur cig snyam pa'i phyir ni yang dag pa zhes bstan pa yin no //üîΩdon phyin ci log ma yin pa'i phyir ni de bzhin nyid ces bya'o zhes bstan pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa sgyu ma nyid du 'dzin bar ma gyur cig snyam pa'i phyir ni yang dag pa zhes bstan pa yin no // don phyin ci log ma yin pa'i phyir ni de bzhin nyid ces bya'o zhes bstan pa lta bu'o //
translated: The term reality is taught in order to prevent the apprehension that it is a mere illusion, thinking May it not be held to be unreal, a mere illusion.

original: de la don dam pa zhes bya ba la dam pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la don dam pa zhes bya ba la dam pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The term thusness is taught in order to prevent the apprehension that it is a mere negation, thinking May it not be held to be a mere negation.üîΩAmong those, the term ultimate is used because it is the object of the highest wisdom.

original: ye shes dam pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes dam pa'o //
translated: The highest is as follows: the highest wisdom.

original: don ni yul gyi don to //
analyzed: don ni yul gyi don to //
translated: The object is the object of the domain.

original: 'di ltar de bzhin nyid 'di ye shes dam pa rnam pa gnyis kyis dmigs par bya ba'i yul gyi don du gyur pa'i phyir don dam pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar de bzhin nyid 'di ye shes dam pa rnam pa gnyis kyis dmigs par bya ba'i yul gyi don du gyur pa'i phyir don dam pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Thus, thusness is called the ultimate because it is the object of the domain of the highest wisdom, which is twofold.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las /
translated: Therefore, in the Vrtti it is explained:

original: don dam pa'i bden pa ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid yin par rig par bya'o zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid yin par rig par bya'o zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: The ultimate truth should be known as the fully present nature.

original: ci'i phyir de bzhin nyid rnam pa bdun la don dam pa'i bden pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de bzhin nyid rnam pa bdun la don dam pa'i bden pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why are the seven aspects of thusness called the ultimate truth?

original: smras pa / ye shes dam pa gnyis kyis dmigs par gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smras pa / ye shes dam pa gnyis kyis dmigs par gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is said: Because it is the object of the two highest intuitions.

original: de yang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de yang 'di lta ste /
translated: And that is as follows:

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes dang / rjes las thob pa'i 'jig rten pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes dang / rjes las thob pa'i 'jig rten pa'i ye shes so //
translated: The supramundane intuition and the mundane intuition attained subsequently.

original: don dam pa 'di spros pa med pa'i phyir ye shes gzhan gyi yul ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam pa 'di spros pa med pa'i phyir ye shes gzhan gyi yul ma yin no //
translated: This ultimate truth is not the object of any other intuition, because it is free from conceptual elaboration.

original: de las gzhan pa'i don rnams ni bden pa gnyis bstan pa dag las 'byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i don rnams ni bden pa gnyis bstan pa dag las 'byung ba bzhin no //
translated: The other meanings are like those that occur in the teaching of the two truths.

original: de la chos bdag med pa nyid ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la chos bdag med pa nyid ces bya ba ni /
translated: Therein, the realitylessness of things is as follows:

original: bstan bcos mngon pa kun las btus pa las /
analyzed: bstan bcos mngon pa kun las btus pa las /
translated: In the treatise Compendium of the Abhidharma,

original: ji skad du bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: ji skad du bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid gang zhe na /
translated: it says: What is the characteristic of selflessness?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: ji ltar bdag tu smra ba rnams kyis bdag tu brtags pa'i mtshan nyid ltar phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched ni mtshan nyid de ma yin pa des ni phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched la bdag gi mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ji ltar bdag tu smra ba rnams kyis bdag tu brtags pa'i mtshan nyid ltar phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched ni mtshan nyid de ma yin pa des ni phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched la bdag gi mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir /
translated: Just as the characteristics of the self are imagined by the proponents of a self, the aggregates, elements, and media do not have those characteristics. Therefore, since the aggregates, elements, and media do not have the characteristics of a self,

original: bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya'o zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya'o zhes 'byung ste /
translated: they are said to have the characteristic of selflessness.

original: bstan bcos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa las kyang de skad du ston to //
analyzed: bstan bcos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa las kyang de skad du ston to //
translated: The treatise, the Compendium of Abhidharma, also teaches this.

original: stong pa dang bdag med pa la bye @205b brag ci yod ce na /
analyzed: stong pa dang bdag med pa la bye @205b brag ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the difference between emptiness and selflessness?

original: smras pa / bstan pa rnams la so so nas bshad pa mi mthun te /
analyzed: smras pa / bstan pa rnams la so so nas bshad pa mi mthun te /
translated: It is said that the teachings are explained differently.

original: mdzod kyi bstan bcos dang sbyar na /
analyzed: mdzod kyi bstan bcos dang sbyar na /
translated: When applied to the treatise, the Treasury of Abhidharma,

original: bshad pa mi mthun pa rnam pa bzhi yod de /
analyzed: bshad pa mi mthun pa rnam pa bzhi yod de /
translated: there are four different explanations.

original: de'i phyir de nyid las bdag gir lta ba dang / mi mthun pa'i phyir stong pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid las bdag gir lta ba dang / mi mthun pa'i phyir stong pa'o //
translated: Therefore, in that very treatise, it says, ‚ÄúIt is empty because it is incompatible with the view of ‚Äòmine.‚Äô

original: bdag tu lta ba dang mi mthun pa'i phyir bdag ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba dang mi mthun pa'i phyir bdag ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is not a self because it is incompatible with the view of a self.‚Äù

original: gzhan yang de nyid las nad kyi skyes bu dang bral ba'i phyir stong pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang de nyid las nad kyi skyes bu dang bral ba'i phyir stong pa'o //
translated: It is empty because it is devoid of a person who is sick.

original: rang dbang med pa'i phyir bdag ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: rang dbang med pa'i phyir bdag ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is not a self because it is not independent.

original: gzhan yang de nyid las /
analyzed: gzhan yang de nyid las /
translated: Moreover, that same text says,

original: 'di la bdag med pa'i phyir stong ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la bdag med pa'i phyir stong ba'o //
translated: It is empty because it is devoid of a self.

original: bdag nyid kyis bdag ma yin pa'i phyir bdag ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis bdag ma yin pa'i phyir bdag ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is not a self because it is not a self by itself.

original: gzhan yang de nyid las /
analyzed: gzhan yang de nyid las /
translated: Moreover, that same text says,

original: bdag gir lta ba'i gnyen po'i phyir stong pa'i rnam bsgom mo //
analyzed: bdag gir lta ba'i gnyen po'i phyir stong pa'i rnam bsgom mo //
translated: It is the meditation on the aspect of emptiness because it is the antidote to the view of mine.

original: bdag tu lta ba'i gnyen po'i phyir bdag ma yin pa'i rnam pa bsgom mo zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba'i gnyen po'i phyir bdag ma yin pa'i rnam pa bsgom mo zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: It is the meditation on the aspect of not a self because it is the antidote to the view of a self.

original: bstan bcos bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las kyang bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
analyzed: bstan bcos bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las kyang bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
translated: The great treatise on differentiation also explains two types of meditation on emptiness:

original: mdzod kyi bstan bcos las 'byung ba'i dngos po gnyis dang mthun no //
analyzed: mdzod kyi bstan bcos las 'byung ba'i dngos po gnyis dang mthun no //
translated: They are consistent with the two things that occur in the treatise on the levels.

original: bstan bcos yang dag pa'i rigs pa las /
analyzed: bstan bcos yang dag pa'i rigs pa las /
translated: The treatise on rational application says,

original: dbang byed pa'i bdag po med pa'i phyir stong pa'o //
analyzed: dbang byed pa'i bdag po med pa'i phyir stong pa'o //
translated: It is empty because it is devoid of a self that is a dominant condition.

original: bdag gi mtshan nyid dang mi mthun pa'i phyir bdag ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gi mtshan nyid dang mi mthun pa'i phyir bdag ma yin pa'o //
translated: Because it is not in accord with the characteristics of a self, it is not a self.

original: gzhan yang de nyid las bdag gir lta ba'i gnyen po'i phyir stong pa'i rnam pa bsgom mo //
analyzed: gzhan yang de nyid las bdag gir lta ba'i gnyen po'i phyir stong pa'i rnam pa bsgom mo //
translated: Moreover, in the same text, it says that the antidote to the view of mine is the cultivation of the aspect of emptiness.

original: bdag tu lta ba'i gnyen po'i phyir bdag ma yin pa'i rnam pa bsgom mo zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba'i gnyen po'i phyir bdag ma yin pa'i rnam pa bsgom mo zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: The antidote to the view of a self is the cultivation of the aspect of not a self.

original: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las rdzas su mi mthong ba ni stong pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las rdzas su mi mthong ba ni stong pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The commentary to the perfection of wisdom says, ‚ÄúNot seeing a substance is called emptiness.

original: bdag mi mthong ba ni bdag med pa zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: bdag mi mthong ba ni bdag med pa zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Not seeing a self is called selflessness.‚Äù

original: bstan bcos mngon pa kun las btus pa las /
analyzed: bstan bcos mngon pa kun las btus pa las /
translated: The treatise Compendium of Abhidharma says:

original: stong pa'i mtshan nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: stong pa'i mtshan nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is the definition of emptiness?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is this:

original: gang la gang med pa de ni rigs pa des stong par yang dag pa rjes su mthong ba ste /
analyzed: gang la gang med pa de ni rigs pa des stong par yang dag pa rjes su mthong ba ste /
translated: That which is not present in something is seen correctly as empty of that by means of reasoning.

original: 'di la lhag ma gang yin pa de ni 'dir yod pa'o zhes rigs pa nges yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yod par shes pa ni stong pa nyid la shin tu zhugs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di la lhag ma gang yin pa de ni 'dir yod pa'o zhes rigs pa nges yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yod par shes pa ni stong pa nyid la shin tu zhugs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Here, the knowledge that what remains here exists just as it is is called deep engagement with emptiness.

original: gang na ci zhig med ce na //üîΩphung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams la rtag pa dang / brtan pa dang / @206a * //
analyzed: gang na ci zhig med ce na // phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams la rtag pa dang / brtan pa dang / @206a * //
translated: What is absent in what?üîΩ In the aggregates, elements, and sense bases, a self and what belongs to a self are absent, as well as permanence, stability,

original: ther zug dang / mi 'gyur ba'i chos can bdag dang / bdag gi la sogs pa yod pa ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: ther zug dang / mi 'gyur ba'i chos can bdag dang / bdag gi la sogs pa yod pa ma yin pa ste /
translated: eternality, and immutability.

original: rigs pa des de dag kun stong pa'o //
analyzed: rigs pa des de dag kun stong pa'o //
translated: By this reasoning, all are empty.

original: de la lhag ma yod pa ci zhig ce na /
analyzed: de la lhag ma yod pa ci zhig ce na /
translated: What remains there?

original: gang la bdag med pa nyid de /
analyzed: gang la bdag med pa nyid de /
translated: That which is selflessness.

original: de ltar bdag ni med kyi bdag med pa nyid yod pa ni stong pa nyid ces bya'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de ltar bdag ni med kyi bdag med pa nyid yod pa ni stong pa nyid ces bya'o zhes bshad do //
translated: Thus, the self does not exist, but selflessness does exist. This is called emptiness.

original: gzhan yang bstan bcos de kho na nyid grub pa las chos kyi phyag rgya'i mdo las ji skad du /
analyzed: gzhan yang bstan bcos de kho na nyid grub pa las chos kyi phyag rgya'i mdo las ji skad du /
translated: Moreover, in the treatise Establishing Reality, it is said, in the Dharma-mudra-sutra:

original: rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis gzugs mi rtag pa dang / stong pa nyid du bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis gzugs mi rtag pa dang / stong pa nyid du bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Yogis and yoginis should meditate on form as impermanent and as emptiness.

original: de la mi rtag pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la mi rtag pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Here, impermanence is as follows.

original: gzugs ngo bo nyid kyis mi rtag pa'o //üîΩstong pa ni ji ltar bum pa'i nang na chu med pas /
analyzed: gzugs ngo bo nyid kyis mi rtag pa'o // stong pa ni ji ltar bum pa'i nang na chu med pas /
translated: Form is impermanent by its very nature.

original: bum pa stong pa zhes bya ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: bum pa stong pa zhes bya ba de bzhin du /
translated: Emptiness is like the statement, ‚ÄúA pot is empty‚Äù when there is no water in a pot.üîΩIn the same way, because of the absence of a self in the five aggregates, they are said to be empty.

original: phung po lnga po dag la shes pa'i bdag med pa'i phyir stong pa zhes bya'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba dang / gzhan yang de nyid kyi nang nas 'phags pa'i spyod pa bstan pa'i le'u las /
analyzed: phung po lnga po dag la shes pa'i bdag med pa'i phyir stong pa zhes bya'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba dang / gzhan yang de nyid kyi nang nas 'phags pa'i spyod pa bstan pa'i le'u las /
translated: And in the same text, in the chapter called ‚ÄúTeaching the Conduct of the Noble Ones,‚Äù it says:

original: spyod pa ni rnam pa gnyis yod de /
analyzed: spyod pa ni rnam pa gnyis yod de /
translated: ‚ÄúThere are two kinds of conduct:

original: stong pa'i spyod pa dang / bdag med pa'i spyod pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa'i spyod pa dang / bdag med pa'i spyod pa'o //
translated: the conduct of emptiness and the conduct of selflessness.

original: phung po lnga po dag la sems can mi dmigs pa ni stong pa'i spyod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phung po lnga po dag la sems can mi dmigs pa ni stong pa'i spyod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Not observing sentient beings in the five aggregates is called the conduct of emptiness.

original: phung po lnga po med pa nyid du mthong ba ni bdag med pa'i spyod pa zhes bya ba'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: phung po lnga po med pa nyid du mthong ba ni bdag med pa'i spyod pa zhes bya ba'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: The vision of the nonexistence of the five aggregates is called the practice of selflessness.

original: de bzhin nyid dang / don dam pa'i de kho na'i rjes su 'brang zhing gnyis su med pa'i shes pas gnas byas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid dang / don dam pa'i de kho na'i rjes su 'brang zhing gnyis su med pa'i shes pas gnas byas pa'i phyir /
translated: Because they follow suchness and the ultimate reality, and because they abide in nondual knowledge,

original: thams cad du ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid don dam pa'i bden pa la nges par rtogs pas /
analyzed: thams cad du ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid don dam pa'i bden pa la nges par rtogs pas /
translated: they realize the ultimate truth, which is of the same taste everywhere.

original: mngon par rtogs par byed de zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa mthun pa'i rnam par bshad pas ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par rtogs par byed de zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa mthun pa'i rnam par bshad pas ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'o //
translated: Thus, the second explanation of the same taste is the explanation of the same taste as the concordant class.

original: mdo'i tshig 'di rnam par bshad pa yang so so nas bshad pa mi mthun te /
analyzed: mdo'i tshig 'di rnam par bshad pa yang so so nas bshad pa mi mthun te /
translated: The explanation of the words of this sutra is also not uniform.

original: kha cig na re /
analyzed: kha cig na re /
translated: Some say:

original: 'di kho na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'di kho na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase ‚Äújust this‚Äù

original: thams cad kyang phung po gcig kho na'o zhes tha dad pa'i dgag pa bstan pa'i phyir gnyis pa kho na zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: thams cad kyang phung po gcig kho na'o zhes tha dad pa'i dgag pa bstan pa'i phyir gnyis pa kho na zhes gsungs te /
translated: refers to the fact that all are just one aggregate, in order to teach the negation of difference. The phrase ‚Äújust two‚Äù

original: phung po gzhan la sogs pa dgag pa yin no //
analyzed: phung po gzhan la sogs pa dgag pa yin no //
translated: refers to the negation of other aggregates and so on.

original: 'di zhes bya bas ni phung po 'di gcig kho na'o zhes bstan pa'o zhes zer te de ni 'di skad du phung po 'di gcig kho na'i de bzhin nyid dang / don dam @206b pa dang / yod pa dang / med pa gnyis su med pa'i chos bdag med pa'i yul rnam pa gsum po dag rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis gnas byas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di zhes bya bas ni phung po 'di gcig kho na'o zhes bstan pa'o zhes zer te de ni 'di skad du phung po 'di gcig kho na'i de bzhin nyid dang / don dam @206b pa dang / yod pa dang / med pa gnyis su med pa'i chos bdag med pa'i yul rnam pa gsum po dag rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis gnas byas pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, it is said that the reality of this aggregate is only one, and that the non-conceptual intuition which is the objective domain of the three kinds of non-substantiality, the ultimate, existence, non-existence, and the non-duality of the two, is the basis of the reality of this aggregate.

original: rjes las thob pa'i ye shes kyis de dag thams cad la ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid du nges par rtogs pas /
analyzed: rjes las thob pa'i ye shes kyis de dag thams cad la ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid du nges par rtogs pas /
translated: The intuition attained subsequently to that determines all of them as having the characteristic of a single taste, and so it is called realization.

original: mngon par rtogs par byed pas de'i phyir de bzhin nyid ni ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid yin par shes par bya'o zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mngon par rtogs par byed pas de'i phyir de bzhin nyid ni ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid yin par shes par bya'o zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, it is taught that reality should be understood as having the characteristic of a single taste.

original: kha cig na re gnyis su med pa'i shes pa zhes bya ba ni gang zag dang / chos gnyis bdag med pa'i shes pa ste /
analyzed: kha cig na re gnyis su med pa'i shes pa zhes bya ba ni gang zag dang / chos gnyis bdag med pa'i shes pa ste /
translated: Some believe that the phrase non-dual intuition refers to the intuition of the selflessness of both the person and the dharma.

original: gzhan ni snga ma bzhin no zhe'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni snga ma bzhin no zhe'o //
translated: The rest is as before.

original: kha cig na re rnal 'byor pa dag 'di ltar rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes pa rnam pa gsum gyis gnas byas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: kha cig na re rnal 'byor pa dag 'di ltar rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes pa rnam pa gsum gyis gnas byas pa'i phyir /
translated: Some say: Because yogis are situated in three types of nonconceptual consciousness,

original: shes pa 'di dag gis thams cad du ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid la nges par rtogs pas mngon par rtogs par byed do //
analyzed: shes pa 'di dag gis thams cad du ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid la nges par rtogs pas mngon par rtogs par byed do //
translated: they realize the nature of the single taste of all through these consciousnesses and they realize it.

original: gzhan ni dang po bzhin du bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni dang po bzhin du bshad par bya'o //
translated: Others should be explained like the first.

original: yang na gzhan ni snga ma bzhin no zhe'o //
analyzed: yang na gzhan ni snga ma bzhin no zhe'o //
translated: Or else, others are like the former.

original: gong ma de dag kyang mdor bsdu na /
analyzed: gong ma de dag kyang mdor bsdu na /
translated: Also, the former are summarized as follows.

original: bshad pa rnam pa gsum du 'gyur te /
analyzed: bshad pa rnam pa gsum du 'gyur te /
translated: There are three explanations.

original: kha cig ni chos 'di 'ba' zhig ro gcig pa'i de bzhin nyid yin no zhes zer te /
analyzed: kha cig ni chos 'di 'ba' zhig ro gcig pa'i de bzhin nyid yin no zhes zer te /
translated: Some say: This dharma alone is suchness of single taste.

original: 'di la bshad pa rnam pa gsum yod pa yang snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di la bshad pa rnam pa gsum yod pa yang snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: There are three explanations of this, which should be understood as above.

original: kha cig ni phung po gcig po 'di 'ba' zhig de bzhin nyid yin no zhes zer te /
analyzed: kha cig ni phung po gcig po 'di 'ba' zhig de bzhin nyid yin no zhes zer te /
translated: Some say: This single aggregate alone is suchness.

original: 'di la bshad pa rnam pa gsum yod pa yang gong ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di la bshad pa rnam pa gsum yod pa yang gong ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: There are three explanations of this, which should be understood as above.

original: 'di ltar gong du bstan pa de dag kyang bshad pa rnam pa dgur 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gong du bstan pa de dag kyang bshad pa rnam pa dgur 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, the above explanations are nine in number.

original: yang na de bzhin nyid tsam gang yin pa de ni phung po gcig yin no zhes zer te /
analyzed: yang na de bzhin nyid tsam gang yin pa de ni phung po gcig yin no zhes zer te /
translated: Or else, the one who says that the mere suchness is the one aggregate.

original: 'di la bshad pa rnam pa gsum yod pa yang gong ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di la bshad pa rnam pa gsum yod pa yang gong ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The three explanations of this are to be understood as above.

original: de ltar bshad pa yod kyang tshig bden pa ma yin pas bshad pa'i don mdor bsdu na /
analyzed: de ltar bshad pa yod kyang tshig bden pa ma yin pas bshad pa'i don mdor bsdu na /
translated: Although there are such explanations, they are not true words.

original: mdo'i tshig snga ma ni chos gzhan la don dam pa yin par yongs su tshol ba'i phyir mi mthun pa'i rnam par bshad pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mdo'i tshig snga ma ni chos gzhan la don dam pa yin par yongs su tshol ba'i phyir mi mthun pa'i rnam par bshad pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The former words of the sutra are called ‚Äúexplanation by way of contradiction‚Äù because they seek the ultimate in other phenomena.

original: mdo'i tshig 'di ni phung po gcig kho na yongs su tshol bar sgrub pas /üîΩrjes su mthun pa'i rnam par @207a * //
analyzed: mdo'i tshig 'di ni phung po gcig kho na yongs su tshol bar sgrub pas / rjes su mthun pa'i rnam par @207a * //
translated: These words of the sutra establish the search for the one aggregate alone.

original: bshad pa zhes bya'o zhes ston to //
analyzed: bshad pa zhes bya'o zhes ston to //
translated: Therefore, they are called ‚Äúexplanation by way of conformity.‚Äù

original: slob dpon yang dag bden pas mdo'i tshig 'di gnyis kyi bshad pa byas pa las /
analyzed: slob dpon yang dag bden pas mdo'i tshig 'di gnyis kyi bshad pa byas pa las /
translated: Master Samghabhadra explains these two sutra passages as follows.

original: mdo'i tshig snga ma ni yul rnam pa gsum pa rtogs par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: mdo'i tshig snga ma ni yul rnam pa gsum pa rtogs par bshad pa'o //
translated: The former passage of the sutra explains the realization of the three aspects of the object.

original: mdo'i tshig phyi ma ni nges par rtogs pas mngon par rtogs par byed par bshad pa yin no zhes 'byung ngo //üîΩ'di gsum tha dad pa yang theg pa chung ngu'i bstan pa dang sbyar na /
analyzed: mdo'i tshig phyi ma ni nges par rtogs pas mngon par rtogs par byed par bshad pa yin no zhes 'byung ngo // 'di gsum tha dad pa yang theg pa chung ngu'i bstan pa dang sbyar na /
translated: The latter passage of the sutra explains the realization of the realization by means of ascertainment.

original: zag pa med pa'i dbang po gsum la bye brag yod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i dbang po gsum la bye brag yod pa'i phyir te /
translated: These three are different because there is a distinction among the three uncontaminated faculties.

original: 'di ni mthong ba dang / bsgom pa dang / mi slob pa'i gnas skabs kyi bye brag gi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ni mthong ba dang / bsgom pa dang / mi slob pa'i gnas skabs kyi bye brag gi phyir ro //
translated: This is because of the distinction of the states of seeing, cultivation, and no learning.

original: 'dir theg pa chen po'i bstan pa dang sbyar na /
analyzed: 'dir theg pa chen po'i bstan pa dang sbyar na /
translated: Here, in the teaching of the Mahayana,

original: sa re re la yang 'jug pa dang / gnas pa dang / 'byung ba'i chos yod pas go rims bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: sa re re la yang 'jug pa dang / gnas pa dang / 'byung ba'i chos yod pas go rims bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: each stage has the qualities of entry, abiding, and emergence, so they should be applied in order.

original: de'i phyir rab 'byor rigs pa nges kyang don dam pa'i bden pa ni thams cad du ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid yin par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa mjug bsdu ba ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir rab 'byor rigs pa nges kyang don dam pa'i bden pa ni thams cad du ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid yin par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa mjug bsdu ba ste /
translated: Therefore, Subhuti, you should know that although the rational is manifold, the ultimate truth has the characteristic of being everywhere of one taste.

original: brda phrad par zad do //
analyzed: brda phrad par zad do //
translated: This is the second, the conclusion.

original: rab 'byor ji ltar phung po de dag phan tshun tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa dang / ji ltar skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang / zas dang / bden pa dang khams dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang /
analyzed: rab 'byor ji ltar phung po de dag phan tshun tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa dang / ji ltar skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang / zas dang / bden pa dang khams dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang /
translated: Subhuti, just as those aggregates have the characteristic of being mutually different, and just as the sense spheres, dependent origination, the sustenances, the truths, the elements, the establishments of mindfulness,

original: yang dag pa'i spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / lam gyi yan lag de dag phan tshun tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa de bzhin du zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gsum pa skyon rnam pa gsum dang bral bas ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid rnam par bshad pa ston to //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / lam gyi yan lag de dag phan tshun tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa de bzhin du zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gsum pa skyon rnam pa gsum dang bral bas ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid rnam par bshad pa ston to //
translated: From here onward, the third characteristic of one taste that is free from the three faults is explained.

original: 'di ltar de bzhin nyid la sogs pa rgyu la sogs pa'i skyon rnam pa gsum dang bral ba'i phyir ro gcig pa nyid du 'grub pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar de bzhin nyid la sogs pa rgyu la sogs pa'i skyon rnam pa gsum dang bral ba'i phyir ro gcig pa nyid du 'grub pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is established as one taste because suchness and so on are free from the three faults of cause and so on.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis kyis bstan te /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis kyis bstan te /
translated: This is also explained in two ways:

original: rnam par bshad pa dang / 'jug bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par bshad pa dang / 'jug bsdu ba'o //
translated: the explanation and the summary of engagement.

original: rnam par bshad pa yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
analyzed: rnam par bshad pa yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
translated: The explanation is divided into two:

original: phung po la sogs pa phan tshun tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa dang / de bzhin nyid tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid med par rnam par 'byed pa ste /
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa phan tshun tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa dang / de bzhin nyid tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid med par rnam par 'byed pa ste /
translated: The aggregates, etc., are taught to have the characteristic of mutual difference, and suchness is taught to have the characteristic of non-difference.

original: 'di ni dang po'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po'o //
translated: This is the first.

original: mdo'i tshig @207b 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su phye nas bstan te /
analyzed: mdo'i tshig @207b 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su phye nas bstan te /
translated: This statement of the sutra is taught by dividing it into two parts:

original: phung po rnams phan tshun tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa dang / zlas skye mched la sogs pa phan tshun tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid bstan to //
analyzed: phung po rnams phan tshun tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa dang / zlas skye mched la sogs pa phan tshun tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid bstan to //
translated: the aggregates are taught to have the characteristic of mutual difference, and the sense spheres, etc., are taught to have the characteristic of mutual difference.

original: 'di ltar phung po la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i phyir skyon rnam pa gsum yod par gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar phung po la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i phyir skyon rnam pa gsum yod par gyur pa yin te /
translated: Thus, because the aggregates, etc., have the characteristic of mutual difference, there are three faults:

original: rgyu dang bcas pa las 'byung ba'i phyir dang / 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid rnam par 'gyur ba can du 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / don dam pa ma yin pa zhig yang btsal ba dang / mthar phyin pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang bcas pa las 'byung ba'i phyir dang / 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid rnam par 'gyur ba can du 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / don dam pa ma yin pa zhig yang btsal ba dang / mthar phyin pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they arise from causes, they would have the characteristic of being conditioned and subject to change; because they are not ultimate, they would have to be sought again; and because they are not final, they would not be final reality.

original: gal te chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid dang / don dam pa dang / chos bdag med pa nyid kyang /
analyzed: gal te chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid dang / don dam pa dang / chos bdag med pa nyid kyang /
translated: If the suchness of all phenomena,üîΩthe ultimate, and the selflessness of phenomenaüîΩ

original: tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid yin par gyur na ni /
analyzed: tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid yin par gyur na ni /
translated: If the suchness of all phenomena, the ultimate, and the selflessness of phenomena were to have the characteristics of being different,

original: des na de bzhin nyid dang / don dam pa dang / chos bdag med pa nyid kyang rgyu dang bcas pa yin zhing rgyu las byung ba yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na de bzhin nyid dang / don dam pa dang / chos bdag med pa nyid kyang rgyu dang bcas pa yin zhing rgyu las byung ba yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: then suchness, the ultimate, and the selflessness of phenomena would also have causes and would arise from causes.

original: gal te rgyu las byung ba nyid yin na ni 'dus byas yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te rgyu las byung ba nyid yin na ni 'dus byas yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If they were to arise from causes, they would be conditioned.

original: 'dus byas nyid yin na ni don dam pa ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dus byas nyid yin na ni don dam pa ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If they were conditioned, they would not be the ultimate.üîΩIf they were the ultimate, then another ultimate truth would have to be sought.

original: don dam pa yin na ni don dam pa'i bden pa gzhan zhig yongs su btsal dgos par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba man chad ni gnyis pa de bzhin nyid la tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid med par rnam par 'byed pa'o //
analyzed: don dam pa yin na ni don dam pa'i bden pa gzhan zhig yongs su btsal dgos par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba man chad ni gnyis pa de bzhin nyid la tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid med par rnam par 'byed pa'o //
translated: The second is the analysis of the absence of the characteristic of difference in suchness.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: This also has two parts:

original: don dam pa la skyon rnam pa gsum yod par bstan pa dang / rab 'byor zhes bya ba man chad kyis mthun pa'i rnam par bshad pas don dam pa skyon rnam pa gsum dang bral bar bstan pa ste /
analyzed: don dam pa la skyon rnam pa gsum yod par bstan pa dang / rab 'byor zhes bya ba man chad kyis mthun pa'i rnam par bshad pas don dam pa skyon rnam pa gsum dang bral bar bstan pa ste /
translated: The explanation of the ultimate as free from the three faults

original: 'di ni dang po'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po'o //
translated: The explanation of the ultimate as free from the three faults by means of a concordant explanation beginning with ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti‚Äù is the first.

original: mdo'i tshig 'di yang gnyis su dbye ste /
analyzed: mdo'i tshig 'di yang gnyis su dbye ste /
translated: This passage of the sutra is also divided into two parts:

original: tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid smos pa dang / skyon rnam pa gsum bstan pa'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid smos pa dang / skyon rnam pa gsum bstan pa'o //
translated: The mention of the characteristics of the different and the teaching of the three faults.

original: skyon rnam pa gsum ni gang du bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: skyon rnam pa gsum ni gang du bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: The three faults are as they are taught.

original: yang na skyon rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: yang na skyon rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: Or there are five faults:

original: rgyu dang bcas pa dang / rgyu las byung ba dang / 'dus byas su gyur pa dang / don dam pa ma yin pa dang / don dam pa gzhan yongs su tshol ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang bcas pa dang / rgyu las byung ba dang / 'dus byas su gyur pa dang / don dam pa ma yin pa dang / don dam pa gzhan yongs su tshol ba'o //
translated: Having a cause, arising from a cause, being conditioned, not being the ultimate, and seeking another ultimate.

original: mdo'i tshig 'di dang sbyar na /
analyzed: mdo'i tshig 'di dang sbyar na /
translated: When applied to the passage of the sutra,

original: me long lta bu'i ye shes la sogs pa ni rgyu las byung ba'i phyir 'dus byas kyis bsdus pas don dam pa'i bden pa ma yin par ston te /
analyzed: me long lta bu'i ye shes la sogs pa ni rgyu las byung ba'i phyir 'dus byas kyis bsdus pas don dam pa'i bden pa ma yin par ston te /
translated: mirror-like wisdom and so on are not the ultimate truth because they are included within the conditioned due to arising from causes.

original: de'i phyir slob dpon nye ba'i 'od la sogs @208a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir slob dpon nye ba'i 'od la sogs @208a * //
translated: Therefore, in the commentaries of Master Upasena and so on, it is said:

original: pa'i 'grel pa las longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ni mi rtag pa yin te /
analyzed: pa'i 'grel pa las longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ni mi rtag pa yin te /
translated: The Enjoyment body is impermanent,

original: ji tsam du skye ba dang bcas pa dag ni nges par 'jig par 'gyur ro zhes mgo gcig tu bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: ji tsam du skye ba dang bcas pa dag ni nges par 'jig par 'gyur ro zhes mgo gcig tu bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: because it is taught unilaterally that whatever is born is definitely destroyed.

original: kha cig ni rtag pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kha cig ni rtag pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say: It is permanent.

original: don gzhan ni 'og nas rgya cher rnam par 'byed do //
analyzed: don gzhan ni 'og nas rgya cher rnam par 'byed do //
translated: Other topics will be extensively distinguished below.

original: rab 'byor gang gi phyir de bzhin nyid dang / don dam pa dang chos bdag med pa nyid rgyu dang bcas pa zhes mi bya bas /
analyzed: rab 'byor gang gi phyir de bzhin nyid dang / don dam pa dang chos bdag med pa nyid rgyu dang bcas pa zhes mi bya bas /
translated: Subh≈´ti, because suchness, the ultimate, and the selflessness of phenomena are not said to be causes,üîΩthey do not arise from causes, they are not conditioned, and therefore they are the ultimate.

original: rgyu las byung ba ma yin pa dang / 'dus byas kyang ma yin pas don dam pa yin pa dang / don dam pa 'di thob nas /
analyzed: rgyu las byung ba ma yin pa dang / 'dus byas kyang ma yin pas don dam pa yin pa dang / don dam pa 'di thob nas /
translated: Having attained this ultimate,

original: don dam pa'i bden pa gzhan yongs su btsal mi dgos kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyis pa rjes su mthun pa'i rnam par bshad pas don dam pa skyon rnam pa gsum dang bral bar bstan pa'o //
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa gzhan yongs su btsal mi dgos kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyis pa rjes su mthun pa'i rnam par bshad pas don dam pa skyon rnam pa gsum dang bral bar bstan pa'o //
translated: The passage beginning with ‚ÄúThe ultimate truth is not something to be sought elsewhere‚Äù explains the second, the explanation in accordance with the ultimate truth being free from the three faults.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: This also has two parts:

original: don dam pa skyon rnam pa gsum dang bral bar yang dag par bshad pa dang / rtag pa rtag pa'i 'du shes bya ba man chad kyis yang rigs pas bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: don dam pa skyon rnam pa gsum dang bral bar yang dag par bshad pa dang / rtag pa rtag pa'i 'du shes bya ba man chad kyis yang rigs pas bsgrub pa'o //
translated: the correct explanation of the ultimate truth being free from the three faults and the establishment of that by reasoning from ‚Äúpermanence, the notion of permanence‚Äù onward.

original: 'di ni dang po ste /
analyzed: 'di ni dang po ste /
translated: This is the first.

original: 'di ltar tha dad par 'gyur ba la skyon rnam pa gsum yod pa'i phyir don dam pa ni ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid skyon rnam pa gsum dang bral ba yin par shes par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'di ltar tha dad par 'gyur ba la skyon rnam pa gsum yod pa'i phyir don dam pa ni ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid skyon rnam pa gsum dang bral ba yin par shes par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Thus, since there are three faults in being different, the ultimate truth should be understood to be characterized by being of one taste, free from the three faults. This is the meaning.

original: rtag pa rtag pa'i dus dang / ther zug ther zug gi dus su de bzhin gshegs pa 'jig rten du byung yang rung 'jig rten du ma byung yang rung /
analyzed: rtag pa rtag pa'i dus dang / ther zug ther zug gi dus su de bzhin gshegs pa 'jig rten du byung yang rung 'jig rten du ma byung yang rung /
translated: Whether or not the TathƒÅgata appears in the world,üîΩthe reality of phenomena and the realm of phenomena are always present.

original: chos rnams kyi chos nyid dang / chos kyi dbyings rnam par gzhag pa rnam par gnas pa ni yod pa kho na'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa yang rigs pas bsgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi chos nyid dang / chos kyi dbyings rnam par gzhag pa rnam par gnas pa ni yod pa kho na'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa yang rigs pas bsgrub pa yin te /
translated: This is the second logical proof.

original: 'di yang don dam pa ro gcig pa'i de bzhin nyid de rtag pa dang / ther zug gi dus su /üîΩde bzhin gshegs pa 'jig rten du byung yang rung /
analyzed: 'di yang don dam pa ro gcig pa'i de bzhin nyid de rtag pa dang / ther zug gi dus su / de bzhin gshegs pa 'jig rten du byung yang rung /
translated: This also refers to ultimate reality, which is the suchness that is of one taste, and is always present and eternal.üîΩWhether or not the TathƒÅgata appears in the world,

original: 'jig rten du ma byung yang rung /
analyzed: 'jig rten du ma byung yang rung /
translated: whether or not the TathƒÅgata appears in the world,

original: chos thams cad kyi chos nyid ni chos kyi dbyings la rnam par gnas shing /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi chos nyid ni chos kyi dbyings la rnam par gnas shing /
translated: the reality of all phenomena is present in the realm of phenomena.

original: yang rnam par 'gyur ba dang / mtshan ma sna tshogs med par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: yang rnam par 'gyur ba dang / mtshan ma sna tshogs med par gyur pa'o //
translated: It is not subject to change and does not have various signs.

original: tshig nges par 'grel pa'i mdo las ni ther zug dang / rtag pa zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: tshig nges par 'grel pa'i mdo las ni ther zug dang / rtag pa zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The S≈´tra Unravelling the Intended Meaning says:üîΩ‚ÄúThe ultimate is the object of the knowledge of the noble beings in meditative equipoise.

original: chos kyi dbyings dang / chos gnas pa nyid ces bya ba'i bar du 'byung ste /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings dang / chos gnas pa nyid ces bya ba'i bar du 'byung ste /
translated: up to the expanse of reality and the true nature of reality.

original: slob dpon yang dag @208b bden pa'i 'grel pa las /
analyzed: slob dpon yang dag @208b bden pa'i 'grel pa las /
translated: In his commentary on the Sublime Truth,üîΩthe master Haribhadra says:

original: lam gyi mdun rol gyi gnas skabs na yang /
analyzed: lam gyi mdun rol gyi gnas skabs na yang /
translated: Even in the phase prior to the path,

original: snga nas rang bzhin gyis yod pa'i phyir ther zug ces bya ste sangs rgyas 'jig rten du byung nas gdod yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snga nas rang bzhin gyis yod pa'i phyir ther zug ces bya ste sangs rgyas 'jig rten du byung nas gdod yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
