translated: it is said to be ‚Äúeternal‚Äù because it exists from the beginning, not because it exists only after a buddha appears in the world.

original: lam gyi bar dang / tha ma'i gnas skabs na yang don gyi tshul 'di 'gag pa med pa'i phyir rtag pa zhes brjod de /
analyzed: lam gyi bar dang / tha ma'i gnas skabs na yang don gyi tshul 'di 'gag pa med pa'i phyir rtag pa zhes brjod de /
translated: And even in the phase of the path and in the final phase, it is said to be ‚Äúpermanent‚Äù because the way things are does not cease.

original: sangs rgyas 'jig rten du byung ba'i 'og tu yang don gyi tshul la zad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'jig rten du byung ba'i 'og tu yang don gyi tshul la zad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And even after a buddha appears in the world, the way things are does not come to an end.

original: chos nyid ces bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis sangs rgyas kyi ngo bo nyid la gnas pa ste /
analyzed: chos nyid ces bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis sangs rgyas kyi ngo bo nyid la gnas pa ste /
translated: ‚Äú Reality‚Äù means that which naturally exists as the essence of buddhahood.

original: lam gyi mdun rol gyi gnas skabs na byang chub kyi sems kyi gzhi byed pas /
analyzed: lam gyi mdun rol gyi gnas skabs na byang chub kyi sems kyi gzhi byed pas /
translated: In the phase prior to the path, it serves as the basis for the spirit of enlightenment.

original: sems can rnams 'di'i dbang gis sems bskyed pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can rnams 'di'i dbang gis sems bskyed pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because sentient beings, by its power, obtain the generation of the mind.

original: chos kyi dbyings zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi ngo bo nyid 'dren cing 'byung bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi ngo bo nyid 'dren cing 'byung bar byed pa ste /
translated: The basic element is the nature of the Buddha, which is the cause and source of the path.

original: lam gyi gnas skabs bar ma rnams su dbyings ni spyod pa rnams kyi gzhi byed de /
analyzed: lam gyi gnas skabs bar ma rnams su dbyings ni spyod pa rnams kyi gzhi byed de /
translated: In the intermediate state of the path, the basic element is the basis of the practices,

original: spyod pa tshad med pa rnams 'dren cing 'byung bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyod pa tshad med pa rnams 'dren cing 'byung bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the cause and source of the immeasurable practices.

original: chos gnas pa nyid ces bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi sa'i gnas skabs su phyin pa thob pa ste /
analyzed: chos gnas pa nyid ces bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi sa'i gnas skabs su phyin pa thob pa ste /
translated: The nature of phenomena is the attainment of the state of the Buddha ground.

original: lam gyi tha ma'i gnas skabs mya ngan las 'das par phyin nas chos kyi ngo bo nyid rtag par gnas pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: lam gyi tha ma'i gnas skabs mya ngan las 'das par phyin nas chos kyi ngo bo nyid rtag par gnas pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Because the nature of phenomena is always present at the end of the path, in the state of nirvana.

original: mdo 'di las rtag pa rtag pa'i dus dang / ther zug gi dus su zhes gsungs pa ni ro gcig pa'i de bzhin nyid gzod ma nas sngar yang gcig pa nyid ma yin pas /
analyzed: mdo 'di las rtag pa rtag pa'i dus dang / ther zug gi dus su zhes gsungs pa ni ro gcig pa'i de bzhin nyid gzod ma nas sngar yang gcig pa nyid ma yin pas /
translated: In this sutra, the phrase ‚Äúin the eternal, eternal time‚Äù and ‚Äúin the everlasting time‚Äù are not the same as the primordial oneness.

original: rtag pa rtag pa'i dus zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rtag pa rtag pa'i dus zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the time of the eternal eternity.

original: phyis kyang gcig pa nyid ma yin pas /
analyzed: phyis kyang gcig pa nyid ma yin pas /
translated: Since it is not the same later,

original: ther zug ther zug gi dus zhes bya ste /
analyzed: ther zug ther zug gi dus zhes bya ste /
translated: it is called the time of the immutable immutability.

original: dus 'di lta bu rnams su chos rnams kyi chos nyid chos kyi dbyings la rnam par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: dus 'di lta bu rnams su chos rnams kyi chos nyid chos kyi dbyings la rnam par gnas pa'o //
translated: In such times, the reality of phenomena abides in the dharmadhƒÅtu.

original: chos kyi chos nyid chos kyi dbyings la rnam par gnas pa 'di yang don rnam pa gnyis yod de //
analyzed: chos kyi chos nyid chos kyi dbyings la rnam par gnas pa 'di yang don rnam pa gnyis yod de //
translated: This abiding of the reality of phenomena in the dharmadhƒÅtu has two topics:

original: dpe gzhan gnyis dang sbyar na rnam pa gsum du dbye ste /
analyzed: dpe gzhan gnyis dang sbyar na rnam pa gsum du dbye ste /
translated: When it is applied to the other two examples, it is divided into three:

original: chos rnams kyi chos nyid dang / chos kyi dbyings rnam par gzhag pa dang / gnas pa nyid rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi chos nyid dang / chos kyi dbyings rnam par gzhag pa dang / gnas pa nyid rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: the presentation of the reality of phenomena, the presentation of the dharmadhƒÅtu, and the presentation of abiding.

original: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis byas pa'i theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa las ni gnyis su phye nas bstan te /üîΩchos rnams kyi chos nyid @209a * //
analyzed: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis byas pa'i theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa las ni gnyis su phye nas bstan te / chos rnams kyi chos nyid @209a * //
translated: In the Commentary on the Compendium of the MahƒÅyƒÅna composed by Master Ni·∏•svabhƒÅva, it is taught by dividing it into two:üîΩthe presentation of the reality of phenomena

original: rnam par gzhag pa dang / chos kyi dbyings rnam par gzhag pa zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rnam par gzhag pa dang / chos kyi dbyings rnam par gzhag pa zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: and the presentation of the dharmadhƒÅtu.

original: de la rnam pa lngar gzhag pa zhes bya ba ni ming gi rnam grangs rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: de la rnam pa lngar gzhag pa zhes bya ba ni ming gi rnam grangs rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: The fivefold presentation is a presentation of synonyms.üîΩThe YogƒÅcƒÅra Levels presents it as threefold:

original: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las ni rnam pa gsum du phye nas bstan te /üîΩ'di lta ste /üîΩchos nyid dang / chos kyi dbyings dang / chos gnas pa'o //
analyzed: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las ni rnam pa gsum du phye nas bstan te / 'di lta ste / chos nyid dang / chos kyi dbyings dang / chos gnas pa'o //
translated: the reality of phenomena,üîΩthe expanse of phenomena, andüîΩthe stability of phenomena.

original: de la rnam par gnas pa zhes bya ba ni chos gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: de la rnam par gnas pa zhes bya ba ni chos gnas pa yin te /
translated: Stability is the stability of phenomena.

original: de'i phyir rnam 'byor spyod pa'i sa las rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba de dag thog ma med pa'i dus nas grags pa'i rigs pa gang yin pa de ni chos nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam 'byor spyod pa'i sa las rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba de dag thog ma med pa'i dus nas grags pa'i rigs pa gang yin pa de ni chos nyid do //
translated: Therefore, the YogƒÅcƒÅra Levels says, ‚ÄúThe reality of those dependent originations is the reasoning that has been renowned since beginningless time.

original: ji ltar grags pa de phyin ci ma log pa'i rigs pa'i tshig dang yi ge rnams kyi rnam par gzhag pa de ni chos gnas pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar grags pa de phyin ci ma log pa'i rigs pa'i tshig dang yi ge rnams kyi rnam par gzhag pa de ni chos gnas pa'o //
translated: The presentation of the words and letters that are the unerring reasoning of that renowned reality is the stability of phenomena.

original: chos gnas ba de'i rgyu chos nyid de yin pas na //
analyzed: chos gnas ba de'i rgyu chos nyid de yin pas na //
translated: Because that reality is the cause of the stability of phenomena,

original: de'i phyir de la dbyings zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir de la dbyings zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
translated: it is called the expanse.

original: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las ni rten cang 'brel bar 'byung ba de smos pas /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las ni rten cang 'brel bar 'byung ba de smos pas /
translated: In the YogƒÅcƒÅrabh≈´mi ≈öƒÅstra, the three phrases are taught in the section on dependent origination.

original: don gyi ngo bo nyid dag bstan to //
analyzed: don gyi ngo bo nyid dag bstan to //
translated: Thus, the three phrases teach the three realities.

original: yang na bstan bcos de las rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba de dag la tshig 'di gsum yod par bstan pa yin gyi /
analyzed: yang na bstan bcos de las rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba de dag la tshig 'di gsum yod par bstan pa yin gyi /
translated: Or, in that treatise, the three phrases are taught as existing in dependent origination,

original: don gyi ngo bo nyid bstan pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: don gyi ngo bo nyid bstan pa ni ma yin te /
translated: but they do not teach the three realities.

original: 'on kyang tshig gsum bshad pa'i don la bye brag tu gyur pa ni med do //
analyzed: 'on kyang tshig gsum bshad pa'i don la bye brag tu gyur pa ni med do //
translated: However, there is no difference in the meaning of the three phrases.

original: de'i phyir rab 'byor rigs pa des kyang /
analyzed: de'i phyir rab 'byor rigs pa des kyang /
translated: Therefore, Subh≈´ti, by this reasoningüîΩyou should know that ultimate truth is characterized by a single taste everywhere.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa ni thams cad du ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid yin par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa mjug bsdu ba ste //üîΩbrda phrad par zad do //
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa ni thams cad du ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid yin par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa mjug bsdu ba ste // brda phrad par zad do //
translated: This is the second summary.üîΩSubh≈´ti, for example, space is signless,

original: rab 'byor dper na rnam pa sna tshogs rnam pa gcig ma yin pa tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gzugs la nam mkha' ni mtshan ma med pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor dper na rnam pa sna tshogs rnam pa gcig ma yin pa tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gzugs la nam mkha' ni mtshan ma med pa /
translated: without conceptualization, and not a conceptualization.

original: rnam par rtog pa med pa 'gyur ba med pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med pa 'gyur ba med pa ste /
translated: It is non-conceptual and immutable.üîΩIt is the characteristic of being of one taste everywhere.

original: thams cad du ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa dpes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad du ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa dpes bstan pa'o //
translated: The rest of the passage up to ‚ÄúThe example is the sky‚Äù is the second part, the explanation by means of an example.

original: rnam pa sna tshogs rnam pa gcig pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi phung po zhes bya ba yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs rnam pa gcig pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi phung po zhes bya ba yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThe various aspects are not one‚Äù means that the aggregate of form has three aspects.

original: dang po ni 'byung ba chen po dang / rgyur byas pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: dang po ni 'byung ba chen po dang / rgyur byas pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The first is the characteristic of the great elements and the derivative form.

original: @209b gnyis pa ni bstan bcos yod pa la thogs pa dang bcas pa dang / bstan du med pa la thogs pa dang bcas pa dang / bstan du yang med la thogs pa dang bcas pa lta ba gsum bye brag tu gyur pa'i mtshan nyid dang /
analyzed: @209b gnyis pa ni bstan bcos yod pa la thogs pa dang bcas pa dang / bstan du med pa la thogs pa dang bcas pa dang / bstan du yang med la thogs pa dang bcas pa lta ba gsum bye brag tu gyur pa'i mtshan nyid dang /
translated: The second is the characteristic of the three views that are distinguished as having resistance in the treatises, as being invisible and having resistance, and as being invisible and without resistance.

original: gsum pa ni rnam par 'gyur zhang 'jig pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gsum pa ni rnam par 'gyur zhang 'jig pa 'di lta ste /
translated: The third is the characteristic of the transformation and destruction of form.

original: snga ma'i rnam pa gnyis po de dag rnam par 'gyur zhing 'jig pa dang bcas pas rnam par 'gyur zhing 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ste /
analyzed: snga ma'i rnam pa gnyis po de dag rnam par 'gyur zhing 'jig pa dang bcas pas rnam par 'gyur zhing 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ste /
translated: Since the two former aspects are subject to transformation and destruction, they are said to have the characteristic of transformation and destruction.

original: rnam pa 'di gsum dang ldan pa'i phyir rnam pa sna tshogs rnam pa gcig ma yin pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rnam pa 'di gsum dang ldan pa'i phyir rnam pa sna tshogs rnam pa gcig ma yin pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: Because it possesses these three aspects, it is said to be manifold, not unitary.

original: yang na tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid ces kyang bya'o //
analyzed: yang na tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid ces kyang bya'o //
translated: Or else, it is said to have the characteristic of differentiation.

original: nam mkha' la rgyur byas pa'i mtshan ma gzhan med pa'i phyir mtshan ma med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' la rgyur byas pa'i mtshan ma gzhan med pa'i phyir mtshan ma med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is said to be signless because there is no other sign that is based on space.

original: bstan du yod la thogs pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyi bye brag med pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa med pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bstan du yod la thogs pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyi bye brag med pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa med pa zhes bya ste /
translated: It is said to be non-conceptual because there is no differentiation of the various kinds of form, etc., that are demonstrable and have resistance.

original: rnam par rtog pa ni bye brag gi ming gi rnam grangs so //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ni bye brag gi ming gi rnam grangs so //
translated: Conceptualization is a synonym for differentiation.

original: tshig nges par 'grel pa'i mdo las ni bye brag med pa'i phyir rnam par 'gyur zhing 'jig pa yang med pas 'gyur ba med pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: tshig nges par 'grel pa'i mdo las ni bye brag med pa'i phyir rnam par 'gyur zhing 'jig pa yang med pas 'gyur ba med pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Because there is no distinction, and because there is no change or destruction, it is called ‚Äúunchanging.‚Äù

original: mtshan nyid 'di gsum dang ldan pas ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: mtshan nyid 'di gsum dang ldan pas ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Because it has these three characteristics, it is called ‚Äúthe characteristic of one taste.‚ÄùüîΩSimilarly, you should understand that all phenomena, which have different natures and different characteristics, are the ultimate truth, which is one taste.

original: de bzhin du ngo bo nyid tha dad pa dang / mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i chos thams cad la don dam pa'i bden pa thams cad du ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gsum pa dpe dang don du sbyar ba'o //

analyzed: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las ni rang gi mtshan nyid dang / bye brag tu gyur pa zhes 'byung ste /

original: thams cad la kun na yod kyang /

translated: Then the bodhisattva-mahƒÅsattva Vi≈õƒÅlamati said to the Blessed One:üîΩBlessed One, how many kinds of characteristics of mind, thought, and consciousness are there?

original: bcom ldan 'das bcom ldan 'das kyis ji skad du sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa'i gsang ba la mkhas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes gsungs pa zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni yongs su brtag par bya ba'i yul las don dam pa dang /

translated: The Blessed One has said, The bodhisattva who is skilled in the secrets of mind, thought, and consciousness.

original: kun rdzob kyi bden pa rnam pa gnyis so zhes bstan pa las /üîΩde yan chad du don dam pa'i bden pa bshad zin nas /
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi bden pa rnam pa gnyis so zhes bstan pa las / de yan chad du don dam pa'i bden pa bshad zin nas /

original: da 'di man chad ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa ston par mdzad do //
analyzed: da 'di man chad ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa ston par mdzad do //

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis kyis bstan te /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis kyis bstan te /

original: tshig rkyang pas rgyal cher rnam par bshad pa dang / tshigs su bcad pas mdor bstan pa'o //üîΩrgyal cher rnam par bshad pa yang /
analyzed: tshig rkyang pas rgyal cher rnam par bshad pa dang / tshigs su bcad pas mdor bstan pa'o // rgyal cher rnam par bshad pa yang /

original: rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
translated: The extensive explanation is also divided into two parts:

original: zhu ba gsol ba dang / zhus pa bzhin du lan yang dag par gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: zhu ba gsol ba dang / zhus pa bzhin du lan yang dag par gsungs pa'o //

original: chos bshad pa'i gang zag gi nang na byang chub sems dpa' gzhan dag blo gros yangs pa'i yon tan 'di lta bu dang mi ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' 'di blo gros yangs pa'i chos kyi sgo mo las ming du rnam par gzhag pa yin no zhes 'byung
analyzed: chos bshad pa'i gang zag gi nang na byang chub sems dpa' gzhan dag blo gros yangs pa'i yon tan 'di lta bu dang mi ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' 'di blo gros yangs pa'i chos kyi sgo mo las ming du rnam par gzhag pa yin no zhes 'byung

analyzed: med pas blo gros yangs pa zhes bya'o zhes bshad do //
translated: Because there is nothing that the renunciate and the householder do not know about the various topics related to the scriptures, it is called ‚Äúvast intellect.‚Äù

original: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las /

analyzed: shes rab de nyid tshad med pa dang / mtha' yas pa'i spyod yul yin pa'i phyir /

translated: it is called ‚Äúvast wisdom.‚Äù

analyzed: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis sems dang / yid dang rnam par shes pa'i gsang ba'i don yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du khong du chud pa ni mkhas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes gsungs pas so //
translated: Thus, the Blessed One has said that the bodhisattva who has understood the secret of mind, thought, and consciousness just as it is is a wise bodhisattva.

original: sems dang yid dang / rnam par shes pa'i gsang ba la mkhas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes bgyi na /üîΩji tsam gyis na sems dang / yid dang / rnam par shes pa'i gsang ba la mkhas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes bgyi lags de bzhin gshegs pas ji tsam gyis na /
analyzed: sems dang yid dang / rnam par shes pa'i gsang ba la mkhas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes bgyi na / ji tsam gyis na sems dang / yid dang / rnam par shes pa'i gsang ba la mkhas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes bgyi lags de bzhin gshegs pas ji tsam gyis na /
translated: If the bodhisattva is called wise in the secret of mind, thought, and consciousness,üîΩto what extent is the bodhisattva wise in the secret of mind, thought, and consciousness?üîΩTo what extent does the TathƒÅgata designate him as a bodhisattva who is wise in the secret of mind, thought, and consciousness?

analyzed: de dag sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa'i gsang ba la mkhas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes 'dogs lags /

analyzed: de skad ces gsol ba dang zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa bstan pa las brtsams nas zhu ba gsol ba'o //

original: mdo'i tshig 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
analyzed: mdo'i tshig 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
translated: This statement of the s≈´tra is also divided into two parts.

analyzed: gang zhu ba nyid smos pa dang / ji tsam gyis na zhes bya ba man chad kyis gang zhu ba nyid kyi tshig smos pa'o //
translated: The question itself is stated in the passage beginning with ‚Äúwhat is the question?‚Äù and ending with ‚Äúhow much?‚Äù

original: zhu ba 'di gsol ba yang dgongs pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
analyzed: zhu ba 'di gsol ba yang dgongs pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
translated: This question is asked with two intentions:

original: de la dang po ci tsam gyis na sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa'i gsang ba la mkhas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes bgyi lags zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i gnas skabs zhus pa ste /
analyzed: de la dang po ci tsam gyis na sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa'i gsang ba la mkhas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes bgyi lags zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i gnas skabs zhus pa ste /
translated: The first is the question concerning the bodhisattva stage, which is stated in the passage beginning with ‚Äúwhat is the question?‚Äù and ending with ‚Äúhow much?‚Äù

original: de ni bstan pa las gsungs pa'i don to //üîΩgnyis pa de bzhin gshegs pas ji tsam gyis na de dag sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa'i gsang ba la mkhas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes 'dogs lags zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ni bstan pa las gsungs pa'i don to // gnyis pa de bzhin gshegs pas ji tsam gyis na de dag sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa'i gsang ba la mkhas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes 'dogs lags zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is the meaning stated in the teaching.üîΩThe second is the question concerning the TathƒÅgata‚Äôs designation of the bodhisattva as skilled in the secrets of mind, thought, and consciousness, which is stated in the passage beginning with ‚Äúhow much?‚Äù and ending with ‚Äúthe bodhisattva is skilled in the secrets of mind, thought, and consciousness.‚Äù

original: de bzhin gshegs pas byang chub sems dpa' ji lta bu dag las brtsams nas bstan pa nye bar 'dogs par mdzad ces bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas byang chub sems dpa' ji lta bu dag las brtsams nas bstan pa nye bar 'dogs par mdzad ces bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: This means, ‚Äúconcerning which bodhisattvas does the TathƒÅgata teach and designate?‚Äù

original: de la nye bar 'dogs pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la nye bar 'dogs pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The term to designate means

analyzed: rnam par bshad pa zhes bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: de nas bcom @212b ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' chen po blo gros yangs pa la 'di skad ces bka' stsal pa'o //
translated: Then the Lord said to the great bodhisattva Maitreya:üîΩExcellent, excellent!

original: legs so legs so zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa zhus pa bzhin du lan yang dag par gsungs pa zhes bya ba ston to //
analyzed: legs so legs so zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa zhus pa bzhin du lan yang dag par gsungs pa zhes bya ba ston to //
translated: The rest of the text, up to the correct answer to the second question, shows the correct answer.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis kyis bstan te /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis kyis bstan te /
translated: This is also shown in two ways.

original: zhu ba gsol ba la bsngags shing bshad par snang ba dang / blo gros yangs pa 'di ltar shes par bya ste zhes bya ba man chad kyis zhus pa bzhin du lan yang dag par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: zhu ba gsol ba la bsngags shing bshad par snang ba dang / blo gros yangs pa 'di ltar shes par bya ste zhes bya ba man chad kyis zhus pa bzhin du lan yang dag par bstan pa'o //
translated: The praise of the request and the permission to explain, which appear in the passage beginning Maitreya, it is excellent that you have thought to ask about this, and the correct answer to the question, which appears in the passage beginning Maitreya, you should understand it in the following way.

original: dang po yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: dang po yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The first is also divided into two:

analyzed: zhu ba gsol ba la bsngags pa dang / bshad par bkas gnang ba'o //
translated: the praise of the request and the permission to explain.

original: zhu ba gsol ba la bsngags pa yang gnyis su dbye ste /
analyzed: zhu ba gsol ba la bsngags pa yang gnyis su dbye ste /
translated: The praise of the request is also divided into two:

original: spyi dang bye brag go //
analyzed: spyi dang bye brag go //
translated: the general praise and the specific praise.

original: 'di ni dang po spyi bstan pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni dang po spyi bstan pa ste /
translated: This is the first general praise.

original: gang zhus pa'i don de shin tu zab cing phan pa rgya che bas de'i phyir tshig zlos bur legs so legs so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gang zhus pa'i don de shin tu zab cing phan pa rgya che bas de'i phyir tshig zlos bur legs so legs so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Since the meaning of the question is very profound and of vast benefit, therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúExcellent, excellent!‚Äù

original: 'phags pa sa bcu'i 'grel pa las legs so zhes bya ba ni bshad par bya ba'i chos de dag la dge ba phun sum tshogs pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'phags pa sa bcu'i 'grel pa las legs so zhes bya ba ni bshad par bya ba'i chos de dag la dge ba phun sum tshogs pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: In the commentary to the Ten Stages, it says, ‚ÄúExcellent‚Äù means that the Dharma to be explained is endowed with the perfection of virtue.

original: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las legs so zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa rnams kyi bsngags pa brjod pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
analyzed: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las legs so zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa rnams kyi bsngags pa brjod pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
translated: In the YogƒÅcƒÅrabh≈´mi ≈öƒÅstra, it says, ‚ÄúExcellent‚Äù means that it expresses the praise of the noble ones.

original: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las /
analyzed: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las /
translated: In the commentary to the Perfection of Wisdom,

original: legs so legs so zhes bya ba ni yon tan gyi snyan pa brjod pa'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: legs so legs so zhes bya ba ni yon tan gyi snyan pa brjod pa'o zhes bshad do //
translated: it says, ‚ÄúExcellent, excellent‚Äù means that it expresses the praise of its virtues.

original: gzhan yang de nyid las tshig yid ches su rung bas /
analyzed: gzhan yang de nyid las tshig yid ches su rung bas /
translated: Moreover, in that same text, it says, ‚ÄúSince the words are credible,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la zhu ba gsol bas /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la zhu ba gsol bas /
translated: he requests the TathƒÅgata to explain.

original: 'khor mang po'i the tshom gcod cing phan yon che ba'i phyir legs so zhes gsungs so zhes bshad do //
analyzed: 'khor mang po'i the tshom gcod cing phan yon che ba'i phyir legs so zhes gsungs so zhes bshad do //
translated: It is said that he said Excellent! because it cuts through the doubts of the many assemblies and has great benefit.

original: 'phags pa bla na med pa'i gnas bstan pa'i mdo las kyang nyon mongs pa yod bzhin du ma gos ma chags pa gang yin pa de ni legs pa zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'phags pa bla na med pa'i gnas bstan pa'i mdo las kyang nyon mongs pa yod bzhin du ma gos ma chags pa gang yin pa de ni legs pa zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: And in the noble teaching of the unsurpassed stage sutra, it is said, When there is affliction, that which is unstained and unattached is called excellent.

original: blo gros yangs pa khyod kyis 'dir de bzhin gshegs pa la don zab mo 'di lta bu 'dri ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyis bye brag tu bsngags pa bstan to //üîΩ'di yang rnam pa gnyis te don zab mo zhus pa la bsngags pa zhu ba gsol ba la phan yon yod @213a * //
analyzed: blo gros yangs pa khyod kyis 'dir de bzhin gshegs pa la don zab mo 'di lta bu 'dri ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyis bye brag tu bsngags pa bstan to // 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te don zab mo zhus pa la bsngags pa zhu ba gsol ba la phan yon yod @213a * //
translated: By saying O you of vast intellect, here you ask the Tathagata about such a profound meaning, and so on, he praises the two in particular.

original: par bsngags pa ste 'di ni dang po'o //
analyzed: par bsngags pa ste 'di ni dang po'o //
translated: This is also twofold: praising the asking of a profound meaning and praising the request. This is the first.

original: khyod skye bo tshad med pa dag la phan pa dang bde ba dang / 'jig rten la snying brtse ba dang / lha dang mi dang lha ma yin la sogs pa'i don dang / phan pa dang bde ba dang thob par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: khyod skye bo tshad med pa dag la phan pa dang bde ba dang / 'jig rten la snying brtse ba dang / lha dang mi dang lha ma yin la sogs pa'i don dang / phan pa dang bde ba dang thob par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: You think to ask this very question in order to benefit and bring happiness to countless beings, out of compassion for the world, for the benefit, benefit, and happiness of gods, humans, demigods, and so on, and to attain it?

original: 'di nyid 'dri bar sems sam zhes bya bas ni gnyis pa zhu ba gsol ba la phan yon yod par bsngags pa'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid 'dri bar sems sam zhes bya bas ni gnyis pa zhu ba gsol ba la phan yon yod par bsngags pa'o //
translated: This praises the benefits of requesting the second turning.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis kyis bstan te phan yon gyi spyi bstan pa dang / 'jig rten la snying brtse ba zhes bya ba man chad kyis phan yon gyi bye brag bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis kyis bstan te phan yon gyi spyi bstan pa dang / 'jig rten la snying brtse ba zhes bya ba man chad kyis phan yon gyi bye brag bstan pa'o //
translated: This is also shown in two ways: the general benefits are shown, and the specific benefits are shown from out of compassion for the world onwards.

original: de dag la phan pa dang / bde ba zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'grel pa las /
analyzed: de dag la phan pa dang / bde ba zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'grel pa las /
translated: Regarding benefit and happiness, in the commentary on the noble Buddha's Stage, it is said:

original: ji skad du da ltar phan 'dogs pa ni bde ba'o //
analyzed: ji skad du da ltar phan 'dogs pa ni bde ba'o //
translated: What benefits now is happiness.

original: ma 'ongs pa na phan 'dogs pa ni phan pa'o //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa na phan 'dogs pa ni phan pa'o //
translated: What benefits in the future is benefit.

original: 'jig rten pa ni bde ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa ni bde ba zhes bya'o //
translated: What is worldly is called happiness.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa ni phan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa ni phan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The supramundane is called benefit.

original: sdig pa dang bral ba ni bde ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sdig pa dang bral ba ni bde ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The absence of evil is called happiness.

original: dge ba sdud pa ni phan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba sdud pa ni phan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The accumulation of virtue is called benefit.

original: bsod nams ni bde ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bsod nams ni bde ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Merit is called happiness.

original: ye shes ni phan pa zhes bya'o zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ye shes ni phan pa zhes bya'o zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: Wisdom is called benefit.

original: gzhan yang slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis byas pa'i theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa las rnam pa lngar bstan pa yin te de'i phyir 'grel pa de nyid las 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis byas pa'i theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa las rnam pa lngar bstan pa yin te de'i phyir 'grel pa de nyid las 'di lta ste /
translated: Moreover, it is taught in five ways in the commentary on the Compendium of the MahƒÅyƒÅna composed by Master SvƒÅbhƒÅvika. Therefore, it says in that very commentary:

original: chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa dang / ye shes gya nom pa dag gis ni sems can thams cad kyi phan pa dang bde ba rnam par 'jog pa ste /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa dang / ye shes gya nom pa dag gis ni sems can thams cad kyi phan pa dang bde ba rnam par 'jog pa ste /
translated: The benefit and happiness of all sentient beings is established by the pure dharmadhƒÅtu and the excellent wisdom.

original: dge ba'i rgyu bsgrub tu gzhug pa gang yin pa de ni phan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i rgyu bsgrub tu gzhug pa gang yin pa de ni phan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That which causes the accomplishment of the cause of virtue is called benefit.

original: bde ba'i 'bras bu thob par byed pa gang yin pa de ni bde ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bde ba'i 'bras bu thob par byed pa gang yin pa de ni bde ba zhes bya'o //
translated: That which causes the attainment of the result of happiness is called happiness.

original: gzhan yang sdig pa dang bral bar byed pa ni phan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang sdig pa dang bral bar byed pa ni phan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Furthermore, that which causes one to be free from evil is called beneficial.

original: dge ba sdud par byed pa ni bde ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba sdud par byed pa ni bde ba zhes bya'o //
translated: That which causes one to accumulate virtue is called happiness.

original: gzhan yang sdug bsngal las 'dren pa gang yin pa de ni phan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang sdug bsngal las 'dren pa gang yin pa de ni phan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Furthermore, that which leads one out of suffering is called beneficial.

original: dge ba sbyin pa gang yin pa de ni bde ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba sbyin pa gang yin pa de ni bde ba zhes bya'o //
translated: That which gives virtue is called happiness.

original: tshe 'di dang phyi ma dang / 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa la sogs pa yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: tshe 'di dang phyi ma dang / 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa la sogs pa yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: This should be understood in the same way for this life and the next, and for the mundane and supramundane.

original: 'jig rten la snying brtse ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni phan yon rnam pa gnyis yod par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten la snying brtse ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni phan yon rnam pa gnyis yod par bstan pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúout of compassion for the world‚Äù and so on teaches the two kinds of benefits.

original: @213b de la 'jig rten zhes bya ba ni phung po lnga'i 'jig rten de gang gi lus mngon par 'grub par byed pa'i chos so //
analyzed: @213b de la 'jig rten zhes bya ba ni phung po lnga'i 'jig rten de gang gi lus mngon par 'grub par byed pa'i chos so //
translated: Here, the ‚Äúworld‚Äù is the five aggregates of the world, which are the phenomena that constitute one‚Äôs body.

original: lha dang mi zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni phung po las grub pa'i gang zag ste /
analyzed: lha dang mi zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni phung po las grub pa'i gang zag ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúgods and humans‚Äù and so on refers to the person who is constituted by the aggregates.

original: phung po lnga las tha snyad du btags pa'o //
analyzed: phung po lnga las tha snyad du btags pa'o //
translated: It is designated conventionally in dependence on the five aggregates.

original: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las /
analyzed: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las /
translated: The commentary to the Perfection of Wisdom says:

original: 'jig rten ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The world is threefold:

original: snod kyi 'jig rten dang / phung po lnga'i 'jig rten dang / sems can gyi 'jig rten no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: snod kyi 'jig rten dang / phung po lnga'i 'jig rten dang / sems can gyi 'jig rten no zhes bshad do //
translated: the world as container, the world as the five aggregates, and the world as sentient beings.

original: 'dir ni bstan pa'i phan 'dogs pa rnam par 'byed pas de'i phyir phung pho lnga'i sems can 'ba' zhig bstan pa'am yang na phan gdags par bya ba'i sems can rnams ni 'jig rten zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir ni bstan pa'i phan 'dogs pa rnam par 'byed pas de'i phyir phung pho lnga'i sems can 'ba' zhig bstan pa'am yang na phan gdags par bya ba'i sems can rnams ni 'jig rten zhes bya ste /
translated: Here, the five aggregates are taught because they are the recipients of the teaching. Alternatively, sentient beings are called the world because they are the objects of benefit.

original: 'khor gyi nang nas go zhing khong du chud pa'i gtso bor gyur pa gang yin pa de ni lha dang mi la sogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'khor gyi nang nas go zhing khong du chud pa'i gtso bor gyur pa gang yin pa de ni lha dang mi la sogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Those who are foremost in understanding and comprehending the teaching are called gods, humans, and so on.

original: tshigs su bcad pa las /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa las /
translated: In the verse it says:

original: byis pa rnams la ngas ni de ma bstan //
analyzed: byis pa rnams la ngas ni de ma bstan //
translated: I do not teach that to the childish.

original: zhes ma gsungs sam zhe na /
analyzed: zhes ma gsungs sam zhe na /
translated: Did I not say that?

original: ci'i phyir 'jig rten la snying brtse ba dang lha dang mi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'jig rten la snying brtse ba dang lha dang mi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs /
translated: Why did he say ‚Äúfor the sake of the world‚Äù and ‚Äúfor the sake of gods and humans‚Äù?

original: smras pa / bstan pa gsungs pa'i dgongs pa ni don mang ste /
analyzed: smras pa / bstan pa gsungs pa'i dgongs pa ni don mang ste /
translated: He replied: ‚ÄúThe intention of the teaching is for many purposes.

original: 'di ltar gal te sdig pa las bral zhing dge ba la gzud par mdzad na ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te sdig pa las bral zhing dge ba la gzud par mdzad na ni /
translated: If it is to free them from evil and to lead them to virtue,

original: rigs pa yod pa dang / rigs pa med pa yang sdud par mdzad la /
analyzed: rigs pa yod pa dang / rigs pa med pa yang sdud par mdzad la /
translated: then it is reasonable to include both the reasonable and the unreasonable.

original: gal te bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la gzud par mdzad na ni byang chub sems dpa'i rigs can dang // rigs ma nges pa'i ched kho nar gsungs par mdzad pas so //
analyzed: gal te bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la gzud par mdzad na ni byang chub sems dpa'i rigs can dang // rigs ma nges pa'i ched kho nar gsungs par mdzad pas so //
translated: If it is to lead them to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment, then it is taught only for those of the bodhisattva lineage and for those of unfixed lineage.

original: khyod kyis legs par nyon cig dang / ngas khyod la sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa'i gsang ba'i don bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa bshad par bkas gnang ba'o //
analyzed: khyod kyis legs par nyon cig dang / ngas khyod la sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa'i gsang ba'i don bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa bshad par bkas gnang ba'o //
translated: Listen well, and I will explain to you the secret meaning of mind, thought, and consciousness.‚Äù This is the second permission to explain.

original: de la legs par nyon cig ces bya ba ni slob dpon yon tan byin gyis 'grel pa las /
analyzed: de la legs par nyon cig ces bya ba ni slob dpon yon tan byin gyis 'grel pa las /
translated: Listen well is stated in the commentary by Master Gunaprabha:

original: legs par nyon cig ces bya ba ni dmigs pa la sems rtse gcig pa'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: legs par nyon cig ces bya ba ni dmigs pa la sems rtse gcig pa'o zhes bshad do //
translated: Listen well means to one pointedly focus the mind.

original: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las /
translated: The Yogacarya Levels states:

original: legs par nyon cig ces bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: legs par nyon cig ces bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Listen well means that you should listen like this.

original: mtshan nyid kyi chos 'di lta bu nges par nyon cig ces bskul ba'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi chos 'di lta bu nges par nyon cig ces bskul ba'o zhes bshad do //
translated: You should listen to this Dharma that has the characteristics of being definite.

original: blo gros yangs pa 'di ltar shes par @214a * //
analyzed: blo gros yangs pa 'di ltar shes par @214a * //
translated: Bhai·π£ajya-rƒÅja, you should understand it in the following way.

original: bya ste / 'gro ba drug gi 'khor ba 'di na sems can gang dang gang dag sems can gyi rigs de dang de dag tu gtogs pa yang na sgo nga las skyes pa'i skye gnas sam /
analyzed: bya ste / 'gro ba drug gi 'khor ba 'di na sems can gang dang gang dag sems can gyi rigs de dang de dag tu gtogs pa yang na sgo nga las skyes pa'i skye gnas sam /
translated: In this samsara of the six types of beings, whatever sentient beings belong to this and that type of sentient being, whether they are born from eggs,

original: yang na mngal nas skyes pa'am /
analyzed: yang na mngal nas skyes pa'am /
translated: born from wombs,üîΩborn from heat and moisture,

original: yang na drod gsher las skyes pa'am /
analyzed: yang na drod gsher las skyes pa'am /
translated: Or else they are born from heat and moisture.üîΩ

original: yang na rdzus te skye ba'i skye gnas su lus kyi yan lag skye zhing 'byung ba zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa zhu ba gsol ba bzhin du lan yang dag par gsungs pa ston te sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa 'di nyid rnam
analyzed: yang na rdzus te skye ba'i skye gnas su lus kyi yan lag skye zhing 'byung ba zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa zhu ba gsol ba bzhin du lan yang dag par gsungs pa ston te sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa 'di nyid rnam
translated: The remainder of this chapter is the second part, the correct answer to the question, which is taught in the following way.

original: par shes pa brgyad yin pas de'i phyir 'dir sngar rnam par shes pa brgyad kyi bye brag bstan nas /
analyzed: par shes pa brgyad yin pas de'i phyir 'dir sngar rnam par shes pa brgyad kyi bye brag bstan nas /
translated: Since this mind, thought and consciousness is the eight consciousnesses, therefore, after the above explanation of the eight consciousnesses,

original: de'i 'og tu sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa'i bye brag gi mtshan nyid yang dag par bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa'i bye brag gi mtshan nyid yang dag par bshad pa yin no //
translated: the characteristics of the distinctions between mind, thought and consciousness are correctly explained.

original: de yang mdor bsdu na don rnam pa drug gis bstan te /
analyzed: de yang mdor bsdu na don rnam pa drug gis bstan te /
translated: This is taught in brief through six topics.

original: grangs kyi rnam pa mang nyung bstan pa dang / nges tshig rnam par bshad pa dang / ngo bo nyid bstan pa dang / gnas dang dbang po bstan pa dang / dmigs pa'i yul bstan pa dang / sems las byung ba du ma dang mtshungs par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: grangs kyi rnam pa mang nyung bstan pa dang / nges tshig rnam par bshad pa dang / ngo bo nyid bstan pa dang / gnas dang dbang po bstan pa dang / dmigs pa'i yul bstan pa dang / sems las byung ba du ma dang mtshungs par bstan pa'o //
translated: the teaching on the number of aspects, the etymological explanation, the teaching on the nature, the teaching on the faculties and their objects, the teaching on the objective perceptual object, and the teaching on the similarity of the many mental factors.

original: de la grangs kyi rnam pa mang nyung bstan pa ni nyan thos kyi sde snod rnams las rnam par shes pa ni drug kho na zhes 'byung gi / bdun dang brgyad ces ni mi ston te /
analyzed: de la grangs kyi rnam pa mang nyung bstan pa ni nyan thos kyi sde snod rnams las rnam par shes pa ni drug kho na zhes 'byung gi / bdun dang brgyad ces ni mi ston te /
translated: The teaching on the number of aspects: In the ≈õrƒÅvaka scriptures, it is said, ‚ÄúThere are only six consciousnesses,‚Äù but it is not taught that there are seven or eight.

original: zhib tu ni de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no //üîΩ'dir theg pa chen po'i bstan pa dang sbyar na bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de de la dang po ni slob dpon klu sgrub la sogs pas /
analyzed: zhib tu ni de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no // 'dir theg pa chen po'i bstan pa dang sbyar na bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de de la dang po ni slob dpon klu sgrub la sogs pas /
translated: This is taught in detail in that text.

original: rnam par shes pa ni drug kho na'o zhes bshad de /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni drug kho na'o zhes bshad de /
translated: Here, when applied to the teaching of the MahƒÅyƒÅna, there are two explanations. The first is that masters such as NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explain that there are only six consciousnesses.

original: de'i phyir slob dpon bha byas mdzad pa'i bstan bcos dbu ma'i snying po'i nang nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir slob dpon bha byas mdzad pa'i bstan bcos dbu ma'i snying po'i nang nas /
translated: Therefore, in the treatise Essence of the Middle Way composed by the master BhƒÅviveka,

original: de kho na nyid kyi bdud rtsi la 'jug pa'i le'u las /
analyzed: de kho na nyid kyi bdud rtsi la 'jug pa'i le'u las /
translated: The chapter on entering the nectar of suchness explains:

original: rnam par shes pa drug las gung na gzhan kun gzhi rnam par shes pa med de /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa drug las gung na gzhan kun gzhi rnam par shes pa med de /
translated: Apart from the six consciousnesses, there is no other foundation consciousness.

original: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa drug gis ma bsdus pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa drug gis ma bsdus pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is not included in the six consciousnesses such as eye consciousness and so on,

original: nam mkha'i me tog dang mtshungs so zhes bshad pas /
analyzed: nam mkha'i me tog dang mtshungs so zhes bshad pas /
translated: it is similar to a flower in the sky.

original: de'i phyir de dag gi gzhung gis rnam par shes pa drug kho na rnam par bzhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag gi gzhung gis rnam par shes pa drug kho na rnam par bzhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore it should be understood that their texts present only six consciousnesses.

original: gnyis pa 'phags pa byams pa'i gzhung @214b gis ni /üîΩ'phags pa gser 'od dam pa'i mdo la sogs pa la brten nas /
analyzed: gnyis pa 'phags pa byams pa'i gzhung @214b gis ni / 'phags pa gser 'od dam pa'i mdo la sogs pa la brten nas /
translated: Second, the texts of Arya MaitreyaüîΩpresent eight consciousnesses in dependence on the Sutra of Golden Light and so on.

original: rnam par shes pa brgyad tshang bar rnam par 'jog pas gzhung 'di la brten nas rgya gar yul ba'i slob dpon rnams rnam pa gsum du bshad de /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa brgyad tshang bar rnam par 'jog pas gzhung 'di la brten nas rgya gar yul ba'i slob dpon rnams rnam pa gsum du bshad de /
translated: Therefore Indian masters explain that there are three types of texts.

original: dang po ni slob dpon po dhe le'u cis bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa la brten nas /
analyzed: dang po ni slob dpon po dhe le'u cis bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa la brten nas /
translated: The first is the master Bodhibhadra, who in his treatise Establishing Consciousness Only explains:

original: sems rnam pa gnyis rnam par 'jog go //
analyzed: sems rnam pa gnyis rnam par 'jog go //
translated: The mind is posited in two ways.

original: de la dang po ni chos nyid kyi sems te /
analyzed: de la dang po ni chos nyid kyi sems te /
translated: The first is the mind of reality.

original: de yang de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: de yang de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo nyid de /
translated: It is the reality of suchness.

original: de bzhin nyid kyi sems kyi ngo bo nyid la sems zhes bya yang dmigs pa can ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyi sems kyi ngo bo nyid la sems zhes bya yang dmigs pa can ni ma yin no //
translated: The reality of the mind of suchness is called mind, but it is not an object of perception.

original: gnyis pa ni mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems te /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems te /
translated: The second is the mind of association.

original: dad pa dang 'dod chags la sogs pa'i sems las byung ba rnams dang mtshungs par ldan pa'o zhes bshad de /
analyzed: dad pa dang 'dod chags la sogs pa'i sems las byung ba rnams dang mtshungs par ldan pa'o zhes bshad de /
translated: It is associated with the mental factors of faith, desire, and so on.

original: de ni 'di skad du /
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du /
translated: This is explained as follows.

original: rnam par rig pa tsam gyi yid kyi ngo bo nyid yin par phyir dang / rnam par rig pa tsam gyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par rig pa tsam gyi yid kyi ngo bo nyid yin par phyir dang / rnam par rig pa tsam gyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is the nature of the mind of mere representation and because it is the nature of mere representation,

original: yid dang rnam par shes pa zhes bshad kyang 'gal ba med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yid dang rnam par shes pa zhes bshad kyang 'gal ba med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: it is explained as mind and consciousness, but there is no contradiction.üîΩThis is the meaning.

original: gnyis pa ni slob dpon yang dag bden pas rnam par nges pa'i mdzod ces bya ba'i bstan bcos las brten nas rnam par shes pa rnam pa dgu'i don rnam par 'jog ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni slob dpon yang dag bden pas rnam par nges pa'i mdzod ces bya ba'i bstan bcos las brten nas rnam par shes pa rnam pa dgu'i don rnam par 'jog ste /
translated: The second is the master Paramartha, who in his treatise called the NyƒÅyƒÅnusƒÅrako≈õa establishes the meaning of the nine consciousnesses.

original: rnam par shes pa rnam pa dgu'i le'u las bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa rnam pa dgu'i le'u las bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: This is as explained in the chapter on the nine consciousnesses.

original: de la rnam par shes pa dgu zhes bya ba yang /
analyzed: de la rnam par shes pa dgu zhes bya ba yang /
translated: As for the nine consciousnesses,

original: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa drug ni 'phal cher bstan bcos gzhan dag las bshad pa dang yang mthun no //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa drug ni 'phal cher bstan bcos gzhan dag las bshad pa dang yang mthun no //
translated: the first six are the eye consciousnesses and so on, which is in accord with the explanations in other treatises.

original: bdun pa ni len pa'i rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: bdun pa ni len pa'i rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: The seventh is the appropriating consciousness.

original: brgyad pa la bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pas /
analyzed: brgyad pa la bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pas /
translated: The eighth is the afflicted mind, which is so called because it is the support of the afflictions.

original: nyon mongs pa kho na'i sgrib pa dang ldan gyi /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa kho na'i sgrib pa dang ldan gyi /
translated: It is endowed with the obscurations of the afflictions alone.

original: chos kyi 'dzin pa ni med de /
analyzed: chos kyi 'dzin pa ni med de /
translated: It does not have the grasping of phenomena.

original: nges par sangs rgyas su mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: nges par sangs rgyas su mi 'grub bo //
translated: It is certain that it does not become a buddha.

original: brgyad pa ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: brgyad pa ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: The eighth is the foundation consciousness.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: This also has three parts.

original: kha cig na re dang po ngo bo nyid kyi kun gzhi ni /
analyzed: kha cig na re dang po ngo bo nyid kyi kun gzhi ni /
translated: Some say that the first is the natural foundation consciousness.

original: sangs rgyas su 'grub pa'i don dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas su 'grub pa'i don dang ldan pa'o //
translated: and it is endowed with the meaning of accomplishing Buddhahood.

original: gnyis pa rnam par smin pa'i kun gzhi ni /
analyzed: gnyis pa rnam par smin pa'i kun gzhi ni /
translated: The second, the fruitional foundation consciousness,

original: khams bco brgyad po dag la dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: khams bco brgyad po dag la dmigs pa ste /
translated: is the objective domain of the eighteen elements.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa las /üîΩdbang po don @215a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa las / dbang po don @215a * //
translated: Therefore, the treatise Distinguishing the Middle from Extremes states:üîΩThe consciousnesses of the sense faculties,

original: dang bdag rnam rig / snang ba'i rnam par shes pa las //
analyzed: dang bdag rnam rig / snang ba'i rnam par shes pa las //
translated: their objects, and the selfüîΩarise in a way that is similar to that.

original: de dang 'dra bar skye zhes byung bas bstan bcos 'di dag la sogs pa la brten nas /
analyzed: de dang 'dra bar skye zhes byung bas bstan bcos 'di dag la sogs pa la brten nas /
translated: Based on this treatise and others,

original: brgyad pa khams bco brgyad la dmigs par byed do zhes bshad do //
analyzed: brgyad pa khams bco brgyad la dmigs par byed do zhes bshad do //
translated: it is explained that the eighth consciousness has the eighteen elements as its objective domain.

original: gsum pa kun nas nyon mongs pa'i kun gzhi ni de bzhin nyid kyi yul la dmigs nas nga rgyal rnam pa bzhi 'byung ste /
analyzed: gsum pa kun nas nyon mongs pa'i kun gzhi ni de bzhin nyid kyi yul la dmigs nas nga rgyal rnam pa bzhi 'byung ste /
translated: The third, the defiled foundation consciousness, is the objective domain of suchness. Four types of pride arise from it.

original: de ni chos su 'dzin gyi /
analyzed: de ni chos su 'dzin gyi /
translated: It is said that this consciousness apprehends phenomenaüîΩbut does not apprehend the person.

original: gang zag tu 'dzin pa ni ma yin no zhes slob dpon blo brten gyi gzhung la brten nas de skad du 'chad do //
analyzed: gang zag tu 'dzin pa ni ma yin no zhes slob dpon blo brten gyi gzhung la brten nas de skad du 'chad do //
translated: This is explained based on the treatise of Master Sthiramati.

original: dgu pa ni dri ma med pa'i rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: dgu pa ni dri ma med pa'i rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: The ninth consciousness is stainless consciousness.

original: de bzhin nyid kyi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyi bdag nyid do //
translated: It is the essence of thusness.

original: de bzhin nyid kyi bdag nyid gcig la don gnyis dang ldan pas /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyi bdag nyid gcig la don gnyis dang ldan pas /
translated: Since the one essence of thusness has two meanings,

original: dang po ni dmigs par bya ba'i yul te /
analyzed: dang po ni dmigs par bya ba'i yul te /
translated: the first is the objective realm that is the object of perception.

original: de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: It is called thusness, the perfect end, and so on.

original: gnyis pa ni dmigs par byed pa'i don te /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni dmigs par byed pa'i don te /
translated: The second is the meaning of the agent of perception.

original: de ni dri ma med pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes kyang bya /
analyzed: de ni dri ma med pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes kyang bya /
translated: It is also called stainless consciousness.

original: gzod ma nas rig pa zhes kyang bya ste /
analyzed: gzod ma nas rig pa zhes kyang bya ste /
translated: It is also called primordial wisdom.

original: zhib tu rnam par shes pa dgu bstan pa dang / bstan bcos rnam par nges pa'i mdzod kyi nang nas rnam par shes pa dgu bstan pa'i le'u las 'byung ba bzhin no zhe'o //
analyzed: zhib tu rnam par shes pa dgu bstan pa dang / bstan bcos rnam par nges pa'i mdzod kyi nang nas rnam par shes pa dgu bstan pa'i le'u las 'byung ba bzhin no zhe'o //
translated: This is explained in detail in the teaching on the nine consciousnesses and in the chapter on the nine consciousnesses in the treatise the Definitive Commentary on the Treasury of Abhidharma.

original: gsum pa ni slob dpon hyan tsang gis /
analyzed: gsum pa ni slob dpon hyan tsang gis /
translated: The third is the position of the master Hyan-tsang.

original: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa'i mdo la sogs pa dang / slob dpon chos skyong gi gzhung la brten nas rnam par shes pa brgyad kho na rnam par 'jog gi / dgu zhes ni mi 'chad de /
analyzed: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa'i mdo la sogs pa dang / slob dpon chos skyong gi gzhung la brten nas rnam par shes pa brgyad kho na rnam par 'jog gi / dgu zhes ni mi 'chad de /
translated: and the noble Sutra on Entering Lanka and so on, and the treatises of the master Dharmapala, posit only eight consciousnesses and do not explain nine.

original: slob dpon bha bya'i gzhung gzhig pa'i phyir /
analyzed: slob dpon bha bya'i gzhung gzhig pa'i phyir /
translated: This is because they refute the treatises of the master Bhavaviveka.

original: 'di skad du tshad ma rnam par gzhag pa de nyid la rang gi lung dang 'gal ba'i skyon yod de /
analyzed: 'di skad du tshad ma rnam par gzhag pa de nyid la rang gi lung dang 'gal ba'i skyon yod de /
translated: In that way, in that very presentation of valid knowledge, there is the fault of contradicting their own scriptures.

original: 'di ltar 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa la sogs pa'i mdo kun las brgyad pa ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa la sogs pa'i mdo kun las brgyad pa ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus the noble Sutra on Entering Lanka and so on state, The eighth is called the foundation consciousness.

original: gal te de lta na ci'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mdo'i le'u chen po la sogs pa las /
analyzed: gal te de lta na ci'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mdo'i le'u chen po la sogs pa las /
translated: If that is so, why do the chapters of the perfection of wisdom sutras and so on state:

original: rnam par shes pa ni drug kho na'o zhes gsungs /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni drug kho na'o zhes gsungs /
translated: There are only six consciousnesses.

original: slob dpon chos skyong gis bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las /
analyzed: slob dpon chos skyong gis bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las /
translated: The master Dharmapala, in his treatise Establishing Consciousness Only,üîΩsays:

original: brda sprad de bshad pa las ji skad du /
analyzed: brda sprad de bshad pa las ji skad du /
translated: The explanation of the term indicates that the six consciousnesses are the six collections of consciousness.

original: mdo dag @215b las rnam par shes pa ni drug go zhes gsungs pa de ni rjes su 'gyur ba'i don gyi sgo yin no //
analyzed: mdo dag @215b las rnam par shes pa ni drug go zhes gsungs pa de ni rjes su 'gyur ba'i don gyi sgo yin no //
translated: The sutras state that there are six consciousnesses, but this is a gateway to the meaning of transformation.

original: yang na rten du gyur ba'i dbang po drug gi rjes su rnam pa drug go zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: yang na rten du gyur ba'i dbang po drug gi rjes su rnam pa drug go zhes pa yin te /
translated: Or, it is the six aspects that follow the six sense faculties that are the basis.

original: rnam par shes pa'i rnam pa'i bye brag ni yang dag par na rnam pa brgyad yod do //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i rnam pa'i bye brag ni yang dag par na rnam pa brgyad yod do //
translated: The specific aspects of consciousness are, in reality, eight in number.

original: ci slob dpon klu sgrub kyis rnam pa drug kho na'o zhes rnam par gzhag gam zhe na /
analyzed: ci slob dpon klu sgrub kyis rnam pa drug kho na'o zhes rnam par gzhag gam zhe na /
translated: Did the master Nagarjuna posit only six?

original: smras pa / yang dag par na slob dpon klu sgrub kyis bdun pa dang brgyad pa yang yod par yid ches mod kyi /
analyzed: smras pa / yang dag par na slob dpon klu sgrub kyis bdun pa dang brgyad pa yang yod par yid ches mod kyi /
translated: He did, but in reality he believed there were seven and eight.

original: rab tu dga' ba'i mya ngan las 'das pa chen po la gnas pa'i phyir bstan bcos de dag las /
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba'i mya ngan las 'das pa chen po la gnas pa'i phyir bstan bcos de dag las /
translated: Because he abided in the great nirvana of complete joy, in those treatisesüîΩhe did not mention the seventh and eighth consciousnesses.

original: rnam par shes pa ni drug go zhes bstan pa ni 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i le'u chen po'i mdo la sogs pa'i dgongs pa bstan pa'i phyir 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni drug go zhes bstan pa ni 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i le'u chen po'i mdo la sogs pa'i dgongs pa bstan pa'i phyir 'gal ba med do //
translated: The statement in the sutra that consciousnesses are six is not contradictory to the intention of the great Perfection of Wisdom sutras, etc.

original: slob dpon yang dag bden pas rnam par shes pa ni dgu'o zhes bshad pa yang /
analyzed: slob dpon yang dag bden pas rnam par shes pa ni dgu'o zhes bshad pa yang /
translated: Master BhƒÅviveka explains that there are nine consciousnesses.

original: bar dang ri rab kyi sde snod gsum po de dag la skyon mang du yod de /
analyzed: bar dang ri rab kyi sde snod gsum po de dag la skyon mang du yod de /
translated: There are many faults in the three scriptural baskets of the SautrƒÅntika-SvƒÅtantrika-MƒÅdhyamika.

original: de la re zhig rnam par shes pa bdun pa bstan pa la skyon rnam pa gnyis yod de /
analyzed: de la re zhig rnam par shes pa bdun pa bstan pa la skyon rnam pa gnyis yod de /
translated: First, there are two faults in the teaching of seven consciousnesses.

original: dang po len pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa brgyad pa'i ming gi rnam grangs yin gyi /
analyzed: dang po len pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa brgyad pa'i ming gi rnam grangs yin gyi /
translated: First, the term appropriator is a synonym for the eighth consciousness.

original: bdun pa ma yin pas de'i phyir mdo 'di nyid la sogs pa las /
analyzed: bdun pa ma yin pas de'i phyir mdo 'di nyid la sogs pa las /
translated: It is not the seventh, and therefore this sutra and others say,

original: rnam par shes pa brgyad pa ni len pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa brgyad pa ni len pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: ‚ÄúThe eighth consciousness is called the appropriating consciousness.‚Äù

original: gnyis pa ni don 'gal ba yin te /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni don 'gal ba yin te /
translated: Second, the meaning is contradictory.

original: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang ldan no zhes bshad pa nyid mdo sde nyid 'gal te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang ldan no zhes bshad pa nyid mdo sde nyid 'gal te /
translated: The statement that it is associated with the afflictive obstructions contradicts the sutras themselves,

original: sa brgyad pa yan chad la nyon mongs pa can gyi yid yod do zhes bstan pas so //
analyzed: sa brgyad pa yan chad la nyon mongs pa can gyi yid yod do zhes bstan pas so //
translated: because it teaches that the afflicted mind exists on the eighth level and above.

original: sangs rgyas su mi 'grub bo zhes bstan pa yang bstan bcos mdo sde'i rgyan la sogs pa las /üîΩrnam par shes pa brgyad gnas gyur pas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas su mi 'grub bo zhes bstan pa yang bstan bcos mdo sde'i rgyan la sogs pa las / rnam par shes pa brgyad gnas gyur pas /
translated: The statement that one will not achieve buddhahood contradicts the meaning of the explanation in such treatises as the Ornament of Mahayana Sutras that

original: ye shes bzhi mngon par 'grub bo zhes bshad pa'i don dang 'gal bar gyur pas /
analyzed: ye shes bzhi mngon par 'grub bo zhes bshad pa'i don dang 'gal bar gyur pas /
translated: the four kinds of exalted wisdom are achieved through the transformation of the eight consciousnesses.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa chos su 'dzin pa skyed par byed pa dang khams bco brgyad la dmigs par byed do zhes bstan pa de dag kyang rigs pa ma yin no //üîΩgzhan yang dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa'i tshig @216a * //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa chos su 'dzin pa skyed par byed pa dang khams bco brgyad la dmigs par byed do zhes bstan pa de dag kyang rigs pa ma yin no // gzhan yang dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa'i tshig @216a * //
translated: Therefore it is also illogical to teach that the foundation consciousness generates the apprehension of phenomena as real entities and that it observes the eighteen constituents.üîΩMoreover, the recently translated text of the Differentiation of the Middle and the Extremes

original: le'ur byas pa gsar 'gyur las /
analyzed: le'ur byas pa gsar 'gyur las /
translated: says:üîΩConsciousness appears as objects, sentient beings,

original: rnam shes don dang sems can dang // bdag dang rnam rig lta bur snang //
analyzed: rnam shes don dang sems can dang // bdag dang rnam rig lta bur snang //
translated: the self, and the representations of the mind.

original: yul 'di nges par yod ma yin //üîΩyul med phyir ni rnam shes med //
analyzed: yul 'di nges par yod ma yin // yul med phyir ni rnam shes med //
translated: This object does not exist.

original: ces 'byung ste /
analyzed: ces 'byung ste /
translated: Because the object does not exist, consciousness does not exist.üîΩThe Vrtti explains:

original: 'di nyid kyi 'grel pa las de la don lta bur snang ba 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi 'grel pa las de la don lta bur snang ba 'di lta ste /
translated: The appearance as objects is as follows:

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i yul gyi dngos por snang ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i yul gyi dngos por snang ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the appearance as the entities of objects such as form.

original: sems can lta bur snang ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: sems can lta bur snang ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The appearance as sentient beings is as follows:

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi yul lta bur dbang po lnga'i ngo bor snang ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi yul lta bur dbang po lnga'i ngo bor snang ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the appearance as the nature of the five sense faculties in the form of objects of self and others.

original: bdag lta bur snang ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bdag lta bur snang ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The appearance as self is as follows:

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid bdag tu rmongs pa la sogs pa dang / rtag par mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid bdag tu rmongs pa la sogs pa dang / rtag par mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the afflicted mind, because it is always concomitant with delusion of self, etc.

original: rnam par rig pa lta bur snang ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rnam par rig pa lta bur snang ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The appearance as representations is as follows:

original: rnam par shes pa gzhan drug po dag mtshan nyid rnam par rig pa rags pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad de /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gzhan drug po dag mtshan nyid rnam par rig pa rags pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad de /
translated: It is the other six consciousnesses, because the characteristics of representations are coarse.

original: zhib tu de nyid las bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: zhib tu de nyid las bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is explained in detail in that text.

original: de'i phyir brgyad pa ni sems pa la sogs pa la mi dmigs par rig par bya ste /üîΩzhib tu rnam par 'byed pa ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir brgyad pa ni sems pa la sogs pa la mi dmigs par rig par bya ste / zhib tu rnam par 'byed pa ni /
translated: Therefore, the eighth is known not to focus on intention and so on.

original: rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa'i bstan bcos las bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa'i bstan bcos las bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: Detailed analysis is like that explained in the treatise Establishing Consciousness Only.

original: gzhan yang slob dpon yang dag bden pas dri ma med pa'i rnam par shes pa ni bdag nyid la dmigs par byed do zhes bshad pa yang /
analyzed: gzhan yang slob dpon yang dag bden pas dri ma med pa'i rnam par shes pa ni bdag nyid la dmigs par byed do zhes bshad pa yang /
translated: Also, the explanation by Master Par≈õva that stainless consciousness focuses on itself

original: lung gi khungs kyang gtan tshig yid brtan du rung ba yang med la /üîΩgzhan yang bstan bcos de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan gyi rgyan las /
analyzed: lung gi khungs kyang gtan tshig yid brtan du rung ba yang med la / gzhan yang bstan bcos de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan gyi rgyan las /
translated: has no reliable scriptural source.

original: bstan pa dag dang yang 'gal bar 'gyur te de nyid las /
analyzed: bstan pa dag dang yang 'gal bar 'gyur te de nyid las /
translated: Moreover, it would contradict the treatise Ornament of the TathƒÅgata‚Äôs Qualities, which says:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i dri med rnam shes ni //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i dri med rnam shes ni //
translated: The stainless consciousness of the tathƒÅgatas

original: shin tu dag cing zag med dbyings yin pas //
analyzed: shin tu dag cing zag med dbyings yin pas //
translated: is extremely pure and the realm free of contaminants,

original: sgrib pa thams cad las ni rnam par grol //
analyzed: sgrib pa thams cad las ni rnam par grol //
translated: liberated from all obscurations,

original: me long lta bu'i ye shes mtshungs par ldan //
analyzed: me long lta bu'i ye shes mtshungs par ldan //
translated: and is associated with mirrorlike wisdom.

original: zhes 'byung ba ni mdo sde las gsungs pa bzhin du shes par bya ste /
analyzed: zhes 'byung ba ni mdo sde las gsungs pa bzhin du shes par bya ste /
translated: This should be understood according to the sutras.

original: de la dri ma med pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la dri ma med pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Among them, the so-called stainless consciousness is

original: rnam par byang ba'i phyogs kyi kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i phyogs kyi kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: the foundation consciousness of the side of purification.

original: gzhan yang rnam par nges pa'i mdzod kyi bstan bcos zhes bya ba 'di nyid rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa @216b yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang rnam par nges pa'i mdzod kyi bstan bcos zhes bya ba 'di nyid rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa @216b yin te /
translated: Moreover, this treatise called the Abhidharmako≈õa is the YogƒÅcƒÅra bh≈´mi,

original: bstan bcos de nyid las rnam par shes pa dgu'i le'u zhes bya ba med do zhes bshad do //
analyzed: bstan bcos de nyid las rnam par shes pa dgu'i le'u zhes bya ba med do zhes bshad do //
translated: because it explains that the treatise itself does not have a chapter called the chapter on the nine consciousnesses.

original: de la nges tshig rnam par bshad pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la nges tshig rnam par bshad pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of etymological explanations:

original: spyi dang bye brag go //
analyzed: spyi dang bye brag go //
translated: general and specific.

original: de yang rnam par shes pa brgyad ces bya ba ni spyi'i ming ste /
analyzed: de yang rnam par shes pa brgyad ces bya ba ni spyi'i ming ste /
translated: The so-called eight consciousnesses is a general name.

original: brgyad ces bya ba ni grangs smos pa'o //
analyzed: brgyad ces bya ba ni grangs smos pa'o //
translated: The word eight refers to a number.

original: rnam par shes pa ni rnam par rig pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni rnam par rig pa'o //
translated: Consciousness is cognition.

original: spyi'i ngo bo nyid dang mtshan nyid kyis ni /
analyzed: spyi'i ngo bo nyid dang mtshan nyid kyis ni /
translated: By the general nature and characteristics,

original: rnam par shes pa drug las rnam par 'byed de /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa drug las rnam par 'byed de /
translated: it is distinguished from the six consciousnesses.

original: rnam par bshad pa rnam pa drug las 'di ni grangs dang bcas pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par bshad pa rnam pa drug las 'di ni grangs dang bcas pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o //
translated: This is the explanation of the sixfold classification.

original: de la bye brag gi ming ni /
analyzed: de la bye brag gi ming ni /
translated: The specific names are:

original: ming la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa drug po rnams te /
analyzed: ming la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa drug po rnams te /
translated: The six consciousnesses of name, etc.

original: thams cad kyang bdag po'i dbang du mdzad nas rnam par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyang bdag po'i dbang du mdzad nas rnam par bshad pa'o //
translated: All of these are explained in terms of the dominant condition.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: mig la brten pa'i rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de ni mig gi rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mig la brten pa'i rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de ni mig gi rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: the consciousness that is supported on the eye is called eye consciousness.

original: de bzhin du yid la brten pa'i rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du yid la brten pa'i rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Similarly, the consciousness that is supported on the mental faculty is called mental consciousness.

original: bdun pa nyon mongs pa can gyi yid ni /
analyzed: bdun pa nyon mongs pa can gyi yid ni /
translated: The seventh consciousness, the afflicted mind,

original: rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa'i bstan bcos las /
analyzed: rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa'i bstan bcos las /
translated: is explained in the treatise Demonstration of Consciousness Only:

original: rtag tu nges par sems pa rnam par shes pa gzhan dag las kyang khyad par du gyur pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad de /
analyzed: rtag tu nges par sems pa rnam par shes pa gzhan dag las kyang khyad par du gyur pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad de /
translated: Because it is always and exclusively associated with four passions, such as the view of a self, etc., and because it is different from the other consciousnesses, it is called the afflicted mind.

original: bshad pa 'di dang sbyar na /
analyzed: bshad pa 'di dang sbyar na /
translated: In accordance with this explanation,

original: yid nyid rnam par shes pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yid nyid rnam par shes pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because the mental faculty is consciousness,

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ste /
translated: it is called the mental consciousness.

original: 'di ni las yongs su 'dzin pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni las yongs su 'dzin pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o //
translated: This is the explanation of the function of grasping karma.

original: brgyad pa kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni sbed par byed pa dang / spa bar bya ba dang sbas pa 'dzin pa'i don dang ldan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: brgyad pa kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni sbed par byed pa dang / spa bar bya ba dang sbas pa 'dzin pa'i don dang ldan pa'i phyir /
translated: The eighth consciousness, the store consciousness, is called ƒÅlaya because it has the meaning of hiding, being hidden, and holding what is hidden.

original: go rims bzhin du 'bras bu rgyu las sbas pa dang / rgyu 'bras bu la sbas pa dang / yul 'dzin pa la sbas pa ste /
analyzed: go rims bzhin du 'bras bu rgyu las sbas pa dang / rgyu 'bras bu la sbas pa dang / yul 'dzin pa la sbas pa ste /
translated: In order, it is the result hidden in the cause, the cause hidden in the result, and the object grasped hidden in consciousness.

original: zhib tu bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa dang / theg pa chen po bsdus pa las bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: zhib tu bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa dang / theg pa chen po bsdus pa las bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: This is explained in detail in the treatises, such as the SƒÅ·πÉkhya Treatise, the Tattva·π≠ƒ´kƒÅ, the Proof of Consciousness Only, and the Compendium of the Great Vehicle.

original: de la ngo bo nyid bstan pa yang re zhig don rnam pa gnyis la brten nas bstan te /
analyzed: de la ngo bo nyid bstan pa yang re zhig don rnam pa gnyis la brten nas bstan te /
translated: The teaching of its nature is based on two meanings,

original: ngo bo nyid rnam pa gsum dang / chos rnam pa gsum la brten nas bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid rnam pa gsum dang / chos rnam pa gsum la brten nas bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is based on the three natures and the three natures of dharmas.

original: gal te ngo bo nyid rnam pa gsum la brten nas @217a * //
analyzed: gal te ngo bo nyid rnam pa gsum la brten nas @217a * //
translated: If it is based on the three natures,

original: rnam par shes pa brgyad rnam par dbye na thams cad kyang ngo bo nyid gsum du bsdus pa yin te /üîΩyang dag pa ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams gcig tu bsdus nas de kho na la phyags pa ni de bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / rgyu dang rkyen la ltos nas 'byung bas thams cad kyang zhan gyi dbang yin pa'i phyir /üîΩji tsam du brtags pa'i sems kyi rjes su yod pa dag ni /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa brgyad rnam par dbye na thams cad kyang ngo bo nyid gsum du bsdus pa yin te / yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams gcig tu bsdus nas de kho na la phyags pa ni de bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / rgyu dang rkyen la ltos nas 'byung bas thams cad kyang zhan gyi dbang yin pa'i phyir / ji tsam du brtags pa'i sems kyi rjes su yod pa dag ni /
translated: If the eight consciousnesses are classified, all are included in the three natures.

original: kun brtags kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde'i phyir rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa'i bstan bcos las /
analyzed: kun brtags kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro // de'i phyir rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa'i bstan bcos las /
translated: The imagined nature is the nature that is imagined in such things as the aggregates, constituents, and sense fields, and it is included in the imagined nature.

original: rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo nyid ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis te /üîΩyang dag pa ma yin pa ni 'di lta ste /üîΩkun du brtags pa'o //üîΩyang dag pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo nyid ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis te / yang dag pa ma yin pa ni 'di lta ste / kun du brtags pa'o // yang dag pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The dependent nature is the nature that is dependent on others, and it is included in the dependent nature.

original: yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: The perfected nature is the nature that is perfected, and it is included in the perfected nature.

original: gzhan yang ngo bo nyid rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: gzhan yang ngo bo nyid rnam pa gnyis te /
