translated: The three natures are also included in the three non-natures.üîΩThe imagined nature is included in the nature that is imagined, because it is the nature that is imagined in such things as the aggregates, constituents, and sense fields.üîΩThe dependent nature is included in the nature that is dependent on others, because it arises in dependence on other causes and conditions.üîΩThe perfected nature is included in the ultimate non-nature, because it is the ultimate and is not the nature of the imagined.

original: kun rdzob ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: kun rdzob ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The conventional is as follows:

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid do //
translated: The other-dependent nature.

original: don dam pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: don dam pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The ultimate is as follows:

original: yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid do zhes bshad do //
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid do zhes bshad do //
translated: The perfected nature.

original: chos rnam pa gsum la brten nas ngo bo nyid bstan pa yang phung po lnga las rnam par shes pa brgyad po dag ni thams cad kyang rnam par shes pa'i phung po'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: chos rnam pa gsum la brten nas ngo bo nyid bstan pa yang phung po lnga las rnam par shes pa brgyad po dag ni thams cad kyang rnam par shes pa'i phung po'i bdag nyid do //
translated: The teaching of the three natures in dependence on the three natures of phenomena is as follows: In the five aggregates, the eight consciousnesses are all of the nature of the aggregate of consciousness.

original: skye mched bcu gnyis las ni thams cad kyang yid kyi skye mched kyis bsdus te /
analyzed: skye mched bcu gnyis las ni thams cad kyang yid kyi skye mched kyis bsdus te /
translated: In the twelve sense bases, all are included in the sense base of the mental faculty,

original: thams cad la yang de ma thag pa'i 'gag pa la brten pa'i don yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad la yang de ma thag pa'i 'gag pa la brten pa'i don yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the meaning of the sense base is the immediately preceding cessation of consciousness.

original: khams bco brgyad las snga ma'i rnam par shes pa lnga po dag ni thams cad kyang rang gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang yid kyi khams kyi phyogs gcig gi bdag nyid byed do //
analyzed: khams bco brgyad las snga ma'i rnam par shes pa lnga po dag ni thams cad kyang rang gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang yid kyi khams kyi phyogs gcig gi bdag nyid byed do //
translated: In the eighteen constituents, the first five consciousnesses are all of the nature of the consciousness constituents and one part of the mental faculty constituent.

original: drug pa dang bdun pa dang / brgyad po'i rnam par shes pa gsum po dag ni thams cad kyang yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang / yid kyi khams kyi phyogs gcig gi ngo bo nyid byed do //
analyzed: drug pa dang bdun pa dang / brgyad po'i rnam par shes pa gsum po dag ni thams cad kyang yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang / yid kyi khams kyi phyogs gcig gi ngo bo nyid byed do //
translated: The three consciousnesses of the sixth, seventh, and eighth are all of the nature of mental consciousness and one part of the mental element.

original: de la gnas rnam par dbye ba yang rnam par shes pa brgyad po dag gi gnas ni re re la yang rnam pa gsum gsum yod de de la dang po rgyu'i rkyen gyi gnas ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la gnas rnam par dbye ba yang rnam par shes pa brgyad po dag gi gnas ni re re la yang rnam pa gsum gsum yod de de la dang po rgyu'i rkyen gyi gnas ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The analysis of the bases is as follows: The bases of the eight consciousnesses are threefold for each consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa brgyad po dag mngon du bskyed pa'i sa bon rnams te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa brgyad po dag mngon du bskyed pa'i sa bon rnams te /
translated: The first is the causal condition as a basis, which is the seeds that generate the eight actual consciousnesses.

original: de'i phyir rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa'i bstan bcos las dang po'i rgyu'i @217b rkyen gyi gnas ni 'di lta ste /üîΩrang gi sa bon 'dus byas kyi chos rnams te /üîΩthams cad kyang gnas 'di la ltos nas rang gi rgyu'i rkyen dang bral na /
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa'i bstan bcos las dang po'i rgyu'i @217b rkyen gyi gnas ni 'di lta ste / rang gi sa bon 'dus byas kyi chos rnams te / thams cad kyang gnas 'di la ltos nas rang gi rgyu'i rkyen dang bral na /
translated: Therefore, the treatise Establishing the Existence of Only Consciousness states:üîΩThe causal condition as a basis is the seeds of all conditioned dharmas.

original: nges par mi skyed pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: nges par mi skyed pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: Because, in the absence of this basis, all dharmas are definitely not generated.

original: gnyis pa go 'byed pa'i gnas ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa go 'byed pa'i gnas ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The second is the basis of opportunity.

original: skad cig ma snga ma rang gi rnam pa 'gags pa'o //
analyzed: skad cig ma snga ma rang gi rnam pa 'gags pa'o //
translated: It is the cessation of the aspect of the prior moment.

original: rnam par shes pa brgyad po dag phan tshun ltos pa'i skad cig ma snga ma ni go 'byed pa'i gnas byed pas /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa brgyad po dag phan tshun ltos pa'i skad cig ma snga ma ni go 'byed pa'i gnas byed pas /
translated: The prior moment of the eight consciousnesses is the basis of opportunity because it is the basis of the opportunity for the subsequent moment.

original: de'i phyir rnam par rig pa tsam du grub ba'i bstan bcos las //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par rig pa tsam du grub ba'i bstan bcos las //
translated: Therefore the treatise Demonstration of Consciousness Only says,

original: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyi gnas ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyi gnas ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The basis of the condition as cause is the five homogeneous and immediately antecedent conditions.

original: sngar 'gags ma thag pa'i yid de /
analyzed: sngar 'gags ma thag pa'i yid de /
translated: The immediately antecedent mind is the basis of opportunity for the six consciousnesses.

original: sems dang sems las 'byung ba rnams gnas 'di la ltos pas go 'byed pa'i gnas dang bral na nges par mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
analyzed: sems dang sems las 'byung ba rnams gnas 'di la ltos pas go 'byed pa'i gnas dang bral na nges par mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
translated: Since mind and mental activities depend on this basis, if they are separated from the basis of opportunity, they definitely do not occur.

original: gsum pa ni lhan cig pa'i gnas te /
analyzed: gsum pa ni lhan cig pa'i gnas te /
translated: The third is the simultaneous basis.

original: lhan cig pa'i gnas de yang rnam par shes pa rnams kyis mi mtshungs bas mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa lnga po de dag re re la yang gnas bzhi bzhi yod de /
analyzed: lhan cig pa'i gnas de yang rnam par shes pa rnams kyis mi mtshungs bas mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa lnga po de dag re re la yang gnas bzhi bzhi yod de /
translated: This simultaneous basis is not the same for the various consciousnesses, and therefore each of the five consciousnesses, such as visual consciousness, has four bases.

original: de la yul mtshungs pa'i dbang po ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la yul mtshungs pa'i dbang po ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The faculties that are similar in object are as follows.

original: mig la sogs pa'i dbang po lnga po dag phan tshun ltos pa'i rang gi rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i dbang po lnga po dag phan tshun ltos pa'i rang gi rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: The five faculties such as the eye are the five corresponding consciousnesses.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i dbang po ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i dbang po ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The conceptual faculties are as follows.

original: shes pa lnga po dag yid kyi rnam par shes pa la ni dmigs par mtshungs pa'o //
analyzed: shes pa lnga po dag yid kyi rnam par shes pa la ni dmigs par mtshungs pa'o //
translated: The five consciousnesses are the same in object for the mental consciousness.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i dbang po ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i dbang po ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The faculties of defilement and purification are as follows.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid do //
translated: The defiled mind is the faculty of defilement.

original: rtsa ba'i gnas ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i gnas ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The fundamental basis is as follows.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: The fundamental basis is the store consciousness.

original: de'i phyir rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa'i bstan bcos las /
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa'i bstan bcos las /
translated: Therefore, the treatise Establishing Sense-Experience-Only states:

original: des na rnam par shes pa lnga po dag gi lhan cig pa'i gnas ni nges par rnam pa bzhi yod de /
analyzed: des na rnam par shes pa lnga po dag gi lhan cig pa'i gnas ni nges par rnam pa bzhi yod de /
translated: Therefore, the five consciousnesses definitely have four kinds of simultaneous support.

original: 'di ltar dbang po gzugs can lnga dang / rnam pa drug dang / bdun dang / brgyad po de dag las gang yang rung ba las gcig ma tshang na nges par mi 'jug pa'i phyir dang / yul mtshungs pa'i dang / rnam par rtog pa dang /üîΩkun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang / @218a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar dbang po gzugs can lnga dang / rnam pa drug dang / bdun dang / brgyad po de dag las gang yang rung ba las gcig ma tshang na nges par mi 'jug pa'i phyir dang / yul mtshungs pa'i dang / rnam par rtog pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang / @218a * //
translated: Because the object, aspect, and mental activity are the same,

original: rtsa ba'i gnas tha dad pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i gnas tha dad pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
translated: and because the root basis is different for afflicted and pure states.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i lhan cig pa'i gnas ni rnam pa gnyis kho na ste /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i lhan cig pa'i gnas ni rnam pa gnyis kho na ste /
translated: The basis of the mental faculty is only two.

original: de'i phyir rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa'i bstan bcos las /
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa'i bstan bcos las /
translated: Therefore the treatise Establishing Sense Bases explains:

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i lhan cig pa'i gnas ni gnyis kho na'o //üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i lhan cig pa'i gnas ni gnyis kho na'o // 'di lta ste /
translated: The basis of the mental faculty is only two.

original: rnam par shes pa bdun dang / brgyad pa las gang yang rung ba cig ma tshang na nges par mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa bdun dang / brgyad pa las gang yang rung ba cig ma tshang na nges par mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Because if any one of the seven consciousnesses or the eighth consciousness is incomplete, it definitely does not engage.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kyi lhan cig ba'i gnas ni gcig kho na ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kyi lhan cig ba'i gnas ni gcig kho na ste /
translated: The single simultaneous support of afflicted mentality is the storehouse consciousness.

original: de'i phyir rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa'i bstan bcos las /
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa'i bstan bcos las /
translated: Therefore, the treatise Demonstration of Consciousness Only says:

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kyi lhan cig pa'i gnas ni gcig kho na ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kyi lhan cig pa'i gnas ni gcig kho na ste /
translated: The single simultaneous support of afflicted mentality is the storehouse consciousness.

original: gal te kun gzhi rnam par shes pa med na nges par mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
analyzed: gal te kun gzhi rnam par shes pa med na nges par mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
translated: If the storehouse consciousness did not exist, there would be no certainty of simultaneous arising.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i lhan cig pa'i gnas kyang gcig kho na ste /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i lhan cig pa'i gnas kyang gcig kho na ste /
translated: The single simultaneous support of the storehouse consciousness is also the afflicted mentality.

original: de'i phyir rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa'i bstan bcos las /üîΩkun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i lhan cig pa'i gnas kyang gcig kho na'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa'i bstan bcos las / kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i lhan cig pa'i gnas kyang gcig kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, the treatise Demonstration of Consciousness Only says:

original: de yang 'di lta ste nyon mongs pa can gyi yid do //
analyzed: de yang 'di lta ste nyon mongs pa can gyi yid do //
translated: The single simultaneous support of the storehouse consciousness is also the afflicted mentality.

original: gal te rnam par shes pa de med na /
analyzed: gal te rnam par shes pa de med na /
translated: If this consciousness did not exist, that would not exist.

original: nges par mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad de bstan bcos dag las kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni rtag par nyon mongs pa can gyi yid dang lhan cig 'jug go zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges par mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad de bstan bcos dag las kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni rtag par nyon mongs pa can gyi yid dang lhan cig 'jug go zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the treatises explain that the storehouse consciousness always occurs together with the defiled mind.

original: rnam par shes pa brgyad car yang zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa la gnas par ni bye brag tu gyur pa ci yang med do //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa brgyad car yang zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa la gnas par ni bye brag tu gyur pa ci yang med do //
translated: There is no difference whatsoever between the eight forms of consciousness in terms of whether they are associated with outflows or free of outflows.

original: de la dmigs par bya ba'i yul bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de la dmigs par bya ba'i yul bstan pa ni /
translated: The objects that are its objective realm are now explained.

original: sgo re re la lang rnam pa bzhi bzhi yod de /
analyzed: sgo re re la lang rnam pa bzhi bzhi yod de /
translated: Each of the six sense bases has four aspects.

original: rnam par shes pa lnga dag gis dmigs pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa dang / nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kyi dmigs pa dang / kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa lnga dag gis dmigs pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa dang / nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kyi dmigs pa dang / kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa bstan pa'o //
translated: These are the objects that are perceived by the five consciousnesses, the objects that are perceived by the mind consciousness, the objects that are perceived by the defiled mind, and the objects that are perceived by the storehouse consciousness.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa lnga po dag ni /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa lnga po dag ni /
translated: The five forms of consciousness that are associated with outflows

original: yul rnam pa lnga las re re kho na la dmigs par byed de /
analyzed: yul rnam pa lnga las re re kho na la dmigs par byed de /
translated: each have their own specific object.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa gzugs la dmigs @218b nas lus kyi rnam par shes pa reg bya la dmigs pa'i bar du ste /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa gzugs la dmigs @218b nas lus kyi rnam par shes pa reg bya la dmigs pa'i bar du ste /
translated: Eye consciousness focuses on form, up to body consciousness focuses on tactile objects.

original: 'di ni mngon sum gyi tshad ma kho na'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mngon sum gyi tshad ma kho na'o //
translated: This is direct valid knowledge alone.

original: zag pa med pa'i gnas skabs gang yin pa de ni bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las slob dpon gnyis kyi bshad pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i gnas skabs gang yin pa de ni bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las slob dpon gnyis kyi bshad pa 'byung ste /
translated: The treatise Demonstration of Consciousness Only explains the two masters‚Äô explanations of the state of the absence of outflows.

original: de'i phyir de las bya ba grub pa'i ye shes dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems kyi rnam pa ni kha cig na re mngon sum gyi tshad ma rnam pa lnga kho na la dmigs par byed de /
analyzed: de'i phyir de las bya ba grub pa'i ye shes dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems kyi rnam pa ni kha cig na re mngon sum gyi tshad ma rnam pa lnga kho na la dmigs par byed de /
translated: Therefore, in that treatise, the aspect of mind associated with the knowledge that accomplishes the task focuses on five kinds of direct valid knowledge alone.

original: bstan bcos mdo sde rgyan las /
analyzed: bstan bcos mdo sde rgyan las /
translated: The treatise Ornament of the Scriptures of the Great Vehicle says,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbang po lnga po dag ni thams cad kyang yul lnga po dag la 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad pas so zhe'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbang po lnga po dag ni thams cad kyang yul lnga po dag la 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad pas so zhe'o //
translated: Because the five organs of the TathƒÅgata engage all five objects.

original: kha cig na re dus gsum gyi chos rnams la khyad par dmigs par mdzad de //
analyzed: kha cig na re dus gsum gyi chos rnams la khyad par dmigs par mdzad de //
translated: Some say that it focuses on the special objects of dharmas of the three times.

original: 'phags pa sangs rgyas kyi sa'i mdo las bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes thugs sprul pa'i phrin las rnam pa gsum bskyed pas sems can rnams sems kyi spyod pa tha dad pa gtan la dbab pa dang / 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa sangs rgyas kyi sa'i mdo las bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes thugs sprul pa'i phrin las rnam pa gsum bskyed pas sems can rnams sems kyi spyod pa tha dad pa gtan la dbab pa dang / 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang /
translated: The noble Sutra of the Buddha's Levels states that by generating the three kinds of emanation, the wisdom that accomplishes activities, one determines the different mental activities of sentient beings, and one causes them to enter the path, to progress on the path and to be purified of obscurations.üîΩ

original: da ltar gyi don rnams so sor myong bar mdzad do zhes gsungs pas so zhe'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: da ltar gyi don rnams so sor myong bar mdzad do zhes gsungs pas so zhe'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: The noble Buddha-bhumi-sutra says, ‚ÄúThe wisdom that accomplishes actions generates the three kinds of emanations from the mind and thus determines the different mental activities of sentient beings and causes them to experience the past, future, and present objects.‚Äù

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni khams bco brgyad po kun la dmigs par byed de /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni khams bco brgyad po kun la dmigs par byed de /
translated: The contaminated mental consciousness focuses on all eighteen elements.

original: bstan bcos kun las kyang mthun par de skad bshad do //
analyzed: bstan bcos kun las kyang mthun par de skad bshad do //
translated: All the treatises agree in explaining it in this way.

original: gnas gyur pa'i dus su yang chos rnams kun la dmigs par byed de /
analyzed: gnas gyur pa'i dus su yang chos rnams kun la dmigs par byed de /
translated: At the time of the transformation of the basis, it focuses on all phenomena.

original: de'i phyir rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa'i bstan bcos las so sor rtog pa'i ye shes dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems kyi rnam pa ni chos thams cad kyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyi dang / spyi'i mtshan nyid la thogs pa med par dmigs par mdzad do zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa'i bstan bcos las so sor rtog pa'i ye shes dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems kyi rnam pa ni chos thams cad kyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyi dang / spyi'i mtshan nyid la thogs pa med par dmigs par mdzad do zhes bshad do //
translated: The aspect of mind concomitant with discerning wisdom focuses on the individual characteristics and general characteristics of all phenomena without impediment.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa can gyi yid ni /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa can gyi yid ni /
translated: The afflicted mind with outflows

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i lte ba'i rnam pa la dmigs shing bdag dang chos su 'dzin par byed de /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i lte ba'i rnam pa la dmigs shing bdag dang chos su 'dzin par byed de /
translated: focuses on the aspect of the center of the foundation consciousness and apprehends a self and phenomena.

original: bstan bcos kun las kyang de skad du ston to //
analyzed: bstan bcos kun las kyang de skad du ston to //
translated: All treatises teach this.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid ni de yang bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa dang sbyar na /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid ni de yang bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa dang sbyar na /
translated: As for the afflicted mind, when applied to the treatise Establishing a Single Cognition,

original: bshad pa mi mthun pa gsum yod de /
analyzed: bshad pa mi mthun pa gsum yod de /
translated: there are three conflicting explanations.

original: de'i phyir de nyid las /
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid las /
translated: Therefore the same text says:

original: @219a * // mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems kyi rnam pa de yang kha cig na re brgyad pa yongs su dag pa'i rnam par rig pa la dmigs par mdzad de /
analyzed: @219a * // mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems kyi rnam pa de yang kha cig na re brgyad pa yongs su dag pa'i rnam par rig pa la dmigs par mdzad de /
translated: Some say that the aspect of mind concomitant with the gnosis of equality focuses on the pure aspect of the eighth consciousness.

original: ji ltar nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la dmigs par byed pa bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro zhe'o //
analyzed: ji ltar nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la dmigs par byed pa bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro zhe'o //
translated: Because it focuses on the foundation consciousness in the same way that the afflicted mind focuses on it.

original: kha cig ni de bzhin nyid kyi yul kho na la dmigs par mdzad de /
analyzed: kha cig ni de bzhin nyid kyi yul kho na la dmigs par mdzad de /
translated: Some say that it focuses on the domain of reality alone.

original: chos thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid la dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhe'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid la dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhe'o //
translated: Because it focuses on the equality of all phenomena.

original: kha cig ni don dam pa dang / kun rdzob kyi yul kun la dmigs par mdzad de /
analyzed: kha cig ni don dam pa dang / kun rdzob kyi yul kun la dmigs par mdzad de /
translated: Some say that it focuses on all objects, ultimate and relative.

original: 'phags pa sangs rgyas kyi sa'i mdo las /
analyzed: 'phags pa sangs rgyas kyi sa'i mdo las /
translated: The noble Buddha-bhumi states:

original: mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes ni mnyam pa nyid rnam pa bcus khong du chud do zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes ni mnyam pa nyid rnam pa bcus khong du chud do zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro /
translated: The gnosis of equality is comprehended through ten equalities.

original: gzhan yang bstan bcos mdo sde'i rgyan las /
analyzed: gzhan yang bstan bcos mdo sde'i rgyan las /
translated: Moreover, the treatise Ornament of Mahayana Sutras states:

original: sems can rnams kyi bdag dang gzhan mnyam pa nyid la dmigs shing gzhan dag gi mos pa bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi gzugs brnyan tshad med par ston par mdzad do zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi bdag dang gzhan mnyam pa nyid la dmigs shing gzhan dag gi mos pa bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi gzugs brnyan tshad med par ston par mdzad do zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: It is said that the Buddha, observing the equality of self and others among sentient beings, displays immeasurable reflections of the Buddha‚Äôs form according to the aspirations of others.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i spyod yul ni bstan bcos rnams las bshad pa mi mthun te /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i spyod yul ni bstan bcos rnams las bshad pa mi mthun te /
translated: The domain of the contaminated foundation consciousness is explained differently in the treatises.

original: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las ni rnam pa gnyis so zhes bshad do //
analyzed: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las ni rnam pa gnyis so zhes bshad do //
translated: The YogƒÅcƒÅrabh≈´mi ≈öƒÅstra explains that it has two aspects.üîΩTherefore that text says:

original: de'i phyir de las mdor bsdu na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni dmigs pa rnam pa gnyis kyis 'jug ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir de las mdor bsdu na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni dmigs pa rnam pa gnyis kyis 'jug ste /
translated: In brief, the foundation consciousness operates on the basis of two objects:

original: nang gi len pa rnam par rig pa'i phyir dang / phyi rol gyi snod kyi rnam pa yongs su ma chad pa rnam par rig pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: nang gi len pa rnam par rig pa'i phyir dang / phyi rol gyi snod kyi rnam pa yongs su ma chad pa rnam par rig pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: it cognizes internal appropriation and it cognizes the external appearance of the world.

original: rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa'i bstan bcos las ni yul rnam pa gsum la dmigs so zhes bshad de /
analyzed: rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa'i bstan bcos las ni yul rnam pa gsum la dmigs so zhes bshad de /
translated: The treatise Establishing the Existence of Representation explains that it has three types of objects.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It says:

original: phyi rol gyi snod kyi 'jig rten dang / zag pa dang bcas pa'i sa bon dang / dbang po dang bcas pa'i yul la'o //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi snod kyi 'jig rten dang / zag pa dang bcas pa'i sa bon dang / dbang po dang bcas pa'i yul la'o //
translated: The three are the external physical world, the seeds of that which is corruptible, and the objects of the senses.

original: gzhan yang de nyid las yul rnam pa bzhi la dmigs so zhes bshad do //
analyzed: gzhan yang de nyid las yul rnam pa bzhi la dmigs so zhes bshad do //
translated: Moreover, that same treatise explains that it has four types of objects.

original: snga ma gsum gyi steng du chos kyi skye mched du gtogs pa'i yang dag pa'i gzugs kyis bsnan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snga ma gsum gyi steng du chos kyi skye mched du gtogs pa'i yang dag pa'i gzugs kyis bsnan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It adds the objects of the sphere of mental objects to the previous three.

original: mdor bsdu na rnam par shes pa 'di'i @219b dmigs pa'i yul ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na rnam par shes pa 'di'i @219b dmigs pa'i yul ni 'di lta ste /
translated: In brief, the objects of this consciousness are as follows:

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i sa bon dang gzugs kyi skye mched dang / chos kyi skye mched du gtogs pa'i yang dag pa'i gzugs so //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i sa bon dang gzugs kyi skye mched dang / chos kyi skye mched du gtogs pa'i yang dag pa'i gzugs so //
translated: the seeds of that which is corruptible, the sphere of form, and the true form that is included in the sphere of mental objects.

original: ci'i phyir rnam par shes pa 'di sems la sogs pa la dmigs par mi byed ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rnam par shes pa 'di sems la sogs pa la dmigs par mi byed ce na /
translated: Why does this consciousness not have mind, etc., as its objects?

original: bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa la ni gdon mi za bar yang dag pa'i nus pa yod pas /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa la ni gdon mi za bar yang dag pa'i nus pa yod pas /
translated: In the treatise Establishing Knowledge-Only, the object of the fruitional consciousness must definitely have real power.

original: gal te sems la sogs pa la yang dmigs par byed na ni /
analyzed: gal te sems la sogs pa la yang dmigs par byed na ni /
translated: If it also takes mind, etc., as its object,

original: yang dag pa'i nus pa med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i nus pa med par 'gyur te /
translated: it would not have real power.

original: rgyu mtshan gyi rnam pa'i sems la sogs pas dmigs par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan gyi rnam pa'i sems la sogs pas dmigs par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the mind, etc., which are the aspects of the reason cannot be its object.

original: 'dus ma byas la sogs pa la dmigs na yang /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas la sogs pa la dmigs na yang /
translated: Also, if it takes unconditioned things, etc., as its object,

original: yang dag pa'i nus pa med par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i nus pa med par 'gyur bas /
translated: it would not have real power.

original: rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa ni /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa ni /
translated: Therefore the fruitional consciousness

original: sems la sogs pa la dmigs par mi byed do zhes bshad do //
analyzed: sems la sogs pa la dmigs par mi byed do zhes bshad do //
translated: does not take mind, etc., as its object.

original: zag pa med pa'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yang bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las slob dpon gnyis kyis bshad pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yang bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las slob dpon gnyis kyis bshad pa 'byung ste /
translated: Also, the treatise Establishing Knowledge-Only explains the uncontaminated foundation consciousness in two parts.

original: de'i phyir de las me long lta bu'i ye shes dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems kyi rnam pa yang kha cig ni de bzhin nyid kyi yul la dmigs pas /
analyzed: de'i phyir de las me long lta bu'i ye shes dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems kyi rnam pa yang kha cig ni de bzhin nyid kyi yul la dmigs pas /
translated: Therefore, some say that the aspect of mind concomitant with mirrorlike timeless awareness focuses on suchness,

original: rnam par mi rtog pa yin gyi /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa yin gyi /
translated: so it is nonconceptual.

original: rjes las thob pa'i ye shes kyi rnam pa'i spyod yul ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rjes las thob pa'i ye shes kyi rnam pa'i spyod yul ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not the domain of the postmeditational phase of timeless awareness,

original: shes par mi nus pa'i phyir ro zhe'o //
analyzed: shes par mi nus pa'i phyir ro zhe'o //
translated: because it is not possible to know it.

original: kha cig na re sems kyi rnam pa 'di ni chos thams cad la dmigs par byed de /
analyzed: kha cig na re sems kyi rnam pa 'di ni chos thams cad la dmigs par byed de /
translated: Some say that this aspect of mind focuses on all phenomena,üîΩbecause the treatise Ornament of the S≈´tra Section of the canon states that mirrorlike timeless awareness focuses on all objects,

original: bstan bcos mdo sde'i rgyan las me long lta bu'i ye shes ni yul thams cad la dmigs par byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa dang / 'phags pa sangs rgyas kyi sa'i mdo las /
analyzed: bstan bcos mdo sde'i rgyan las me long lta bu'i ye shes ni yul thams cad la dmigs par byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa dang / 'phags pa sangs rgyas kyi sa'i mdo las /
translated: and the noble Buddha-field S≈´tra states:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor la brten nas skye mched dang / de'i yul la rnam par shes pa'i gzugs brnyan dag snang ngo zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor la brten nas skye mched dang / de'i yul la rnam par shes pa'i gzugs brnyan dag snang ngo zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The mirror-like pristine wisdom of the transcendent lords is the basis for the appearance of the images of the sense faculties and their objects.

original: gzhan yang 'di ni nges par zag pa med pa'i sa bon dang / sku dang zhing la sogs pa'i gzugs brnyan @220a * //
analyzed: gzhan yang 'di ni nges par zag pa med pa'i sa bon dang / sku dang zhing la sogs pa'i gzugs brnyan @220a * //
translated: Moreover, it is definitely the seed of the uncontaminated states, and it is the focus of the images of the body, land, and so on.

original: la dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: la dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: This is what the YogƒÅcƒÅra say.

original: rnam par shes pa brgyad po de dag yul btags pa'am /üîΩrdzas su yod pa'am /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa brgyad po de dag yul btags pa'am / rdzas su yod pa'am /
translated: The eight consciousnesses are distinguished in terms of their objects, whether they are imputed or substantial,

original: 'dus byas sam /üîΩ'dus ma byas sam dus gsum la sogs pa gang la dmigs par byed ces bya ba'i bye brag ni bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa la sogs pa las bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas sam / 'dus ma byas sam dus gsum la sogs pa gang la dmigs par byed ces bya ba'i bye brag ni bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa la sogs pa las bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: whether they are conditioned or unconditioned,üîΩwhether they are in the three times, and so on.

original: de la sems las byung ba du dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i bstan pa yang /
analyzed: de la sems las byung ba du dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i bstan pa yang /
translated: The teaching on which mental factors are concomitant with which consciousnesses is also explained in the treatises.

original: bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las /
translated: The treatise Establishing Knowledge Only explains:

original: slob dpon chos skyong gis bshad pa de yang dag pa'i don dang sbyar na sems las byung ba'i chos lnga bcu rtsa gcig las zag pa dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa lnga po dag ni sems las byung ba'i tshes sum bcu rtsa bzhi dang mtshungs par ldanüîΩno // 'di lta ste /
analyzed: slob dpon chos skyong gis bshad pa de yang dag pa'i don dang sbyar na sems las byung ba'i chos lnga bcu rtsa gcig las zag pa dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa lnga po dag ni sems las byung ba'i tshes sum bcu rtsa bzhi dang mtshungs par ldan no // 'di lta ste /
translated: When the meaning of the explanation by the master DharmapƒÅla is applied to the correct meaning, then from among the fifty one mental factors, the five contaminated consciousnesses are concomitant with thirty four mental factors.

original: lnga kun du 'gro ba dang / lnga yul so sor nges pa dang / bcu gcig dge ba dang / rtsa ba'i nyon mongs pa las gsum po 'di lta ste /üîΩ'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa las bcu po 'di lta ste /
analyzed: lnga kun du 'gro ba dang / lnga yul so sor nges pa dang / bcu gcig dge ba dang / rtsa ba'i nyon mongs pa las gsum po 'di lta ste / 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa las bcu po 'di lta ste /
translated: They are the five omnipresent mental factors, the five object determining mental factors, the eleven virtuous mental factors, and the three root afflictions.

original: 'bring las gnyis dang / chen po las brgyad do //
analyzed: 'bring las gnyis dang / chen po las brgyad do //
translated: They are attachment, anger, and delusion. The ten secondary afflictions are the two middling afflictions, the eight great afflictions, and the two small afflictions.

original: dge ba bcu gcig po de dag la slob dpon gnyis kyis bshad pa'i don yod de /
analyzed: dge ba bcu gcig po de dag la slob dpon gnyis kyis bshad pa'i don yod de /
translated: The eleven virtuous mental factors have the meaning explained by the two masters.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las /
translated: Therefore, the treatise Establishing Knowledge Only states:

original: kha cig na re rnam par shes pa lnga po dag ni ngo bo nyid kyi rnam par g-yeng ba rnam pa bcu po kho na dang ldan te /üîΩshin tu sbyangs pa med pa'i phyir ro zhe'o //üîΩkha cig na re rnam par shes pa lnga po dag la yang shin tu sbyangs pa yod de /
analyzed: kha cig na re rnam par shes pa lnga po dag ni ngo bo nyid kyi rnam par g-yeng ba rnam pa bcu po kho na dang ldan te / shin tu sbyangs pa med pa'i phyir ro zhe'o // kha cig na re rnam par shes pa lnga po dag la yang shin tu sbyangs pa yod de /
translated: Some say: The five consciousnesses possess only the ten types of distraction by nature because they lack pliancy.üîΩSome say: The five consciousnesses also have pliancy because there is physical well-being in virtue of generating concentration and because pliancy definitely exists in the wisdom that accomplishes action.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyis bskyed pa'i dge ba la yang zo mdog bde ba yod pa'i phyir dang / bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes dang lhan cig pa la yang nges par shin tu sbyangs pa yod pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro zhes 'byung ste sems las byung ba gzhan med par bshad pa ni bstan bcos dag las rgya cher bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyis bskyed pa'i dge ba la yang zo mdog bde ba yod pa'i phyir dang / bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes dang lhan cig pa la yang nges par shin tu sbyangs pa yod pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro zhes 'byung ste sems las byung ba gzhan med par bshad pa ni bstan bcos dag las rgya cher bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o
translated: The explanation that there are no other mental factors should be understood in accordance with the extensive teachings in the treatises.

original: // zag pa dang bcas pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni sems las byung ba lnga bcu rtsa gcig @220b dang mtshungs par ldan te /
analyzed: // zag pa dang bcas pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni sems las byung ba lnga bcu rtsa gcig @220b dang mtshungs par ldan te /
translated: The contaminated mental consciousness is concomitant with fifty one mental factors.

original: bstan bcos kun las kyang mthun par ston pas tha dad pa'i don med do //üîΩzag pa dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa can gyi yid ni slob dpon chos skyong gis bshad pa'i yang dag pa'i don las /
analyzed: bstan bcos kun las kyang mthun par ston pas tha dad pa'i don med do // zag pa dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa can gyi yid ni slob dpon chos skyong gis bshad pa'i yang dag pa'i don las /
translated: Since all the treatises agree on this point, there is no need to distinguish them.

original: sems las byung ba bco brgyad kho na dang mtshungs par ldan no zhes bshad de /
analyzed: sems las byung ba bco brgyad kho na dang mtshungs par ldan no zhes bshad de /
translated: The contaminated afflicted mental consciousness is concomitant with only eighteen mental factors, as explained by Master DharmapƒÅla in his commentary on the meaning of the correct view.üîΩTherefore the treatise Establishing Cognition Only states:

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'di dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems las byung ba ni bco brgyad de /üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'di dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems las byung ba ni bco brgyad de / 'di lta ste /
translated: The mental consciousness is concomitant with eighteen mental factors.

original: snga ma'i chos dgu dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa las brgyad dang / yul so sor nges pa las shes rab po zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: snga ma'i chos dgu dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa las brgyad dang / yul so sor nges pa las shes rab po zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Nine dharmas of the former, eight secondary afflictions, and wisdom that is determined by its object.

original: de la snga ma'i chos dgu zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la snga ma'i chos dgu zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The first nine mental factors are as follows:

original: lnga kun du 'gro ba dang nyon mongs pa bzhi po dag go //
analyzed: lnga kun du 'gro ba dang nyon mongs pa bzhi po dag go //
translated: the five omnipresent mental factors and the four afflictions.

original: nyon mongs pa bzhi po ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa bzhi po ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The four afflictions are:

original: bdag tu rmongs pa dang / bdag tu lta ba dang / bdag tu nga rgyal ba dang / bdag la sred pa'o zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: bdag tu rmongs pa dang / bdag tu lta ba dang / bdag tu nga rgyal ba dang / bdag la sred pa'o zhes 'byung ste /
translated: delusion about self, view of self, pride in self, and craving for self.

original: sems las byung ba gzhan med par bshad pa yang bstan bcos dag las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sems las byung ba gzhan med par bshad pa yang bstan bcos dag las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The explanation that there are no other mental factors should be understood according to the treatises.

original: zag pa med pa'i rnam par shes pa brgyad pa ni /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i rnam par shes pa brgyad pa ni /
translated: The eighth consciousness, which is uncontaminated,

original: sems las byung ba nyi shu rtsa gcig dang mtshungs par ldan te /
analyzed: sems las byung ba nyi shu rtsa gcig dang mtshungs par ldan te /
translated: is concomitant with twenty-one mental factors.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: kun du 'gro ba lnga dang yul so sor nges pa lnga dang dge ba bcu gcig go //
analyzed: kun du 'gro ba lnga dang yul so sor nges pa lnga dang dge ba bcu gcig go //
translated: the five omnipresent mental factors, the five object-determining mental factors, and the eleven virtuous mental factors.

original: de la bye brag ni so sor rtog pa'i ye shes kyang rgyu'i gnas skabs kyi tshe rtog dpyod dang mtshungs par ldan pa ste sman dang nad la sogs pa dag la dbang du ma gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la bye brag ni so sor rtog pa'i ye shes kyang rgyu'i gnas skabs kyi tshe rtog dpyod dang mtshungs par ldan pa ste sman dang nad la sogs pa dag la dbang du ma gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The specific is also the wisdom of discernment, when it is in the causal state, it is associated with investigation and scrutiny, because it is not yet mastered with regard to medicine, illness, etc.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sar byon pa'i tshe ni rtog pa dang dpyod pa mi mnga' ste rtog pa mi mnga' bar yang mdzad pa'i dngos po rnams 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sar byon pa'i tshe ni rtog pa dang dpyod pa mi mnga' ste rtog pa mi mnga' bar yang mdzad pa'i dngos po rnams 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But when it has arrived at the stage of Buddhahood, it is not associated with investigation and scrutiny, because it accomplishes all its tasks without investigation.

original: rgya cher rnam par 'byed pa ni bstan bcos dag las 'byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: rgya cher rnam par 'byed pa ni bstan bcos dag las 'byung ba bzhin no //
translated: The extensive analysis is like that found in the treatises.

original: sems dang / yid dang / rnam par shes pa'i don ni rgya cher mtshan nyid bstan pa gzhan dag las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: sems dang / yid dang / rnam par shes pa'i don ni rgya cher mtshan nyid bstan pa gzhan dag las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya ste /
translated: The meanings of mind, thought, and consciousness should be understood as they are found in other treatises that teach their definitions in detail.

original: de'i tshig gi don rnam par bshad pa yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
analyzed: de'i tshig gi don rnam par bshad pa yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
translated: The explanation of the words of that verse is also divided into two parts.

original: sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa'i gsang ba'i don bstan pa dang blo gros yangs pa de ltar zhes bya ba @221a * //
analyzed: sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa'i gsang ba'i don bstan pa dang blo gros yangs pa de ltar zhes bya ba @221a * //
translated: The explanation of the secret meaning of mind, mentation, and consciousness, and the vast intellect, is as follows.üîΩ

original: man chad kyis gsang ba la mkhas pa rnam par 'byed cing sngar zhus pa rnam pa gnyis kyi lan ston par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: man chad kyis gsang ba la mkhas pa rnam par 'byed cing sngar zhus pa rnam pa gnyis kyi lan ston par mdzad pa'o //
translated: The explanation of the secret meaning of mind, thought, and consciousness, and the answer to the two questions asked earlier are presented in the passage beginning with ‚ÄúVast Mind, it is thus.‚Äù

original: dang po yang rnam pa gnyis kyis bstan te /
analyzed: dang po yang rnam pa gnyis kyis bstan te /
translated: The first is also presented in two parts:

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i ming gi rnam grangs mang po'i bye brag bstan pa dang / blo gros yangs pa len pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba man chad kyis rnam par shes pa rnams lhan cig 'jug pa'i bye brag bstan pa'o //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i ming gi rnam grangs mang po'i bye brag bstan pa dang / blo gros yangs pa len pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba man chad kyis rnam par shes pa rnams lhan cig 'jug pa'i bye brag bstan pa'o //
translated: the explanation of the many different synonyms for the storehouse consciousness, and the explanation of the differences in the simultaneous functioning of the consciousnesses, from ‚ÄúVast Mind, the appropriating consciousness . . .‚Äù

original: dang po la yang rnam pa bzhis bstan te /
analyzed: dang po la yang rnam pa bzhis bstan te /
translated: The first is also presented in four parts:

original: rnam par shes pa'i sa bon bstan pa dang / len pa'i rnam par shes pa rnam par 'byed pa dang / kun gzhi rnam par shes pa bstan pa dang / sems kyi ming bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i sa bon bstan pa dang / len pa'i rnam par shes pa rnam par 'byed pa dang / kun gzhi rnam par shes pa bstan pa dang / sems kyi ming bstan pa'o //
translated: the explanation of the seeds of consciousness, the analysis of the appropriating consciousness, the explanation of the storehouse consciousness, and the explanation of the names of mind.

original: 'di ni dang po rnam par shes pa sa bon bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni dang po rnam par shes pa sa bon bshad pa yin te /
translated: This is the first explanation of the seed of consciousness.

original: de la sa bon thams cad ces bya ba ni bag chags rnam pa gsum nyid de /
analyzed: de la sa bon thams cad ces bya ba ni bag chags rnam pa gsum nyid de /
translated: The term all seeds refers to the three kinds of habitual tendencies.
